text: As a 30 year old woman who travels all the time between Canada and the USA, I don't think I have been to a place with more disrespectful staff. Drinks mediocre at best. Save your money. If you have any class go to Broadview hotel...Better drinks ... better food...better staff...

I had to drop a star. This has been a local spot for my work colleagues and after work pub night stop.  The last few times the service was lacking on the main floor in the back, but today really left me wondering. Not only was the service extra slow, much of the staff seem to have lost their friendliness and have built up an unfriendly wall.  Lacking in smiles and simple sever courtesies.  This has been the general consensus of our group of regulars.  That said, the upstairs staff and vibe is def what makes us want to come back to drink and play games.

It's still my birthday for a few more hours so my best friend and I decided to visit a second Prohibition Gastrohouse location; the other one which I like is on Eglinton Ave East near Yonge St.

This location was not the easiest for me to get to but I made the effort to check it out.  A cover charge and dress code is in effect on Friday & Saturday party nights.

Several large TV screens were showing an NFL game, the Raptors game and the Leafs game.

Ultra premium bar rail is $7.30 all day every day and only $5.75 during Hooch Hour from 5-7pm and 10-11pm nightly.  If tap is your fancy, choose from several draughts and ciders on tap.  Others may prefer a 6 oz Hooch Hour wine for $5.75 or bottled wines which they mark up $30 from LCBO prices.

Party shots of Jagermeister and JD Tennessee Honey are $2.88 all day every day.

Off the dinner menu, I chose an Inside-Out Pulled Pork Grilled Cheese Handheld with Duck Fat Frites for $16.95.  My friend is having the Fish and Avocado Tacos for $15.95.  Very nice..and delicious.

Overall, it's a different crowd here and I really liked it.  The place started to get packed about 9:45 p.m. just as the DJ arrived to set up.  A dance floor is located at the back to strut your stuff to the great music.

Bar staff were friendly (especially Amanda) and service was excellent!
Giving it 4 stars for the BBQ Sauce and service was ok. Food was ok. Great place to watch any games and they have decent daily deals

Food was Ok 
Service was Ok

Ordered the wings from them and it was ok, no the worst or the best. the price was really good comparing to other sports bars.

My friends and I go to Prohibition quite often for their weekend brunch. Always a good time and good food. Servers have always been excellent and attentive.  Dinner is great as well for a nicer version of pub food.

Pretty cool spot near the Convention Centre. We came on a quiet snowy night during their wing Wednesday's. I can imagine this place getting heaps of thirsty customers in the summertime since it's so close to the arena (after the Jays lose..). No fear, they have ample seating up and downstairs. 
If drinking and eating aren't your thing (lol?), they have a whole row of pinball machines, air hockey and basketball arcade games to tickle your inner competitive self. 
For $5 a pound on Wednesday's, their wings were actually not half bad. They offer 40 flavours with ambiguous names, so that's pretty awesome. I'll definitely be back again.
The food like the chicken & waffles and drinks are really good but the service can be quite slow and we had to keep asking for things like straws and a spoon for coffee.

It was hot and noisy but totally a perfect place for a reception near the convention center. Had a great time connecting with colleagues and talking with friends. We didn't play any of the games. We were only there to network for the conference. Staff seemed really nice. We didn't eat any food but they did have an open bar for the even. People seemed to enjoy the overall beer and wine selections. Pretty great way to end the afternoon of the first day of convention.
Good nite at Mcsorleys. Easy. Good food & Service. Consistent as always. Local we can trust.

The steak is incredible and the atmosphere is nice too. My only issue I've had here is trying to order from their keto menu, after three separate attempts I have yet to try the cauliflower crust flatbread and I was told by a server to avoid the chicken skin chips because "they're not very good". Soooo, go for the steak!!!

Food: 4 Stars
Service: 3 Stars
Ambience: 4 Stars
Fill Factor: Satisfied

I have been here several times (mostly for wings night on Wednesdays) and have to say my experience here has mostly been positive.

As I mentioned, I have been here a few times for wings and they offer forty different flavours and each order comes with veggie sticks and a dipping sauce. I must say I did enjoy the flavours of the wings with some of my favourites being Maple BBQ, Peri Peri and Momofuku (might be an acquired taste). I have also had their tacos which I did not enjoy as much (if you have to choose one though go with the fish) as well I tried the crispy chicken sandwich. The sandwich was good as the chicken was fairly crispy and there was a nice sweet taste to it. It got a bit messy as they put a lot of coleslaw in it.

Service is decent here considering how packed it gets on wings nights. The food takes a bit of time to get here but it could be a lot worse. There is a ton of seating as there are two floors in this place. The walls are crammed full of sports memorabilia and lots of TVs to watch the game on.

Overall, this is a pretty cool place to hang out with friends. The place is usually lively and the food is not bad here. A pretty good choice if you are looking for a sports bar in the area.
The best steak sandwich I have had in years! They are fast and the prices are reasonable. Tons of parking and a very clean restaurant.

Went there for brunch on a Saturday. Pleasantly surprised as I never would have thought brunch at a pub would be so delicious! Only downside was alcohol couldn't be served till 11am. 

Got the breakfast poutine and it was made with tater tots. Friends got the duck confit Benedict and basic breakfast.

Great for those on a Keto, vegan and gluten free diet as they have lots of substitutions.

Not a fan of the pinball arcade setup on the 2nd floor. The novelty completely wears off if people can't afford to pay a loony per game. 

Pardon the photo, these are not your average sexy shots of the hottest wings in town. The insanity dry rub spice wings are guaranteed to churn your insides for a creamy finish in the morning. Definitely a ride to remember!!

*sigh

Extremely disappointing, but then again I shouldn't have had my hopes any where near up.
Went for a recent Trivia Night (Marvel) and had some food, so lets break this up into 3 sections: Trivia Night, Food, and Service

Trivia
$5 entry fee/person. Chance to win one of 3 prizes (which would make the entry fee viable). BUT the number of teams (20+) means the chances of winning a prize to be laughably low. Many other formats of pub trivia work, this one doesn't. 

Food:
Low quality, over-priced.

Service:
Atrocious. The server broke 3 server rules (for me). 1. laughed at my question. 2. told me I was wrong. 3. broke the cardinal server sin
in more detail:

1. My question was 'What kind of Craft Sodas do you have'. A little bit of a pretentious question, but one that can be used to gauge the kind of server and establishment. When asked the server laughed, and said they just have normal sodas. It doesn't matter that a place doesn't offer craft soda's (or rather it does matter but that argument is for another time). But how a server reacts to that question can speak volumes, rather than say something like, 'sorry, we focus on craft beers, but do have a selection of coke products' the server laughing at the question simply makes the server look unprofessional. Not a good start.

2. Once my soda did arrive it tasted off, too much soda water and not enough syrup. Little background here: I am a grown-ass man who has worked in multiple restaurants/pubs for many years and have been drinking pops/sodas my whole life. I know when a fountain machine is mis-calibrated, or due to recent change of syrup/CO2 the gin can produce a bad glass. It is relatively common and so a good bartender will keep an eye on their fountain guns to ensure they are serving a decent product. When I told the server 'this tastes wrong, like there is too much soda'. She 'checked' and told me 'the syrup isn't out, so you probably just don't like it, so what else would you like?'. hu? I'm telling you there is something wrong with the drink, and you are telling me there is something wrong with me. nice. Did the server (or bartender) test? nope. Did the server offer me another pour of the drink? nope. All in all i declined any drink.

3. You may disagree with the above 2 points, citing I am just being picky, and you may be right. But the next point is one of those egregious mistakes that any server should be taught day 1 of training. 
I paid cash for my bill. $20 for a $16.95. The server asked 'do you need me to bring change?'. This is a no-no. This is akin to asking 'can I keep the change?' The correct thing to say at this juncture is 'I will be right back with your change'. The assumption should be that the patron wants their money back, and this gives the patron the opportunity to say 'no, thanks that's fine' (or similar). This is the interaction upon which I will judge a server, and one in which this server failed. The server also failed basic math and brought back $3 as oppose to $3.05. yup 5cents. The smallest cash denomination available. Do I care? no. Is it worth noting in a review? yes. Either the server needed the money -in which case: fair-play. Or they were too lazy to pick up the nickel, or didn't want to tell me they don't have a nickel in the till -in which case: *sigh


so yeah. 1 star. will not return

This was a fun spot to come to for some drinks and dancing on a Saturday night. The crowd certainly was a mixed bag of nuts, but the vibe was friendly and felt very safe. All of the bartenders were attentive and never seemed perturbed which is sometimes hard to come by, especially in larger cities. I also love that I could happily order an entire bottle of champagne for myself and was even served in a bottle service bucket since my friend and I felt like being extra. Security is everywhere and ensures that things are running smoothly and there is also a great menu to order from if you are feeling hungry. I would def come back for another girls night when in town next.

The service and food was one of the worst experiences I've ever had. Arrived at 2pm so it wasn't busy at all. Appetizer took 30 minutes and still had to ask them to warm it up. Lunch order took another 30 minutes and wasn't that great. But most of all, the service was terrible.

I eat Gabby's wings all the time and their really good. There are a few locations around Toronto and I would recommend the wings to anyone. Super tasty, warm, welcoming and great service. 
If Gabby's experience is an 8/10, then St.Louis experience is about a 2/10. Just saying

Cold inside, service sucked and the wings were burned and terrible. 

Save your frustration and go to Gabby's much, much, much better

date jan 20th 8:00pm no one greeted us at the door.we sat ourselves.once we were sitting a young lady came over with menus.it took our waitress about 10 mins to come to our table.eventually she took out order brought and brought us water.10 mins after that she advised us that they don't have veggie burgers.highly disappointed because i wish she would have told us before that they were out.im going to try the cauliflower wings hopefully they don't disappoint.

This St. Louis is much like the other St. Louis' - minus the service. The service is horrendous. You will eventually get your order if you are patient and ask (I never got my ginger ale until the food came out - which was 45 minutes after ordering). The waitresses never came back after we ordered - she also got our orders wrong (I ordered a ginger ale - she came out with an iced tea... we each ordered one pound instead of two - gave and charged us two pounds - just use a pen and paper, simple solutions...)!

For a restaurant bigger than its average St. Louis, they should have more waitresses on the floor (especially on a Tuesday), but no, people seat themselves and go up to the bar for their own drinks. 

The food is typical - tastes much like the others restaurants. 

P.s. it is crazy on a Tuesday - not worth the wait.

Maybe it was just an off night, but our server was really rude and clearly not interested in her job.  Our "burger bar" orders were spectacularly mixed up, but I was too scared to say anything (!)  The burger was good (despite all the wrong toppings) but I probably won't go back.

Our dinner started well, until I found a black hair in my mac n cheese. While our server responded professionally and was kind enough not to charge us for our food, I have no desire to return. It's unfortunate as this was otherwise a lovely experience ranging from the food, drinks, atmosphere, and service.
Nice atmosphere, ' cocktails' $14 were over priced, stick withe a regular vodka soda 7$..tried the pulled pork sliders..they were really good but wish the pork was hot.

Didn't even get the chance to eat here. The sign said Please Seat Yourself, so we took up a spot near the bar. Three different employees looked at us and then walked away. We waited fifteen minutes of being ignored before we walked out.

The service here was unbearably slow! And it wasn't even a full house. Furthermore, the food is very below average and overpriced. I got the poutine, which was just ok. But others in my party ordered the burger, which took forever to come out and it was the most plain burger I had ever seen. It looked like one of those burgers you make yourself at a backyard bbq. For the price, I expected something a little bit fancier. I know this place is near the Blue Jays stadium, so the prices are expected to be higher but cmon. Don't waste your time here unless you have time to kill and want a beer or something.

Service was fine & food looked appetizing.  Ordered duck poutine & nachos w/ chicken.   This used to be good eats.  Today however, it was disappointingly dry; barely any gravy, barely any cheese, skimpy toppings.  The nacho toppings are shedded almost like they are leftover scraps.  NY Fries are better (especially for the price). Prohibitions used to have nachos to rave about.  No more . We'll look for a new place.

Really awful service.
I never write reviews but just know they're pretty arrogant here.

Very good food at a premium price.  Lunch with no alcohol was over $50.  

The flatbread was delicious and the service was terrific, fast and very friendly.   

I'm not sure about coming here often but wouldn't hesitate to come again for the right occasion.

Food was very underwhelming. Went here for my cheat day meal and was hoping to have a deliscious and juicy cheeseburger with fries, but got what tasted like a dried, pre-frozen patty on an what was a very bland burger all together. Not worth the price paid what so ever. Fries were average, and the wings were very small and had nearly no flavour or sauce added to them. Extremely disappointed as I had heard good things about this place. Service on the other hand was great, however the quality of the food did not match up with the service and ambiance.

Decided to check this place out. Margaritas were horrible and we were unable to drink.  Per management they were no going to remake or remove from the bill. Food was ok but wasn't worth while. Our server was great though.

My boyfriend and I came here on St. Patrick's Day. He had one of the specials for the day the lamb stew and i had chili fries. Chili fries are fries with chilli and cheese for $12.You can supreme it aka add sour cream, lettuce and tomato for $2 more making it $14. I was happy to find they had my favourite cider and my boyfriend got the house beer, Shakey's beer which was coloured with green food colouring for that days festivities. Our waitress was awesome! Very friendly and attentive despite being the only one working in the packed bar at the time. Despite it being busy we didn't feel rushed or neglected. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was I wanted the chili fries but wanted sour cream on it. She said no problem but didn't mention it would be $2 to add sour cream so it ended up being the same price as the chili supreme. If i was told that i probably would have opted to not have the sour cream but the waitress was great so i didn't mind much. We saw swag sitting on the table at the back but figured it was for later that night. My boyfriend thought it didn't hurt to ask so he asked the waitress how you get the hat/sunglasses/keychain/T-shirt etc. Was there something you have to buy etc? She said just wear green and then offered us something. I chose a hat which is sponsored by moose head beer and actually really good quality! So special thanks to shakeys for the hat! We will definitely be back again for more great food, great drinks and great service!

I love all stars, however I will never come back to this location. I ordered the sweet heat and when the waitress went in the back the cook questioned her if the customer knew chocolate was an ingredient she screamed yes "people like that disgusting stuff." There was no music turned on yet so I heard it crystal clear. The wings we ordered barely had any sauce on them, they were very dry. We ordered a blue cheese, ranch, and dill; we received two ranch and a dill in a smaller size cup than the other two dips. They're super cheap with their sauces, their wings are tiny with barely any meat on them, no bar, and poor customer service. This is my second visit with issues. I'll make the drive to Scarborough from here on out.

Went in last night as we were staying at the Broadview Hotel. 

Delicious food and great atmosphere - they had the Leafs Game 7 on and the Raptors game on as well. 

I initially picked this place as they had both keto (for my husband) and vegan (for me) options on the menu - they explicitly state which meals they can accommodate and change which is great to see! 

The vegan version of the lettuce wraps were amazing! 5/5 definitely recommend. 

Their blood orange & ginger beer margarita was also great, even as a virgin mock tail!

Our server was attentive and accommodating - she was able to switch our table towards the end of the night so we had a better view of the hockey game.

Would definitely go back again.
Pathetic service. Seems to be a common theme in these reviews. Any half responsible owner of this restaurant would be dealing with this by now. Very disappointed.

Food was amazing!! Drinks were fine and our server was nice. 

The French toast blew my mind. They put chocolate covered bacon on it!! What?!? The bread was so tender and perfect and it was a huge piece. 

The duck confit Benny was good but a little dry. The confit maybe was heated per portion which got rid of that nice duck fat moistness you would expect and it's in a biscuit so that added to the dryness. Still yummy just not what I was hoping for. 

Back was perfect. Thick cut and cooked perfectly!

Came for lunch before a baseball game. Great local beer selection. Service was quick and friendly, even though we were in town to root for the Blue Jays' opponent. Fish tacos had a good mix of flavors from the pico and cabbage. My son had the maple bacon burger and loved it.

A place where you will pay $18 to have a chicken salad sandwich with bacon inside that is so fatty and chewy it's inedible. 

The entree of cauliflower fake mac n cheese is too small for the $14 price tag. 

Service is good.

My family visited this location earlier tonight for a rare late dinner - many other restaurants in the area were closed by 8pm and we decided to eat at The Pint. The atmosphere was dark and tavern-like, similar to a BJ's Restaurant - the music was loud but did not drown out our voices and the restaurant was fairly empty (it was a Thursday night, so I'm sure that Fridays and weekends are much more packed). We ordered the chicken strips, falafel plate, and salmon - all of the entrees were fine, nothing wrong, but they were not anything special (especially considering the $15-per-entree prices). Service was friendly, however we would still not return again.

The vibe is like Jack Astor's or some general bar and grill. Not thrilling. You could find some good craft beers here, but the atmosphere is just awful. There are TVs everywhere so people gather round to watch a game. It's very loud and noisy there and if you're unlucky, you're seated next to a table of ladies trying to catch up and talk louder with their shrill voices and then it just hurts. It's unfortunate because their mac and cheese is so good. Just come here at off-peak times like an early supper or late lunch. Otherwise, walk over a few blocks east and you'll find some better spots for a quiet dining experience.

Super rude staff and winterlicious was terrible. I got the chicken skin chips which were very greasy and made me sick. Not to mention. Dessert was cookies and whipped cream and some berries. They also don't serve oysters anymore which is sad.

On of our go-to's for friendly service, creative yet casual food, fun drink specials and comfortable booths. They always play cool music and all the important sports. You can charge your phone in the booth which is always a bonus.

This almost hurts to write as this was my go to local for the last few years. Unfortunately, the quality of both service and food has drastically gone down in the last several months. 

While I enjoy a free meal, I would much rather pay for a quality meal than be comped for a poor one. Sadly, my expectations have been completely reset. On my last visit I ordered the duck poutine - sounded delicious! Problem was it arrived without any duck and was just a messy bowl of fries, cheese and gravy. I asked the waitress who apologized and said the kitchen could get a side bowl of duck ready for me in 20 minutes while my poutine went cold. Apparently doing the the full order again was out of the question. Well, there was free meal # 1.

The visit before I went for the fish and chips. The batter on the fish was not even close to cooked and was still a paste when it arrived. The waitress who dropped it off looked at the plate and apologized before I could even mention it.  Again, I was comped for the meal but would have rather just paid for an edible one.

Being a recognized regular in the bar, several months ago one of the managers approached me and asked if I would be kind enough to do a survey with Parcel Designs, one of Prohibition's third party partners who were evaluating the bar. In exchange, I would get a $50 gift card for Prohibition mailed to me. Well the survey was completed back in July and I'm still waiting to receive it. I mentioned it last month to the same manager who took down my contact info and guess what....still nothing.

Shame about this place going downhill so rapidly. The hooch hour selection is sadly the only redeeming quality left. That is, unless you enjoy meals so poorly prepared the staff offers to take it off the bill before you even complain.

Another late review!  Came here for a Raptors game as apparently it's not well known enough  to get packed up - which is why we got a table when Rally's was slammed.  It's in a little plaza, unassuming, a few parking spots.

This is what I think when you wonder where your grandfather has disappeared to for a few hours...lol.  It seems like that type of bar.  It's run by brothers and they are super friendly.  Our server was really nice.  The beer selection is limited, but they have cheap house beer...so I guess you can't really go wrong there.

Other than that...since I didn't order food, I can't comment on that...but it just looked old and tired.  Seems like the Crown is losing it's gleam?

My husband and I were in town and were staying at the Intercontinental next door.  While  touring the city we stopped to take a selfie of the Ripley's sign on the corner.  Out of nowhere a security guard comes out and tells us we aren't allowed to take pictures in front of the restaurant.  Really, a selfie on a public street?  Felt like maybe she was just bored and wanted to hassle some tourists.  We happened to be in town during Game 2 of the NBA finals.  We planned on watching here since it was so close but instead went elsewhere.  If this is their behavior before we step foot into the restaurant, I don't want to know how they act inside.  Looking at these awful reviews, it appears we were right to spend our money elsewhere.

We came in on a Monday at 1:30, so very slow time. The service was so incredibly slow. It took a good 10-15 just for the server to come to our table. She forgot our appetizer, and looked surprised no one brought it out - maybe she could have checked on us before our mains came? 

Oh, then the mains came. My chicken tasted like bleach. It was completely inedible so I sent it back. Didn't get the replacement (disgusting chicken tacos) for a good 20+ minutes. 

I'm being nice by giving two stars. My husband and kids thought their food was okay.

My friend and I came after a baseball game as a last minute choice since it started to rain and the hostess said if we head upstairs to the bar and we can just go ahead and seat ourselves as there were more tables. 

The upstairs had an arcade style set up with pinball machines that cost around a buck a play which was a good way to kill some time while you wait for your server just to give you menus....and boy did we wait!  I ended up going up to one of the wait staff asking if we can get two menus and she proceeded to tell me practically sneering no less that "we shouldn't have seated ourselves as that only applies to the bar stool section only"  I proceeded to tell her you should really take that up with the hostess downstairs who at that time sent several people upstairs who all proceeded to seat themselves.    

Menu is pretty basic pub/sports bar style food and we ordered wings and drinks that took equally as long to arrive with some of the wings so burnt that was all you were able to taste.   We didn't bother returning them because at that point we were already there for 2.5 hours by the time our mains arrived (Yes the wait was that long!).   

With all of the options downtown I regret ever stepping foot in that place.  So in the end if, you are looking for low quality food that is over priced, the most miserable and unfriendly staff and want to watch the time slip away because it takes hours for any form of service this is the place for you.    

Save your money and go across the street or anywhere else.

The food in here is disgusting. And 3 times we were served another tables food with utter confusion from the server who couldnt even remember our drinks, for a small group thats pretty pathetic. But seriously, the food is the worst in the city!

Overall good spot for a quick bite and drink after some walking around. We ordered the Niagara Nachos, I'd give them a 2.0. The poutine fries were good! I'd recommend those. Just an average place for average food.

Very busy when we walked in. Sat at the bar. Were enticed by the happy hour specials but when I ordered my beer I was told that wasn't part of the happy hour deal.... only 3 choices for happy hour. That instantly brought them down for me a couple stars.
Ordered wings and they were really good but I also wanted some veggies. 2 pieces of carrots and two pieces of celery for 4.00 and the dip was 2.00.
That was pretty pathetic. 
Overall I don't think when visiting Toronto that I will come back to this sports bar....

We were at this location on April 4th (Husband's birthday) and what a disappointment. We waited 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and bring us to a table (it was 8pm on a Thursday... NOT busy at all!) The service just got worse from there. It took 2 (yes, TWO) hours to order and leave. We only ordered wings and a side caesar salad. Our waitress did not care to be there (we could tell by the zero f*cks she gave when we tried to get her attention a few times). We tried to wave down another waitress (who was also equally as rude) for extra dill sauce. Guess what... she kept walking by and didnt give a f*ck either! 

The table beside us was left filthy since before we arrived (they took the plates away after an hour or so but failed to wipe down the table), my glass of water was dirty, other tables were served before us but arrived afterwards,etc. 

I tip. I tip very well as I know the hospitality industry is hard work. But this was the first time (and hopefully the last) that I did not leave a tip. HORRIBLE experience. Fire your staff and hire people who want to be there. PLEASE!

They brought out margaritas that were made with daiquiri mix. They were syrupy. They were not drunk by 4 out of 6 patrons and they took them back. Everyone ordered something else. I added water and another shot of liquor to make it tolerable. The bartender brought out a complimentary shot of something that we did not ask for and apologized for not having a blender. 

Come to find out they took the the drinks back that were not drunk and still CHARGED THEM ALL for them. That by far was the worst experience and given that the waitress was by herself the rest of the party just paid the bills. I don't understand why if the drinks were not drank at all and there was an issue that they could not be take off the bill. 

The food was okay. Glasses were dirty brought out. The service was slow. The waitress was the only one serving everyone in the bar so I get the slow service. She was very friendly. Here visiting and I'd never come back this way. It would have been easy to take the drinks off the bill since they were not drank. The coming to the table with unsolicited complimentary shots was weird with the drinks still on the bill.

man this place is awesome 
was fortunate to come here for a work training dinner and it was fantastic, I honestly didn't hear about this place until I asked my co-worker if they knew about it. they told me that it was awesome all of the times that they went. because it was a vendor dinner, we had a full spread of food to try. veggie platter, veggie nachos, three different styles of poutine, deep fried pickles, and whichever beer you wanted to try. all of that food was really good, and bonus points for the veggie nachos as they were fresh and crisp. I decided to go with a pulled pork burger and an order of Jamaican heat wings. the pulled pork burger was phenomenal, by and far the best pulled pork burger I've ever had at a restaurant, as for the wings, the wings were overly salty, but otherwise enjoyable in size and flavor. the service here was great, we had two ladies for the 20+ people that were apart of our crew, and the servers didn't skip a beat and didn't slack on either the food or the drink, very impressed. 

the outdoor patio sucks in the summer time during sunset as it gets the direct sunlight during those hours otherwise a really enjoyable place and a very warming atmosphere. 

I totally didn't know as well that they have a games room upstairs with a lot of pinball machines? 


cant wait to come back to this one, and would go out of my way to come back to this one.

lots of parking lots in the area both above and below ground, transit options are the 510 spadina streetcar with a bit of walking and also the 121 Fort York-Esplanade bus. this is also a short walk from union station, I would put it around the 5-10 minute mark.

This review is specifically for this location only as I'm usually a fan of St. Louis, specifically their wings and fries.

When you first enter, there's no sign like the other locations as to whether or not to seat yourself so you're left standing there just waiting while the servers see you but don't greet you in a timely manner. Otherwise, their service while you're seated is fine, they're nice, but not attentive enough to fill your water. 

The food can be hit or miss, their wings are typically still a hit as are their fries. Their salad when I tried it didn't seem the freshest and the crispy noodles were on the stale side of things (let's just say they weren't crispy).

Great service! Drinks are great and affordable.. bartenders awesome! He helped us with all our drinks and made us try a bunch of new things. Loved it! Came here twice within a few hours because it was so awesome!!

Been coming to this one for 2 years... Went last night and the food was horrible even after I sent it back once before.  The meat was dry and over cooked.  Their sous vide used to be great now it's like an over cooked piece of this rate show leather.  

I have not eaten anything afterwards and I've been to the bathroom 4 times in 2 hours with cramps.

Never ever going back.

On the road tonight and feeling hungry.  Tuesday is half-priced wings day here; winged and boneless available.

Paired with $5.99 for a 23 ounce domestic pint draught beer and let the great Coors Light times begin!

My friend had family to take care of so I'm dining solo seated at the bar.  In hindsight, it was probably the worst place to sit as the place was hopping and the 2 bartenders were super busy.  I went unnoticed for close to 10 minutes and wedged myself between Daniella and her drinks prep to rhyme off my order.  (...sorry but minus 1 star)

After order placement, service for my draft was very quick followed by 2 pounds wings with vegetables sticks (...hold the fries but they came anyhow); 1 pound Cajun and 1 Sweet Asian BBQ.

This is my favourite wing restaurant chain.  Lots of big screens to view sporting events.  There are booths + tables on the lower level and only tables + bar seating on the raised dining area.  The noise level was quite loud given the place was packed.

With a little force from me tonight, it was still a great dinner...Yum!!!
The service was very slow and even when I asked for help it was not that great...I was sitting at the bar so it should have been easy to get me a beer quicker than the 15 minutes it took.

Last Thurs. (Sept.19) I made my first visit to The Pint Public House; it was for an Event that a friend invited me to called Rock The Block. The Event featured comp. drinks and food all of which was quite enjoyable. The venue has 2 floors as well as outside patio space and is quite elegant in appearance. They have several pinball machines on their main floor and more pinball machines and other games on their 2nd floor than I've ever seen outside of an arcade or an amusement park.

Like many Pubs, they have daily specials for food and drinks and their specialty is wings; I'm not a 'wings person' so I won't comment about their wings offerings but they offer a fairly wide range of other food and beers on their menu.  The Pint is also known as a sports bar and it's convenient location close to Scotiabank Plaza and Rogers Centre as well as multiple TV screens situated strategically on both floors do plenty to maintain that reputation.  Not being a sports fan I don't see myself returning specifically to watch a game, but the venue is pretty close to home for me so given the right occasion I can see myself coming back.
Pint o'clock says a selection of draught beer, but the only selection is PBR which is already on special. What a selection, especially when they say 40 ways to draught.

We decided to have some pre game wings and a couple of Beers before the Yankee game at Rogers Center. The location is perfect to do just that. The Pint has a good vibe when you walk in, lots of sporting pictures on the walls, and multiple TVS THROUGH OUT

  We were told that our table needed to be only used until 5pm. She said they have reservations at that time. It didn't seem like a big deal to us because we i was only 3:30..  it took about 15 mins for the waitress to come and take our drink orders. For a bar they didn't hit the mark in this area. Then another 15mins went by and she waitress was now the bartender serving people at the bar. So I waved another waitress over and explained my disappointment and where are our drinks. She went right to the bar and got them. So we're set right? Noooo, no one came back to take our order. So once again I waved the waitress down and she took our order. And just to save another 15 mins I asked her to bring us another round. 
   Once she brought our second round I asked her if she would mind if we moved to the open seats at the bar because we were running out of time. She said no problem. So we move to the bar the original bartender comes over and welcomes us to the bar and if we wanted to order. I said we already did, she had no clue she forgot about us.

     Wings came out and didn't find them very good. They were small and reminded me of the frozen pinty's wing you get at the store. We shared a French fry and found them to be nice and crispy. Sauce was ok but the wings were soggy.. over all not the best for a sports bar.

Went for summerlicious.  Cool pub atmosphere.
Customer service was 4/5. Food was 2/5.
Con: Chicken skin had a old flavour.
Pro: The guacamole was good and sizeable.

Let's get bar rescue to the building. 6 of us went here. We ordered strawberry margaritas. It tasted more like kool aid. The mix used was extremely thick and sugary. They informed us that use the same mix as the daiquiris and margaritas. The glasses were dirty. The first waitress never brought menus or brought back water. The second waitress was more personable. However, she informed us that the manager said that they wouldn't be taking the drinks off of our bill. I had one sip and stopped because it was disgusting. I ordered a bacon cheese burger and fries. They ran out of burgers so one person from the party had to switch orders last minute. Her chicken was over cooked. The manager never came to our table. The waitress did bring us a shot on the house but much cheaper than the actual drink. We ordered many drinks afterwards. The waitress was nice. It was karaoke night so it was decent crowd. But the food quality and service doesn't meet my expectations so I wouldn't recommend.

To be fair, the manager was amazing and changed one of the TVs to ufc free night at our request. The server was polite and nice  but I've never had such a dru burger in my life! There was no mayo and they charged us a dollar for it. The ambiance was nice and relaxing, and the fries were really good, but had to say something about the burger. If you pay $20 for a burger it shouldn't be dry as coals. Got the pint classic burger, boyfriend got the cheeseburger. I'll be back to try their world famous wings though, again service was great!

we tried this restaurant for the first time and had high expectations as we've heard allot of good things about this restaurant. We had a Cobb salad and pull pork nachos. The Cobb salad was acceptable but it was nothing special with very little leafy greens. The pull pork nachos were ok but we were disappointed to find allot of fat on the pull pork..... bottom line we wouldn't go back as there are allot of restaurants to choose from on Queen St.

Is in my neighbourhood in Riverside so only went with a friend after yoga because it was convenient (strangely, the two other restaurants we wanted to go to weren't open yet). We both had the omelette special. It was the smallest omelette I've ever been served in a restaurant. The toast was really bread that had been warmed up and didn't have any butter on it. And the coffee tasted like coffee flavoured hot water.

My boyfriend came here twice while we were in Toronto. It was in a great location from us, not too far from our Airbnb, and on the way to most of our destinations. We only stopped here for drinks, but I did notice a lot of people eating food. 

We sat at the bar on both occasions, and each time our bartender was very friendly and helpful. He offered suggestions on what Canadian beers to try, as well as bucket lists things for us to do before we left. It can get pretty loud inside, as they have music blasting throughout, and on one of the nights there was even a Live DJ. 

Overall, cool little place with an entertaining vibe. You could meet friends here after work or enjoy a bite to eat while watching the latest sports game. There are TVs all around the bar area, and around the table areas as well. We enjoyed our visits and would recommend for a late night spot.

This was disappointing!
The atmosphere/ vibe is cool and cozy
And the service is professional and friendly 
But our meals were not great . My fish/chips was so bad I almost sent it back but we waited close to an hr to get it and I was starving so I forced it down. Chips were burnt, fish was greasy and the slaw was just sad. My partners salad was better but not nearly as good as the last time she had it. And it's not cheap. Very reluctant to eat there again!

I think this place is exactly what you would expect. The pricing is a bit higher than other places in the area but that may have to do with where they are located. It's right next to two tourist attraction and next to a souvenir store. But since we had time to kill before our visit to the aquarium we split some wings and ordered some PBRs. They have a long list of sauces or dry rubs but we kept it pretty simple and had the Peri Peri. It was like a chili glaze, not hot at all, but very flavorful. The wings we're pretty small, so not very filling if you're sharing one order.

Came here on a seemingly overly busy Tuesday evening.

Waited around 10 mins for our Hooch Hour beers, the only things reasonably priced here..

Waited over an hour for food, just burgers and a club sandwich.
I will say the waiter (tall skinny guy) comped us a free round and even discounted the food, good service to make up for it.

Reason for two stars regardless, is that in no way was my $19 burger premium in any way. Was it bad? No. But for $19 I should be getting lamb or something premium!

I'll get a shawarma next time..

Visited The Pint to have a drink and lunch before a walking tour. We arrived at 12 and sat right at the bar. We ordered two beers and at 12:15 we ordered lunch. The place started to fill up with people going to the game but we felt confident that we would get our food before most since we had been there so long. 

At 1:20 we still hadn't gotten our food and both our beers were gone and not one bartender stopped to ask if we wanted a refill. We had to try very hard to flag down a bartender. We asked how much longer for the food and she said she would ask but that the kitchen was pretty backed up at the moment. 

She never got back to us so at 1:30 we asked for the check for the two beers and to forget about the food. Not only did we have someplace to be at 2 but waiting over an hour (at a sports bar) for some very basic food items is not acceptible in any situation. 

Very disappointment in this establishment.

Instead of trying half price chicken wings, this time I had all you can eat boneless chicken before the deal ends(it was for January only). Service was alright and food came fast as well. The chicken was pretty dry and I think it was fried already and they just mix with different flavored sauces on it when they get orders. It was a fun experience to try out all you can eat boneless chicken tho.
I come to this spot every summer. Food is good patio is nice. Just a cool place for drinks and snack

I was very impressed by their ability to handle a party of 25. The breaded broccoli appetizer was very good and the burger did not disappoint. The food was good, but the service was great. If you have a large party, make a reservation and go here. The atmosphere is a sports bar and is perfect when you have children who can often be loud!
Very good restaurant, convenient if you stay in Delta hotel. Food was delicious and service was great!
Loved this spot! Very clean and nice. The food was great. Free WiFi. A little bit overpriced but delicious food!

I ordered eggs Benedict which arrived fairly quickly with a side of a berry smoothie shot. Wasn't the biggest fan of the shot. My extra spicy Caesar was pretty good. They add good amount of vodka in it which is always a plus  the drink was topped with a pickle wedge and a pepperoni stick. Our server was very attentive and friendly

Awesome spot to catch a quick bite and a cold beer. We stay at the Crown Plaza frequently for work and always stop on in for a bite. It's convenient, the service is friendly and the prices are reasonable. Worth a visit if you feel like taking a quick walk from your hotel.
Awesome first meal in toronto! Burger and short rib were off the hook! Would highly recommend! Luke was great and gave us some awesome recommendations of things to do in the area. Bravo!!

My boyfriend and I stopped by here for dinner and had a really great experience. 

The Service:
The service was really good and our waitress placed our orders relatively quickly and she continued to fill our glasses throughout the night. Our food also arrived really quickly, which allowed us to enjoy the beautiful ambiance. 

The Ambiance:
The restaurant is really nice and has a romantic feel. It is definitely the perfect place for a nice enjoyable date night. 

The Food:
We ordered a margarita flatbread pizza (this was loaded with gluten and dairy) for my boyfriend and a cauliflower steak for myself. 

My boyfriend really enjoyed his flatbread pizza. The portion was huge and he said it was really good. I asked him how it compares to his favourite pizza restaurant and he said it was good but not as good as his favourite pizzeria. He would give it 3 out of 5 stars. 

I loved the cauliflower steak. It was placed on a bed of lentils in a curry of some sort and featured a green pesto sauce. The flavours on my dish were fantastic and I would give it a 5 out of 5. I liked it better than the cauliflower steak at the Keg, which I used to think was pretty great! My boyfriend tried it as well and he loved my dish as well. 

Would I Return?
Absolutely!
Roach spotting.  No attempt at compensation.  When spoke to the manager was just offered a portion of bill off.  Horrid.

One evening out with a friend, we were walking along the harbour and then found ourselves wandering through the streets of Toronto. Closer by my area, we actually stumbled upon Soco Kitchen and Bar which looked quite extravagant and seemed to be decently crowded. Spontaneously we decided to have dinner there.  

We were greeted by the staff and taken swiftly to our seats out on the patio, and for a nice summer night it was the perfect setting to enjoy the view of the Roger Centre, or the ACC (depending on what side of the table we sat on!).

The two of us started with some drinks - my friend ended up ordering a beer for himself, while I had a nice cocktail of Raspberry Twist (I believe it was called) on the recommendation of the waiter that night. It was definitely very refreshing for a night out in July!

Shortly after getting our drinks, our main courses came out, fresh from the soco kitchen! On the top portion of the photo we have my friend's selection - he ordered the Orrechiette Pasta which had smoked bacon, green peas, wild mushrooms, and truffle pecorino. On my side of the table I ordered a classic Beef Burger which consists of a ground prime chuck, smoked cheddar, bacon, red pepper jam, pickled onions, whisky BBQ sauce with a house brioche bun and a side of fries. My dish was honestly one of the best gourmet burgers I have ever had - and well worth the $19. The dining experience at Soco was also stellar, and promises a nice evening out with whomever you are spending it with. It is perfect for small get togethers and its location is definitely extraordinary as well!

For the full review, click here: https://foodieutopiablog.com/2016/08/15/soco-kitchen-bar/

The service is the reason for the stars. Our waitress was very friendly. She was attentive, personable and funny. It was a very busy night so the amount of attention she gave was surprising. 
The food, however, was awful. 
Appetizers:
- The mushroom flatbread (actually a pizza) was really good--though we could have just been super hungry.  
- Sweet potato fries, decent but soggy
Mains:
- Mushroom soup & the striploin...first, it took forever to come. The order was lost so I waited ages for it to come. Our waitress gave us a free dessert but I was so hungry I didnt even enjoy it. When I finally did get the soup it was cold. Again, I was hungry so I didnt even bother sending it back. The steak, medium well, was just okay. The flavour was lacking, the texture was amateur; the mushroom ketchup is what made it. The double baked potato was so salty
Dessert:
-creme brulee--it was okay. Big portion which is good for sharing.

The server was very passionate and kind, funny guy. The ambiance of the restaurant was classy and relaxing. Food was wonderful:)) FYI; got the 5 cheese Mac n Cheese, Margherita pizza, tuna poke bowl (super good), veggie Bennie and a mushroom soup (rich and flavourful). To sum it up, super good service and great food. Would recommend and come back again!

At Local for St.Paddys Day! And I have to say it's a packed house here, but the staff, from the bar backs to the bartender's, and to the food service are absolutely on point with friendly and fast service when getting your orders in. This my Local, make it yours!
I give it

This place was amazing! The people treated us splendidly and the food was simply to die for. From great tasting coffee to delicious avocado toast. 

That's what I would have said if the service was actually great :D 

The issue is, I see a lot of great reviews here so I expected the same. So my experience started with a very cold morning (In Toronto so duh!) and wanting a warm meal with my coffee. As we entered the restaurant we were greeted pretty aggressively with "we only serve brunch now". Naturally we're like ok fine, as long as there's coffee we should be golden. 

We were then seated and given a menu. The menu was nothing really special and a little pricey for what was in the area. This was our third restaurant and can say there are much cheaper options that were DELICIOUS. I digress, so then we wait, we talk, we wait. Then another couple gets seated exactly 24.75 inches (not accurate, it was just really damn close) away from us and within seconds (I kid you not) gets service. Welp that's when we took an executive decision to get our asses out of there. Wish our experience could have been better but it wasn't. 

Cheers if you made it this far :D

The to-go here is awesome, order is always correct, things are separated and labeled. Portions for delivery are equal to when you eat there. (Unlike some places, if you know what I mean!) 

When I do decide to step inside I love the atmosphere, the music is always good. You get seated right away. 

I recently feel in love with their salad! Huge bowl! But other times I always go with the chicken strips. Close to my usual work hotel and tons of parking.

I'm usually pretty patient because I'm a waitress myself but I can't believe it. We have had servers and managers walking past us for the past 25 minutes and only now do we get someone at our table because I stared down every worker who walked by. They took our drink and food order together it has now been 10 minutes and we still don't have drinks. It may be a little busy but there's so many of them. I'm just annoyed and wanted to rant

If I could give this place a zero star, I definitely would. This is the worst customer service I've ever received. The manager is absolutely rude and disrespectful. She screams at her employee and customers!

 From the moment we walked in, she already gave us attitude and told us we couldn't sit in the booths because it was reserved. But we were seated there by the server and we had made reservations. Instead of checking and politely asking us to move, she demanded us to leave the seats immediately. We ended up moving to another booth and table combined as we were a big group and the server nicely apologized for the confusion. 

We placed our order and the order was slow to come out and we never got cutlery, or plates at all. When we asked for another pitcher it took 20 mins to give us a new one as the manager stated that she doesn't take orders. When we did ask the server she had forgotten several times so we had to remind her and hence the delay. We ordered dessert and same thing happened, it was delayed. Their kitchen wasn't able to handle the amount of people in the restaurant as it was game night and probably the busiest they've ever been. 

Finally, when we asked for the bill, after we paid and tipped they came over telling us we paid the wrong one as they gave us the other tables bill. We waited for it to get refunded but they were busy running around, the paper ran out for the receipt and the manager came over. This time, not only did she not apologize for the mistake and the delay, she demanded that we do the refund and pay the new bill. It was a really small difference and it wasn't our fault that they gave us the wrong bill but she decided to a big deal out of it and gave us all attitude like we were at fault. It was horrible and we were not taking anymore of it so we just paid it and left. We didn't want to be there any longer to be further mistreated. 

On our way out, she was saying horrible thing about us to her employee and the worst part of it is that we weren't even out the door!!! Unbelievable. This is the worst customer service ever!!! We will not be returning and nor do I recommend anyone to this restaurant unless you want to be mistreated.

Have been several times and this last was great. Had the duck Reuben sandwich and it was heavenly  with a slightly sweet taste to its heavy savoury flavour. The Mac and cheese is fantastic as was the pepperoni pizza (we added sausage to it as well). I will definitely be back.

Came here randomly on a Friday with a friend cause we were in the area. Decent spot but it's quite loud. 

I wouldn't come here to chill but if you are looking for a really boisterous spot to kick back some drinks while on the patio or watch some sports casually while eating this could be a good place for you. 

They also have a decent happy hour. We ordered poutine and tacos with a pint of beer (on tap and your choice) for $7 each. Which were pretty filling and I don't think small in portion. 

Tip - We had no reservations but would recommend to do so as we had to be placed on a waiting list and maybe wait 10-15 mins. We also came at the right time as after that there was crowd lining up when we were seated.

Came here for lunch one afternoon. Food took about an hour to arrive and tasted like it was sitting waiting to be served to us. I ordered a salad and the greens lost its texture and shape. My coworker shared their fries and they were at room temperature.

Came here for a drink at the very end of St Paddy's day. We ordered Irish car bombs (8.99), Belgian moon (7.52), and the house lager (5). We also ordered some wings and was pleasantly surprised by how big the portion size was for only 14 bucks. The wings were probably one of the best I've had at a pub. We were glad that we decided to give the draft house a try. It looks a bit grungy on the outside but the food is actually pretty good and the prices very agreeable. They even have specials during the week with cheap wings and drinks.
Home made food with a super cozy vibe, excellent staff and quick service. Can't go wrong here.
Pretty suboptimal experience.  Service is scattered.  Food is overpriced for mediocre quality.  Would definitely look elsewhere for food.

Was back in Toronto and so came back to this location near the Airport and all the hotels - so good location - fun decor and theme - lots of sports and TVs on - used to go to a location in Carey, NC.  Food is ok but doesn't separate them.  This time I did Chicken Parma   It's was ok but the creamy noodles on side were very dry (very) it's as if it sat under heat lamp.   Service - waitress was very nice.  Just slow.

I used to LOVE the tuna club at this place. But they changed the menu without hesitation which was disappointing. 

Bring back the old tuna club!

This place was awesome! My fiancé and I came here for dinner the day we got engaged. We're from out of town and we were blown away by the service we received! We had Korri as our server and he was really great! He gave us a lot of recommendations. We ended up with the Mac and cheese, mushroom soup, a steak, and pepperoni pizza all to which we're phenomenal! 

To our surprise, we were gifted a desert plate to celebrate which was a beautiful touch for such a special day. I could not be happier with where we celebrated the night of.

Korri was even sweet enough to write down some places to visit while in the city before we left.

All in all, great food, great service, great vibe.

This is definitely one of the better places to hang out in Liberty Village. It's easy to see how popular and busy it gets during the summer months especially but it can be just as busy during the slower winter months as well. Either way it's a great atmosphere for a drink or a bite to eat just about any day of the week. 

What stands out here the most however is the friendliness of the staff and how they do go out of their way to make sure your needs are met. There is a real feeling of this being a neighborhood bar even though it's a corporate creation of the Joey Restaurant chain. My first visit here and the bartender bought me a drink (special shout out to Mike) as a sort of welcome to the 'hood' and in a time where few staff or managers extend the courtesy that alone makes this place tops in the Liberty Village area. 

Keep up the good work guys!

We stayed at the delta hotel on vacation and stopped in Soco for breakfast a couple of times out of convenience. It got pretty busy but the staff were attentive. The food was good. I got eggs Benedict

Had a wonderful dinner at Soco Kitchen. I had the duck - crispy skin, moist & full of flavor. The dessert was the Limoncello Apple "cobbler." What a great combination of flavors & textures! A must have!

I'll start my review on a positive note. The service was great, very attentive and welcoming, even on a very busy night. The location is excellent, especially during a sports event. The food was not as great. Tasteless! Came out cold! Expensive and a real shame since its part of the Delta hotel. We got the award wining mac n cheese, was bitter, and boring. The steak came out luke warm, mushroom soup came out cold, but was actually the tastiest dish. Our sweet potato fries were soggy and cold. Very disappointed considering the location, and price! Stay away, much much better options in the wonderful city of Toronto!

This place is one of the nicest restaurants in the area. I've been here many times and the staff are always really friendly and accommodating. The drinks are great, large selection of cocktails and the food has a lot of flavour. Only problem with this place is that they seem to put bacon bits in everything and as a vegetarian this is quite annoying.

This is probably the best rib and wing place I have ever eaten. I discovered them on Just-Eat.ca and the first time I actually ordered delivery. The second time I tried the same thing, I was told they were too busy and couldn't get anyone to deliver. The place was just a few blocks away from where I lived at the time so I decided to take a walk over there. I realized as soon as I entered the place that I was never getting take out from there again. They get the sports atmosphere right. Loads of televisions, pool table in the corner and of course great service.

I have had the rib and wing special a half dozen times now.

I ordered the BBQ chicken which was good and I loved the sauce. The food was really great but the environment and service need to be improved. The dinnerware wasn't clean and I saw it was dirty on the floor. I never saw bugs flying in restaurant ever but I saw many when we had dinner. The waitress didn't really care our table, water wasn't refilled if you didn't ask. We had our dinner around 5 pm which the restaurant was not busy at all. 
Wouldn't come back and not recommend.

Meh. The food was ok, the service was good but it's only a fairly clean restaurant, at best. 

I ordered poutine as an a appetizer and it was VERY good.

However, when our meals came out (there were 4 of us) only 3 meals
came out. My chicken and waffles was missing. 

Our server blamed the kitchen and said it would be 10 more minutes. I waited and when it came it was tasty, but the waffles weren't cooked all the way through. That was disappointing, but the chicken was good. One of our group informed the server of the issue with my meal and they took it off; which seemed like the right thing to do. 

I wasn't impressed and would probably not go back there. 

The other issue is that they don't carry coke products, which isn't a big deal, unless you order a mixed drink with coke and they use Pepsi. They did let us know in advance but if you have full bar service - you should probably carry coke as a mixer, if nothing else.
Okay place to watch the game the seats on Edward are subjected to the wind from the door opening and closing. There are screens almost any where. The place is not busy

I went for a long walk today and had lunch at The Draft House.  I sat at a table by the open window ... there was lots to see outside.

I ordered a pound of wings with medium sauce and ranch dressing on the side.  Wings were one of the Sunday specials ... $7.99!  I'm not a big fan of fries but these were really good.  The wings were good.  The sauce had a bit of a kick to them.  I thought it was a great deal for $7.99!  I'd get this again.

Shane was my server.  He was friendly and took good care of me.

This is by far one of my best restaurants I have ever been too! I'm from the states and I came here twice in two weeks just for this food & desserts. Incredible food, desserts, and drinks. Not to mention in a great location.

Well, Unlike their sister restaurant on Lake shore (different owner) this one is absolutely fabulous... Very clean modern friendly staff consistent and delicious food. The female manager is a little bitchy but we all have days I guess. 

I prefer smaller wings but this restaurant mainly has medium to large wings. They are  also fresh never frozen. 

Best wings I've had in the GTA so far hands-down five stars

My boyfriend and I first went inside, and the host told us we can grab any table available outside. Conveniently there was one right by the window so she told us to sit there. It took about 10mins for someone to take away the dirty plates, but she didn't bother to clean it. Then waited another 10mins for a server to bring us water and the menu. We took a few minutes to decide what we wanted to order but she didn't come back. After making many eye contacts with the servers, we got up and left. It is unacceptable to have to wait that long for someone to clean the table, bring us the menu, and an additional 20mins and still no one came to take our order.

I understand it was busy, but for me to see servers standing around chatting with each other... That made us angry and the customers sitting nearby uncomfortable..

Losing my boyfriend and I as customers probably won't make a dent to your sales but customers are customers.

Busy place on a Wednesday evening.  They would not take a reservation but were able to seat us immediately.
The servers were friendly and helpful. I ordered the chips and guacamole as I liked it recently when I went.  Sadly the chips were bland this time with minimal seasoning.  The guac was fine.  I did not want a salad as my last experience was basically a bowl of lettuce with little else.  I was not hungry enough for a bowl, which they said they could make dairy free and vegetarian (some were already gluten free).
I decided just to have dessert instead but there were no gluten free and dairy free desserts:(( The server offered an orange sorbet (their only flavour) so I agreed.  It came in a little styrofoam cup with paper lid, like the kind you get in a hospital.  We were a little surprised but assumed it was presented this way to ensure there was no cross contamination.
Overall a "meh" experience.
The food itself is good but the wait is ridiculous. We had to wait 2hours for our food. They told us it will be 6 minutes at that point and we waited another half hour and still didn't get our food.
The service is always good, however the food is a hit or a miss.  They keep changing their menu and it's consistently going down hill with every change

My colleagues and I visited this restaurant on a work trip on July 9. I will happily admit that we were a very large group, but we booked well in advance and the restaurant agreed to a fixed menu for us. The service from the wait staff was okay, for the most part. The problems we experienced came someone who I think is a manager, and one particular male waiter. 

Jack Astor's isn't really known for the quality of its food, but our problems began there. First, because we were offered a fixed menu, no changes in any way were permitted. For example, my vegetarian colleague was not permitted to have chicken removed from his chicken pasta, so he received dry boiled noodles instead. Another colleague requested his steak be cooked medium-well, instead of medium--this was also not permitted.

Recognizing that a large group like ours puts a strain on the kitchen, we could understand if we were asking for a different dish. But 30 seconds more on a steak? To achieve this, the manager told us, we would either have to hold back every plate for the entire group or have this colleague served last. Additionally, removing chicken from pasta is actually one less step, unless these are cooked in advance (which I would then recommend not eating). Beyond this, the manager who explained this to us was rude, condescending, and seemed annoyed by our business. As a result, my two colleagues chose not to eat. Good experience, right?

In terms of drink service, it was slow, inconsistent, and the male server who took some of our drink orders was, like his manager, rude and condescending. Truth be told, this was the least of our problems and was merely annoying, especially considering that gratuity was automatically added to our drink bills (watch out for this, business travellers).

And last but not least, on top of not being able to make even the slightest (and entirely possible) change to the temperature of our food, my "medium" steak arrived rare (and I mean *rare* with a capital R). I didn't dare send it back, because I didn't want to be party to yet another argument with the remarkably rude manager. 

I would not recommend this restaurant, plain and simple. This visit was disappointing and a waste of money, and will ensure that we do not book with any Jack Astor's again. All I can say to anyone who chooses to visit this restaurant is "good luck."

Don't go there if you're counting on seeing PPV boxing. No one in the place could figure out how to get it even though they had a poster saying they were showing it. I sat there until 9pm and finally said something and they gave me a big sorry...everything else was fine.

The best Mac and cheese I have ever had. Seriously. They have won awards for it! (It's on their menu description, and I haven't fact checked it, but I believe it!)

The area is bustling with a mix of tourists, sports fans, and business men and women on work lunches. You are in unique (good) company every time!

What a terrible experience coming here . We came around 6:30 pm for dinner only 2 people in the entire restaurant. The waitress smoking right next to entrance and not even in work clothes . Then we order wings no joke 40-45 mins to get 2lbs !!!!! And nobody in the entire place . It's already a bad location and on top 40 mins wait for wings this place will be gone before the leafs next home game . Poor management and bad ownership. They don't deserve any local business they way they treat customers

This is the most ghetto ratchet disgusting st Louis I've ever been to.... What the hell is going on with Toronto's restaurants .... So many flies just hanging around each other on the wall like they pay rent there too... Absolutely lost my appetite. I warn any one that comes here toavoid going here before you get sick! If the front of the house is like that, imagine the kitchen ! My boyfriend was slapping the flies down every 30 seconds and couldn't enjoy his food ! Idk just don't go here

This is the worst location in Toronto! Been to other locations and was massively disappointed by this one. If I could I would give this location a 0 star rating. Service is extremely slow when it's not half price wing day and the quality of food is trash. 

We went around 8:50 pm for their half price appetizers, particularly for their wing poutine. Keep in mind that there were only about ten customers including us(2) when we were there. We ordered one calamari and two wing poutines. It took close to FIFTY minutes for our calamari to arrive and for our waitress to tell us that there was not enough gravy for our poutines. HUUUH?! 

Why did it take the 50 minutes to tell us that?  There is clearly ZERO communication all around within their team if it takes that long to tell customers that something is sold out. Also when we received the calamari, there was only about EIGHT full small pieces!!! Imagine paying $12.99 for that! Even though it was half off I felt like it was still a rip off. Go to the Atrium location if you like to be massively disappointed and want to give money away for virtually nothing!

Great place to grab food with the family and even catch a live sports game if you're into it! Their bar is outstanding and they have a very elaborate drink menu including giant fishbowls. If you like something spicy I would recommend their Asiago 4 cheese Mac, it was delicious!

Neighbourhood pub in Forest Hill. Bar seating in the front of the house tables in the back. Friday night live cover band with a busy crowd. Standard draft options with a mix of craft beer, imports (Heineken) and domestic. Food is above average for pub fare.  The grilled chicken wings were solid. Fries soggy this time. Cheers.

We had a nice evening at the bar on the roof and were debating on getting dinner at the restaurant below but decided that the food selection was lackluster at best. As we were leaving the hostesses made a comment to us saying "they probably can't afford to eat here." What a disrespectful thing to say to customers and I can't imagine employing people who act like that. Will never be coming back to this place.

Was looking to kill time while waiting to go to a music festival at Ontario place and found this place near where we parked. It was lively and filled with people going in and out, especially on the patio. Really loved the ambience and decor - the beers on tap were found on this board that would update periodically which was really cool. Loved the weekend drink specials, tried the mystery wine for like $4-5 which is solidly priced especially for it being a busy Sunday during brunch time in liberty village. Also tried the sweet potato fries and they were such a delicious snack, crispy on the outside but soft inside. I was pleasantly surprised at how attentive the staff were considering how busy it was. Would definitely come here again! Super close to the CNE grounds so I anticipate stopping by again before heading there.

The Lamb ShakShouba is fantastic. Probably the single most favorite breakfast item I have ever had anywhere. The atmosphere is great and the servers were amazing. Honestly this place is the best to take family, dates, anyone!

Came here with a friend due to the convenient location. 

Pros: convenient location, variety of different cuisines on the menu. 

Cons: service can be improved (server didn't come to take our order for a while and didn't give us water at all). According to my friend, their shrimp pasta had a bad sauce which "tasted like someone's mom made it"?  

The sweet potato fries were okay and so was the Malbec!

I had lunch today at Jack Astor's.

I ordered what I always get at a Jack Astor's ... Chicken Parmigiana.  The chicken was a decent size and tender and juicy.  There was lots of cheese on it ... yum!  The pasta was good too.  It was a delicious meal.

I felt like something sweet so ordered My Cookie Ate Your Brownie.  On Heather, my server's advice, I had ice cream added.  I ate the ice cream and some of the cookie and took the rest home (the paper bag it's served in came in handy!).

Heather was friendly and helpful and took good care of me.

"Local Public Eatery: Friendship day special"

Fell in love with this place the moment I glanced at it.
.
It was in my check list, and what other occasion would do justice to a patio place like this than friendship day  
.
I will rate the service 4.5, that too on a busy Sunday. It's a must visit on summer afternoon to grab some brunch and play games with your people.
.
They have indoors which is equally amazing, at night it dazzles with the rope and small bulbs that they have put for ambiance. The night view actually dragged me to visit the place again 
.

Food I would rate 4.5/5, it was that lip smacking. Just deducted points as they don't have ranch available 

What we ordered:
1)fully loaded Chicken nachos, with sour cream, jack cheese, fresh avacado

2) "Huevos Rancheros"
.I tried this first time in my life. And I almost fainted because it tasted heavenly. 
.
.
Fresh corn tortillas, with porched egg that was so perfectly cooked layered with black beans and salsa roja  accompanied by cheddar and jack cheese  
The egg mixed with gravy was giving and outstanding flavour. I am drilling right now 

4) hot wings
.
One can't go wrong with wings right? But this one will keep you smiling with every bite. Tangiest I ever tried 
.


Drinks were fine, I tried Spanish Sangria which was ok. The fruits were sweet.
.
5)Mystery wine from happy hours, ok I need to sit down for this.

It has a pleasant texture, it was the smoothest and I will check out the name next time if they reveal it to me. Its going in my all time favourite list

Really solid pub! Came in with a group of 10 and had beers ordered right away, and brought back within just a couple minutes. Having a background in the service industry, I know how large groups can be complicated, but Adam and Dan absolutely killed it. There was never a point where we were looking for our server, or needed an item. They were always there. Adam rhymed off the beer menu for us, and gave a couple suggestions. Took our food order and got everything out to us perfectly. Separate bills? No problem! Figured everything out and got us paid and out right when we needed to go. Dan mentioned that during football season they have a happy hour, and invited us back for another Monday night! We will definitely be back to visit the Abbot, for their great service, food and beers.

I'm enjoying this new joint in leaside, that took over where shoeless joes was. I'll generously give it 4 stars, and list a few pros and cons 

Pros:
-Vlad, one of the owners, is very nice and has accommodated me and my guests a few times even during busy UFC nights when there was no room 
-Laila, one of their head bartenders, is very friendly and efficient 
-their wings are Ontario farmed and tasty. I had interview with the vampire and my fiancé had their infamous Black Mamba, and he managed to get on their Wall of Flame for that one.. I don't know how he did it. 
-If you like spice, this is the place to go for your wings. Seriously. Scorpions Kiss and Black Mamba are outrageously spicy. Even my super experienced partner had his lips puffing up, and his eyes watering. He powered through and said they were delicious
-Occasionally good specials, on both food and drink-mostly weekdays though. Sometimes $5 pints and $4ish rail

Cons:
-some of the other servers have been slow-ish. I don't see them around very much anymore though. But it does generally take a while to get another drink 
-they close too early! Half the time I'm only leaving to get my beer at 11, and then last call is 11:45
-on the no-drink-special nights, beer can run a bit pricey. 
-if you want a dip, you gotta pay extra, and your wings only come with about 8 or so. 


Other noteworthy things:
-There is a jukebox, which i find slightly more expensive than the other jukeboxes of the same brand. It's about $1 per song. 
-There is a pool table, which is a nice change from the former shoeless joes, which just used the space for more tables 
-there is a patio for those nice weather drinks... if you can tolerate the sounds of cars screeching along Eglinton, swing by for a daytime pint. Otherwise wait until well after dinner. 
-there are 88 flavours of wings to try!! Including a few interesting seeming flavour combos. 
-if you eat those crazy ass black mamba 4 million scoville unit wings, DONT TOUCH YOUR PARTNER FOR LIKE THREE DAYS CAUSE IT WILL HURT 

All in all nothing too awful to complain about. Give it a try! 

If you're driving, just... don't. Eglinton is a disaster because of all the construction!

This aesthetically pleasing restaurant in Liberty Village is one of the cutest restaurants I've been to. With a large open patio, and dainty lights!! 

It's perfect for date nights or dinner with a group of friends. I highly recommend coming here not just for their awesome food deals, but because of the vibe. 

However, the service on receiving your is quite slow and takes a little longer than some restaurants. But it was worth the wait! 

I ordered their late night taco deal, with a side of porgies. DELICIOUS. That is all. I'd definitely come back and bring a larger group of friends!

The food was good but the service and server were bad and rude. I went with my friends to grab a bit at locals last night and it was after 9. So, the server told us there is a happy hour menu. I ordered just the local burger and the yam fries while holding the happy hour menu and pointing to the items I wanted. After we finished, the bill came with the local burger and extra 2$ (for the adjusted yam fires). I told the server I ordered just the local burger and the yam fries from the happy hour menu (which is cheaper btw). The server told me no you ordered the locals burger from the normal menu and adjusted the fries. I told her, no I ordered just the local burger and the yam fries from the happy hour menu. She then said are you going to eat the sandwich and the full serving of yam fries. (Is she shaming me for the amount of food I can eat). She also didn't even offer to fix the problem and was giving me an attitude.
We went there for breakfast . We had the waffles with berry compote and eggs with sausage . It's just ok. Wouldn't go back .
We were looking for a good place near the airport and walked here from our hotel. It was awesome. It's a bit pricey, but everyone loved their food and left happy. Our waitress was great, too.
The best mac and cheese I have ever had and I am from Wisconsin!  And the desserts...!!!

I decided to give St Louis a try again after staying away from it for a few years.. because a couple of locations my boyfriend and I have been to, the wings which they are supposed to be famous for, were really tiny . So we checked out this location at the Atrium on Bay last night, thinking we could watch the Raptors game there while having our dinner.
