The button riblets appetizer was tasty but my wings and combo entree was miserable. The so-called 1/2 pound of wings were just 4 pieces and must have weighed 80 g the most...and the half rack of ribs must have been from a piglet.The caesar salad that came with the meal were all leaves from the stem part of a lettuce and didn't look or taste too fresh. My boyfriend liked his buffalo wrap and fries though..so phew! At least one of us had a decent dinner. However, since previous diners of this bar had not said good things about their wings which are St Louis' specialty, it's disappointing that they haven't done anything to improve on them. If the management wants to stick with small wings, then give more on a plate!  Better still, they should go check out other restaurants which serve wings and find out where they are getting their wings from! No point using such tiny wings and flavoring them with the sauce of customers' choice because they will most likely turn out overdone or dry . Our young Ukrainian waitress was quite friendly and attentive but the lady bartender was letting a male diner give her hugs throughout our 2 hours there . Well, I guess if he's getting some loving in the restaurant, he wouldn't be complaining about his chicken wings!

I ordered the Memphis steak(medium rare), when it arrived it looked unusual turns out they gave me a wrong cut with alot of fat cavities, couldn't even chew it. Sam the manager was very kind and told me that's not how the cut was supposed to be and gave me a second portion of what it was meant to taste like, It was delicious, although if y'all are medium rare lovers like myself, I'd still advise to opt for medium instead at this location couldnt cut my last 3/4 of it. Again Sam was a great help he even waved off the bill and was on the house.

Sorry probably the worse thing I had when I went to Toronto. It was late, so my friend randomly chose a place. 

Horrible. Don't remember the name of these dishes. But the Asian style dish was horrible. Sauce was to overpowering. I don't know why it was a a recommended dish. 
Friend A got The steak. Tried a piece. It was dry, and only the fries seems decent.
Friend B got the salad. Decent.
I feel like I wasted money here, but if this is your only choice here avoid this dish. Stick with something simple like a burger or if i remember their fried chicken something. Don't think they can mess that up.
The waitress was nice.

Busiest of the three breweries, the one that comes closest to a decent feel, look, vibe.
They also have a shuffleboard.

Liberty village (for me) is a very unattractive area, lots of repetitive ugly glass condos.  Best looking thing is 'maybe' a Scotiabank w a cool chimney, in other words, a branched bank is the most attractive.  This is usually when someone feels the bizarre need to message me and defend their 'hood and tell me how awful I am and I'll never amount to anything, etc.  Yelp can get real ugly!

DO NOT GO HERE WITH KIDS!!!  Horrible horrible service. Our waitress was one of the worst waitresses I have ever had! We ordered our food and specifically asked for our sons pasta to be brought out as soon as it was ready. We waited an hour for our food. Every time we asked our waitress for something she would go to every other table before bothering to bring us ketchup, water etc. When we asked her why all the tables around us got their food so quickly and ours took forever she said it was because there was a steak order at our table????? Are they cooking it from frozen. And no apologies whatsoever. We asked for the bill and fifteen minutes later she came back asking if there was anything else - without the bill! Never going back there again. Such poor service and zero apologies.

It's a great place to visit if you are in the town and want to just chill out. We went there on a weekend evening when we just took a stroll in the downtown. They had live music and it was good. We just got a beer and a wine - both good - along with nachos (+ avocado and salsa). Great time. 
The service was a little challenging as getting the attention of the gentleman at the counter was tough in the crowd and there weren't many folks to take care of the patrons. Having said that, once we placed the order, it didn't take much time to get it. 
Overall, we had a great time and would definitely love to come back.

Great location food and staff attended twice for the NBA finals. However the manager Tyler extremely poor training. A patron deliberately took ownership of my reserved seating and manager Tyler did not appropriately investigate and informed me to leave based on false evidence evidence of intoxication. Followed by discrimination in threatening to cancel my reservations. Currently escalating with Marriot Customer Care and will file a complaint with consumer Protection Ontario and appropriate provincial and federal escalation agencies.

Grilled chicken is good. Ordered pasta which is very salty. They were scotch on the martini - only half a glass filled. They were also out of olives and olive juice. Therefore the martini was not made properly.

Dusted wings and food was fine until we realised how dirty the establishment was. Bathrooms were disgusting (flies around the faucet, lots of black smudges around the toilet). We also noticed that there were bugs (gnats and other small fleet fliers) circling around behind the bar area. The hygiene of what we see, for us, calls into question the hygiene of the kitchen. 

There were two servers for the place. Took us a long time for us to be seated, as it took a long time for one table in plain sight to be cleared. Again with hygiene, the table wasn't wiped down well -- still kind of sticky. Generally, a slow and forgetful service. 

Definitely will not be back.
The pad thai is ridiculously awful here...please take it off the menu. It is like noodles with sweet tomato ketchup..horrible !

Bring back the old tuna club. The new one really sucks balls in comparison. The tuna is much smaller  and nearly covers 3/4 of the bun. There is No more Avocados on the sandwich either. It's sad because this was hands down the best thing on the menu, now it's just an over priced & shittier version of a fillet o fish from MacDonald's 

#bigmistake
The chicken wings are so tasty! Also they have discounts everyday for different items so it's worth going another time!

Lunch today was at Soco Kitchen and Bar. We had a set menu for our group lunch:

To start - assorted fruits and pastries for the table and family style urban green salad (heirloom carrots, radish, mulled wine vinaigrette, pomegranate, pumpkin and granola.

Entrees- choice of 
AVOCADO TOAST - smoked ricotta, wild mushrooms, poached eggs, herb salad, herbed tater tots or fresh cut fruit.
HUEVOS DIANA - Corn tortilla, black beans, sunny eggs, chicken chili con queso, avocado salsa, herbed tater tots or fresh cut fruit
MAC N' CHEESE - 2015, 16, 17 Toronto Mac and cheese best of festival champion, herb bread crumbs.
SOCO BACON CHEESEBURGER - ground chuck and brisket, white onions, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese, bacon SOCO secret sauce, SOCO fries or urban salad.

Dessert - Family style Chef's choice seasonal desserts.

Outcome? Four stars for service and presentation. I spoke with my friends with respect to the different plates they chose. While none of them were out of this world, they were good, shareable even. Would definitely need to come back to rate the place for other selections.

Terrible experience! 

I would tell anyone to avoid this restaurant at all costs. We walked in and on a day when Toronto is in an excessive heat warning and the AC wasn't working. That should've been our first clue. 

We tried to order quickly and after we put in our drink order I was told they didn't have Molson on draft. Molson (a Canadian) beer in a bar/restaurant was out?!?! Seriously! So I asked about another beer Richards Red (also a Molson product) - "do you have this?" Waitress replied yes, but then came back and told me they didn't have it. 

I stuck with water, quite frustrated that a bar/restaurant didn't have beer. After that mess my mother's drink she ordered took way longer than it should have. It was one of their "signature" cocktails, yet we could overhear the bartender (and apparently also a server and asst manager) talking her way through the instructions on how to make the drink. 

We then ordered our apps and meals together and waited...and waited...and waited...and waited. 

Then our meal and appetizers came out at the same time. We canceled the apps, since our meal was already there. Last issue was the salad my mother orders came without ranch dressing. No big deal until she waited for about 7 mins and still don't have her dressing. I had to get up and ask for it. Then when it came it was a tiny little helping for a huge salad. It was just embarrassing for the restaurant. 

I will never come here again! Bad deal all the way through and the fact they the staff seemed clueless about the whole ordeal made it worse. 

Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!

A lively fun resto-bar serving up eats and bringing people together.  Personally, the food isn't really the highlight of this restaurant, at least from my experience.  But the service and environment are worth the visit.  This is a place you go after a days work to catch up with friends grab a drink (or two), some food and play shuffle board or soccer pool.  This place can get lively in its modern rustic environment.  As they describe "kind of like your living room, with better food and people to serve you craft beer and rotating selections".  The food isn't terrible but again, isn't anything special.  If I could compare my food experience here, it would be similar to eating at a Jackastors (again the food isn't horrible but you're not getting anything unique/Michelin star worthy) but that's okay because some people aren't about that foodie life...shame on you.  

The service was great, our waitress was very prompt, fun, and personable.  Really made the overall experience at this restaurant memorable.  

We would love to come back during the evening to experience the night life of this fun restaurant.

What a sad Canadian experience. Sitting there for 10 mins and not one came to even ask if we wanted coffee, and then we noticed they served a table that came after us right away. Seems to be a trend here after reading some other comments. Thankfully there are better places in Canada.

We go to both locations and the food is consistent and delicious. This review is for both locations (Leaside and Liberty Village) The service depends on how busy it is. The food snd drinks are always good. The decor is rustic and goes perfectly with the food and drink selections. I don't remember ever having a bad dish. The burger arrived soggy once, the restaurant was too crowded that day, so I didn't send it back. Although the buns was soggy, I still ate it, and it was good and the beef patties were well seasoned nonetheless.

While visiting Toronto from Wisconsin, we were on the lookout for a sit down restaurant that we would not find in the States. We came upon Jack Astor's and decided to try it. We made the right choice! The menu was diverse but not overwhelming, and the food and drinks were delicious! The wait staff was friendly and helpful throughout our meal (shout out to Angie and Alexia). Now, we wish we had a Jack Astor's in Wisconsin. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I love every LOCAL I've been to. This was not an exception. Great place with chill vibes. Came here for some drinks before heading to a music festival by echo beach. They have a great and vast selection of craft beers. Love their board with the rotating taps. I also love their happy hour specials between 3-6 and after 9pm. Waitress was super nice and friendly.
We came for drinks after a long drive. The service was solid, and the fries and drinks were also average. It was a pretty typical hotel bar/restaurant.

Nice with with a great outdoor seating area. The service was ok but they were busy. The pizza and the shrimp pasta was spicy and flavorful. Also the drinks were refreshing. You can't go wrong with this place.

Food was ok. The ooey gooey description in the menu is not true! Ordered a burger that was supposed to be a play on a patty melt and it definitely was not. The beer could be a bit colder. But the food came out relatively fast which I appreciate!

For the love of all that that is holy do not go here! Thursday night, just before 10pm, we walk in. No one on patio, two guys at bar, one lady at table, one couple at table. Ok so not busy. Had long day, just wanted something fast to eat then home to crash. Drinks take about 10 minutes, sure ok. We order nachos with chilli. After 30 minutes Waitress comes to tell us Sorry, they're out of chilli. Why did it take 30 minutes to tell us (we were wondering why it was taking so long to make nachos in the first place). We were gonna leave but starving. So we order wings and fries. It's a wing place so they should pump those out in the regular. After another half hour were talking about leaving. Guy next to us says they have trouble keeping staff, we say they're gonna have trouble keeping customers. People at other table overheard and says they're fed up and leaving. Wait more time. Lady at table we thought was a customer goes behind counter. So two waitresses and no service? As we pack up to leave, the food comes out. Stomach won, we ate. No apologies for long wait. If you can't handle being open late, don't be. If you can't handle customers, don't work in the food industry.

No toilet paper in guys washroom

Wrong wifi access from bartender

Can't find a tv station for sports

Plan carefully because finding free parking is a chore since the Eglinton area roads are all torn up for the Crosstown line.

Our server was Anesthesia; cheerful and courteous.

A friend has a birthday today so we dropped by this place, his favourite hangout.

I'm having a Budweiser Light $5.55 on draft.  From the menu I'm trying the Onion Rings $7.25 as a snack.  My friend ordered 1 pound wings $14.00 to sample.  (Anesthesia took a photo to show us how fresh the wings were...bonus!)

Great service and the food was excellent.  

There's a street facing patio for outdoor seating.  Indoor seating is available at the bar, booths or tables.  Large TV screens hang throughout the restaurant to view sporting events.
Thank you for a great times at Wingporium! Thanks Vlad and the team for making our celebration a crazy party! ))

I went on a Tuesday around 6:30pm for the half-price wing deal and should have known better. 

The wings were small, dry and lacked meat on them. I prefer dry wings and the seasoning was poorly applied (see picture). Usually I'm decently full from a pound of wings but because these wings were so small, my buddy and I decided to split another order.

Wings aside, the service was also poor - waitresses left us alone for long periods of time and didn't acknowledge us when we called them. Now I know they get extremely busy on a Tuesday, especially after office hours, but I've been to other locations during these times that are larger, busier and with less staff - but have received better service.

Don't think I'll be coming back to this location.

Decided to drop by here Thursday morning for a breakfast. Ordered a smoked salmon Benny, it came with fried eggs on muffin instead of poached eggs, sloppy job. The hollandaise sauce is close to no flavour, had to send it back to kitchen... Talked to server, didn't apologize at all for the kitchen, and sounded like he is just doing it because of my demand, not because their kitchen made a mistake.
They had the audacity to have a cover and minimum per head price on game 5 of the Raptors. Pure capitalist greed.

Very enjoyable breakfast.  I would suggest the Avocado toast. Best I've ever had.  The atmosphere was very nice and not overly crowded for the time of morning we visited.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

This place is the best jack Astor's I've been in in toronto! Food is always on point and accommodates all your request to the best of their ability! Chicken bowtie, macho nacho, calamari and donut dippers. Always good food and good value!
Bad service. The lady looks like she hates working there. She only wants to play her music. Very rude and bad service.

RACIST DISCRIMINATION civil litigation currently under way against General Manager Justin Larouche and Delta General Manager Catherine Velie. Currently filing the Ombudsmen of Ontario complaints phase. The restaurant acting manager Tyler Ross discriminated (with NO EVIDENCE AS FORMALLY REQUESTED) with regards to reserved seating arrangements and dismissal of the property. We are elite members of East Indian decent and have evidence of discriminatory behavior from all levels of management. Public court records will be fully disclosed in the near future.

Dirty, beer had malt-vinegary taste (either dirty lines or dirty glasses). Had fish and chips - very little fish in batter. Fish was clearly not fresh and very chewy. Batter was not crispsy. Pros: the server took my beer off the bill and the mint was ok.

Had a great evening here with friends a few weeks ago. Our server was quite friendly and personable with a sense of humour which I enjoy because not all servers have one. He also very kindly but quickly reminded us it was very close for the appetizers special to be closed and made sure we ordered any appetizers we wanted to get the discounted rate. Awesome! There were seven of us there and we got our food and appetizers in less than 20 minutes. I loved it. Will definitely go back!
Food might be good but service was deplorable. Waited over 15 minutes to even order drinks. Left before we ordered anything

I had the half chicken it was very tasty they had a good assortment of vegetables as well. My son had a big burger and loved it. Our waiter Nick was great and attentive. Going back tonight for dinner with friends.

LOVED THIS PLACE drinks is amazing I had the Oklahoma sampler and the Sampler of the appetizer I was full with that I had the mai tai which was amazing and the Lemonade drink wasn't that bad the sprite smoothed out the lemon taste

Our first food stop in Toronto and let me tell you: we were not disappointed! First of all the food was amazing. Of course we had to try the poutine and it was delicious. The chicken and waffles sandwich was so yummy and beware it was a kick of heat!! Second of all Canadians really are the nicest people. Our server gave us some free mini donuts for dessert. He also recommended some great local beers.

So, my sisters and I were craving a good burger. This is the place. Great drink menu, excellent burgers and amazing fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings. Some really good dipping sauces as well. Really cool ambiance and our server was very attentive. If you are looking for a good beer and a burger, stop in. Not really suitable for children, but I would come again.

The bartender was friendly I sat downstairs and it's definitely a bar to hangout and have drinks! Unfortunately for me when I ordered a beer I noticed a hair in my drink, neither mine or the bartenders. Asked for another drink and the bartender acted professionally and gave me a new one overall good food I had the fish and chips and couldn't complain about the portion size!

Casual atmosphere, we got the sample appetizer and wings, beer and a shaken margarita. The food is great! 
Unfortunately the servers are extremely rude, they think they are on a catwalk but they are supposed to serve the customers... You have to go to the extreme to get their attention... So disappointing because we really liked the food, but will not go back.
The music skipped all night. I ordered a burger but the patties were very well done. Would not come back.

The Bar With No Name had its Closing Day Party yesterday, therefore I made my 2nd and final visit to the venue to celebrate.  My 1st visit was in Spring 2018 for a great Beer Fest. on their very nice back patio.  The official start time for the Party was 8 pm; I was meeting a few others there so I arrived at 7:45 by which time the place was already pretty packed - it became quite a bit more so later on - and the music was blasting.  They had a drink special (a full pint for $7, incl. tax) and comp. food samples which was quite nice and the beer and food were both quite good.  The venue is of course a dive bar and pretty small but of course it's a shame they are closing.  One of my friends asked about rumours that they are looking for another location, hopefully in the same area/neighbourhood, and it appears the search is still on.

As both of my visits to the venue were for special occasions there I can't really comment on the regular vibe, food or drinks, etc. but as they have now closed that doesn't really matter at this point and might only if/when they do find another location.  They did start a fundraiser to try to buy the building they were located in but it appears they couldn't raise enough money in time.  I should also state that I've known of the venue for a long time and wish I could have visited years ago but I never made it until last year, and I'll close by stating that it had my all-time favourite name for a bar.

Loved this place!  Cozy and warm, great food and drinks and a knowledgeable staff.  They had a special whiskey that is $100 shot (can't remember the details) but it is a bottle that is only available once a year. (See pictures)

The food was far above what I was expecting for "bar food".  The food was fresh and creative which was a double bonus.

If you want a relaxing night and good food and drinks check out the Moose!

The level of food quality at this place is a Waffle House. So here goes: went for lunch on Saturday, July 27, 2019. My fiancée and I order tea and soda water. They only have sweet tea by fountain. Had water. Ordered the wings. They were fried and breaded and dry and tossed in some type of Buffalo sauce  (sauce was decent). I ordered a burger (simple, right) and my honey ordered a grilled chicken salad. The burger comes out and it is two tiny patties burned around the edges. The fiancées chicken has one sliver and one slice of chicken (less than a quarter of a small chicken breast). I asked the waitress to take the burger back since it was overdone and was not as described on the menu. The manager came over and I explained that  the menu said burger (not too tiny patties from the Waffle House, thin as ever). The cost for this tiny overdone burger was 14.95. 

In sum, their drink (non-alcoholic) selection sucked, the wings were fried with breading and dry and they served Waffle House burgers and salads. The reviews of 4.2 must be for alcohol or ambience, there is no way it is the food. 

We will not get into the laissez-faire attitude of the staff. Save your money.

I came here for dinner with a group of friends. I had their lobster fettuccine, the lobster was quite fresh, and it was quite good.  Since i went with friends, i also got to tried three of their desserts: mascarpone cheesecake, sticky toffee pudding and chocolate cake.  I like the sticky toffee pudding the best as it comes out warm from the oven, and with the vanilla ice cream slightly melted, it was perfect.  They also have a good selection of beer.

Exceeded Expectations
Stopped by Wayne Gretzky's recently for lunch with a friend. We weren't anticipated a good meal, but wanted to grab a quick bite to eat before our eventful afternoon. I ordered the Oasis Chicken Club with a side of Caesar salad. I was surprised to find that the chicken was cooked perfectly and was very juicy, the sauce used was very flavourful, and the ingredients were fresh. The salad also came with a generous amount of bacon and had the perfect amount of dressing.
The service was excellent and the atmosphere was pretty great with lots of memorabilia, photos, hockey decor and TVs.
I wouldn't hesitate to return with friends to watch the game or for a quick lunch.

Been here a bunch of times. Service is usually decent. Food quality varies. When I ordered the  lobster fettuccine dish the lobster was undercooked and i could barely chew it. I ordered fried calamari once and it was so undercooked that  I requested another one. The pizza was not a good choice . Don't order their pizza, there are other better options. The sticky toffee putty is probably their best dessert, but it's only for people that like desserts that are really sweet. The drinks are pretty good. The best one is the blood orange smash. Definitely order the blood orange smash. It has sweet house-made meringue on top that balances out the sourness of the drink just perfectly.

Stopped here for lunch on a Tuesday. It wasn't too busy and we were seated right away. Our waitress was there almost immediately to take our order. I had the superfood bowl with tofu and it was delicious. I wish there was a little more dressing on it and the tofu was a little too sweet for my liking. Otherwise good food and food service.

It's a pub, you know? Decent beer list, nachos needed more cheese, and pleasant enough service. We were there early-ish (8:30 - 10 p.m.) on a Saturday night and liked the music (plus it wasn't too loud so we could talk!) and I was happy to have Newcastle on draft & our server was very nice, but we kept having to grab a certain person (a bartender, maybe?) to fix the pool table (not all the balls are released when the money goes in). 

So my question is this: If your pool table is broken and you know your pool table is broken, instead of giving attitude that you need to come unlock it to release the balls every time, why not fix it? Or put an "out of order" sign on it? Sadly, the cute one with the old Maple Leafs logo was not usable, which is too bad. But I get it: It's a collectors item (a big, space-consuming collectors item.) 

In short, this place is fine, but I doubt I'll go back during my next Toronto visit.

This place feels much cosier than many sports bars out there. They serve regular bar food and drinks for average-to-low prices. The light & dark beer duo was a catch for only $6! My only minor complaint is that the service was initially sluggish and the servers were hard to find, though the kitchen was up to speed and served our food promptly on a Saturday night. Overall, the place had a nice vibe & I can see myself going back!
Stopped in to have a drink before a Second City show.  Staff was very attentive and so friendly. Gave multiple recommendations of things to do after the show.

Stopped in for a quick drink, SO many to choose from. Great bartender with great service. Watched other people's food & it looked good, we couldn't eat because we had dinner plans in a little bit. Name is cute & inside is just as cute, rustic and lot cabin'ish.
We came here for beers and apps after a show at Second City and were pleasantly surprised how good the food was. Chicken strips were pretty damn tasty and pierogies were great!
Great beer, nice staff, and literally the best chicken wings I've ever had in my life. Would 100% recommend.
Service was very slow. Went out for drinks and appetizers and the appetizers came quick but it took a super long time for us to get our beer and our water

Great place if you like to watch sports games and eat all you can eat boneless wings night for only about $20 after tax and tips.

It is conveniently located outside of Fairview Mall, so accessibility and parking aren't an issue at all. Otherwise, the decor and service are both basic compared to other similar sports bar or pubs.

Apart from the basic salads, veggie burger, fish and chips, and tomato soup, there were only fish and veggie tacos to choose from for me, so this is not my kind of place, but I was here because the birthday boy chose this place and the weather this past weekend was horrid.
Old school place on Dundas. Smelled like smoke, full of older male patrons. Good place to watch soccer, if you're into this kind of place.

Good place! Good vibes, music and overall aura. Food was yummy with a variety of dishes and flavors. Good basic place for some good burgers, sandwiches and beers. Our waitress mixed up our orders but it all worked out in the end. A bit loud but you can ask for a quiet area. Loose moose is a must stop!

New to Toronto and tried Kelly's Lansing tonight. My server, Vince, was amazing! Very on top of things especially given how busy it was. He wasn't flustered by the chaos and was genuinely nice guy. The food was great! I had the lobster fettuccine and was pleasantly surprised on how good the flavor was. The lobster was fresh and not rubbery. Would for sure recommend this place. I'm not sure why the reviews are so low to be honest
Nice large pub with ample bar seating and a decent beer menu.  We had the loaded poutine and it was okay.  Not the best we had in the city.  Plenty of televisions tuned to sports.  Good service.

The food is sub-par and the service is spotty at best. Portions are nothing to crow about either. I have been here a couple of times and always leave disappointed, however it is the one of a handful of restaurants in the area, so I don't imagine they will be leaving anytime soon. 

The one start comes mostly from my last experience with them. I had ordered a diet coke and when it arrived, I had my suspicions that she had not actually brought me diet. I politely asked her if she was sure and she assured me that she was. Now normally, this wouldn't be the end of the world, but I am a diabetic, so 10 minutes later, my sugars are starting to climb (now this could be attributed to other factors, but I cannot confirm either way). I again, tell the waitress that I do not think my drink is diet, and ask her if she could please get me another glass of diet coke, just so I can be 100% sure that it is in fact diet. She once again assures me that she is positive it is diet, and does not change them out. Fast forward to 20 minutes later when my sugars are in the 20s and I am feeling groggy and sick...SIMPLY UNACCEPTABLE! It would be one thing if it was an honest mistake, because no one is perfect, but this was unacceptable.
From Boston watched a playoff game Boston/Leafs. Quick friendly service. Seated right away in period 2. Would go back!

Came here for some pre game beers and food, service was prompt polite and pleasing.
Good selection of beers available. Atmosphere was good busy noisy in a good way, you could talk and hear but only at your table.
Food was good in that bar food way not fancy pricing was commensurate with that.

All in all we will definitely put this on the list of places to come back too for a fun pre match pub. If we lived closer I'd use it regularly.
My go to place before any ScotiaBank event. Great service, Good share plates and reasonable pricing for the location. There is always a wait but never more than 10min usually for groups of 2-4.

This pub is better than most in the Downtown core. The servers are really helpful. The food and the beer selection is great. I found some new beers that I really enjoyed here. 

The food was average. There was nothing special about it. I had the nachos and a burger. I would probably go back to grab a drink.

Here in Toronto for a short vacation and a bunch of us grabbed brunch here in our way to the baseball game. Christina waited on our group and she was absolutely terrific. As an appetizer, we had a couple orders of wings...Christina recommended the dry rub with dipping sauces in the side....these were probably the best wings we've ever had. All the drinks and rest of the food had lots of flavor. That sticky coffee toffee desert is unbelievable. If only we could give more stars. Awesome service, food, and atmosphere! Will definitely be back...
Great place. Fair prices. Great kareokee on fridays and saturdays. BEST CHICKEN WINGS. Friendly environment, clean, great lightning.

With a sell out crowd at the Scotia Bank arena and the Real Sports Bar closed for refurbishment we headed here as the line up for Kelly's Landing was ridiculous.
The bar was busy, noisy and convivial and we soon had seats at the bar. Service was prompt and friendly and my cider was fine.
Had the food lived up to expectations it would be a five star review. My chilli and fries was lacking something. The flavour was harsh rather than spicy and certainly not to my taste, I realise this may be their recipe but it lacked something, possibly tomato paste, and was too salty.
Our other dish was hamburger and brisket on a toasted bun with a Caesar salad. The salad was lacking in dressing and buried under dry dusty Parmesan powder.
All in all the food turned a good experience to a mediocre one.
This may reflect the busyness of the venue at the time we attended.

I stumbled across the Loose Moose while exploring downtown Toronto. I was immediately drawn in by the dark, comfortable / casual atmosphere. I took a seat at the bar and was greeted by a friendly enthusiastic server. There was a large selection of beers on tap as well as other drinks. I chose a local hard cider which was delicious. The menu is really interesting with a lot of unique options as well as staples such as burgers, chicken sandwiches, etc. I ordered the "spicy southwest bowl" which was DELICIOUS. I didn't add a protein on top, which I wish I would have, because the portion wasn't very big and I was starving. Even so, the meal was delicious. I highly recommend The Loose Moose!

A friend of mine recently came to this restaurant (he is balding and sensitive about this) and when he received his bill, he was identified as 'Bald Matt') What a stupid remark on the servers part. Personally, I would never spend my money in an establishment where servers make fun of the clients.
My wife had the Poutine which was fantastic. I had the hot buffalo wings which were great. Plenty of beer choices and a great vibe. Staff was on top of everything.
Good food and nice atmosphere.  Waiter was great.  My girlfriend has food allergies and they took great care of her.
Boring menu and service takes a while. Found the food a bit salty but overall taste was good

By far the worst service I've ever received. It wasn't very busy, our waiter had 4-5 tables. The waiter gave our table so much attitude asking for the simplest thing like salt and rolled his eyes when asked for separate bills and told us that on a busier night, separate bills wouldn't fly. He also got the order wrong.

So we had a reservation for 4 people, 4:30pm today (on Saturday)

We showed up a bit early and asked if we could sit at the bar for a drink while we wait for our table. The hostess was very accomodating and was able to get us seated at our table immediately instead. Unfortunately, that section of the restaurant was undergoing a shift change, so while there was plenty of staff walking around, none of them approached us. Eventually we raised the concern to a passing server and our server came over to us - 20 minutes before her own shift was scheduled to start. Her name is Victoria and she was fantastic. Not only was she very apologetic for something that was clearly not her fault, the manager was over in minutes to apologise as well. The food was fantastic except for a patch of brown lettuce in the Cesar salad, but everything else was amazing.

The manager even went over and above to add a generous discount for any inconvenience. We will definitely be back.

We came here after movie night, on a sports night also, at around 830-900pm. We were got a seat quickly and was introduced to our server right away. We have placed our orders and got our food a little faster than expected on such a busy night. My steak was cooked accordingly so I have no complain on that. However, here's my complain... We asked for the bill at 10pm, but we did not get to leave until 1045pm. Why? Because our waitress did not print the bill until 1025pm! Now, I understand it was a busy night but still, we did not expect the bill to be printed at 1025pm, 25 mins after we have asked for the bill. We have seen others asked for the bill and got theirs quickly. So I didn't understand.

Basically, come to this location if you have much time to spare on a dinner

The Loose Moose is essentially a staple amongst Toronto sports fans, sporting enough TV's to watch a game from just about any seat in the restaurant or the bar.

Situated not far from Rogers Centre, it's a good spot to get dinner before the game, or a drink with some of the local fans after. That being said, after Blue Jays games, it can get packed out quickly.

I've been to the Loose Moose twice, and both times I was incredibly satisfied with the food, staff, and environment. All around, it's about what you'd expect from a sports bar: A wide selection of finger foods (Including unique varieties of burgers, nachos, chicken wings, and tacos) as well as a long list of beers ranging from the largest breweries in the world to the local craft varieties.

Their fully loaded poutine was delicious, and big enough to split between a few people while you wait for your entree. For the main course I got the Gouda and Brisket Burger: A certainly unique option, but it was incredibly good (especially if you prefer a more smoky flavor).

All in all, the Loose Moose is good. The prices can feel a bit high for a sports bar and grill (the most basic hamburger on the menu is $15 CAD) but for the excellent location and long list of options on the menu, it's worth stopping by.

My boyfriend and I were visiting Toronto on vacation, and I read an article that told me I had to visit Wayne Gretzky's while there! I made reservations ahead of time (but judging from the restaurants emptiness on a Friday night, I'm not so sure they're necessary). We were seated right away upon arrival. 

I loved looking at all of the memorabilia that brought Gretzky's career to life. This is definitely a great place to bring a hockey fan to explore all of the cool souvenirs from the past! 

Our waitress was super attentive and really made this experience worth the 4 stars. The food isn't anything super special, but not bad either. I ordered the fajitas, which were very flavorful and my boyfriend enjoyed his extremely large burger. We each also ordered a cocktail, and they were quite tasty. 

It's definitely a cool little joint to enjoy any sports games or a family night out. We enjoyed our visit!
This was the a good time for our first night in Toronto. Nice little bar and they had a really nice food. The French fries were pretty darn bomb.

while the decor is your typical sports bar with nothing setting it apart from any other sports bar, their beer selection is pretty good, so it at least has that going for it. i ordered a classic burger which really wasn't impressive, but i guess food is food when you're hungry. the bartender was friendly, so that's always a plus, but overall, i won't be jumping to come back here.

After what seemed like the longest day every at the AERA conference we just wanted something close and tasty. I'm so glad we came here. It was a little too loud for in-depth conversations but the food was amazing. Probably one of the best places we ate in the area. Our waitress was really friendly, fast, and checked on us to make sure we had everything we needed. I almost wish i went back there cause i knew it would be good before we left. Prices weren't too bad for that area either. I can imagine it gets crazy when games are going but i would recommend it any time.

It was a corporate outing for me. We had a table to around 10 people and it seems like the service was slow as molasses. This is a typical sports bar with great drinks and appetizers but so so food. I tried the tacos, not bad but not my fav. Also I had of the healthy choice bowls (superfood bowl, or smth like that). It was good. 
Would I come here again, hmm if I were to be in the area and wanted a drink yes, otherwise probable not.

If you are lucky enough to get a spot on the patio, it's a great place to enjoy the sights and sounds of Toronto. It is a fairly large bar so getting a table is usually not a problem. Service is good. Although after we were nearing the end of our food and drinks, there were a few signs that the restaurant wanted the table back. Both the fish tacos and Korean cauliflower were great.

Visited On: August 14, 2018
Meal: Lunch
Would I Return: Maybe

Ordered:
-Curry Shrimp Rice Bowl

Thoughts
I got the lunch special curry shrimp rice bowl. My dish consisted of sauteed shrimp, butter masala sauce, mint chutney, cilantro, rice, arugula, radish, carrot, cabbage, crisp taro, almonds, sesame, raita and papadum. The papadum was stale and not edible, but the shrimp was delicious. Overall, it was a good bowl and I enjoyed it.

The servers are very nice and I do not blame this rating on them. Burgers are served well done no matter how you order them. We inquired and were told that due to potential bacteria in ground beef, the burgers are cooked according to a timer that ultimately results in well done, blackened burgers. If that is the case, buy better beef or tell people before they order that burgers are cooked like a hockey puck. Point #2 is the omnipresent flying bugs. It is April and cold. No reason for annoying, food diving bugs all over the place. I can't imagine what the bug situation would be when the weather turns nice. 

There are numerous restaurant choices in Toronto. Pass this one up unless you enjoy the above.

Waited over 30 minutes for a Breakaway Burger that tasted like something from Red Robin. 

My cousin had the buffalo wings and they were okay at best. 

Also was served food with no utensils or napkins and no one came back to check on us for at least 15 min

This location is surprisingly small but that doesn't stop the crowds from coming here on a Friday night when The Raptors game is on. The friendly hostess at the front can easily give you an estimate for a table here which came to 30 minutes for me, which honestly is not such a big deal with Fairview mall there as a distraction. 

One our their specials for the day were unlimited boneless wings and a ribs and wings combo - both that required a drink purchase. I got the wing and ribs. The waitress was very nice as she let me mix my two go to wing flavours - honey garlic and garlic Parmesan so my wings were extra garlic-y but I thought the ribs were rather dry. 

This spot is a great one to watch a Raptors game if the space allows since they have one grand projector and a couple hinged TV's. I'll see myself here again if I ever happen to be at the mall.

We came here when we arrived in Toronto based on the recommendation of a friend who has been here many times before. When we arrived for lunch it wasn't very crowded and we had our pick of seats. Our server was awesome - she made great recommendations and we had great conversation! I ordered the Notorious MAC and poutine (maybe loaded poutine - it had sour cream). Both were delicious and hit the spot after traveling that morning. I would come here again without hesitation.

Decided to take my son to Gretzky's since we had a few hours to kill while wife and daughter were at a concert.
So we were seated and everything seemed to be going well with one exception, the second cup that my drink arrived in was not washed properly and there was dried hard bits of food stuck to the rim of the glass.
I'm not one to make a big stink of little things and never even brought it up, but when I went to use the bathroom I realized that cleaning is not high priority for this establishment. The bathroom stunk of urine and the stall was covered in feces.
The food was ok but it makes you wonder, how clean is the kitchen?

Order my striploin steak medium rare and got it well done (see pic). I get that they were really busy at the time but it's really a joke how the steak was cooked. Also had a fried calamari and a sticky toffee pudding, both were OK, nothing special.

Only thing saving them from a 1/5 is the decor and environment.

Having been walking for a while, I was in need of lunch. Since Jack Astor's had a nice patio, that seemed like the place to relax, eat, and try to cope with having had a very long day of travel. The hostess told me to sit wherever, so I grabbed one of the many free tables and waited. And waited. And eventually a waiter came by and told me that my actual waiter was coming, but could he get me something to drink. I'm pretty sure my actual waiter and my glass of water turned up together, at which point I ordered the fish and chips.

The fish and chips were...ok. I like shoestring fries and the coleslaw was decent. The fish seemed nice at first, but I eventually realized that there was way too much batter on it (some parts were just fried batter) and the inside part wasn't cooked all the way in some places. I ended up kind of picking through it and eating bits and pieces. Not the best version of that dish I've ever had.

The only high point of my experience was my waiter, who was absolutely delightful. I think we could have chatted happily all day. His only issue was that he actually was not a very good waiter. Getting my water refilled took waaaaay too long, and did I mention they weren't busy? Overall, it was a nice place to sit and enjoy the weather, but I really can't recommend actually eating here.
Nice environment, spacious, and good service. Nacho is huge and very good. Pizza was good too. Carbonara was too heavy. I wouldn't recommend it. Their curry is but spicy but good.

We recommend the place!  The crowd was lively, there were TVs everywhere if you want to watch the game. The food that we ordered was excellent - buffalo chicken sandwich for my wife, Chicken Coop for me. We both thoroughly enjoyed it.  We'd definitely come back next time we're in Toronto.
Food quality is better than your usual bar food & a bit more pricey. Service was good. It's your high energy bar with good service. Would come back and recommend this place.

The food was amazing (shouting out the fish sandwich) and so were the drinks! Place is a little noisy though so if you're looking to have a conversation with someone through dinner, be ready to talk very loudly. It's a good place to catch drinks with friends as well since they play the games. Overall it was a great experience but our waitress didn't really check in with us and we had to get her attention when we wanted more drinks.

Me and my friend went out after a stroll for a couple drinks and had a pretty good time. I love the atmosphere and the musical selection was much more to my liking with classic rock and such. I hope they update their drink menus because scratching the beer on a sheet of paper with a pen doesn't look very good and there were no prices on the drink menu either.

I went with a friend just after we got off the train a couple of guys off the street suggested it to us when I asked if there was any place good to eat. We went inside and immediately got sat in a two person because the servers were super friendly and they were very helpful with suggestions we ended up getting the same thing we both got the burger with the salad burger tasted almost home made like my grandfather used to do. The salad was a little garlicky for my taste but it was so good. My friend thoroughly enjoyed it as well we have also had a couple of drinks I got a cocktail and she got a more fancy cocktail her cocktail was a little more expensive than mine but she seem to really like it I really liked mine as well we read a review that they were good for their drinks so we decided to test it out ourselves overall we had a great time I would definitely go back again and I would definitely recommend it.

I don't know why people keep complaining about them taking a long time to seat people. We were seated right away. But you do need to fix your floor though before someone trips on it. The tile has a huge lump right in the middle of of the restaurant which leads to the bar, washrooms and kitchen. Also this is for all your locations I wish you would bring back your chicken options as I ordered that the first time I went there.Though your new Burger is good. But because of the floor I am giving you a three. As for those complaining about wait times. Our wait time was average. So either we were lucky because my family had no issue with wait times to be seated or for our food, or you guy want fast food service in a sit and dine restaurant.

Our main food arrived before our appetizer. I guess this is what happens when you specifically say while ordering "Can we get the nachos to start please?"

Both Steaks we ordered were overcooked and not cooked to the temperature as asked. Why even ask how you want your steak cooked if your going to over cook it properly anyways?

15% off the bill still didn't justify it as we left hungry and not satisfied.

P.S. Thanks for the dirty look for the $0 tip i keyed into the debit machine - what were you surprised?..... Just sayin'.

Love this place. 
Since the very beginning. 
Hidden gem. 

Believe me.  You will love everything. 
Owners and patrons. 
Fresh delicious menu. 
Spotless, modern, welcoming. 

And you always meet someone. 
If you're talkative as us
Great location, just down from the hotel where I was staying at. Food was decent, but it was just generally nice to be able to sit at the patio and eat / drink / people watch.

Descending into the Wild Wing washroom, I was reminded of what Orpheus must have felt traveling into hades. The smell of the washroom was beyond the stench of a Detroit water sanitation plant. The urinal was covered in a thick layer of yellow and flies buzzed en mass. 

I tried to rip a casual Juul to endure the experience, but the long haul led to uncontrollable gagging. The sinks were likely to give me diphtheria so I avoided the experience all together. Should one attempt to use these facilities, I recommend extreme caution. 

The service was another story. The server stated to her manager on multiple occasions that she wanted to leave due to the numbers in the restaurant. When the food was presented it was not much better then a microwave dinner. I ate it to be polite but realized this was a calculated risk. I am quite certain I will be sick within the hour and will pay dearly. Upon leaving I should have warned the family desperately trying to have their order taken, however their son was happily colouring a placemat. 

To summarize, only drink at this place.... and only if a game you must watch is on. Godspeed.
The 5-star is for their kitchen/ service staff.
Really tasty food and great selection of beer! I got their poutine with a collective arts beer (highly recommend any of these beers). The service was great and attentive.

Took 1.5 hours to prepare 18 chicken nugget style wings.  Portions were small including the cheesecake.  Taste nothing to write home about.  Again.  They are more like chicken nuggets than boneless wings.  Oh and no fork for the cheesecake...

Let me start by saying the service was great! Our waitress was very personable and came by many times on a busy Saturday night. The beer was also very good. The food however - was VERY overpriced and lacked so much flavor. I think even if the price was half, I still wouldn't return. We ordered the "poor man" waygu steak fritz which turned out to just be a burger patty with no seasoning. The fries were ok but nothing special. For two of those meals and 3 beers, it didn't feel like $90 CAD.

Allright. So un-drunk update.
The place is very busy and around the arena and baseball stadium
Place is huuuuge but still very busy. Caters to the ''relaxed'' after office crowd. Bar staff was friendly and competent. Food is your typical large pub fair. Good but nothing special.

Came here on a Sunday night for wings. Place was full and there were only 3 staff present (2 waiters and the bartender). As we came in, a pair of women were leaving their table abruptly complaining that they were never going to get their order taken. It took us 15 minutes to be seated and after about 20 minutes of waiting at our table and not being even asked for drinks, we realized how much of a disaster this place was. Tables outside were full of garbage as the waiters did not have the time to get to them. After about 30 minutes of waiting, we realized we were not going to get our order taken so we decided to leave. 

Dear St. Louis management, why would you leave your restaurant so understaffed that there are only 2 waiters for the entire restaurant? It is unethical to the waiters who have to do way too much and it is terrible for your customers. I was a big fan of St. Louis wings before this but I don't think I can justify coming back.

Watching the game tonight? The loose moose is a good place to watch with lots of space to lounge around while sipping a beer. Menu wise - there's not alot of vegetarian options. There's no vegetarian gravy for the poutine so I ended up getting fries and cheese, which was very weird. The fries were cut in weird sizes and some felt more burnt then others. My pet peeve is having super small fries that makes you feel like you're eating rice.  The nachos was as good as it get. Wasnt the best not the worst.

Stopped here after work to meet a couple of friends. Place was super busy and we got on a wait list, estimated time 34 mins. How we our table was available in 15 mins.

Our waitress came pretty much right away. We were waiting for our drinks to join so didn't order right away. Ended up just ordering a couple of appetizers. Both were tasty. The goat cheese dip as part of the trio was amazing! The garlic bread was also so warm and buttery and delicious!

Service was good but a little slow, took us a while to wave our waitress down when we wanted to order something else/ when we wanted our bill.

Otherwise a really nice after work spot, great food and drink options, a bit pricey but good. Would love to return!

Summary: come here if you want sub par food, sub par alochol and sub par servicr. In other words AVOID at all costs even if it's your last resort. 

I rarely have to ever wrote reviews for anywhere but what happened to us there last night I think this place is a joke. We went there last night for game 5 of the raptors final game after not being able to find a place anywhere else downtown kind of like a last resort kind of thing and I can see why its a last resort. I get it that its busy but we waited well over an hour for overpriced nachos and a overpriced burger which was overcooked and just utterly disgusting. Did I also mention the beer that tasted a bit stale to me? I would normally be able to put it with that on a usual night but not after what happened to my friends and I. The tipping point for me and when my friends and I decided to leave was when the rude and obnoxious security  "Flynn Security guard 1097293" told my 5'0" friend that she couldn't go in because she was being rude and obnoxious. Now yes she is my friend and it may seem like I am defending her but she is the absolute opposite of that. I tried reasoning with him and even offered him some money to try to smooth things over but he wouldn't have any of it and instead he was the one that was rude and obnoxious. I tried talking to the on duty manager at the time, Falon, explaining our case and assuring that my friend was not and she was being rude and obnoxious. What a joke of an establishment. If you don't believe me there are also other reviews for this place saying the exact same thing. AVOID THIS PLACE EVEN IF IT'S YOUR LAST RESORT!

Second time here and still the slowest service in Toronto. Now I'm sitting at the bar, there are two bartenders, a total of five of us at the bar yet ten minutes to get a drink or a "be right with you." Pierogies were good, decor needs update. But who wants to sit ignored? And this was a half hour after a Leafs game.

Great Lunch spot! Went to the Loose Moose for my girlfriend and I's first meal in toronto in our trip. Didn't fail to live up to our expectations and actually shattered them! The Jalapeño Popper Dip was amazing, the notorious MAC burger was perfect too! My girlfriend had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and loved it! Great selection of Beers as well and The Donuts were a great treat to end the meal! Our service was also great and cheery! Definitely a place to check out before a Jays game or a day in downtown TO as its in walking distance of many attractions!
Pretty much met my expectations.  The food was OK, the service was fairly good, but it was too loud for my tastes. It's worth noting that it wasn't horribly busy when we were there, maybe half full.

We went out for lunch before seeing the Blue Jays. The customer service was horrible and the food was average. He was cold and took forever to receive our food. The waiter only came around once every 15 minutes to check on us which was also incredibly poor customer service

I have wanted to try Wayne Gretzky's for so long. The interior of the place is cool if you are into hockey or even if you have 0 interest in hockey (like myself) its still cool to see a lot of stuff...resembles a mini museam. As for the service: our server was great and fairly prompt...no complaints there. For food, I ordered the chicken fingers since I was informed that they breaded them in house. They were incredible chicken fingers - tasted similar to the ones at Jack Astors which I also love. I also got a caesar salad as a side instead of the fries and I am SO glad that I did because the fries were absolutely disgusting! My bf got the fries and couldn't even finish them....they were cold and tasted SO stale lol. You might be wondering why I am giving this place a 4 though....it is because MY food tasted great, our server was great and because the actual venue was pretty cool...however, if I had gotten fries with my meal my rating would definitely be more like a 3 haha. SO DON'T GET THE GROSS FRIES!!! :D

C'était la première fois que j'allais dans un Jack Astor. J'ai bien aimé la décoration et il faisait un peu froid pour aller sur la terrasse mais ça aurait été un bon spot. 
La nourriture était ok and les prix pas exagérés , en revanche le service était vraiment à la rue (retard, ne donne pas des couverts lorsqu'ils servaient les plats...). 
J'ai du me lever 2 fois pour aller interpeller le service qu'il nous manquait quelque chose. 
Ils ont offert un dessert car celui ci n'était pas arrivé en même temps que les 4 autres (juste 2 minutes après) donc c'était un geste appréciable. 
J'y retournerai peut être mais ça ne sera pas ma première option considérée.

Horrible experience. Was so excited for a local wing hangout, only to be severely disappointed. Glass given was filthy/used, wings were bland, service was mediocre, cost was overpriced. Fries were tasty! Never again. So sad.

It was an okay experience,

The service wasn't good, the food was alright, and the noise made the experience even worse. 

The final nail in the coffin was the giant tv screen, it was so bright and just made my head hurt, and there was constant ads on it. 

All in all I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone visiting Toronto.
5$ beer all summer but most importantly the ONLY nachos I have come across which are worth 18$ and don't even have any meat...well played Jacky

Great service.. great food! I only wish the fries were not as salty. For some it might have been just right, I'm just not big on salt at all. But loved everything about this place
Great service, atmosphere and super good food!

came here last Thursday and waited hours to in line to get a seat. we asked ahead of time how much capacity was and was told about 400 ..we were definently only about 100-150 ppl in line when we were in line. several people in front kept bringing big groups in the line ( such as the man in picture that I attached). right when we got to door .. we were told they were full. they let us wait for hours and even after they were full they let ppl still stay in line instead of informing us they were full.  spoke to manager and security... and they were rude and could not care less. very unorganized and rude . would give 0 stars if I could.

This is THE place to grab a brew and some food before a jays game. You will see much jays attire here if there is a game on. 

If you like a raucous and loud, energized atmosphere, go here!  

Food is OK. There are a lot of beers to choose from. Burgers are plentiful but the patties I got on my classic burger are not the fat juicy kind that I prefer. 

Strange thing - my waiter asked me what kind of beer I liked and dropped off random beers without even announcing what they were. The prime thing this place offers is its atmosphere. You don't really come here to "dine" in the classic sense.

Good downtown location and for some reason there are usually seats here when the nearby bars like Kelly's Landing are full. Everything is pretty decent here in terms of service, food, and drinks. I was actually hungry when I came and so I had the chicken and waffle which was decent for pub food. I forgot which cocktails I had but I remember them being not bad either. It's a good spot to chill and hang out after work.

Came here to watch the Raptors game as it was listed as one one of the better bars to watch the game.  Someone called to confirm my reservations and I requested to be seated to be with other Raptors fans. When we got there the server tried to sit us in some random corner as she's trying to fill up the crappier seats in the place.  I obviously said something and she reluctantly seated us somewhere else.  Didn't know what the fuss was considering the place wasn't packed.  Unfortunately, it did not deliver as an exciting bar to watch Raptors games.

We ordered their platter of appies and it was pretty tasty.  Definitely worth it and great if you want a bit of everything. Came with chips and a dip, sliders, fries, and fried dill pickles.  Saving grace for this place was their $4 Caesar's on Sundays.  Pretty decent and super cheap.

Will we come back? Probs not...

Love love love the atmosphere in this place. Bars like this just warm your heart and make you want to drink beer and watch sports. This place is also constantly packed, so be prepared to wait. Our waitress wasn't very happy the day my coworker and I came in. She was having a bad day. The food is very pleasant. And beer list is very good. This is a great place in Toronto to get away from the hooty tooty restaurants normally found here.

Go for the bar food (burger, pizza, wings), not the steak.

Great atmosphere and fun to watch the game. Our waitress was slow and not the friendliest. But, there were other servers that appeared to want to be there.

The burger, wings, and pizza was great. My Sirloin and Shrimp tasted good, but the steak was really chewy and only 3 small
Service was friendly but not very prompt. Our food was just ok. Ordered the 7oz sirloin and it was meh. It was nice to sit out side and watch people walk by. I enjoyed the atmosphere.

This was probably one of the worst sports bar I've ever been to.
I'd start with the fact that we went here because of how cool it looked from outside and even because my friends told me that you could get a big beer for 10$ which is a good price considering its location.
The menu is super limited, they don't have many options for vegans/vegetarians which is less than acceptable.
I'm not vegan but one of my friends is and even if he didn't want a burger he had to get it because it was the only thing who could be substituted with a plant based one.
Their menu looks identical to the Warehouse(where everything is 5$) except for the price.. BE READY TO SPEND MORE OR LESS 20$ for a small burger and a really tiny portion of fries. 
THIS PLACE IS OVERPRICED, 
NOT THAT CLEAN(check their washroom when they get busy), IT DOESN'T OFFER AN INCLUSIVE MENU AND THE SERVICE ISN'T THE BEST. 
SUPER DISAPPOINTED! 
Will never come back!
Great service, excellent food! Loved the location and outdoor seating! Perfect Atmosphere even in the middle of the afternoon.

We went to this sports bar because we saw a lot of people inside and we thought tthat there was a good restaurant. We ordered nachos that it is a plate to share but I think it is too much food for an entrace. After the nachos we ordered the burger and was normal. No good no bad. For me the music is too loud.

Amazing food! Probably the best nachos we've had in a long time! 

I had the Nashville Hot Chicken Burger, it wasn't as hot as I was expecting but still very good! 

My husband had a burger and it was amazing! The sweet potatoes fries were huge! 

Our server was hilarious, from England (I think that's where he said or the UK) and was very honest about the food.

Only been a couple of times, had the beef  bourguignon (nice deep and rich) served with perfect mashed potatoes, fish and chips the second time all done by the hand of Doug the chef.
Great staff! Lucy is an absolute diamond, Arther is a very hands on owner creating an atmosphere that people can enjoy.
looking forward to my next visit

Kelly's Landing is an underrated spot. Its identity struggles between being an after work drinks, pre-game grub, or dinner with friends spot. Perhaps the fact that it doesn't stand out for any one of the above makes it versatile, as it can fulfil any of those roles. But that sort of makes it the second choice in most cases. Ok, I'm done rambling.

Before the Toronto Rock game this evening, Gord, Trish and I had supper at Kellys Landing Bar Grill Hub.

The Toronto Rock Roadies had their pre-game celebration there and we sat with them.  They were very welcoming, friendly and enthusiastic.  They were giving out gifts which were donated by the Toronto Rock.

I ordered what I usually order at Kellys ... Maple Cider Half Chicken (minus the veggies).  It was really good.  The potatoes were tasty and the chicken was really tender.

Gord ordered what he usually orders there ... the Landing Carbonara.  He said it was really good and there wasn't anything left when he was finished.

Trish is vegan and ordered the Righteous Greens Bowl.  It was pretty and colourful and Trish said it was really good (she's had it before.

Great food, loud atmosphere. 
My family (2 adults, 2 teenagers) went here on our trip to Toronto in July 2019. We made the mistake of going on a Friday night after a Blue Jays baseball game. The restaurant was extremely loud and crowded, although we were seated immediately. Service was questionable, a bit distracted and slow, but that's understandable considering the crowd of bar-goers. Really good burgers and fries!

have been here only once before and was not impressed but it was close by and I was hungry.i sat at a table that was dirty and when my waitress came with the new paper,she didn't wipe the table first and I had to ask her to clean it because there were food particles from the previous diners. she said oh I didn't realize it hadn't been wiped , well she should have wiped it no matter what. I ordered a bloody Cesar and it was so full the contents of the glass kept spilling all over the table. it was not only all over the table but all over me. I did not have utensils or napkins ,I had to ask her for them so I could mop up the spillage. I ordered my meal and the sirloin steak was so tough I kept having to take the pieces of unchewed grilse and put it on the side of the plate. I ate some of the steak, some of the potatoes, and some of the bread. she came and took the dishes away and asked me if I wanted any thing else I said no just the bill , she brought it and said let me know when youre ready and I said im ready now, she turned and walked away. I sat there for about 5 minutes, got my things and walked out without paying, I have never done that in my life,and I have eaten all over the world. jack astors you should be ashamed.

What a great place to eat and enjoy looking at Hockey memorabilia!  We were recently at Gretzky's for a special needs hockey tournament and Heather and her staff went out of their way to accommodate our very large group (34) people, The food was served quickly and was absolutely delicious.  The ribs were a big hit with our group as were the burgers.  Gretzky's cranked it up a notch by giving all the players a free t-shirt which totally made their night!  I don;t know that other restaurants would have been this accommodating for us, did I mention that the day we went was the opening night for the Jays?  This is one of the busiest nights for Gretzky's and to have them bend over backwards to take care of us was just above and beyond!  Thanks again Gretzky's you are truly great!
Good burgers & sandwiches, service is a little spotty mid-day between lunch and dinner. Plenty of TVs and cool decor.

Great burgers, really nice servers. Went here for lunch and will definitely try to come back. The chicken sandwich is actually a burger (on a bun) and a bit small compared to Australian burgers but super tasty and they subbed in poutine for fries as a side dish for no extra charge.

My family and I ate here last night on our visit to Toronto. Was unimpressed. The food selection was limited and what we ordered wasn't very good. Not to mention this place is expensive. This is a tourist trap and we got hooked.

Amazing atmosphere and bar tenders were very kind. The games here are a lot fun and it gets busy quick but there's a list you put your name on to queue. The drinks are all fantastic and the bartenders are friendly!

This place has exceptional service. Food is good, vibe is great. Nowhere better to watch a hockey game. Manager recognized us from being here the week before and gave us a free appetizer. We live close by so are here often and have never had a bad experience. Highly recommend!
The chicken fingers are SOOOOO GOOD! probably my favorite ever! Will be coming back next time im in Toronto

Overpriced wings. $15 for 8 wings or a pound. Poor service. Waiting staff is almost non existent. Extra $1 charge for refills. Better off going to the other numerous wing spots in Scarborough like Wild Wings or Fanzone Wings. Nothing special or to look forward to returning.

Decent place for a dinner but very crowded after events at the nearby stadium. Our wait was 40 minutes and we were told that it wasn't because there weren't tables, but rather because the kitchen was backed up. Service was ok, burger was ok, but all in all, nothing was fantastic. I also would have thought there would have been more hockey items on display. Worth a visit if you are a Gretzky fan.

The bar was busy because there was a FIBA exhibition game across the street.  No one was seating people a sign said seat yourself. I asked a waiter if it was ok to sit on the side room and he said yes and handed me menus.
We sat there for for almost 20 minutes.  I went to the bar and asked if there was a waitress for the side area.  She responded "you can see we are busy. We will get there in a little while". I said can you tell me when and she responded "when we get a chance we are all very busy"
There are plenty of places to eat in Toronto.  No need to deal with rude unprofessional staff that doesn't know how to plan for an event in the arena across the street
Avoid this place

I really did like this place. Food is good and the staff are quite friendly. This was the first restaurant I ever went to in Canada and it really did have a Canadian feel. Poutine is pretty great as well. I would check it out.

Gord and I had supper Saturday evening at Kellys Landing Bar Grill Hub.

We split an order of ancho pepper lime wings.  They were good ... the pepper and lime really came through.  Gord really liked the feta dip.

I usually order chicken there but felt like a burger ... so I ordered the Landing Burger with no cheddar or mixed greens.  The fries were good.  The burger was okay ... I found the bun and patty a bit dry.  The bun seemed to be too much for the patty ... so maybe a bigger patty or a smaller bun?

Gord ordered what he always orders there ... the Landing Carbonara.  He said it was really good.

Michaela was our server ... she was friendly and took good care of us.

Ordered chicken strips with fries - $17. Got 20 fries and 3 1/2 tenders - is this a kids menu? The meal Takes up only half of the plate; Wasn't even an appetizer. 

Wrote into Jack Astor's about it 5 days ago, and haven't heard a peep back - probably more upsetting not hearing any feedback from them. 

Although service was decent.

Tonight we went in with a party of 6. Here on vacation and was our last dinner in town . If I could have done zero stars I would have. First we waited for a table as the girl lazily washed down table and left cleaner all over table as we sat down . Second our blonde haired waitress who none of knew her name As she did not introduce herself or wore a name tag. She did not write our orders done but tried to memorize them and this was evident when one member of our party did not get served her meal as they made the wrong item . That member of our party was then brought just fries and made to wait for her chicken tenders . Then out came the actual tenders and a mysterious sauce which tasted horrible . Should have known something was wrong when she came to the table and we ordered waters and all 6 of us saw her eye roll in the back of her head cause we didn't order soft drinks . This played a roll in the crappy service tonight . Then as the meal progressed she was annoyed at us drinking water and Instead of coming back to the table brought a carafe of water that was not cold at all . Towards the end of the meal one member of the party was so disappointed with the food that she did not eat it all and the waitress came back and rolled her eyes again when she saw the amount of food on the table . This place is too loud and especially with speakers right over table can't hear people talking at all . The gift shop was not lit up at all instead of debris all over counters. Nobody was at Check in counter when we arrived or anything . The floor is dirty and had to have additional place setting brought over to us as well . Would not have left a tip but needed to get rid of the Canadian money we brought before going home . Waste of time and waste of money. Service sucked and wouldn't think about stepping foot in place again . Wierd thing about not getting seated right away had a huge table in back and tables in back that didn't have anyone sitting at them . Waste of time.

Should be a museum or just a bar. They don't have the ability to serve in a normal amount of time. Waited two hours to be served. 

Two hours is just way too long.

It's a chain but it's reliable if you just need a quick bite. We came in for a late lunch and opted to sit outside. They have reduced the number of menu offerings since the last time I visited, which is fine but it just has much less variety now. 

Our server was friendly but we didn't see her much. It also took at least 45 minutes for our food to come out which seemed a bit excessive, especially since it was crowded or super busy. 

As far as the food goes, it's decent. The garlic pan bread was warm and tasty. We had the original chicken tenders and fries, plus the steak frites with the 7oz top sirloin. The fries are average. The chicken tenders were solid, as was the steak. No crazy or unique flavors but it gets the job done if you are hungry.

Terrible advertisement. They say they are celebrating 30 years with live DJs and music and epic food and drink sampling etc....on June 13 and 14. They search my bag and threw away a whole box of new muffins into the garbage bin. I said don't throw away but feed the homeless, but they did not listen. Terrible experience.
Only sircorp kitchen I know that closes two hours before the restaurant does. Lame af. 2/10, would not recommend.
Lucy is the best bartender ever if you want fast service she's your women !:) couldn't say more good things about her , the bar is cozy and simple and they always have a game on which is a huge plus.

Awful. The food gave me 2 days of food poisoning, including hard diarrhea. Missed two days of work.

Manager won't return my calls. 

Stay away, it's not worth it..

I've rated the place a 1 because there is no 0.  First, I've been to many Jack Astor's locations.  The food is always consistent and the service is good.  This is not the case at this location.  We sat down and were not served for ever.  I finally had to flag some down they said it was not their section and walked away.  Finally we did get a server (about 15 minutes after arriving).  Service for the meal (appies) was incredibly slow.  The most frustrating thing about the service level at this place is that their are a lot of employees congregated at the front door chatting.  Some I think  were on shift some seemed to come there to hang out.  Bottom line - This location is horribly managed.

A solid sports bar in the area. Good selections and a REALLY good burger. The vibe is a little classy/antiseptic, so if you're looking for a unique experience, try Loose Moose across the street. But if you want to spend a little too much on a great burger and watch a game, this is the place. Our waitress was handling the bar and tables and was KILLIN it. Though the all female wait staff in the same tight black shirt dress was a little weird...
Kelly's Landing is ICONIC. Amazing food, music, and people! 10/10 would recommend! Can't wait to go back!

Hands Down one of my favourite places to stop when I am in town from Thunder Bay!   Always a cool place to go after a Jays game or event in Toronto.  Also a great place to hang out before catching a go train.  
Cold drinks and great Nachos! 
So many fun times at the Loose Moose!
The patty melt was very juicy, even if it did have mayonaise on it.  The beer selection is vast and it feels more like an American sports bar than a Canadian one.  I'd go back, for sure.

So much fun! After a LONG day's drive we needed something to eat and drink. It was a toss up from this Loose Moose or another bar next door. We hit up the Moose.  Their guacamole is amazing. Their wings were excellent. I was almost sorry we didn't get two orders. :)  I cannot do lots of beer anymore - my friends did - I stuck with Prosecco. Lots of ambiance lots of fun and it was clearly the start of a weekend on a Thursday night. So fun we ALMOST went back Friday night to see if we could catch the Buckeye game we loved it that much! Being in town for a minute we needed to keep finding new spots though I WILL bring my husband here next time I'm in town. :) I say that a lot lately with this trip - Toronto is just fantastic. :)
Me and my dad went to Wayne Gretzky after hockey hall of frame I have a burger and fries we will return

Visited from the USA. I can tell this place gets packed on weekends and game days (Raptors) as it is about a 10 minute walk to Scotiabank Arena. They played great music (Salsa, Hip Hop, Reggaeton and Top 50). Their drinks are decently priced and the venue itself is very modern looking with semi dim lighting. The attire was semi casual and the bar was non stop crowded. There are TV monitors wrapped around the bar with a giant screen projector in the back of the restaurant. We had the picante pizza (very good), sweet potato fries (great) and steak frites (very bland). Overall the atmosphere and servers were very down to earth and we enjoyed our visit!

Absolutely horrific service. Sat down, at the bar, and was greeted by a small Asian guy who promptly asked us what we wanted.  My buddy told him he was still making up his mind.
