I told him the largest size Steam Whistle they offer. The tap was an arms length away, but the dude disappeared and I never saw him again until 20 minutes later and he was busing a table. In the interim we actually did receive our beers, but from a completely different bartender. This was the last time anyone came over to us the entire time we were there. They also were playing on every TV the replay of the Rogers cup from earlier in the day, all the while live sports were happening in real-time but these "sports bar" bartenders had to be asked by other patrons to please change the channel and put on some actual live sports, which also took them at least 10 minutes to finally change it. 

We were going to get an appetizer but opted not to after all of this. We had to flag down one of the other 4 bartenders to ask to pay our bill. 20 minutes later they gave us the bill. We nearly walked out without paying. And don't get me started on the smell. I know it's the restaurant of the greatest hockey player of all time, but the place smelled like a hockey dressing room after a triple OT marathon.

It was the most excruciating hour and half I ever spent at a bar in my life and I'm 40. I will never go back here. Ever.

Excellent service and location. Whenever we're in town we go here either for a beer or sometimes a bite to eat. 
I had the steak salad and a bottle or the Argentine Malbec. Both were excellent and reasonably priced. 
This is a large and popular place with a lot of indoor and patio seating so obviously noise levels can vary.
Conveniently located near Union station at York and Front street this is ideal for bankers, locals and tourists.

If you're looking for a place to chill, pass time and fill your bellies like we did, look no further!  Loose Moose is a wonderful restaurant that is blocks away from the ScotiaBank Centre.  The ambiance is comfy, relaxed and the servers are super quick, sweet and attentive. 

We came here on a Wednesday afternoon prior to a concert. At 5:30, it was not busy at all. We got a nice hightop window seat and were promptly looked after.

I ordered the mushroom burger - meaty, tasty.  The burger came with two nice beef patties, topped with brie, mushrooms and caramelized onions.  I opted out of the truffle alioli, but I'm sure that would have been really good too.

I got fries with the order, and to be fair, the fries were not the greatest.  It lacked flavour... it was dry. I'm not normally a ketchup person but I definitely needed to dip these guys in something. 

Their menu was extensive and it was a hard choice to make food wise.  A friend had the fried chicken sandwich.  It had a nice kick to it. Another had a cheeseburger, which she thoroughly enjoyed. It's a chill place.  I wish the fries were a bit better, but hey, at least they did something right. Burgers are delicious.

My boyfriend and I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning. It was located just a few blocks from our Airbnb, and we decided to check it out. It was right around 11am (brunch is served 11-3pm), so the restaurant wasn't all that busy. We took our usual seats at the bar, and perused the menu. 

Since I considered myself a newly initiated expert on caesars, we couldn't resist ordering their intense loaded one. It came in a HUGE mug topped with a slice of pizza, a lobster tail, jalapeño havarti, bacon, celery, carrots, and pickles. It was out of this world delicious! 

Our bartender was great, and she offered suggestions when we couldn't decide on what to order. I went with the appetizer of loaded nachos. Holy cow they were huge, but delicious! I barely put a dent in them. My boyfriend got the Kellys Benny, two poached eggs atop an english muffin covered in bacon and hollandaise sauce. He said it was amazing. 

I really liked the layout of the restaurant, and how many tables/booths they had. There is an enormous TV in the back, so I am sure watching a sports game would be perfect! I would definitely eat here again if I ever find myself in Toronto again. Prices were very reasonable.

The most delicious wings! I told one of the owners, Matt, to surprise me and my large group with people pleasing wing flavours and he did not disappoint! I loved every flavour, the wings are juicy and meaty. The service here is very hospitable, warm and welcoming. I will be back!

What a great homage to the man himself.

The front of the place was obscured slightly by construction next door, but coming round the corner from King and seeing that signature and the number 99 made my heart flutter! I may be a little biased as a hockey fan but this is probably the best sports bar I've been in the whole of Canada.

I was greeted by a host named Carly, who promptly showed me to a clean booth with full condiments and brown paper covering the tables to give it its own vibe. My drink was brought straight over, and the girl serving me (Grace) was very accommodating and thorough when I told her of my allergy.

I chose the chicken fingers from their under $15 lunch menu, they came with fries and coleslaw (I opted out of the additional plum sauce due to my allergy) and they were perfectly seasoned.

The drink menu contained products made with Gretzky's own Niagara-based "No.99" brand cask whisky and "Wayne Gretzky Estates Merlot" which gives it that edge over bars competing with generic ingredients. Other wines available under his brand are "Lightly Oaked Chardonnay", "Pinot Grigio" "Riesling", and the "Estate Series Chardonnay", along with the reds "Estate Series Shiraz Cabernet 2013" and the same year "Cabernet Merlot".

The ambiance was chilled yet upbeat, with music playing over the many screens showing different games including soccer.

Overall, cheaper to come at lunch but still decently priced and a great place to look around for memorabilia.

We shared fries, caesar salad and margarita pizza. The fries and salad were great. The Parmesan seasoning on the fries was delicious. The pizza was a little strange, not sure I would ever order that again. There was a lot going on with that pizza when I had hoped for a simple pizza. The drinks were great I had the elderflower cucumber spritz and the blood orange basil smash. Both were delicious but I especially loved the elderflower drink, I love a good cocktail that isn't too sweet. I will for sure stop back in for the elderflower drink and some fries. I think the food here is targeted towards the tourist and suburban crowd. Not sure I would really even bother trying to get into their menu. Just enjoy some good drinks and small bites because the TVs are great if your going to watch a game.

I stopped in here while my friend from Michigan was visiting me for the weekend. They thought the name sounded very Canadian and they had poutine on the menu so we thought it would be a cool place to get a bite to eat after we had visited the aquarium! The poutine was good, we shared it and we were both satisfied, but if we had been any hungrier the portion size wouldn't have been enough to share as a meal. I ordered the "moscow moose" cocktail and it was delicious! The only problem we had was that the service was not great, but it was very crowded so I couldn't blame our server for being busy.

This place is massive, they have plenty of seating and at nights have a place to go dancing if that's what you're into. My friend and I chose to sit at the bar where they have giant HDTVs showing the current sports. We decided to go along the route to sharing an appetizer platter with two sliders, nachos, and dip, fried pickles, and fries.

We each had a beer and were satisfied with our choice. It's a nice walk from Rogers Centre or Scotiabank Place so get here early for a good time before you catch a game.

This is a totally cool place with an energetic vibe. All the food that came out looked amazing and delicious. The service at the bar was lackluster to say the least so we had 1 beer and decided to move on.

Excellent service and location. Whenever we're in town we go here either for a beer or sometimes a bite to eat. 
I had the steak salad and a bottle or the Argentine Malbec. Both were excellent and reasonably priced. 
This is a large and popular place with a lot of indoor and patio seating so obviously noise levels can vary.

The restaurant itself is getting worn down and the service is pretty spotty but if you just need some basic food and are nearby it will still deliver. We were in the area and just needed a quick lunch so we stopped in. 

It was pretty dead on a Thursday around 2 and we were seated in the bar. The lunch menu had items for $15 and under but was pretty limited. We just picked the chicken tenders and called it a day. 

I've been here a few times over the years and they haven't made any changes.. not necessarily a great thing. The bathrooms could definitely use a deep cleaning or upgrade but they still are fine if you need to use them. 

Service wasn't very attentive but the food was at least pretty solid. Huge portions and definitely filled us up. You could do worse but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.. even if you're a Gretzky fan.

Before the Toronto Rock game this evening, Gord and I had supper at Kellys Landing Bar Grill Hub.

Tomorrow's Gord's birthday and what he didn't know was that I had purchased the birthday package for the Rock game for him (it comes with ten tickets) and invited nine friends (he's known some of the guys for almost sixty years!) who were meeting us at Kellys beforehand.  Surprise!!  I had made the reservation in January and unfortunately the reservation no longer existed when we arrived ... fortunately they were able to seat us.

I ordered Maple Cider Half Chicken (minus the veggies).  I've had it before there and had liked it.  This evening it was just okay ... I found the chicken was a bit overdone as were the potatoes.

Christina, our server, was friendly and took good care of us.

On a recent visit to Toronto, family and I wanted to come here for beers and dinner, and overall, had a good experience!

We came in around 5:30pm on a Friday and were immediately seated at a table in the front corner.  The interior to this place was pretty cool with the bar towards the front, somewhat close to where we were, with plenty more tables in the back and the walls were wooden and fashioned with stuffed animal heads with plenty of TVs playing sports.  At the start though, I wasn't very impressed with the service as our waiter came over and asked what drinks we wanted to start with, which we said water to start as we looked over the extensive beer list, but disappeared for almost 20 minutes and forget about our waters!  We saw him chatting it up with another table for a good 10 minutes while others were being seated around us and taken care, one of these tables he took care of.  He finally circled back around and he did apologize and brought our waters along with our beers right away.  He also expedited our order of poutine, so he made up for it.

So yes, we started off by splitting an order of the "Fully Loaded Poutine."  These were soo good!  The fries were thick cut and doused in gravy with more than enough cheese curds.  I really enjoyed that extra flavor from the bacon, scallions, and dollop of sour cream though!  This was listed under the "Fresh Cut Fries by the Pound" section on the menu and, no lie, this dish was a pound.  The family and I had walked around Toronto all day so we were pretty hungry, but on any normal night, I think this would've been a meal all on it's own.

As we devoured poutine, we each ordered a main dish, which came out to the table in about 15-20 minutes.  I thought was pretty fast seeing as how busy this place was getting.  I ended up ordering the "Baja Fish Sandwich" with a chopped Caesar salad as the side.  Now, this sandwich is listed on the menu under a section titled 'Big Ass Sandwiches' and let me tell you, this thing lived up to it!  I definitely needed two hands to eat this.  The sandwich itself was phenomenal!  I was so impressed by the ratio of beer batter to haddock: it was covered and cooked perfectly and the flavor of both batter and haddock was awesome!  The coleslaw, cilantro, and feta cheese added an awesome flavor, crunch, and kick to the sandwich and the guacamole on the bottom bun provided a bit of creaminess and balance.  Even the side Caesar was pretty good.  Now, I was able to finish the sandwich but in a surprise turn of events, I couldn't finish the Caesar as I was way too full, at the point where it was a little too full but I really enjoyed that sandwich.

Overall, we had a pretty good experience!  The beer selection and food were phenomenal but the service was a little iffy.  I admit our waiter made up for it and finished strong but first impressions are important...  Anyway, I would definitely stop here again.

I love jack astors normally and this one is down the street so it's uber convenient. Unfortunately the quality just isn't there anymore. Seems like they've been cutting corners and it's declining for awhile now. Not sure if it's across the board or just this location. 

I ordered the garlic cheese pan bread, a favourite dish that I have been devoted to for 10+ years and it came out burnt and over cooked. I asked them to take it back. It legit just came out the exact same way lol. So sad! I loved this place but you need to step up and bring back the half decent kitchen you once had. 

#IMissTheOldJacks

Not sure why the reviews are so harsh, but many of those seem to be for delivery which doesn't seem very fair for a bar.

This has become our go-to spot to watch the Bills season opener. Several large TVs and they always put football on for us. They let us watch the game and check in on us enough to feel attended to without making us feel badly for spending 4 hours here. 

We had the Sri Lankan curry and the Thai curry poutine. Both were great; spicy. I'm no expert on Sri Lankan food but I've eaten more than your average white person. It didn't taste like any I'd had before but I enjoyed it nonetheless. 

Waitstaff/bartenders are great. This seems to be a real neighborhood place. All sorts of folks popped in for a drink or two. The staff would friendly with everyone and it was all very charming.

If you like a place with average food, boisterous racism, and mediocre service, Aces Place is for you! The regulars are still living life through the 1960's and the wait staff seems to encourage their views. They should get it over with and place a sign on the front of the restaurant stating "No minorities allowed!".

Came here for the very first time with my friends and had great drinks and a very nice waiter, i forgot his name but as the bar was closing,we noticed these two girls that work at the bar were mocking us and being disrespectful to us for no reason and ruined our whole night experience there But other than that this place was great.

First stop in Toronto. Easy to find, we walked up and the pub is upstairs.
We missed the lunch rush, so it was quiet and we were seated right away. The pub is clean and while a little dark, it was clean and friendly.
We decided to try the fish and chips. They came out hot and crispy. And so good. The chips were fresh and wonderfully flavored. 
Service was great and nice.

This was my first time here and probably my last because when we arrived it looked pretty cool as a place but the service is just horrible. Our server only come to the table once to check on us, the food was just ok definitely not worth its price, it's way too expensive for what they serve.

Vigorously endorsed by some of the older locals, but honestly the food is below what the price would lead you to think, both in quality and portion size, and service is far from what's taught in hospitality school. 

Underwhelmed, I am.

Really nice place. Great staff. Got takeout from here. My wings were good, I did not love the sauce but the wings themselves were made well. In this town if you have nothing bad to say about your food it's actually a good thing.

Stopped in for a quick meal today on the way back from aquarium to our hotel.

I had the chicken avocado club and my buddy had a burger.

Both were fine plates of pub food- good but nothing exceptional.

Our waitress Vania however was truly awesome. Really friendly and exceptional service.

I would give the food a 4 and the service a 10 so bumping review up to a 5 overall :-)

Bartender wouldn't give a sample of a wine to pair with the 35 dollar ribs! The wine that was open was turning! Avoid! They ended up not charging for my wine and I changed my review from a one star to the three!

We stopped in here on a whim since we liked the name and we ended up having a really solid lunch! Upstairs has all high top tables and a nice bar atmosphere. They have TVs around with sports on in case you want to watch a game. Bathrooms are a good size and clean. It wasn't very crowded when we arrived but we were sat promptly and our server was on point. 

We had a plain cheeseburger and the patty melt.  Both came with fries and were large portions. For bar burgers these were pretty dang good which we were not expecting. The menu also has a decent amount of other options for those who may not be in a burger mood. 

If you're in the area this is a solid place to chill out, have a drink and grab some food.

Decided to try this place after the Food and Wine Expo. Atmosphere is loud and crowded on a Saturday night. We were seated quickly. Wanted to try a Caesar salad for a starter. Unfortunately there was a recall on romaine so ended up with a Cesar made with iceberg lettuce. It was under dressed and flavourless. Gross. We waited a short while for our main courses. Burger was ok but the fries were way too over seasoned and salty. Portions were decent but service was slow. Once we were done eating it took forever to get our bills. They were nice enough to take the salad off the bill. Was nice to get out of there. Was way too loud and crowded for my liking. Not likely to go back.

We were seated immediately after we arrived. Service was really good. We had Buffalo Cauliflower for the first time. It was really good. Then we had chicken strips and the Salmon Entree. Overall the food and service were really good. Memorabilia was fun to look at

OMG! What started out as a promising quick lunch turned out to be a drawn out almost torturous affair in the hot sun! In a nutshell, the food at Jack Astor's near Yonge-Bloor was good but the service was slooow and not so great.

Stopping in for what was supposed to be a quick lunch on my way back to the office from the bank, I discovered some good food but surprisingly slow service.

Let's start with the food. I had a burger with fries and it was really good! It came with bacon and cheese and lots of thin cut crispy fries. The burger patty was juicy and tender and the whole burger was put together quite well. This was a good meal!

What kinda spoiled it for me though, was the speed of service. Ughhh! I was there for over an hour! And it really wasn't that busy!

Only three tables were occupied on the patio when I arrived and a gentleman took the table in front of me shortly after. That left about eight tables empty. The entire patio was shaded and cool and it was a lovely day. Was!

After around forty five minutes of waiting in the shade, the sun came around the building across the street and it was HOT! The food finally arrived and I just wanted to eat quickly and get out of there. It was getting HOTTER and I was now sweating buckets!

So now I was finished and waiting for my bill. Where were all the staff? The fellow at the table in front of me must have been feeling the same way because he got up to go and look for our server. He finally showed up (it must have been too hot for him out there), we paid and left.

How long did it take to have lunch? Long enough for the customer that arrived after me to have almost three whole beers. Lunch took over an hour. Please don't tell my boss...

PS - The patio was really noisy, from a nearby overhead vent.

Worth going to just for the Hockey history. You don't realize how much Gretzky accomplished until you see this place. Stick after stick, puck after puck, and newspaper article after article. This place is great to just go, grab a drink, and read through all the amazing things he accomplished over his career. As you would expect, the bar is rich with hockey history, and cool stuff to look at. You can even grab a drink mad with one of his spirits made right in Niagara on the Lake. I recommend any hockey fan should stop by and have a look around this place.

It was a little messy. The servers and bartenders were messy as well. The food was decent I got the taco trio. My server was nice , but could have been more attentive. She seemed like she didn't want to be there. The tacos come with cilantro but its not on the menu so make sure you ask. They have great deals everyday. If you are looking for fast good service and a good time, I would try a different location. The food took a good time it wasn't super fast. I waited a longer time for my drinks and water actually.

What a great little bar. Me and my husband were trying to find a bar to watch the Packers game while in Toronto. Came across this Gem and was NOT disappointed. We arrived and you are to seat yourself. The waiter was attentive and gave us great suggestions for beer and food. The atmosphere was great.

Beautiful decor wasted on a poor theme.  This gorgeous recently remodelled restaurant looks very much like a French bistro with white subway tiles, comfortable cushioned seats and square bar.  Unfortunately the owners have chosen a baseball/sports theme that doesn't meld well.  In a city bereft of decent bistros with light fare and good drink (which the commoner offers) it's disappointing when it's not fully embraced.  I have some hope that in the summer this will be a patio destination in the neighbourhood where drinks and food are prioritized over tv watching.

Customer service here is a hit or miss. Came here during the afternoon. My server was rude, rushed me to take my order, and barely gave service. Funny that I haven't been asked for my ID for years until my visit here. 

The food here is questionable. The quesadilla is alright and the margarita was so small and had too much dough for $14. Kitchen was slow to get the pizza out but when it came to my table, it wasn't hot. Go to blaze pizza downstairs for a better, bigger and cheaper pizza.

We reserved the back space and held a party there for 85 people. The service was amazing! Very friendly staff! Everyone loved the food and called us the next day to tell us what an awesome place this was. Their Mac and cheese is the best I've had. Their beer selection is very sophisticated. We will definitely go back to the restaurant and would also hold an event there again. Highly recommended.

I primarily go here for the bar food, or drinks with friends a-game of pool, or to watch sports. But my adventurous tastebuds often lead me to change up the specifics of my order. Which is why I can say without a shadow of doubt their wings are better depending on which sauce you ask for. I usually get hot sauce and did this time, but last time I got Barbecue and I must say their wings pair best with hot sauce. Secondly was my drink I've been feeling for cocktails lately for some reason, so I got the Tropical trip and the only thing missing was the beach, because this drink tastes exactly like the drinks you will find on a tropical vacation. They perfectly blend the alcohol with Pineapple juice and orange juice. And it doesn't hurt that the Amaretto is naturally sweet.

Had an amazing time for my birthday, which just so happened to fall on game 1 of the NBA finals. The crowd was so lively! It was like being at the game. The food was great and for the number of people in there, it was coming out quick!! Shoutout to DAVID! From booking to seating to serving, he was outstanding and made sure we were taken care of. Our waitress was excellent too! I can't remember her name, but she said she was from some part of Africa. So friendly and personable. She recommended the Shark Wings which were amazing. I recommend this place and will be sure to be back!!

1st time in Canada and 1st place we stopped to eat. The setting was nice and our waitress was beautiful I loved her pink hair. I got the chicken and the fully loaded Smash burger. The burger was and the chicken was good, I had to get some ranch that I thought was yummy. It came with mash and gravy and that was incredible. The only down side were the drinks, I wasnt impressed with the selection I wish there were more mix drinks. Had the Tommy gun and pina coloda. Tommy gun kinda tasted like a sour long island.... but it was a different twist on the pina and I loved it.

Burger with a side salad and a pop... $30 with a modest tip included.  Three sliders (off the appetizer menu) and a pop... $23 with a modest tip included. The quality of the food was good, but nothing to rave about.  Service was pleasant and professional.  Great view of Yonge-Dundas Square, but the metal chairs were hard, flat, narrow and instantly uncomfortable. 
If we had gone to the food court next door for lunch we could have had pretty much the same view, better seats, not quite as good but still reasonable food, and saved $30 on our lunch tab between us.
Maybe OK for dinner, or a bar night, or for guests on an expense account, but for a downtown workday lunch it's simply not worth it.

So I've been here twice now in less than a month and I've got to say, I am impressed. What once was a sketchy looking Wild Wing is now a beautiful British-style Gastropub. Now that we've got that out of the way, let's get into the nitty-gritty.

The menu has lots on offer, which is something that I appreciated. Each and every single time, I have found myself at a loss for what to order because I kind of want everything. On this second visit, I had made a mistake thinking that we would be there during brunch, and it seems that brunch is only served on Sunday's. Weird flex, but okay. 

Both times I have had the French Onion Soup ($11) and have enjoyed the comforting and satisfying flavours. The serving size is also pretty forgiving, but you absolutely need to order a secondary item. On my most recent trip, I got the tuna tostada ($11) which when asking the server how big it was she described it to be a LOT smaller than what it actually was. I thought it likely could have used a bit more acid: the slaw was lacking in flavour, the lime slice they provide you to squeeze on was way too small. But otherwise, it was okay. Not the most mindblowing tostada I've had, but pretty legit.  One thing that was a bit disappointing was my pal's fries. On the menu, they are labeled as "Duck Fat Fries" but literally they tasted that regular fries that weren't that hot. 

The service here is pretty hit and miss. What I've noticed from visiting twice now is that both times there seemed to be one server for the entire restaurant. I visited at two contrasting hours (8 PM weeknight and 1:30 PM weekend) and the servers are literally doing their bests, for the amount of space they have to cover. 

Since my two visits here, I have suggested it to everyone I know. It's in a weird spot in Roncy/Dundas West but I'd love to see this spot not only thrive but survive.

Went to Shark Club tonight for wing night, which in the past has been really good (Big, flavourful wings), But tonight the wings were sub-par. The wings were small, dry, and honestly tasted like old frozen grocery store wings. We also ordered a side of poutine, which was lacking. Disappointing considering the food used to be great. Service has also declined, took about 12 minutes for a server to come over to take our drunk order, quite long considering the place was pretty empty. 

I likely won't go back.
One of the horrible customer service ever! After waiting for 25 min to get the first drink I decided to leave and go to another restaurant. It was such a bad experience.

Our family go to these days! I appreciate the fact that they take reservations which is good for a large group. Food is solid - I like their burger and they have a great beer selection. Service is solid. It is not the best place in roncy but when you want to go out with another family for a casual meal, it is nice and convenient.

Came here for Sunday brunch and it was fantastic!!!!
When you walk in the decor is so nice, the mustard yellow chairs!!!
Will definitely be returning to try out the dinner menu. Food was full of flavour, fresh and well seasoned. One of the best meals i've had in Toronto.

New pub in the hood.  I really liked their menu and had a hard time choosing what to eat.  I opted for the burger.  It was a homemade patty, delicious and flavourful.  I had a garden salad and enjoyed the fruity dressing.  My boyfriend had the chicken sandwich.  He really enjoyed it as well.  I had a bite and thought it tasted great.  It's hard to keep chicken breast moist, but this one was!

What's so special about this place is that everything is made from scratch in house, so yes they do smoke their own meat! The ribs are smoked for about 6 hours and pulled pork is around 12 hours. 
The highlight among all the dishes is definitely the pull pork sandwich with sweet potato fries! The pork is so flavourful and cooked perfectly that it basically melts in your mouth. The sweet potato fries is cut thinly so when it's fried it's cooked evenly and perfectly crunchy on the outside.

A cute modern pub, with a wide variety of drinks. We came for Sunday brunch and our table ordered the huevos rancheros, the breakfast sandwich, a vegan burrito, and the eggs Benedict. Overall, the food was tasty and portions were good. A nice touch was that they offered both flat and sparkling water for no additional charge. Service was also pretty good, though the place was relatively quiet.

Hooch hour gets me every time! Delirium Tremens is strong and tastes great! I also love their Buddha bowl (which makes me feel better and healthier while I'm drinking way too many $5.75 beers.) This visit we also ordered an appetizer of flaming cheese. It was a fun experience and tasted amazing! @exploreeatto

I finally made it in to his high-end pub, and it is no commoner. What a welcome addition to Dundas West/Roncy hood. 

My family and pals squeezed into one of their luxe booths and enjoyed some beer, nachos, mussels and truffle fries. As you can tell by the order, this place is a lil' fancy, however, the price is right. 

They have TVs on the wall for your favourite sporting event (I hear some dinosaurs are playing well these days), delicious menus perfect for a date or the family and a patio.

Watching Raptors vs Charlotte Hornets (plus Jays vs Indians) with friends tonight at this local hangout.

It's a very large bar inside with booths, high & low tables, plus about a dozen bar seats, plus a patio for summer dining.  About two dozen TV screens can be viewed from just about anywhere.

I've been here before and sat inside and outside for a meal...the food is great.  Our Bartenders/server were Alicia and Michelle...superb service seated at the bar!

There are 2 dart boards to help past the time away.  Sports-themed art hang the dining areas.

On the menu are specials depending on the day.  Tonight I'm just having a bottle of $5 Moosehead.

Parking is limited at the front but you can find additional parking close by.

Came here for late night dinner on a Friday night and it wasn't busy because none of the Toronto Teams were playing.  I ordered a smoked chicken mushroom fettuccini and it was delicious. It had the right amount of creaminess and sauciness.  The presentation looked good too. It came with two garlic toast. 

My colleagues ordered a nachos to share and it was a huge portion. Another colleague ordered a the smoke burger and she liked it.  The waitress was kind and kept checking up on us to see how we were doing.  I would come here again because of the location.

Great sports bar/restaurant - clean, casual atmosphere with TVs everywhere.  We go a few times a month for dinner or brunch and have never had a bad meal.  Monday-Thursday they have daily specials - Burgers, tacos, wings, etc..  lots of beers on tap too!   The whole back of the restaurant can be rented for corporate events, parties, etc...  staff are friendly and extremely competent.   In the summer you can sit on the patio, but it's a little noisy if the car wash is busy.  Overall our fav casual restaurant in East York
I went there to celebrate my friend's birthday. It turns dance floor on Saturday night. I love the chicken skin nachos

I had the Cobb salad and shared the duck poutine and nachos. Our group of 18 fit comfortably outside, and the seating and patio were really lovely. Our waitress was really sweet, but for some reason her system wouldn't let her input starters and mains at the same time. It was a confusing start to ordering for our large group. 

The duck poutine was great! It had a surprising amount of duck meat inside, and the duck gravy went well with the cheese curds. It could have used less gravy, because the last few fries were swimming.

The nachos were regular nachos. A little overpriced considering we didn't get any meat, but they tasted pretty good. 

The Cobb salad was good, but very very large. This is not a salad for someone who is trying to eat healthy. It came with a generous portion of chicken, bacon, avocado, egg, and cheese. The dressing was good. I just wish there was a little bit more salad to the salad. 

This is a great location for a work event or any other big gathering. There's something for everything on the menu and tons of space out back.

Came here for a surprised birthday dinner. I originally made the reservation for 9 people and later called again to inform them that there were 10 people. The girl on the phone said no problem they will add that in. I also told the girl that this would be a surprise birthday and had asked them if they were able to accommodate and following along with my surprised plan. 

Since shark club was not a typical place for my boyfriend and I to go to, I had told him we were coming here for paint nite. The girl on the phone was happy to comply with my request and to my surprise when we got to the restaurant the hostess went along with it as well. 

But the positive comments stops here.

When we got to our table I can't help to notice how SMALL it was. It was just a bar table with people sitting on both sides. Also, luckily one of our friends couldn't make it, otherwise I wouldn't know where he could've sat down at. 

The food was a disappointment. I got the burger just to be safe and even that was sub par. The fries tasted like it has been sitting out. The burger was burnt. My friends "truffle fries" tasted exactly the same as my plain fries. 

Our server was nice but clearly not the brightest. We had a cake and when I asked her to bring the cake, her response was "there's a cake?" 
Even if she did not know or remembered, she could have went along with it and simply went to check without making her seem stupid. 
But that's not all.... 
Before the cake even got there, she came with a stack of plates and placed on our small tiny table (She might as well scream "the cake is coming!")
And well.. SHE DID. Cause after she placed the plates on the table she goes, who is the cake for ever so loudly when the birthday boy was sitting right beside me. Needless to say.. there was no surprise. 

I guess when 18% gratitude is included, you don't even have to try. 

Will not recommend this place to anyone. 
Food is terrible. Service is sub par. They play terrible music. 
Go somewhere else!

We came here on Thursday evening and I'm sorry we did. We traveled all day and wanted to grab a bite and head back to our hotel and relax. We brought our kids, ages 11 and 14 and were told that they had to be out by 7:00. No big deal being that it was shortly after 5:00. 

They seemed a bit slow except for one large table and only a few other small tables. That's why I was a bit confused as to why service was so slow. We went without  drinks for extended periods of time. It took well over an hour to get our food. When we did get it, my opened faced, medium steak sandwich was literally dehydrated. You could even tell by looking at it. My son's steak was burnt. Completely burnt! The salads were decent and the fries were good but that's about all. 

As a side note, we are usually great tippers. Usually the minimum for us is 20%. I'm not even ashamed to admit we didn't tip at all. When the food it terrible and service is terrible and you spend $136+ dollars on a meal, it's pretty disappointing. Especially on vacation. I'm sure Toronto has many other choices to choose from and I'm sorry we wasted our time and money here. We must have gotten caught up in a tourist trap. 

Our hotel front desk recommended this place, which by listening to them, was our mistake. A wise traveler once told me that you should never follow a recommendation from the desk or concierge. Always ask housekeeping or similar staff if they could eat anywhere in the city, where would it be. Once they give you a suggestion, tip them and move on. You'll never be disappointed.

I am "prohibiting" myself from eating here ever again. 

24 dollars for a Mac and cheese served in a scooped bowl in a recess about as wide as a music CD and "piled" about 3 inches deep. 

Drinks on the other hand-- oh yeah! Great bar rails and beer specials during happy hour. 

But with no reasonably priced food, it's like they want to discourage people from bothering the cooks. 

Patio is however, very nice for a summertime after-work drink. 

Cheers!

We had been trying to go here for a while. It's kind of annoying that basically a neighbourhood joint is pretty much by reservation only. 

The place is beautiful but with a certain amount of masculine sterility, the attempt at BDE. The leather seats got uncomfortable and the height of the chairs at the low top are slightly too high to settle in for a date night.

Decent beer and cider selection. Kind of annoying to pay a premium not to drink beer but that's an ongoing gripe everywhere. 

Our server was lovely but definitely carrying one table too many.  
Now, the food is priced pretty fairly but, the kitchen is poorly run/short staffed. We waited forever for our food.  I found that the portion sizes were also a little skimpy. 

The tuna tostada was delicious but basically just avocado and slaw. For that it was $11. 

The burger was adequate, patty was a bit thin and my dining companion had to load their burger with the aioli from the fries in order to make it more tasty. 

I'm also going to go on record and beg restaurants to stop with truffle fries. They are disgusting. You ruin delicious food by dousing them in truffle oil. Just stahp it! 

I was still hungry so I ordered a chicken taco, as I mentioned the kitchen was extremely slow. Our server came over to address this. By this point I no longer wanted my taco but as it was "two minutes from being done" I said sure I'll take it.  If you're going to overload a corn tortilla with salsa and other ingredients that completely saturate it's shell, the least you can do is double up the shell. Or reconfigure it so you can eat it without a knife and fork.

The food is basically not well but not horribly executed "elevated pub food".


We'll probably be back for drinks but go grab a bite somewhere else.

This place is perfecto.  Excellent service every time we have come (which has been about 5 or 6 times).  
The duck fat fries are AMAZING.  The buffalo cauliflower is also bonkers (and as someone who dislikes blue cheese, the blue cheese sauce that comes on it is actually delicious).  
They also make perfect cocktails.  I am so so so happy this place is here now, and not a weird wild wings. 
Well done Commoner!!

The service is alright and the quality of the food is not worth the amount you're paying, other than the exception of wing Wednesday. I got 30 wings for 15 dollars which is an amazing deal and the wings aren't that bad. I got two flavours, the ghost pepper which is not spicy at all but the sriracha honey is straight up just sriracha sauce and is even more spicer. Don't get me wrong, they're still mediocre but hey, they're only $5 a pound so I can't really complain but yeah I'm not planning to ever go back.

This place was so great. The interior design is BEAUTIFUL - from the bar stools to the lighting to the tile floors near the washroom. I'd love to come back a few times and sit at different tables, since I'd probably notice something new about the place each time.

My boyfriend had the NY steak, which was a big serving of meat, veggies, fries and spices/sauces. It was quality meat and it was cooked well. I had two chicken tacos with pineapple salsa and they were "healthy" but satisfying. Loved the pineapple salsa!

For dessert, I had the toffee pudding and OH my god, it was so good. 100% I'm coming back for this dish. It was both fluffy and dense and the toffee was perfect. It was literally one of the best desserts I've ever had.

Also, the server was so great! Friendly and helpful. We'll be back for sure!

This place is relatively dead on a weeknight. So if you want to get in a game of pool with friends on a Monday after work, consider going here. But it's more than pool it is food, since my last review they changed the gravy. If I were blindfolded before I'd say it was KFC gravy, as it was more of a chicken based gravy, now it is a beef gravy. And that small change means a lot, before the gravy and cheese mixed together in an excellent way, now the cheese isn't as melted, but I digress, pool is pretty good here especially when you factor in the television sets within the view of people playing pool, allowing you to play and watch the game, and if you go when it is really dead the owner will allow you to choose what you want to watch. Add in the friendly staff and you get a nice after work or boys night hangout.

The beer selection is outstanding and lounging at the luxuriously sprawling bar while enumerating the lengthy line of taps is a repeat-worthy experience ... the menu shows promise but the dishes disappoint.

I really like The Commoner and commend the owner(s) for their ambition. The place is exceptionally renovated and you can feel the love that's set this place up well ahead of its time. ("If you build it they will come.")

Having been here for dinner and brunch, I think the food is decent but found it overly complicated. I'd like to see simpler offerings with high quality ingredients assembled in balance. I think the creative options are well thought out. I just found the food to be over-salted (brunch) or, as in the case of the jerk ribs I had (dinner) under-marinated (meat with jerk sauce on top). Portions are great and I hope they get the gourmet gastropub foundation right.

Service is mixed for me. Dinner mains were fast but dessert took way to long. Brunch was excessively slow (they open at 11 and we arrived at 11:20, before they got too busy). Super friendly and responsive wait staff. I just think they need to get the rhythm right. Having worked in this business it may be a matter of synchronizing the kitchen with the service and rotating table seatings in balance. Not sure what it is but something is off and I can't blame the wait staff if it's the same pattern on different meals with different servers.

I opted to leave this review because, if any of it resonates with The Commoner then perhaps it can improve. I think this place has bright a great vibe to our community and stands to bring a regular crowd together for local events and televised sports. And if my views are off then no big deal: it's a decent place that's walking distance and I still plan to drop in for the odd meal.

Ending on a positive: thanks to the owner(s) for creating this great place. I look forward to The Commoner becoming a landmark gastropub that becomes a well known draw both in our community and within our city!

Quality isn't there anymore :(
Nice waitress is gone :(

I have made my way to The Commoner a couple times not and they haven't disappointed yet. The beer selection is good and the food has been delicious. I usually get The Commoner or a sandwich when I go here. The only issue I have found so far has been that their cocktails aren't that great.

I have been here twice now, once for the Raptor playoff run and the other for food.

The Raptors game was on a Friday night and the place was hoping but they managed to find my Buddy and me a seat. We only had a couple of beers but they were cold and the tap lines I believe were clean, My tummy hates dirty tap lines lol.

The most recent time I had dinner here before a concert with my Wife and Daughter. I got the Chicken club on the sourdough bread and I loved it....I got the side cole slaw which I was not impressed with but non the less, the club was de-yummy!!! My Daughter order the fish and chips which really surprised me as she is not a fish eater. She ate it all and thought it was good. I can tell you the fries and onion rings are good too, I may have scooped a couple of my Wife's and Daughter's plate lol. I will must definitely come back if I find myself a bit hungry.

Well, it was friendly. I had high hopes going in with my family but alas... We ordered nothing complex for a neighbourhood pub. Wings & fries and Nachos: both arrived late and cold. We sent them back. Nachos were simply reheated. They re-arrived warm...ish. Wings were hot but the fries were still cold. We mentioned it to the waitress, again, who was lovely. She agreed there was no excuse. Okay, here's the thing: this is regular pub fare. If you can't serve this stuff up right, you have a pubistential crisis. This stuff is easy. I was shocked they didn't comp the meal. Nothing good to say except the live guitarist was good and our waitress was nice.

This place is the best of the whole neighborhood.  Drinks and food are amazing, we particularly like their nachos.  Beer is great.  Their staff is always attentive and friendly.  We are moving and for sure we will miss this place a lot, we hope we can visit them as often as we do now.
Just finished having a good meal. Beer selection is good and pricing is on par. It was a table 14 people and the service was prompt and good at the same time. Highly recommend the bar and restaurant.

Fantastic renovation given this place used to be a Wild Wings locations, however their choice of hard surfaces interior creates a very loud interior where I feel like I can hear other tables conversations as well as I can hear my own. That said, loud restaurants aren't that unique in Toronto so I'm not influencing my review around it.

As for what does matter, let's start with #1 reason to come here - the food...
I had a very tasty "Commoner Burger" that comes with provolone cheese and bacon jam. 
I was admittedly skeptical of the $6 chicken taco, but it was a good size  and pretty darn good as well, with lots of white meat chicken breast sliced up within. 
The fish and chips were decent but 1 piece was mostly batter and the fries with both meals were a bit soggy and limp.

The craft beer selection is quality, with a nice mix of all styles and some of Ontario's best breweries. Kudos to the place for putting together a nice variety to choose from. 

Also, bonus points for the fact they take reservations, and the service levels were all perfectly fine, so overall it was a solid 4 star experience.
Food was great, self seating, loved my wings! -1 for the slow service/ waiting longer than normal for the food on a slow Thursday evening

Currently sitting at the bar with my partner, the bartender was extremely rude. Came over with a scowl and Barely said two words to us except, what do you want .Wow, bad won't ever be back, bartender was busy talking to staff at work and drinking on her own rather than serving her guests.

Great place to watch a game because there are TVs everywhere and very comfortable booths. I've always had wonderful service because the owners make sure everyone walking through the door is looked after. There are daily specials. Food is reasonably priced, tasty and plated well.

My son and I went to the Gym for dinner tonight.  The service was great, the food hot and tasty.  He had a plentiful serving of crispy chicken fingers and fries.  I had the beets and greens salad with chicken breast.  The salad had a nice light dressing, goat cheese, pralined walnuts, sweet pickled onions, and the chicken was nicely seasoned.  My only bit of advice would be to make the walnuts a bit more crispy.

We went here for dinner tonight with our two children and had spectacular service. Not only did our server know whether root beer had artificial food colouring in it, which it does and which our 6-year-old cannot have, she remembered this when she brought us our red stripey mints at the end of the night (we attributed this to her thoughtfulness but she was actually being thoughtful for another reason). Also, she was funny and chased us out into the parking lot to give us mittens. Food was pretty good, music was awful. But exceptional service to a family table (woot woot!) so 5 stars.

This is such a great local pub. Mary the owner/bartender is the absolute best. Good draft selection, ice cold beer, chill atmosphere and amazing/genuine service. Highly recommend! It's a great little spot. Thanks Mary!

Very nice patio in the back and lots of drink options.  TVs with sports and a small dance floor that was empty on a Saturday night. 

Food was OK I had the Cobb salad with moist pulled chicken, pancetta, avocado, blue cheese and a nice light dressing. A bit pricey at $19 but it tasted good.

Men's bathroom is really cramped. I don't need to get that close to other dudes you should consider renovating!

Only other issue was 18% automatic gratuity for large group although waitress completely forgot about my drink and disappeared for 15 minutes.

Great place to watch any main sports event.
I've tried honey garlic chicken wings around downtown & Shark club has the tastiest, good size & portions.
Other meals are good as well, double fisted burger &  beef sliders, etc..
Also, for dessert..   cinnamon donuts :)

I primarily go here for the bar food, or drinks with friends a-game of pool, or to watch sports. But my adventurous tastebuds often lead me to change up the specifics of my order. Which is why I can say without a shadow of doubt their wings are better depending on which sauce you ask for. I usually get hot sauce and did this time, but last time I got Barbecue and I must say their wings pair best with hot sauce. Secondly was my drink I've been feeling for cocktails lately for some reason, so I got the Tropical trip and the only thing missing was the beach, because this drink tastes exactly like the drinks you will find on a tropical vacation. They perfectly blend the alcohol with Pineapple juice and orange juice. And doesn't hurt that the Amaretto is naturally sweet.

Pretty average bar in terms of food and drinks, but it's a large space with lots of TVs and pool tables across the two floors. Not too crowded either, so it's good for playing some games with friends or enjoying a beer while watching the game (I believe there were at least 3 different sports games being broadcast across the TVs so you get to take your pick!).

Had no problem getting a table on a Saturday night with no reservations (no wait as alluded to in other reviews).  I had the Ahi Tuna Tostata and a side of fries and my partner had the Asian salad, both big servings and very tasty.  Service was great.  Only down side and why they're not getting 5 stars is how noisy it is.  The ceramic subway tiles, large glass windows and hard ceiling mean the sound just gets amplified.  So expect to yell across the table to talk.

We were walking along St. Clair and on the hunt for a patio when we spotted The Gym. I didn't even have to look at the menu to know I wanted to stop in. It's called The Gym! I can honestly say I went to The Gym on Friday evening!

Unfortunately, the good times ended there.

Well, okay, that's not exactly fair. The service was friendly and the beer was cold. But the food... Yikes.

I was in the mood for something unhealthy and cheesy, so I figured I'd get a foolproof item: Chili Cheese Fries ("Gym fries, layered nacho style with chili & melted cheese topped with a dollop of sour cream").

The dish arrived a short time later and I was immediately concerned. Hovering around the edges were large swaths of completely unmelted cheese, which is obviously a complete no-no with a dish of this sort.

It only got worse from there, though. The plate of food arrived to the table long after it had been prepared, so it wasn't hot. Heck, it was barely warm. I'm not one to complain or send food back, but good golly was I ever tempted to in this case.

The chili was dry and flavorless, but again, it would've been fine if it had been hot. The cheese that was under the chili was okay, I guess, but there was absolutely no meltiness to be had. The whole thing was one big clump, basically. It's too bad, really, because the fries tasted like they had some potential. 

And that "dollop of sour cream"? Non existent. Our waiter actually noticed this a few minutes after I started eating and asked if I wanted some sour cream brought out. Too little too late, my man.

I honestly don't understand how a joint sends out a dish this terrible. It just shows an absolutely disdain for the customer and frankly it makes me genuinely upset. I'm coming to your establishment to spend my hard-earned money and *this* is how you treat me? Ridiculous.

Needless to say, I'll never return.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at the Commoner, but I am not sure whether I will be coming back anytime soon. I loved the aesthetic, but the place did not necessarily "wow" me. The food was delicious and came on time. I had tacos and they were okay (even though I wish they were juicier). It's a solid 4/5!

I often come here with my friends after work on Friday afternoons.  The restaurant had never included the 18% gratuity, yesterday was the first time they did and it was also the first time when we got a bad service and the food  was not great.  I ordered a quesadilla that was not worth the price.  We are not coming back.
This is a very large restaurant with lots of room. I always get the calamari and the fried chicken. Very yummy but the TV's can be loud and obnoxious

This place is relatively dead on a weeknight. So if you want to get in a game of pool with friends on a Monday after work, consider going here. But it's more than pool it is food, since my last review they changed the gravy. If I were blindfolded before I'd say it was KFC gravy, as it was more of a chicken based gravy, now it is a beef gravy. And that small change means a lot, before the gravy and cheese mixed together in an excellent way, now the cheese isn't as melted, but I digress, pool is pretty good here especially when you factor in the television sets within the view of people playing pool, allowing you to play and watch the game, and if you go when it is really dead the owner will allow you to choose what you want to watch. Add in the friendly staff and you get a nice after work or boys night hangout.

Love the aesthetic and feel of this place! Very swanky and fun. Lots of great beers on tap and not too busy on a Saturday afternoon. Didn't get to try their food, but if we stayed longer I would have liked too. The plates coming out looked incredible.

When first going into this location it was so far, so good. The server was friendly and informative explaining the deal (half off single order wings). We get our food
(Very good), and not long after we were practically done our meal. Typically at this point the server would come around and ask if we want the bill. But no, 5 minutes go by, then 10, then 20 or so. She was helping other customers with their orders, people before us were receiving their bills. I also looked over a few times to see her and the other waitress talking to others at the bar while we are patiently waiting for her with our 2.5 year old daughter. She then comes over FINALLY with our bill and doesn't even have the courtesy to apologize for the wait. It wasn't even busy!

I've been here a few time for group gatherings. It's a great and lively place to watch sports if you're into that. If you go on a game day, it will most likely be busy. At my most recent visit, I was so unimpressed with the service that we received. Server looked unhappy the whole time. Service was fast though, so we brushed it off.

I ordered the Fish Tacos with chips and salsa... I don't recommend it. The fish was cold when it got to our table. NOTE: they charge you $2 for sour cream, which I did not know... It would have been nice if she told me. The portion of it was superrrr small too...

Every day has a drink/food special which is nice. Food is a bit pricier than most places.

Overall, it's a decent place to grab a drink and watch the game.

Très bruyant!  Peu confortable!  J'ai pris le shark burger.  Il était bon!  Par contre j'ai dû changer deux fois de sortes de bière car il y en avait plus.  Mon conjoint a pris un sandwich au poulet.  Il a bien aimé son plat.  Le poulet était parfait.

This might be one of my favourite goto spots at Yonge and Eg. They are typically busy on a Friday night and offer a decent sized patio in the back. I love their take on the Cobb Salad and have put their own spin on other dishes too. They have "Hooch Hour" a couple of times a day, which are indicated by a red and green sign - if the sign is green, you get drinks for under $6. They have a decent selection of beer on tap and servers are fun and very attentive.

Great place to watch any main sportsevent.
I've tried honey garlic chicken wings around downtown & Shark club has the tastiest, good size & portions.
Other meals are good as well, double fisted burger &  beef sliders :)

I can't love this place more.  I went here just after it opened and it was way too busy.  In the months afterwards, it was easier getting a table.  But news is out, this place is great!  So my fear now is that it's too popular, that I won't be able just to walk in and get a table...so make reservations on line, no matter what night.
The staff are all AMAZING, including Marie-Dawn, the manager, who greets everyone.  The menu has changed since it opened and it is amazing.  The burgers are HUGE, so beware if you aren't too hungry.  The schnizel and potatoe salad that come with it are my favourite on the menu.  And I went for brunch and the selections are just as selective as the main menu.  So whether you go for brunch or main menu, it's worth it.  Please keep this place in business.  SO GLAD it's in the neighbourhood, as it's a most welcomed business!!!

Came here to watch UFC and overall it was the perfect environment to do so. They charge a $5 cover and if you don't have a reservation I highly recommend getting their early because they place gets packed! I sat front and center at the bar which provided a great view of the big screen, although they do have several smaller screens throughout which ensures you can see atleast one tv from where you are sitting. 
Drink wise I had a sombersby sangria, a Bellini and a pink lemonade. The sombersby sangria consisted of sombersby cider, absolute peach, lemonade, watermelon and orange. The drink itself was very smooth and light tasting. The Bellini was absolutely delicious! I wasnt thrilled it was so small but it went down easily so I'm not suprised. It was full of flavour a must have if you enjoy bellinis. The pink lemonade was my least favorite of the three. It tasted a bit like lemonade but had a stronger alcohol taste then the others. 
Food wise I had some wings and the queso and bacon dip. The wings were on the small side but they had several of them which made up for it. The flavor was good as was the quality of the chicken wing. Not the best I've had but good enough to get again. The queso and bacon dip was delicious! It has just the right about of smoky bacon taste to be noticable without being over powering and it came with a generous helping of chips. Great bang for your buck at $10. 
Overall great experience but I docked them a star for the $5 cover and that they only had 1 bartender one bartender/server working for the whole place so service wasn't as quick as it could be, especially with the food once the place got busy.
Management changed and now it's a bunch of amateurs at the bar and white ladies talking really loud.

Nah. The waitresses were outstanding and the beer was well priced but the food just sucked. It's basically no attempt at delivering good food and just settling for being a bar to watch sports. My burger tasted like the ones the cafeteria in middle school used to serve. Nice to see that the lunch ladies are still in business lol :)
Best chicken fingers on Dundas. Service was speedy. Server was very nice. Beers were cold.

First of all the service was exceptional. The girl behind the bar was perfect. 
The food was good. The burgers were good. The choices were nice, good prices. Onion rings were excellent. 
I have nothing bad to say, definitely give it a try. I just was not wowed to race back.

Wonderful food and good music. 
We went there after 9pm, and they had a special menu for late night eating. The food was amazing, from sushi to tacos, they have a great variety. 
At the location there was also very good music playing. During happy hour a beer only costs $4.
Definitely would recommend this place!
It was a bad experience for us. Very slow service. The waitress was careless. Not all the orders came to the table at the same time.

The spring roll potatoe was really good, but their serlion (cooked rare) was too tough.  Service was average (nothing amazing)

Overall, good jaw workout if you really want to keep chewing on your dinner!

Took them about 20 minutes to prepare 1lb of wings. Medium BBQ wings Skin a bit dry but tasty. Reason I gave it a 4 its because of the area this is located in been to worst places. Washroom is very clean, very friendly staff. It definitely doesn't deserve a rating below 4 star.
got the worst steak frites of my life! It was chewy and cold! Salad tasted like a sour patch kid, so sour. Definitely not worth $30 wtffffffff waste of my money. Y'all are THIEVES.

We're too late for live band Friday's but who cares!

Da Boyz are partying in celebration of one of our own; Happy Birthday Sako buddy.

Excellent service provided by Ashley.

Big screens to watch sporting events and great music to even dance to.

Coor Light 20oz for $8.25 and great ambiance.

I've been to a joey's before and this visit was slightly more disappointing?

To begin, the venue is made to look nice and put together but they are slacking in cleanliness. There was a dirty napkin under my seat and my hostess brushed off crumbs from my chair before pulling it out for me. I was a little grossed out. 

Wait time for food was longer than i expected but it's okay i made good conversation with my boyfriend in the meantime.

Then the food made me a little sad because you could see just how overpriced it is. I ordered the bombay butter chicken which i've had in the past at a different location, i understand that it will taste different from different chefs but i was underwhelmed. The food was good to eat but the portion was way smaller, I can go to my favourite asian restaurant and order a similar dish for the same great taste, for twice the portion but a fraction of the price. 

My boyfriend had the hand-pressed burger and that was pretty good, I had a bite with some fries and they were well enjoyable. However i find myself comparing it to a five guys burger that is just as good and also a fraction of the price. 

We also had the molten lava cake, which is my favourite and only real reason for coming here. I think this is most worth it if you ever come to joey's. This time they did take a really long time making it and we were informed that the first one broke in the oven and they kindly took it off the bill, i really appreciated that. 

The servers were efficient and maybe im just setting the bar too high but from how joeys makes themselves look versus how they perform is not quite satisfactory. I've seen better.
Warm beer, service and food inconsistant, Have given this place a few tries as I live close by and wanted to like it, but there are too many things wrong with this place.

I got the bombay butter chicken and it was quite hot and delicious. The only thing I would change is the carrot to chicken ratio. It was about 3 carrots to 1 chicken piece. The server was nice and food came relatively quick. Overall good experience.

This place is super convenient. It's right beside Eaton Centre.

We ordered the steak frites, the mushroom burger, and the mushroom soup. The mushroom soup was creamy. The avocado in the mushroom burgers were tasty. The steak frites was average. 

Overall, I'd recommend coming here only because it has a great ambience. The price is not worth the quality of the food we ordered.

Our teammate found this poolhall/bar and we came here last Tuesday to try it out. The pool hall is massive, equipped with so many pool tables, most ive seen inside a poolhall. We sat on the newly renovated patio that was spacious, modern looking, open and had TVs. The staff were all very nice and welcoming, making jokes and doing there best job serving our large group. 

Tried the platter of wings which allowed up to 3 different flavor choices and came with fries, and veggies. This fed 4 adults, it was a good amount. We chose the homemade jerk, honey garlic and Thai chili. We all really enjoyed the homemade fries that tasted fresh and reminded us of swiss chalets original fries. I did not like the homemade jerk flavor as it didn't quite resemble jerk and it was quite sour, can never go wrong with honey garlic and the their chili was average, needs more pop of flavor. Definitely will be back to try other flavors and more!

Overall: 8.5/10 would recommend.
Great atmosphere, awesome happy hour specials. Love the Bombay butter chicken and the new Cobb salad, good service and quality

Some of the best beer and burgers you can get!! My wife is vegetarian and I'm a carnivore. We had such a. Great meal. She had the veggie burger which was one of her favorites with veggie poutine. Food was seasoned well and the poutine was GREAT! Get the large because you will eat it. We ended up ordering more poutine! Burger had a good salt content to it not just bland.
Great service, good food! Very well organized operations  a must try. I recommend steak and sushi, and the ahi tuna salad!

Awesome pulled pork nachos.  Very good burger and sweet potato fries. Amazing selection of beer, had the Shock Top and the Blanche de Chambly. Crazy hyper party atmosphere, like a night club. Service was good, not great.

I normally don't order bowls but this one appealed to me on the menu & I was very happy with my order. I liked the bowl more then I thought I would + it was very filling with the rice and battered cauliflower. The truffle fries are to die for!! AND on Wednesday's this place does half price bottles of wine which was another bonus!! Joey's is definitely a lively restaurant with great service but make your reservations beforehand or you'll have to wait for 30-40 minutes. Overall 4/5

What do you do when you want to see Liverpool play midday during the biggest snowstorm of the year and you're at the aquarium?  You look to Google maps and find the nearest Irish pub!  That's seriously how we ended up here and I'm glad we did!

It's a large space with a large bar area.  They have darts, pool, arcade games, and a plethora of large televisions to show all the games!  The bar tender was super friendly and accommodating (as in, we didn't want to watch Man U, we wanted Liverpool).

I was starving so I ordered the Shepherd's Pie Bits off the app menu.  What you get is two rather large (somewhere between a baseball and a softball) deep fried Shepherd's pies.  Delicious!  And filling.

Beer selection was good, too.  I'm on Untappd so my goal was to up my Great White North badge as many levels as I could in 7 days.  (I started at 1, by the end I was at 8) Dublin Calling provided a few check-ins to that end.

The ambience is classy and during the summer it's nice to sit out on the patio. The service is good. However I find their food is mediocre. I've had their filet mignon which I ordered medium-rare but found it tough and lacking in flavor, as well as their ravioli with lobster cream which was just okay.

A friend and I decided to check out real sports as we heard they got a new menu. After looking it up we both agreed it looked really good!  We started with a negroni $18 and a Moscow mule $14 I guess avg cocktail prices . We ordered the braised beef sliders , ahi tuna poke nachos and salad wraps with a side of fries and gravy . When did a side of fries cost $9 . The food not the greatest I spent the entire night chugging water because everything was so salty . The tacos were terrible. Basically it was a huge chunk of beef without any toppings. It could have been pulled maybe with a coleslaw or something. The tuna nachos lacked major flavour and it was difficult to eat nothing stayed on the nacho . The tuna was missing like a citrus soy dressing or something and the last the salad wraps again were basic with a tiny little side of pickled carrot to garnish.  Overall I gave the food 2/5 and everything was great . The cocktails were awesome and so was the vibe!

Food is average but the service I had at the bar today was amazing. The bao was a bit dry. Try steaming it next time. 

Katie took care of us and she was attentive despite the bar being rammed. Great bubbly attitude, made a great old fashioned. What a difference service makes in your experience. I'm coming back just to see her.

Amazing and massive place, with many huge TVs inside playing hockey, basketball and all sorts of stuff. When we went, it seems to be a pool tournament and it was crowded but it looked like it regularly happens at the bar. Everyone looked like they were having a great time.

There are many tables for you to eat, and the pool tables were super nice and new. The service was also fast, and the servers are very friendly and often check-up on you. The food was also pretty good and for decent price. Great place to hang out in Scarborough!

It was my first time here at Joey's for a birthday gathering. Please note, that if you want to reserve a table for more than 10 people, you have to contact the events coordinator via email or phone. Which I thought was a hassle because I was there in person to make the reservation, but had to go back home to contact them. 

Other than that, the atmosphere, space and service was good and friendly! Our server was very accommodating for our large group and they provided the molten lava cakes on the house just for the one time occasion. My friends enjoyed their dishes, however my dish was quite small for the price ($30.50 + tax + 18% tip = $40.67). I ordered their steak and truffle lobster shrimp ravioli and the portion came out smaller than expected. Even though I quite enjoyed the ravioli, my steak pieces were a bit dry. Probably wouldn't order that dish again next time because it was definitely not worth $40...The prime sirloin dish with crispy potato and asparagus did taste better for the same price though!

I came here for the first time on a Saturday night for a friend's birthday dinner. We were a group of 17 people and were seated in the upstairs lounge area around 8 pm. Around this time it wasn't too busy but it did start to fill up around 9:45/10pm

I've heard a lot of good things about this place but I was a little concerned about the limited menu. I ordered the Raspberry Lemonade, which was just okkkk. It was essentially Sourpuss layered with ice and lemonade. There weren't too many cocktail options, but there was the standard Beer & Wine List with maybe a few interesting cocktails. 

When it came to food, I was really disappointed in the selection and quality of food. I split two apps with 2 friends and we were all pretty disappointed in what we got. 

We ordered the Spinach & Artichoke Dip & The Vegetarian Nachos Platter . The Spinach & Artichoke Dip tasted so much like broccoli that is was difficult to find any spinach or artichoke taste in it at all. The Vegetarian Nachos was simply a platter of tortilla chips drenched in half melted cheese with franks hot sauce on top. There wasn't a single vegetable like onions or tomatoes as a topping.  It did come with a little side tray of sour creme, pico de gallo and guacamole, and sadly those were the best part of the meal. 

Safe to say, I have definitely experienced better food and drinks elsewhere, and honestly really doubtful I will come back here. There was honestly nothing unique or exciting that stood out here, and the lack of variety in the food and drink menus really created for a below average experience.
Great place to go and play pool, several tables, good atmosphere, affordable, and nearby, could not ask for any better

We were seated right away on a late Wednesday evening in a comfy booth with a view of their expansive bar and massive TV collection. As far as ambiance goes, 5 stars! This was the first time my toddler had been in a sports bar/restaurant and it's going to be hard to follow up to this one.
Our waiter was nice but either inexperienced or overwhelmed.  He forgot my husband's drink order and never came back for water refills. My husband loved his burger and fries.  My son and I split the brisket mac and cheese.  It was a major disappointment, tasted like the boxed stuff with chunks of sugary canned meat on top. Both my son and I took a couple bites and were done. The accompanying corn bread was delicious, would have preferred to have a plate of corn bread instead.
Prices are high, but that's expected for the location.  I would recommend this place for a drink.

Wow, wonderful atmosphere and really friendly staff. Our server Patrick was one of the most genuine staff we have encountered. My miso salmon dish was so delicious and my son's brisket sandwich was tender and tasty. We will be back soon!!

Please give them your business. This truly is a hidden gem I fear will close due to lack of business. Staff are very friendly and the food was amazing!! Burgers, salads and chicken are better than most pub grub and totally affordable!!! I have seen this location change hands three times over the years. This is the best of the three. Don't let is change a fourth time!!!

Their website says they open at 11am so I traveled there and it was closed, however the sign on the door said they open at noon. So I came back at noon. The place was closed again, I looked inside - the establishment was completely dark with no one inside. Not sure if they're out of business, or just open when they feel like opening without caring about customer traveling to the location for nothing.

I live near Ann Arbor, so I know when I'm being snubbed, thank you.  I get  the snoot on a regular basis, but that doesn't mean I've grown to like it.  We stopped in mid-week to get dinner & drinks while enjoying a hockey game, even though the Leafs were down in Nashville that night.  We were abruptly informed upstairs that there was "an event" that evening, and we'd need to go downstairs.  Downstairs we got a worse cold fish swoon, with an aloof gesture to where the non-event participants might find service.  While trying to fully decipher her gesticulation, I became less and less enamored with the idea of giving such people my business, and used my smart phone to find another choice.  The Fox is out the door and over a block.  See my review, but suffice it to say, that's a REAL sports bar, and the one with that moniker thinks its a 5-star restaurant.  No, it's a place that's way too full of itself for me, even without "an event".  Real Sports Bar is poorly named.  I can't recommend such a place when there are better choices so nearby.

This is not quite an update, because it is a review of their delivery service on DoorDash, so not dine-in.

The delivery is not too slow within an hour. And the food arrived hot enough, not piping hot, but hot enough. We ordered the rotisserie chicken. It was super delicious. The skin was so flavourful and well-seasoned. And the meat was nice, tender, and juicy whether it was dark or white meat. It was way better than Swiss Chalet's or supermarket chicken. And the mash was quite nice with the gravy. And there are some asparagus, but the asparagus is quite greasy, but okay I guess.

Overall, I'd recommend getting the chicken if you order from them.
Near our Airbnb. Great pizza. Drinks were good. Gina was fabulous. Very pleasant. And attentive.

I think my 5 star rating is coming more from surprise than anything. I've been a chef for many years and rarely come across a place that smacks me in the face like this one. 
Service was very attentive even though it was busy - I was never without a drink. 
I randomly decided to get a brisket plate at nearly 10pm. I anticipated a very dry mound of beef with stale fries and horseradish mayo. 
What I got was the most succulent, perfectly fatty, perfectly sliced smoked brisket with fries that couldn't have been cooked better.
I'm at home 2 hours later still thinking about how perfect the entire experience was. 
I'm at such a loss for words. 
This may well be the best food destination in the beach. 
I'm literally wowed. I applaud the staff at breakwall for creating such a sick vibe. 
I will definitely spread the word.

We had a corporate event in the Game room.  The event went off great.  The staff could not have been more accommodating, responsive and helpful.  The room was spacious and everyone had a great time.  The food was also very good.  I would definitely return if I had another event in the area.

Went there for lunch today. Ordered the California chicken sandwich. Doesn't look like much but sure was yummy - I'd give it 4 stars. Spicy mayo gave it a nice, flavourful kick.

But 18.50 for a sandwich. Add a cranberry juice, tax and tip and it's $29. Really? 30 bucks for a sandwich?? Maybe happy hour there is more my speed...

Almost dead in here for lunch on a Wednesday.  The service was very good and the reason for scoring a high of two stars.  

The food was mediocre to terrible.   

The smoked brisket sandwich was awful.  Why bother smoking meat when you smother it in a heavy oily dark fat sauce.   Could not taste anything but fat.  Why not in a slightly covered BBQ sauce?  The horseradish sauce made the sandwich better but it looked like thick mayonnaise and no one told me what it was until later.  The coleslaw needed to rest longer.  Not a lot of flavour.   French fries were pretty good.  

Was told the ribs were good.  Not too saucy.  BBQ sauce was on the side but no choices of spice level.  Ribs were fall off the bone but not enough smoke flavour in the meat.  

Coffee was as bad as the waitress said it would be.  Probably the worst in Toronto.  But I needed something to wash off my tongue because of the fatty sandwich.  

If you are looking for a good Bbq smokehouse Restaurant then this is not the place.  Definitely the worst BBQ restaurant in Toronto.

I got the fried Korean chicken rice bowl with cabbage coleslaw, kimchi, and miso sauce.
