The bowl was pretty filling and although a bit overpriced (understandable), it was hot, nicely prepared, and delicious! I also got the watermelon drink which didn't have an overpowering amount of alcohol. It was nicely refreshing. A tip is to come here during happy hour for cheaper appetizers and drinks!

Service was slow and indifferent. Beer selection was vanilla..large..but nothing but the typical large scale brewery options. Screens were great. Didnt try the food. But for the service alone the place is over priced at over 10bucks for a pint of industry beer

This place has best wings in Toronto!!! They are smoked to perfection!! The sauce is terrific and the atmosphere is awesome!!! If you ever visit Canada you absolutely have to come to Breakwall BBQ smokehouse!!! The owner was amazing!!!! I love love loved it!!!!!!!

Went for an early dinner on a Saturday while in town for the weekend.  Sat on the patio.  Service was excellent, we had 2 friendly and attentive servers.  The atmosphere was awesome, we got the openness of being outside without feeling like you're right on the street.  The food was very good, got sushi cones, burgers, lettuce wraps, and flatbread.  Best part was it was all on the happy hour menu.  Couldn't ask for a better experience!!

We came here for the late night specials which are from 9pm-close. The drinks were unexpectedly cheap here as we were able to have a fun time with friends, at a generally upscale restaurant, for an affordable price. We all left feeling tipsy without breaking the bank. Definitely would recommend coming here to have a good time or go on a date! 
P.s my favourite was the peach Bellini

Although I'm not a huge fan of their menu, this place gets 5 stars b/c the service was fantastic, the huge location is spot on, and the free popcorn!  lol

I came here with a friend for a late lunch and we ate upstairs.  Even though it was busy and there was only 2 of us, they let us have a big booth.  Like I said, I don't care for that many things on their menu, but that's just my personal preference.  We ended up sharing the lettuce wraps and they were okay.  

We had shared a bottle of wine, and when I was in the bathroom my friend had ordered a second for us.  It was open by the time I got to the table.  I had to pick up my car from the shop later and couldn't share the second bottle, so the server said it was no problem and was going to refund the bottle even though it was already open!  I ended up calling the car shop and said I could pick my car up the next day.  (No way I was going to drink and drive!).  It ended up working out and we kept the bottle, but I was shocked at how accommodating the server was! 

As lunch ended everyone cleared from the upstairs.  The server let us stay up there, but we told them we could move downstairs if that was more convenient.  Even though they insisted it was fine, we ended up moving downstairs to a booth near the window.  

Downstairs the service was just as great and we ordered some more wine and apps.  They also kept bringing us popcorn too - one of my fave new trends (popcorn as the free bar snack instead of peanuts).

This place was awesome! 

Food was great service was on point! 

I had to come back to get another burger for lunch the next day, since we are working across the street at the arena! 

The only suggestion is, allow people to place orders on the phone so they can come in and just pick it up. Some people work on the go lifestyles and just have time to grab and go. 

Second is the phone system is so confusing, it was hard just to get in touch with someone at the location. But when I walked over there was three people standing in the front with no one there, just chatting with each other. 

But the food was great and table service was fantastic!

Don't be a fool like me and be attracted by the "Wings & Beer Sports + Bar" sign ...

Just your average Tuesday night, going for a stroll in the neighbourhood and suddenly I was struck with excitement to try out this "new" place. Especially since the All Star MLB game was on...

I ordered boneless wings, maybe my first mistake. But they came with wedges and both were frozen for $17. I mean I wasn't expecting quality. But as a sports bar I expect better wings! Boneless or not. 

But $20 for Mill St. Organic pitcher made up for it ... kind of...

Approach wisely ... Unlike me.

This place is not at all what it was when it opened. We got reservations same day on a playoffs day, if that's any indication :)

The food was fine, but not very good when you consider the cost. A small plate of nachos without meat and add guacamole was 30 bucks before tax and tip etc. I know there's a premium when you're talking sporting events and venues, but it's a bit bananas considering there are other options in the area.

It's still a big space, pretty cool for the screens and viewing experience (especially if you're not attending the game) but the food/drink was a let down, especially if you went when it was brand new.
Friendly attentive service, fun place to be just before and while the hockey game next door  started. Sorry food was cold, ate it anyway and it was good. Plenty of food.

This place was packed, but I came with two friends and we wanted a calmer environment with nice music so we went to the other side that has less people. The Bartender was very responsive and friendly.


The finger food was amazing and the service was impeccable!
Regular fries absolutely disgusting! Burned and full of OLD oil. Couldn't eat. Pure t

Food here is very tasty. Our waitress had good reccomendations so I had the chicken parmasan it was spicy and so flavourful and my wife had steak and surf. The crispy springroll mashed potatoes are to die for. Service was excellent our waitress Alisha knew the menu inside out and was very accommodating. Expensive but overall great

I'm super happy with this business - we had a group of 7 ladies arrive without a reservation (unsure if you can make reservation) but they had seating for us.  

We were seated inside (which outside is optional) and provided with one amazing waitress - since there was so many of us then of course there was a ton of questions.  Luckily to say - our waitress was happy and willing to answer all our questions/concerns.  Orders were placed and orders were received - we had no issues.  She was even happy to box each person leftovers.  No liquors or beverages were purchased during our visit.

Only suggestion - Maybe have something out for people to snack on; nuts, crackers, and/or basket of bread.

PS - let your waiter/waitress know if you're using anything besides Canada currency so at least you're giving them a heads up.

Happy Eating!!!

Went back during happy hour. I ordered the California chicken sandwich again (13 bucks during happy hour) and I've decided that this is my favourite chicken sandwich. And gotta love that they have TWO happy hours: between 3-6pm and after 9pm.

I will take a conniption if they ever take that chicken sandwich off the happy hour menu.

I honestly love this place. After work drinks with friends, solo drinks at the bar, even my birthday dinner. The staff are always good to us. My group of friends and I have a favorite bartender there. Well experienced and great customer services.  Food is amazing, drinks are good.  Our number 1 anytime restaurant/bar

I come here all the time for the sushi and steak, 
Food is bit on the pricey side although the quality of food is great and they are one of the few restaurants I know that serve foods from all different backgrounds. 
Environment is great, restaurant is very big and has many seating areas. 
Wait time is quick, normally from 10-15 mins 20 at most on busy days. Service is always great and the staff is super friendly! 
It is great for coming in groups or even with a friend to grab a snack.

I know it's a chain BUT this one on King West is great for just an easy/ cheap and fun option when you either don't want to cook (every night) or want a little entertainment.

Whenever we've eaten the foods been very good for a sports bar, not just the wings but the wraps too!

Additionally with the beer specials it's a great sport for watching sport.

Service is always great too!

PS - The pool table is ALWAYS empty too so no waiting to assert your dominance.

Was visiting from the states ... The food was really good, LOVED their French fries I'm. HUGE french fríe person. It's an absolute MUST you try their signature Sangria. I ordered the shrimp lettuce wrap and my friends ordered the California Chicken... was pretty good as well... service was nice.
My fav spot for any family dinner. Everything on the menu is good you really can't go wrong. I love yam frites, wings,  chicken flatbreads. Drinks are a bit watery though.

This is the place to be during sporting events. Very good atmosphere and spacious, even though it was really crowded we still had room to move about. Food is good, nothing gourmet like but what you could expect from a sports bar. Service is right on! Even though it was busy our waitress Carly was very attentive. I would come here again when I am visiting the area.

I was impressed with Joey. Ordered off of Skip the Dishes on a Tuesday evening. I ordered the following:

- Sliders: Delicious. Soft slider buns, delicious patties and secret sauce. Similar to a McDonalds Cheeseburger in a good way
- Spicy Tuna Rolls: Excellent, fresh rolls, presented really well even in a delivery box and the sauce was great
- Half Rack of Ribs and Fries: The fries were super tasty and the ribs were nice and sticky
- Doughnut Holes: Delicious and light with great sauces

What impressed me most about Joey was the quality of delivery. They placed everything on card board paper boxes, that were clearly labeled. They kept sauces on the side. The presentation was terrific and there were ample sauces and cutlery and the food was appropriately hot. I will absolutely order from here in the future. Super eclectic menu and solid delivery!
The happy hour menus is great, the price is affordable. The waiter is kind and it is great for two ppl

We had a great lunch here two days ago. Relaxing time as we just arrived into the city and wanted to regroup. My husband and I throughly enjoyed the atmosphere, quality of food and fantastic service. This time we were out and lost and I saw this place and remembered they had a happy hour, oh lucky us. AGAIN GREAT SERVICE, Thank you Morgan,  FOOD AND ATMOSPHERE top notch!   great place

I had a really good chicken sandwich at Joe's, and what really impressed me was their great service. The waitress offered me an option to substitute the bacon with avocado. Yet I was so impressed by how kind she was, and the food was super great!

Definitely worth it!! :)

It's a dive bar.  Think Croc Rock without all the people.  The place was empty on a Fri night from 7 - 9pm.  Who knows, maybe the place gets live later in the evening.  But overall this place was a disappointment.  We got the Irish nachos to eat, and while the portion was good (enough to split between 4 ppl), it was lacking any quality toppings.  Would not ever plan to come back here.

Our first trip here in Toronto and we loved the food! We got the nachos. The place was huge and each booth had their own tv which was cool! And it wouldn't be a Canadian lunch without a tall glass of Molson!

Went to this place last night for the first time, I wouldn't say it was a great experience. The waitress recommended the Yellowfin Tuna but a couple minutes later, another person (probably the manager) came to told me they didn't have it anymore so I had to choose something else. When I asked his recommendation, he told me to order the Japanese Sushi + Seared Salmon Sushi but unfortunately the food wasn't great... The salad was way too salty, only the sushi were good. When I told him about this issue, he told me he was going to check in the kitchen what happened to see and let me know etc but he never came back to my table and seemed to avoid it, which is very unprofessional for customer service in a well-known restaurant. I also ordered a passionfruit/orange lemonade which wasn't tasty, and I really love passionfruit. This place looks great, the waitress was very nice/polite but regarding the food and the customer service provided at the end, I wouldn't go back... Reading the other reviews make me believe it was just a bad day but my overall experience there wasn't great.

People on diet and no count for calories.  Raspberry lime. Don't take like raspberry drink more like blueberry... after taste  na taste good for spinach dip. The temp sect North Pole. Flys In the place. Place dark. Sweet potato fries tastes like sweet n low fries.  No nuts. Bread hard.  New menu has problems. Birthday cake no knife?????......more to come

This was an amazing bar to eat and enjoy the game . My husband and I found them on Yelp. My husband had the smoked then friend chicken which was $29 and in his words it was worth every penny. It came with a side , mixed portions of chicken , seasoned fries , and something like cornbread . I almost had to carry him out once we were done with out meal. We also had their Cajun wings which were $17 for only 6 wings but they were pretty amazing as well!

Came here to watch the game tonight, we made a reservation so we were quickly seated. The restaurant is quite big and spacious. There's lots of tvs here all around the restaurant and even a tv at each booth, which is pretty awesome! The bar is conveniently located right by Maple Leaf square and the Scotia bank area so the atmosphere of the bar is fun and energetic! We also saw them setting up for live band/music, and they were waiting for the game to finish to start playing (but I didn't stay for that). 

The food was average, nothing special but also a bit pricier for your typical bar food (salads, burgers, wings, nachos, etc). 

The service was also average, I wouldn't consider tonight super busy, especially the section we were in. But our server didn't rly seem to be around much after we ordered and got our food. It wasn't until we wanted the bill did we see him again. He didn't quality check on our food, and we also had to flag him down for water refills. Our glasses were empty for a long time. Nor did he ask if we wanted another drink. But the hostesses were very friendly, prompt and welcoming.

Overall, it's a good spot to watch sport games with friends if you're unable to attend the actual game.

1 star for being an utter fraud!

Me and my girlfriend passed on our way home to watch the MLB All Star game, naturally at the sight of a bar simply named for Wings & Beer (with 66 flavours) we saw this as an opportunity to waste money and watch the game instead lol.

Well we did, it's not that the bar is bad but that it's named wings and beer and yet the boneless wings we ordered were FROZEN CHICKEN DIPPERS (I kid you not) these were literally nothing different to what you could buy in NO FRILLS and the fries were sadly the same.

An absolute joke, when you have competition from a decent chain like Wild Wing and many others you have to stand out for good value and better product but sadly this place has no place.

PS - The bartender wouldn't stop staring at my girlfriend which was kind of awkward.

PPS - We wanted to leave so bad I missed Mookie batting, boooooo!

I came on a game night and it was packed. My 3 vodka sodas must've been watered down, but who knows. The rib tips were delicious and I liked the fries that came with it. It's a decent sports bar with a decent vibe. I do like that there are two bar areas. I mean, I love Toronto and the people are always so nice here. I'd come again.

Excellent place. They have a large slection of drinks to choose from, including beers, wines, and cocktails. I've been on vacation in Toronto for the past week and the food was probably some of the best I've had here. Service was good too, and there are TV's everywhere. 5/5, would recommend

First of all, our server was incredible. We stopped in for a pre-dinner happy hour drink and a taste of their small plate menu. The happy hour menu was broad and included a nice mix of beer, wine and cocktails. I had a glass of the house Malbec and my friend had the the spicy passion fruit margarita. Both were really good. We had dinner reservations for later this evening, but we were both starving, so we sampled some of their small plates. We settled on the pesto shrimp flatbread and the sushi cone. Both were delish. Overall a great visit and again, our server was wonderful!

Perfect spot to get a cold beer and a Korean Power Bowl while watcing the game. The service was spot on despite the hectic environment during the Raptor's game. I'm frequently in the area and will definitely visit again.

I'm a little on the fence between a 3 and a 4 for a rating.  The location is fantastic - you're close to everything, and it's a great meeting place for friends, especially if you're coming in from out of town.

The place is quite large, and offers happy hour specials.  My two friends and I had wandered around Toronto for a little while and decided to get drinks and catch up getting out of the chilly Northern air.

We were still in time for happy hour, so we ordered drink specials (Sangria, white wine, etc).  And we decided to get a few apps as well.  Seated upstairs at a high table, we didn't have to wait.  The stools were tall and wide and very comfortable. Our server was pleasant and attentive, but not too much. 

The ambiance was nice, and upstairs was a little more intimate in my opinion than down stairs.  Noise level wasn't too much of a problem, I felt I could hear my friends easily, despite how crowded it got by the time we left.  

The big joke here, is how far it is to get to the restrooms.  Even the establishment itself has funny signage on the walls as you make your way down to the third basement (or something equivalent).  And from sitting upstairs to the location of the basement, it is quiet a journey.  No lie.

I can't say that there was anything particularly stellar about JOEY, but it is a place with decent drinks and food that will satisfy.
One thing I didn't particularly like was the whole big brother creeper feel I got afterwards.  A day or two later I got an email from JOEY asking about my experience.  I may have checked in on Yelp, but I've never had an email like this before.  And I paid in cash so it wasn't like I had given them my information.  I'm sure it's Google, and I don't love that JOEY uses them for things like that... but I guess that's the world we live in now, and if you don't turn off location services on your phone... well... then...

This place is a fairly decent and chill spot for late night pool and beer. The place is very big and food/drink is decently priced.

Open late nights even on weekdays. When you come here you don't have to play pool either, there are tables and spots at the bar to sit and enjoy some food with friends.

The music they play on average are top 40 hits, though you'll hear some classic rock from time to time.

They also have darts

Came here on a Saturday night to bowl. Got the lane right away, but once there, no waiter came, for about 30 minutes. We went up to the bar to order drinks and food and were told to wait for our server. Who never came. We had to go to the bar four times before someone came. 
We were also on lane 10, which felt like the ugly stepchild to the other lanes. 
It was un-airconditioned, in the middle of summer. And it felt ignored by the staff entirely. At the exorbitant prices I would never come back.

This place was good. I've definitely had better tasting food however it was good. 

They have an extensive menu with a variety of options, so whatever you're in the mood for, Joey's have a dish for you. The restaurant was very clean and the servers were friendly.

We love this place so much! It has become our new go-to spot. Everything on the menu is delicious and never disappoints. Staff is so welcoming and attentive. We tell everyone in the area to try it out.

Visited April 21, 2019 for lunch. 
I don't remember if I've ever been to a South St Burger. It was fairly pleasant experience, but the value was not there. $21 for 2 combo burger, fries and drink. 

Pros
Customize every single topping, would prefer if this can be done on a sheet of paper. The server would need to wait as we thought about each topping and sauce. 
Whole wheat burger available. 

Cons 
A bit pricey for what you get, similar pricing to McDonalds and you could argue their food is just as good if not better. McDonalds is almost certainly faster. 
I don't red meat so I tried the veggie burger, and it did not taste that good. Looking forward to trying a Beyond Meat burger at A + W and Tim Hortens lol.

Damage - $21 after tax, pre-tip.

This place is great! We were able to reserve a table at 5pm during the NBA playoffs for the night of! Super clutch. This was one of the only locations still available to do that. And for those that weren't able to reserve, they had plenty of standing room available for the fans. Our server was Emily, ask for her, she is the best!!! The place was full and lit and she was just bouncing around and making sure all her tables were served. Also the food was good. We had the Irish nachos, and lots of pitchers and shots. Again, can't say enough good things about this place! They have darts, skeeball, shot-skis, photobooths, plenty of tvs, good vibes all around. Highly recommended.
Telling us they were closed on the same day they reopened. It was a client that suggested it, if you like deep friied everything including a waitress go in here
Un très bon restaurant bien qu'il soit légèrement bruyant, les serveurs sont très agréables sans parler du merveilleux fondant au chocolat, je recommande fortement!

Food was great, but was disappointed when another waitress not serving us brought us a refill on our ice tea without us asking for it. Since we are tourists visiting from California we thought the refill was free like it is in California. When our waitress brought us our bill, she distracted us by asking us questions about our visit, so we didn't notice we were charged $17 for 4 ice tea drinks! Beware, I believe this was done on purpose because we are not from Canada. The first waitress asked us where we were from, so she knew we were from California.  We were taken advantage of!!

Very disappointed in them doing this to us, we will not go back there!

I got the torched salmon sushi with Japanese salad. There were tempura bits added that were missing from the picture and DoorDash description. I have an autoimmune response to the gliadin in wheat.  There was also mayo on it. The dressing was extremely salty.  The pieces of salmon were 3-5 mm thin! I have never gotten such a thin piece of fish in sushi before. It cost over $20 for the one fish and though the fish was good quality, there was hardly any of it. 

Overpriced for what tiny, ill-described bits of food you receive. The salad was nice, but dressing can't be so salty. 

Won't order again until food is properly described and an adequate amount of fish is provided.

It's a good place if you're just looking to grab a quick beer or two either by yourself or with company.  

Everything else, from the service to the ambiance to the food is mediocre at best.  Waitresses basically ignore you until your arms get tired flagging them down, and then act as though they're doing you a favour by bringing by whatever you ordered and slapping it down on the table before scurrying off to chat with their co-waitress.  The ONLY time they appear lickety-split and with a smile is when they are picking up the bill, bringing you the change, and then not-so-subtly watching you like a hawk until you leave so they can swing by your table and grab their tip.

I stopped leaving a tip the 3rd time I visited.  The 4th time, I smartened up and just stopped coming by altogether.

I'll admit that the wings are pretty good, although the value is lacking as you'll end up paying over $2 per wing.
And if you want to order 2 pounds and want 2 different flavours, they will  charge you the rate of 1 pound twice, instead of giving you the 2 pound price with a sauce fee. 

We ended up ordering 3 pounds of wings (which come with a max of 2 flavours), and there were 18 wings. They came with fries (decent, nothing special) and a few carrots/celery on the side.
When we ordered an additional pound, it came with 7 wings and fries, which makes me wonder why they are cheaping out on the volume orders that only had 6 per pound.

They have a lot of sauce options to choose from, but the spice levels are very tame .The "medium" maple barbecue flavour was very mild and even one of the hotter options (hot & dill) was lacking in spice.

There are lots of tvs, and once the Raptors game came on they did turn the sound on, so it has that going for it.

In the end, $65 after tax and tip got 4 pounds of wings and 1 beer which leaves me hard pressed to give more than 3 stars.

This is probably one of my favourite restaurant when I am in Toronto. The food is excellent, I have tried almost everything on the menu I am 100% confident to say there food is very and it shows they care for that price they are charging, it's not cheap by any means but if your willing to lash out 80$ for 2 people and be satisfied, it's well worth it. Best dishes to try is there signature burgers, steak is phenomenal, salmon and there pita hummus appetizer. one thing I do gotta say there service and staff is better than anywhere else's I been to, they make you feel like your at home and don't rush when you for something you will get your stuff right away

My friend and I came for happy hour at 3:30 pm and the restaurant was about a third full. The service was amazing. Everyone who we interacted with was super nice and made some small talk. They were very helpful and asked a couple times if we needed anything else and replenished water frequently. 

We ordered the real peach bellini ($4.50) and yam fries ($4) which came with an amazing chipotle aoli. I will definitely come back to Joeys for happy hour as they have a number of drink options and appetizer/meals on the happy hour menu as well.

The happy hour here is amazing. Cheap drinks and cheap foods too from 3-6p and 9-closing (which can be 1/2am depending on the day!). The deals are amazing and I loved the bellinis.

The waitress was amazing and tended to our ever need. She had amazing timing and came just when we were up for another round (sometimes earlier too!). Many thanks to her for chatting with us and making our experience amazing.

The interior is gorgeous and very roomy. The windows are like garage doors and can be opened letting in fresh air on a hot day. The place is very modern with a dark theme.

The washrooms were interesting as they were a long way down (towards private dining rooms) but had fun signs along the way to guide you.

I will definitely be back for the happy hours. Where else can I find $4.50 bellinis!

Joeys chain restaurant always provides decent food at its price. It's one of the good bar restraunts in the country. 

The few dishes I really like here is their special shrimp/chicken pizza, the lobster sandwich (so yummy and cheesy) and their spinach dip is the best ever.

I was unhappy with my experience. Came with my family for dinner. 4 of us arrived and 2 were running late and joined later on. I'm not sure if this factored into it but our server didn't touch our table for a good 20 minutes (maybe more) for food or drinks or anything and we were ready to order. At no point did we say we were waiting on the others either so that shouldn't have even been an assumption. The food came fast but in general the server barely checked in if we needed anything and at one point I wanted to put another order in but by the time she finally came back we were ready to leave. I work at a restaurant and dine out pretty regularly and can honestly say this was the slowest experience I've had. On top of that my meal was subpar and I found the portion size to be quite small compared to other chains that are comparable eg Cactus or Earls. I don't plan to return here and wouldn't recommend.

I would give this a zero star review if I could. The one star would go to the hostesses who found a table for me. I sat at the bar during happy hour and was ignored for one 20 minutes when the staff wasn't that busy. They were chatting and cleaning glassware but didn't seem aware of their patrons. I left with no service.

It's exactly what it should be! Kind staff, clean and fast, but they never rush you. If you want something obscure on the TVs, the got you. Reservation process is easy and the food is delicious. Their chicken tenders with the mild sauce (which is just BBQ) are AMAZING. The day after the Raptors won, the staff was still kind and quick even though the night before was probably insane.

Huge pool hall. I went on a Friday night and there was a big party occupying the center area.

Nice and neat with good tables. The food was half decent and good beer list.
Pretty nice vibe and cheap beer! Would definitely return. Good for watching the game too

Renovation looks average.

Food quality is HORRIBLE!

They clearly think the food doesn't matter because of the location and big screen atmosphere.

I won't go back.

Went on a weeknight around 6:30. Sat upstairs on the patio. We asked the 5 wait staff standing around the bar if we could sit and they said sure. We sat there for almost fifteen minutes until someone asked if we had been served yet. We said no and he brought us menus. He made sure to confirm we were not his table but he would get us menus anyway. We watched two other waiters help tables who had seated after us, and bring order to other tables but not serve us. After probably almost a half hour after sitting down, now starting to run late for the plans that put us there for a drink anyway, they came and asked for a drink order. We order a drink each and nachos to go. The drinks, made by the same wait staff, took nearly ten minutes themselves to come out- and they were gin and sodas. Overall unimpressed by the attitude of the waitstaff on the patio and their general displeasure of being asked to simply do their jobs. Will not be returning on this alone. Nachos were decent and luckily the drink was strong.

Great sports bar. Open and lots of space. I would recommend the brisket, very good. 

Service was a bit slow but not nothing too bad

This was an excellent restaurant! I loved the patio area. Victoria and Hannah were really nice. The ambience is amazing. Happy hour was great.  The peach Bellini was very delicious.  I had a couple of them. The sliders were great.  Our food took a while to come so Victoria brought out some popcorn with truffle butter that was so good, we took what we didn't eat with us to go. The music was on point, very good selection with a variety of  genres.  I will definitely return.

I give 2 stars because of the food.
This is definitely bad and too expensive. 
Here pictures of a $40 meal after 1 bite. Tasteless, fat and greasy.
Customers should eat good food while watching a game, being a " sport bar " is not an excuse for mediocre food.

TVs EVERYWHERE! Even if you didn't want to watch the game, you literally can't help it.

Decent food, lots to choose from. I had the Calamari and Buffalo Chicken Poutine. Both were tasty! 

They offer an large drink menu. There's lots of beer(a little local craft beer), beer cocktails, mocktails and even a lil bubbly.

Pretty good service too!

With the bar packed with raptor fans and every table full we had a great experience last night at joey's . Our server always made sure we had beer and food. We never had to call her over once . I believe her name was Brit she had lots of tattoos . Great attitude

This was an amazing experience!! Our waiter Kevin was AMAZING!!! He was very friendly, and attentive. We came in to watch a Leafs game and get some good food. They're drinks were delicious as the burgers were divine! The atmosphere was great, lots of friendly people!! 
If you're looking for a good time, good service and yummy food/drink, head to Real Sports Bar and Grill!!

This place is amazing! My first time coming here and it has such a welcoming atmosphere. The interior design is really great and the hostesses are very friendly! The 6oz BBQ burger filled me up and was really well made! 

Looking forward to coming back here!
Brilliant place for happy hour and glosdd of fun games like skeeball, pool, darts and ping pong. All free of charger! Fun experience

Yesterday I made my 1st visit to Dublin Calling with a friend in order to partake in their M-F 3 - 6 pm $3.50 pint of Guinness deal.  We arrived shortly after 5:30 pm at which time it was fairly barren inside the venue despite it being Fri. and a great day weather-wise.  By about 6 pm considerably more people had arrived and it was packed by the time we left around 6:30.  Despite the increasingly crowded conditions, we had pretty prompt service (we were seated at a booth by the window) and our server was quite friendly too.  The venue not surprisingly has a pretty strong Irish theme in their colour scheme/décor and there is a separate darts room, pool tables and other games in a raised section and big screen TVs for watching sports and news, etc. throughout.

As the venue is pretty close to where I work I'll doubtless be making a return visit(s) to indulge in their really great Guinness deal.  Neither my friend nor I ordered anything to eat during our visit but we did check their menu fairly thoroughly and they offer a broad range of typical pub food.  My friend and I noted that as is increasingly typical of restaurants/bars, they have somewhat higher food prices to pay for their drinks deals, but being in a central Downtown location is also a factor in their food prices.  If you like Guinness (a very healthy beer) I recommend stopping by when their deal for this beer is offered if you're in the area.

First time at this JOEY!  Showed up for lunch to meet with a past work friend and man I loved it. 

We had seats in a booth by the window in their separate glass enclosed sun-ish room. Really nice digs all around. The place is modern yet still retains a roomy feel (getting rarer downtown) and does not take on that cold aesthetic that some modern places do. 

Service was prompt, accurate and helpful. They did take my allergies seriously and that was very appreciated. From a staff perspective, the people seemed to actually enjoy working there which is always great to see. 

For lunch my friend had a salad with chicken and really liked it. It did look fairly nice. I did not try it as we are not that close. Lol. As for me, I had one of the best sandwiches I have had in a long time. It was a tuna club sandwich and I adorned the plate with delicious fries. 

The sandwich had just the right amount of varying texture, perfect amount of sauce and flavours that worked perfectly together. Oh and the bun squished just the right amount to help make eating it both enjoyable and delicious. 

Roughly $20/person without booze. 

Will I come back again?  If in the area again then I will do my best. 

Apologies for no pictures as mentioned above, not THAT close.

My favourite place in the city for delicious drinks and amazing food. Their veggie burger is THE BEST veggie burger I have ever had. The place is always busy and located in a very convenient spot downtown.
While we had a long wait as it was a Friday night, the staff took orders for drinks in the waiting area, which was great. They also passed around appetizers which was amazing!
Once seated, our waiter Jacob was so nice and patient. He answered all our questions and was super nice!
Food here never disappoints. We ordered a couple for appetizers, which were great. The Tandoori chicken flatbread is my favourite. They also allow you to substitute the meat for a vegetarian option, which is amazing!
All our mains were perfect and delicious. Our wine was also quite tasty and refreshing. Absolutely love the place, service and food and will continue to go there.

AWESOME PLACE! Sleek decor, clean restaurant and GREAT customer service! Our server was Mya, and she was INCREDIBLE! We walked in after spending some time shopping and wanted to take advantage of their happy hour. Mya has such a good energy, she was friendly, exceptionally PROFESSIONAL and gave great menu recommendations. We shared the lettuce wraps which were so delicious. Crispy chicken tossed in a delicious Asian inspired sauce, perfect amount of lettuce wraps for the amount of filling. We each got the burgers which were also so yummy! We had such a good time with Mya, she gave us some tips about where to find things around town. We laughed, we drank, we ate, it was such a good time! I wanna be friends with Mya lol! And to top it all off she brought us out a complimentary dessert! 10 out of 10! Will definitely visit again!

I've never been to Joey's before and decided to come to this downtown location to celebrate my anniversary. 

The inside of this restaurant is bigger than I expected. We came around 9pm on a Sunday, no reservation, but we were seated immediately. I love the vibe here, the lights were dimmed and we were seated at a nice booth near the kitchen, however it wasn't too loud like most tables near the kitchen are. 

*For appetizers, we ordered:

House Salad - $9. This was decent, it was a little small for the price and could've used more salad dressing as it was a bit dry but it was still something nice to munch on as a starter.

Mushroom Soup - $9. My boyfriend said this soup was very good. It was rich and creamy and had chunks of mushrooms. 

Calamari Fritti $16.25. THIS WAS AMAZING! The calamari was so meaty, there wasn't too much batter, and they even gave a few stalks of deep fried asparagus which was really yummy too. 

*For main courses, we ordered:

Herb Crush Salmon - $30.25. This was very good. The salmon was cooked perfectly, and came with lemon butter sauce, crispy mashed potatoes and asparagus. Joey's crispy mashed potatoes may be the best mashed potatoes I've ever tried, and my new favourite. I highly recommend this dish. 

Rotisserie Chicken + BBQ Ribs - $32.25. My boyfriend said this dish was very good as well. The chicken and ribs were meaty and saucy. It also comes with asparagus, and he substituted the fries for crispy mashed potatoes. 

The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because the washrooms were disgusting. They don't have separate washrooms for men and women, they only have 3-4 individual washrooms that are shared by everyone. There were puddles around the toilet, the toilet seat was a mess and there was no toilet paper. I walked right out. 

Overall the service here is great and the food is really good. I definitely recommend coming here. I just wish they did a better job at keeping the washrooms clean.

Joey has changed over the years.  Servers/Bartenders talk more with each other than patrons (in contrast with say, Moxies where they socialize you).  No more Ahi Tuna Tacos, 14oz Pints, Every place has happy hours so I guess this is premium fare for prepubescent food and foamy drinks which is not cool when you are 20-30s and pay premium for good quality and times.  I'll try something else next time...
Great food, and healthy options available. The place is just a tad bit too loud.
Great place to watch the game. Great place for sports. Lots of tvs. Great staff and great wings.

Their calamari was really good. They even deep fried their peppers. It came with two different sauces. 

Do not order any of their pastas. There was one commonality between the pastas we ordered and they were too oily. If you want something that is healthier, do not order their pastas.

Their salads were typical salads with lots of variety. With our burgers, we ordered yam fries and they were fried really well. It was crispy and not oily at all. They were better tasting than their regular potato fries.  

Their NY cheesecake was really good. I highly recommend it. 

The space was very spacious and we brought 14 people and they were able to accommodate us.  We were disappointed that they did not have ping pong during the weekends -- only billiards. The billiards were about $13/hour and they have many tables.

An amazing venue with a great vibe. The staff goes out of their way to make sure that everyone has an incredible time and are extremely kind. If you're looking for a place to dance, eat, and hang out in a large and well-kept venue then this is it!

I was in town for a convention and loved the menu so ate here two times.  Both times were delicious!  Ordered the Pesto Shrimp Flatbread both nights.  The Bombay Butter chicken and Rotisserie chicken were both super flavorful.  Make sure to save a little room for the warm Italian Donuts for dessert.

Location was great! I loved the restaurant ambience itself. My friends and I had a great time during his birthday but there was something about the food that we didn't quite enjoyed as we should have. It was good though, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't great. I definitely would give it a second try and make an updated review once I do.

The service was great. It was a big party and the server was very patient with us. She was very attentive, always came and checked on us. It was just incredible. 

Definitely would come back.

You know why this place is the best sports bar in the world? Because of the staff. They're wonderful, and so friendly. This place is very spacious and also wheelchair and disability accessible. Like you're at the game. Makes me feel young again.

Went for a quick dinner before a concert. Everything was good and what I expected from a pub.
It was a Thursday so we had the drink special ($5 margaritas which were awesome!). They only have the original lime flavour but it's very good. 
I ordered the normal burger but with a veggie patty and was a little disappointed. The patty was very mushy. It said it came with pickle chips which is listed under appetizers as deep fried pickle chips but I just got sad looking ends of pickle slices. It also may have been my mistake for not noticing, but there was a ton of mayo on the burger (both buns) which I hate. I was able to scrape it all off. 
I had a side salad which was nice (+$2). 
The chicken fingers were huge and definitely a good thing to order if you're hungry!
I'll return for the drink specials at the very least!!
Slooooowww service, like ttc, you wont see your server for an hour and then 3 of them show up. The food is sloppy and bland and certainly not what we expected! Theres much better in this area.

We've gone to JOEY Eaton Centre for two reasons: lunch and our wedding reception. Both were excellent experiences.

The restaurant staff were extremely friendly (especially Alex, who was our server) and personable. We felt very welcome, and the food was delicious. Other reviewers have said it, but there is a little something for everybody on the menu. My husband and I both had the tuna poke bowl when we were there, and we loved it. My grandma had the butter chicken option, which was apparently very spicy -- and just up her alley. Good drinks. Tasty food. Wonderful service. We will definitely be back to eat.

Next, and most importantly, our wedding reception. We (and all our guests) had an absolutely spectacular time at the private dining area downstairs. I booked our event about 6 months out, and Hailey (both of them) was so helpful and thorough in explaining how everything would work. She answered my million questions over email and made me feel totally comfortable -- especially given the fact I was initially booking from out of town and had never actually been to JOEY Eaton Centre before.

We felt like we were in excellent hands, and that stayed true for the duration of our wedding reception. Guests were greeted by the super friendly private dining staff -- who's names are blanking on me, but every single person I came into contact with that night was so awesome. We wanted a low-key, relaxed, mix and mingle type cocktail reception, and that's what we got.

And the food. THE FOOD. The cocktail reception menu was why we chose JOEY in the first place, and it did not disappoint. Guests were raving about the sushi, and my husband and I were especially in love with the tuna tacos. So sad those aren't an option on the actual restaurant's menu, because we would be there weekly.

The atmosphere was great all night long. We were even accommodated an extra hour after our end-time because most of the guests weren't ready to call it a night. The pricing was reasonable. The staff were amazing. We couldn't have asked for a better night.

On a personal note, everyone there was very accommodating for my post-concussion issues. I was given a little storage room away from the event to rest in when I needed it. Music was kept low and mellow. All our instructions for what my health needed were followed and then some.

All in all, a fabulous experience. We're so grateful to all the staff at JOEY Eaton Centre for making our reception a memorable and fun night.

Fun place to watch any sporting events. Lots of standing and sitting area. Wish they were organized better. My friends and I came here for game 5 and had to wait from 1 pm. We were second in line and didn't get seats, priority went to those with reservations. Wish they explained that part to us earlier. We were told until around 4 that we'll most likely have to stand. 

I got the vegan burger and it was amazing! I couldn't tell the difference between this and a non vegan burger. The patty was so compact and basically spitting out juices. It worked so well with the rest of the condiments. The fries were pretty basic, nothing to say.
This restaurant has a great vibe and something for everyone. My family liked it so much we dined there for dinner both days! The wings and ribs are AMAZING! Definitely worth the try!

Are you looking for somewhere to watch a game? This is the spot to go!!! We were in town for a long weekend and wanted to watch the NCAA basketball tournament. A few locals had recommended stopping by Real Sports Bar to watch. I would 100% head here for all games! 

They had a HUGe tv for people to watch the main game on. There were also a variety of smaller TVs with other games on as well. The wait staff was also amazing! The bar was super crowded, yet they were always present, and also checking on their tables to make sure we had everything we needed. 

The drinks were great! The food was typically bar food, but also very yummy! Again, if you want a fun atmosphere to watch a game, your only choice is to head to Real Sports Bar!

Had a voucher for Foodora and found this place to be highly rated. Did a pick-up order and noticed there were some recreation options at the establishment including darts, billiards, and some sort of arcade machine.

Tried their classic Dublin burger, fish and chips, shepherd bites, and a pound of wings.

Food in general is pretty good. Wings, however are excellent. The way they make it so that meat is juicy and the batter is soft and crunchy was quite delectable.

According to their website, they run daily/weekly game tournaments with $100 gift card rewards up for grabs. Might be interesting to check out.

For a late night venue to catch up with friends, this is a great spot.  Conveniently located off Dundas and Yonge, this is centrally located. The style of the restaurant is modern yet casual.  The staff was very friendly and greeted us at the door.  Our server was attentive and food didn't take long to come.  I had the Korean bbq boneless wings which was savory and spicy.  Also ordered a side of rosemary garlic fries.  My apologies for not recalling the drinks but they were strong and kept on coming.  Definitely a good time had by all.

It's a standard sports bar, I guess.  The bartender was nice but he couldn't answer our questions about some of the beers even though they were local to Toronto.  Bathrooms were a little sketchy, not terribly clean.  

We didn't eat here, just had a beverage and a restroom stop on our way.

Went Monday night. Special was $19 Prime Rib, or 1/2 price wings.

Food was pretty great. Service was also good.

Ordered the specials, and the price was phenomenal.

Horrible food and horrible service. This is my third time going and every time I go it gets worse. I went there today, it wasn't busy. Me and my friend waited 20 min for even someone to acknowledge us. Then when the food came the bun was stale, the cheese wasn't melted on the burger. I could go on and on but why bother. I will never go back.

I came here on Thursday night for an event with a large group. I had called several times prior, first calling to make a reservation where I was advised that I should be calling six weeks prior to reserve a lane. Then I called back and learned that no I could reserve a lane. At that point the girl on the phone told me as long as I come in about 45 minutes prior I will get my lane in time for my team.

I came in that day specifically about 50 minutes prior to the time I wanted to start bowling. I let the girl know, she wrote my name down and my cell number. I went out of my way to walk to the location and then walk back to where I was picking up the rest of my team. Once we arrived a different girl told us that no we would not be able to bowl as it was full at 6 pm. I was upset at this point as I had been told so many different things by different people, given wrong info so many times. The servers and hosts were not empathetic at all.

We went upstairs for some drinks and snacks, 6 pm arrives and I send my husband downstairs to check around 620, there were many open lanes. When I come down - the girl had crossed out our name. And I asked if we could bowl at that time and she flippantly replied oh ya I was coming to get you guys.

We start bowling and it takes us about 1 hour and 45 minutes to get through the game. The lane kept breaking down where we had to stop. In fact we were not even able to finish our game. The staff was very unprofessional - we had to flag down our server to get snacks halfway through the game. And there were times where they fixed the lane and never let us know that it was repaired and we would be able to bowl again. Keep in mind we had spent a large amount of money within the establishment and it seemed as though no one cared when we had all of these occurances that disrupted our night

Very disappointed and never coming back. I will not be recommending this to anyone for a night out or corporate event.
Poor service. Manager and owner refused my money and banned me from the bar. I work in social media for a big marketing company. Do not support this bar at all

I got the Crispy Tofu Bowl and loved it! Other people at my table got thE fish tacos, chicken sandwich, spaghetti, butter chicken and all loved it, except my one friend who got the steak and ravioli-- her portion was TINY! But it was still delicious! At the end they gave me a lava cake (it as my bday dinner!) and it was SO DELICIOUS! Only complaint is that we were seating right near the bar even though we made a reservation (from what I understood it was completely booked which I completely understand), and the LONNNNG walk to the washroom. Other than that, it was great!

I ordered with DoorDash thrice. I got my order the third time round. This was the worst experience I've had ever with a meal delivery service. 

My first order did not get delivered at all the first time. I had waited over 2 hours and it had still not been picked up even though there was a dasher at the location after about an hour and half. I couldn't wait anymore, and went to cancel it in the app. I was not at all compensated for this time.

My second order, the next day, did not get delivered at all either. I waited over an hour and half, and I contacted Joeys. They contacted DoorDash. Joeys told me that my order was getting picked up in 10 more minutes. It was picked up soon after. But the driver drove off to the opposite side of town, and half an hour later started driving towards my apartment. I thought I would get it soon. The driver arrived near my apartment on the map in my app, and then completed the order without delivering it to me. So I was out of food again. Thankfully, I received a refund again at least.

Joeys apologized. I gave them one last chance. I ordered again. I got my order an hour later that evening. I received my rotisserie chicken. I just order this one dish, and it was overcooked. The chicken was just very dry, chewy, and stringy. I suspect that the chicken was reheated.

These orders took place when there was a promotion with deliveries at Joeys on DoorDash, so take this review with a grain of salt. But I would not order from them again.

Also known as 'Angie's Bar' which is a shame bc Angie, the owner, is a miserly rude woman. I've given this place a few tries bc it's in my neighbourhood, I've given up. The food I've ha she's been decent but unfortunately the service and owner is terrible. The bartenders are okay, kind despite the poor English, but the owner is just miserable. Worse part is the waaaay overpriced drinks (minimum $10 each and no happy hour or specials) and they constantly charge customers for extra drinks not ordered. Amazed that they are still in business. I won't be surprised if their doors will be shut within 6 months.
Really good wings, some of the biggest you'll see anywhere. Great spot for sports watching

Great setting and a huge variety of gluten free fare with dedicated gluten free fryer. The staff is very knowledgeable about menu/ingredients and very friendly. The house wine is delicious and they have great happy hour prices on high balls. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu!

If it's your first trip to All Stars, you're going to feel overwhelmed when you see just how extensive their range of flavours is. Pandora's Box is a safe bet and all around crowd pleaser - you can't go wrong ordering this one. If you're feeling adventurous, try the Cleopatra to parm it up a notch or the God of Thunder for a dry spice rub done right. If you want to try a variety, go in a large group and just share everything. :)

Never go regular on your side order, always do any version of their amazing beer-battered fries (greek is popular). Personally, onion rings are my go to. People it's fingerfood so no, I did not take any pics. :P

Been here a couple times. Smack downtown, convenient location, and great vibe inside as well. Kept very clean and organized. Food is appropriately priced, quite tasty, and portions are pretty good as well.
What a waste of space. I have no idea how this place is still in business. Terrible food. Terrible service. Zero atmosphere.

I'm updating my review, they had a change in management since my last review and the food quality is better. Its honestly still hit or miss at times, as some waitresses have an attitude for no reason...?
Anyways, the Greek fries are great, pandoras bomb is one of their best wing flavours and the mozzarella sticks are surprisingly good.

There is many things I can say about this place and non of them are good. So this place has a hot wing sauce called Armageddon that is so hot you have to sign a waiver before eating. The challenge is to eat the pound of wings in 30 minutes and if you complete it, you will get a t-shirt that says Armageddon. I ate the wings within 9 minutes and the bartender asks what my size is, I told her XL then she made her way to the back for the shirt. She comes back and says they dont have that size but they will make an order and let me know when it arrives. So I write down my name and number, pay my bill and leave. A couple weeks go by and I didn't receive a call or anything so I assumed they have the shirt but forgot to call. I walk in and told the bartender I'm hear for my shirt. She asks the manager if the shirt is here and the manager says she forgot to make the order. I asked when I can expect it and she said 3-4 weeks. Then I receive a call from the manager saying they have a L and XXL if I would want these sizes. I ended up taking the XXL just because I wanted the shirt I was owed. But offering me these sizes let's me know they didnt make the order which is just lazy for a food establishment. So if your going to do this challenge, ask if they have your size first before paying the ridiculous amount of money for a pound of wings.

On April 6th, a friend and I decided to go out for a nice evening on the harbourfront to our regular spot at this location. We ordered the fish tacos to start, which were subpar to our surprise. As mains we ordered the rigatoni bolognese and the crispy shrimp noodle to share. Our food was HORRIBLE. Not only was the rigatoni bland, it was also cold; we were not even able to finish half of our meals. The crispy shrimp noodle bowl, which is the only reason I go to Shoeless Joes, was undercooked, and the shrimp was stale. We informed our waitress, who was very hospitable and the only good thing about this experience, that our food tasted horrible, to which she informed us that there was a new chef. We also ordered a Heineken and a red sangria; the beer was fine, however the sangria was overly sweetened. Not only did we spend $75.00 plus tip, we both went home and suffered through the night with stomach aches. We will be making sure to tell everyone we know that the food and drinks at this location were unacceptable and dangerous. We will most definitely not be returning.

The jumbo wings here are awesome. $20 for 2 lbs on Saturday night. The service is pretty good and they accommodated me by putting on the Habs game while the leafs were playing which was much appreciated. This place is near my sister's house so it's a great spot to grab some wings, beer and watch a game or UFC.

Lets talk about the best Sports Bar in Queen West and possibly downtown Toronto. Lots of TVs a great sound system a there's alway a good game on. From NHL, NBA, NFL to European Football they have it all. A fully stocked bar and a huge menu with some of the best wings and fries on the west side. I lived in the US for twenty years and since I moved back to Canada I've been looking for the sports bar to catch anything from March Madness all the way to the Champions League and this is "the place". Good food, great service and amazing sports. Just ask for Bree!

Me sitting here for 35 minutes without ANYONE saying a word to me while watching them serve SIX PEOPLE who came in after me. WT ENTIRE FUKK??!!  If it was possible for me to give this place a 0 or a negative number I would. I welcome to fucking Toronto!
Robert Poole
Solid service and reasonable price. Bartenders were fun to chat with. They didn't know Shoeless Joe was a White Sox player. They made up for it being attentive and great to talk to.

The pictures below are from an Uber Eats order. Burger patty was burned on side, they served me literally 1 leaf of lettuce, and the fries were soggy and oily. I'm super disappointed . 

:(

The waitress let us in and asked us to leave. Crazy customer service.
We went there for the raptors game. Paid my parking after confirming my seats. And then the waitress suddenly came over and said sorry the table was reserved but she didn't know. Forced to leave and need to find another bar before the start of the game. Very bad exp I

More like the WRONG wing sport pub. The owner was so rude and didn't even try to communicate with us. At one point his staff was basically mediating our conversation when it was pretty simple. Treated other customers politely but us, raises the question whether or not it was because of how we looked. The wife wasn't helpful, she also responded to staff instead of us and we were right in front of her. They didn't care to serve us.

Would never recommend this place to anyone.

great local pub. 

food: i like the burgers, fries, and wings. 

the whole place is super clean, including the kitchen (i've been in it).

the bartenders and owner are nice. if you spend some money, sometimes you'll get some free food and/or drinks. 

karaoke on wednesday and saturday is really fun.

I came here 3 times during my Caribana and OVO Fest visit. My wife and I are pleased with the atmosphere and the food is very good as well. Great place to end up and after interesting day. I highly recommend this place.

Worst location you could possibly think of going to. Their wings have become SO SMALL. They are sooo cheap when it comes to sauce on wings. The girls working there are the absolute worst. If you're not a table of guys, don't expect ANY attention or help from them. I was sitting at the bar, and there were 3 girls working the bar. You can catch them chatting to each other and with all the tables of guys. Meanwhile I needed extra sauce. I GOT UP and walked to them to ask for it. I also got up FOUR times for my drink refill. Not once did she come and ask if we needed anything. It's like this EVERYTIME whether sitting at the bar or lounge. If you don't have manly parts between your legs, you don't exist to these girls. Oh and for the funniest part of all. After me serving myself the whole time there, while shes busy flirting with all the guys. I left her a $5 tip and she huffs and puffs giving me the dirtiest look and runs back to her coworker and starts yelling and pointing at us. Hopefully the guys you were so interested in will give you a better tip hunny. And not the tip between their legs.

Came here many times for food and sports and I LOVE this place for all sports related watching. Lots of screens, great sound, good food and excellent service.
If you're looking for a good place to catch a game or a fight you must check it out. 
Make sure to reserve some places ahead of time as it does fill out fast when popular games are on.

Got take out and didn't receive the extra shrimps I paid for. Until I went back and told them I didn't have extra shrimps, and this server told me they were already inside. But went to go double check in the back and realized I didn't get extra shrimps. So I waited to get extra shrimps, and then she came back with even smaller shrimps that weren't even coconut shrimps! And she left without saying nothing, didn't even bother to check what kind of shrimps they were. Bad service!

This place had their soft opening a week ago. We came for a quick bite to eat and drinks after work. My boyfriend and I arrived just in time for the happy hour, which ends at 6pm. 

We ordered fries (with a side of gravy), jalapeño poppers and mozzarella sticks. For drinks he got a beer and I got a sex on the beach (1oz finlandia vodka, 1 oz mcguinness peach schnapps, with cranberry & orange juice). The fries were delicious, the gravy was slightly salty but hearty and paired well with the fries. The mozzarella sticks were decent. Not amazing but not bad either. The cheese inside had a decent pull at the beginning but not as much as they cooled down. The jalapeño poppers were pretty good. They do specific that there is only 5 pieces, great deal during happy hour. I also got a blue Hawaiian drink (3/4ox Malibu coconut rum, 3/4oz  mcguiness blue curaçao topped with pineapple juice and a splash of lime. When i got the drink the lime was at the top, but once it was stirred a bit it was delicious! Tasted like something you would drink on a beach or by a pool. With the second round of drinks we also ordered a margarita pizza. Pizza was pretty decent, if your last oking for gourmet this Isn't it but it's pretty good for bar pizza and you can't complain about the $12 price point. Most of the cocktails are $7 the same price as a beer which is awesome! What i liked about the cocktails is they allow you to upgrade to premium or top shelf liquor for $1-2 more, which is great if you are more particular about your alcohol. 

Our server, was friendly and knowledgeable. Very attentive and quick and accommodating with any dietary requests or changes. 

The washrooms are gendered and located in the basement which means temperature wise it's a little cold. The woman's washroom had 3 stalls and was fully stocked and clean. Automatic toilets, sinks, soaps, hand sanitizer and hand dryers. You can continue to hear (but not watch what's on tv, in this case a leafs game while in the washroom).

The overall sports bar is just that, a sports bar. A ton of tvs. We sat near the bar and could easily see 9 TVs not including 4 additional projection screens. The sound system is plugged into the TVs so it's a great place to watch sports. After happy hour they have a DJ that plays music sets between sports periods. The music is catchy, a good blend and not too loud. You can hear it clearly but you don't have to yell across the table to talk to who your with.

Will definitely be back again!
I am obsessed with the god of thunder wings and the hail ceasar fries!  It's spicy, flavorful and perfectly cooked!

I don't usually give bad review but their customer service is ridiculous. Rude, disrespectful owner with messy seating arrangement. 

We waited to be seated at a table for four. Then just after we sit down and parked our car , the owner came out and ask us to leave cuz the table was "reserved" for others. And they refused to switch other tables for us. 

Worst experience I ever had at a bar.

Stay here long enough and this place will burn a hole in your wallet. 

The service was not anything special. I guess it depends on who your server is at the bar. 

The nacho platter is massive and can feed approximately 2-3 persons. It was decent, but not anything out of the ordinary. I do appreciate the generous amount of jalapenos, however they should consider using a different type of nacho chip and perhaps reduce the amount of time in the oven.

We stopped in for a quick bite after spending all day at a sporting event in Pickering.  The place was empty, which should have been the first sign but we were very hungry so we decided to give it a try.

First off, the service was very good.  This review is for the food.

We ordered mozzarella sticks and fried pickles.  They were both good and the tomato sauce served with the mozzarella sticks had a nice heat on the end of it.  That is where the good part ends.

The wing menu was overwhelming.  There must have been over 200 different kind of wings on the list.  With that many options I was looking for a sampler, but there wasn't one.  A customer had to order wings by the pound and was only allowed more than one flavor if they ordered 5 pounds!  That wasn't happening...so onto something else with the menu.

I settled on a grilled cheese that had pulled pork, brie, bacon and caramelised onion.  This should have been so good but fell so short.  The onion was in huge chunks, the bacon was fatty and not crunchy, the pulled pork as bland.  It was such a disappointment.  My significant other had fish and chips.  I have to admit that I raised my eyebrows when he placed his ordered for that in a place like this...but I couldn't stop him.  I think he regretted his decision when he asked for vinegar and was brought onion vinegar instead of malt.  Thankfully he isn't fussy and ate regardless.  When I asked him how it was, his response was "it's food".  My thoughts exactly.

I can't say that we will return or even recommend this place given that the fries were not seasoned...even with a sprinkle of salt.  But I think we knew we were not going to have a good meal upon arriving.  Shame on us.

The worst experience ever. The customer service is 
Zero. Not polite, rude, don't know how to give customer a good experience. The food is totally over priced. Not tasty.

200 wing flavours! Everyone can find a wing flavour they like at All Stars. On Mondays, they have a 1 and a half lb for the price of 1lb deal. Wings are a little small sometimes but still filling. My favourite flavour is Hail Caesar. They also have a few beer cocktails which are pretty unique. I had the Rocky Mountain which is Coors Light mixed with other drinks to make a cocktail. It was pretty good! Would definitely try some of the other ones. It's not an overly amazing wing place but a good fix.

Great neighbourhood pub with lots of seating, several large screens and Friday and Saturday Karaoke. What makes this place stand out is THE FOOD. The menu boasts modern takes on pub fare, as well as complex entrees and neither disappoint. Having tried most of the items over several months (I'm new to the area) EVERYTHING I've had has been fresh and served at the right temp. I believe that all the sauces, batter etc. are made fresh and from scratch. Yummy and unique. Service is fast and friendly as well.

We got there long before a typical Friday rush started, but still waited to be seated. The wait for someone to take our order was way too long when the place was almost empty. The server ignored our 3-year old and we had to call out what to bring as she walked away. Very awful attention to her customers! The food took forever and, while it was good, we were just ready to leave by that time and couldn't enjoy the experience. Waiting for the check took way too long. First and last time we stop.
I think i just had the smallest sized buffalo wings in North America. 16 dollars for 10 wings size of half of a pinky finger. Thanks
Had the shrimp bowl it was very flavorful and good balance of flavor. Service was on the slow side however.

Randomly stumbled across this bar on Yelp and decided to give it a shot since the ratings are good. I must say I love it. It's clean, has good prices, friendly nice staff, good selection of beer and cheap bar food. A very down to earth and not overly crowded bar. Not more you can ask for in a dive. Go there!

Tuesday deals: 
- Beer + Bites 
- Bites + Order of a drink 
- Half price ribs 

Over 200 flavours of wings!!! There's something for everyone. 

All Stars have their Wing Deals on Monday's. However, on Tuesdays they also have great deals. We got the Bites for $9.99 with an order of a beverage.

You're able to choose any flavour out of the MANY they offer. Its basically a Chicken Nugget but better! Would definitely come back

We'd just come from checking out the cherry blossoms at High Park (overrated, says I) and were in need of some food and drink. Our first choice was completely full, so we walked a little and wound up at The Wicket.

I'm so glad we did.

We immediately managed to snag a pretty sweet table and the guy who served us was very friendly and efficient. Everyone wound up getting beer and I decided to order the Fried Chicken Sandwich ("lettuce, tomato and sriracha aioli") for food.

It's a decent sandwich. The bread and toppings were quite good, and the fried chicken was fresh and tasty. I will say, though, that the chicken itself wasn't exactly plentiful. It seemed like a got a few bites that were either just bread or just fried breading.

Still, I loved the ambiance and the service. I'll definitely return.

Low prices and good craft beer selection, but rude and dismissive of customer concerns. Not the way to develop loyal clientele. Also need to do something about the smell coming from the washrooms, is off-putting while having a beer.

DYING BREED
A real dive bar, w great staff.
Great neighbourhood bar as well, barflies and softball teams mixing together...
Spacious, with pool tables and patio.

UPDATE!!!!! The cheese was fucking ROTTEN!!! You could smell it across the room and it was absolutely REPULSIVE!!!!

Ordered a chicken quesadilla that took over an HOUR AND A HALF to be made, no waitress came by to refill water, even their "special 2lb wings" for the day almost took an hour as well and were extremely dry. I honestly don't know what's happening here.

I ordered the calamari and it was not good. It wasn't crispy enough and the dip was not good.  Service was really slow. I had to go up to the bar several times to get service. I would tell the waiter to get something but he would forget.  

The atmosphere felt like it was for an older crowd. I went there on a Tuesday and they had Karaoke -- old school Karaoke.  There was also a dance floor and a stage.

I came here for the current promo which is $0.50 cent a wing which is super cheap (no drink purchase needed). 

My bf and I went on a Sunday for lunch during the super bowl. We didn't know the promo was excluded on big game days but the receptionist confirmed it was over the phone. When we arrived we were told it was not available but brought up that we called and only came for the promo.... 

The store honoured the promo for us since we travelled just for the promo! The waitress then proceeded to give us exceptional service after the incident! We ordered 40 wings and a side of carrots. When the carrots came out there was only 3 carrot sticks...The waitress called bs on that and came back with more for us which we really appreciated because we paid extra for a side of carrots. 

Overall, our experience was decent given that the store was also understaffed and slow. We ended up giving a good tip because the waitress made it better. 

For the price you're paying for the wings.... I would highly recommend it! The honey garlic was the best flavour!! Note also that the wings are a decent size!

I had a really frustrating altercation with skip the dishes as the courier didn't deliver my order and the waitress who responded to my calls was very helpful and understanding. When we ended up finally reordering through skip the dishes, she included our previous order along with our new order!

The food was delicious and I'm looking forward to going in person, as the staff was very helpful and personable even though it sounded quite busy. I don't know the name of the waitress who helped me, but she should get a raise!

Last Tuesday I made my 1st visit to Another Bar with 2 friends; we were drawn to visit by their impressive beer menu which features quality local craft beers.  The long, narrow venue was more 'upscale' than I thought it might be (with multiple big screen TVs and a bar counter that seems to stretch into infinity) and they had some standup comedy happening in their back area that evening for awhile after we arrived.  They have some beer deals too (another factor which led us to visit), and all 3 of us partook in their $3.50 half-pint local craft deal.  The venue was somewhat crowded for some time after our arrival but the service was fairly prompt and friendly - we sat at the bar.

As Another Bar is close to the subway - just west of Ossington Station - I'll be coming back for hopefully a longer visit to further explore their beer offerings and maybe order something to eat too, as they have food deals on their menu as well.

I went last night around 930 or 10 with one of my mates. firstly the blonde bartender was lazy, inattentive, overall pretty gross and in need of reaquainting herself with how to do her job properly. 
the wings even by pub fare standard were sub par swimming in sauce and not exactly what i had anticipated given there were maybe 10 people total inside. 
for the encore the bathroom looks like sneaky dees. 
safe to say i wouldnt recommend this puck n wing at yonge and finch to an enemy let alone people i enjoy spending time with. youre better off trying your luck elsewhere. cheers
C'est une très bonne restaurant, mais les prix sont très coûteux pour ce arrondissement. Les calamaris sont très petite pour le prix, mais le sauce aux truffes est très bon.

Five stars for staff but three stars for food. 
It's fairly straightforward pub-grub. But rather average, I would say worth it for the price but nothing to write home about.

We spent Canada Day here and they honoured their half price wing deal for Monday. We ordered three pounds of wings plus a pitcher of Canadian for $50 tax and tip in. The flavours we ordered were creamy Parm (favourite), creole (2nd), and Cajun (3rd). It all came with a complimentary side of fries. The wings were a nice size. A good selection of flavours but I wouldn't say the wings are outstanding just standard pub food. Service was good, ambience is a bit dingy but overall an average wings place with a good half price wing deal on Mondays

Man it normally takes a LOT for me to even care to leave a review at all. This time around it was one teeny little thing that has got me pretty miffed. Hear me out:

Look at the picture. A Jagermeister branded sign with "$15 1lb wings + fries + pint". Great.

I eat my food and pay up without thinking. Walking out I notice that the bill was a bit high. I figured I might have accidentally clicked the default 25% tip prompt (bad sign there).


So the server tells that the $15 deal is only for Amsterdam beers. I bought a Stella.

Nobody told me this when I ordered, nor is it on the sign. I point this out.

Now, I'm not here getting bent up over $7. I wasn't planning on asking for a refund or anything, I already paid. Maybe a "ahhh yeah my bad" or something. Maybe I missed something? 

Anyway this guy looks right at me with the dumbest sh** eating grin I've ever seen and says "I guess I'll add an asterisk".

Alright loser. I suppose I should have expected that from a place with a default tip of 25%

2 stars because the wings were actually good and the stella was really cold. Fries were meh though.

Normally the service isn't great but I had an exceptionally terrible experience on a Tuesday. One server on the floor and one bartender. Moved to the bar because we didn't get greeted after 15 mins. The bartender completely ignored us (on purpose). She was not busy. Even greeting tables that came in after us. Horrible experience. We got up and left. Will never be going back. Ever. Thanks to the horrible customer service from that bartender. In fact what service?
She was blonde if the manager sees this. Hope she gets the reprimand she deserves.

Jan 2, 2019 - my friend and I went here for a drink, we decided to get some appetizers. 

Currently they have a special buy any drink and you get a flatbread for $9.99. So I ordered calamari and he ordered a flatbread.

HERBED MUSHROOM AND SHAVED PARMESAN
Signature creamy mushroom blend, goat cheese, truffle parm mayo and balsamic glaze. Finished with lemon-dressed arugula and shaved parmesan. 4/5

CALAMARI
Golden calamari in tempura-style batter with jalapenos and peppers. Truffle parm mayo and sweet chili for dipping. 3/5 

The flatbread was very good. The corners were too tough or me right now (braces).. but the flatbread was sweet and they had a lemon on the platter we thought it was for decoration  (lol).. but on the last two slices we squeezed the lemon on it and it was pretty damn good. Also the calamari was nice and soft, and the jalapeño peppers and red pepper tasted very good.

I will go back soon and try the main dishes and get that flatbread again!

Really Great service! Ended up here on the 4th anniversary and they had great service and an awesome DJ upstairs! Awesome wine selection and really good nachos! I would definitely come back. My boyfriend loved it too!
Great food and excellent service. Wings are amazing. Best wings . If you don't want Winn's try burger.
Wings are average. Crowd is sketchy. Managers wife is irritating -- point of advice, tell the old lady to stay home.

Jan 2, 2019 - my friend and I went here for a drink, we decided to get some appetizers. 

Currently they have a special buy any drink and you get a flatbread for $9.99. So I ordered calamari and he ordered a flatbread.

HERBED MUSHROOM AND SHAVED PARMESAN
Signature creamy mushroom blend, goat cheese, truffle parm mayo and balsamic glaze. Finished with lemon-dressed arugula and shaved parmesan. 4/5
