CALAMARI
Golden calamari in tempura-style batter with jalapenos and peppers. Truffle parm mayo and sweet chili for dipping. 3/5 

The flatbread was very good. The corners were too tough for me right now (braces).. but the flatbread was sweet and they had a lemon on the platter we thought it was for decoration  (lol).. but on the last two slices we squeezed the lemon on it and it was pretty damn good. Also the calamari was nice and soft, and the jalapeño peppers and red pepper tasted very good.

I have to go back soon and try that flatbread again!

Fun cute place to go with your friends, the owners are awesome and they host events like comedy nights and open mics. Brunch is really good there too, Sunday's 11-4pm, the baileys brunch bowl ($11) is amazing. Check it out if you're around queen west!
I'm not going to share the entire crazy story but what I received in my takeout container was not edible. Food does not come as pictured.

Delicious wings.
Half price on Monday, Saturday 2 pounds for $20 -the prices are amazing.
There was a hair in our fried pickles & the server voided then for us but that will not stop us from coming back the service is always friendly & personable.
The best wing spot in the city!
Try the black & tan onion rings!

The service was slow. I waited over 25 minutes for a pizza and I was the only one in the place! The basement smells like mildew and rot! The decor is frigid and minimal. This place is nothing special.

Terrible service. Takes them forever to take orders and to serve mediocre food. Always check your bill because they're for sure going to overcharge you. Also, just note that they expect to be tipped despite their horrendous service.

Came here on Wednesday for dinner with my kids and literally had the worst experience ever. My son ordered from the kids menu and chose kool aid for his drink and the waitress asked him to pick something else so that she wouldn't have to make the kool aid...I get that she was busy and my son didn't care but I wasn't impressed. We ordered calamari and it was completely tasteless, as was the grilled chicken pasta that my daughter ordered. To top it off - when all of our dishes came out, we were told that there weren't any utensils and that we had to wait until they were washed. The kids were already starving because we waited forever for our food, then couldn't eat it because we didn't have utensils until my boyfriend asked if they had any plastic cutlery. Worst service and food, would never come back again.

Great place to grab drinks and some bar food! I came here on a Sunday night and had the wings with Sangria! They have Sangria Sundays and literally paid 16 CAD for a liter of Sangria which I think is an amazing deal!! 
The service was so good. Our waitress was so sweet and friendly! Definitely visiting again with a bigger appetite

Good place for wings and huge selection of sauces! The only downside is that the wings don't come with fries but celery and carrots instead. Price is average but service is good. The place is also usually not that packed, which is great.

I visited this Shoeless Joe's location on a UFC fight night that had a Leaf's game running a couple hours before. The tables weren't moving AT ALL. While this was not the staff's fault the entrance was really crowded and we waited 45 minutes before we were seated. There was more than one staff member tending the host desk and it felt disorganized. We had no idea how long the wait would be and had no place to sit down. They did offer to let us cash and carry at the bar, there was nowhere to sit, or stand for that matter so we just waited at the door, thankful we had pre-gamed a little to make the crowded standing more bearable.

When we were finally seated we had to ask for the table to be cleaned and for menus. To the server's credit, once he got started he was really efficient and did not keep us waiting. Lagunitas' IPA is not on the menu and no one offered it to us. It just happened that someone in my party noticed a sign at the bar and we were happy to have this option. 

I ordered the fish and chips which was pretty terrible and overpriced. I did not have a chance to ask for ketchup, which seems like something you should just bring or at least offer for this type of meal.

In summary, This is not a good place to go unless you arrive well before the event you want to watch. I would never go here if it wasn't for the game screens and even with them I don't think I would return.

Gord and I had supper this evening at 817 Sports Bar & Grill.  They just opened a couple months ago.

I ordered The 6ix pizza.  When Stella, our server, brought it, it was on the cool-side so I asked to have it put back in the oven for a bit to heat it up.  When it came back, it was better ... everything was hot and the cheese was stringy.  The Italian pepperoni was spicier than regular pepperoni and I was okay with that.  It was a good pizza and I'd get it again.  

Gord ordered a Classic burger (with no tomatoes) and onion rings rather than fries.  I had an onion ring and it was good.  Gord said it was a good burger and he'd get it again.  The bun was soft, just how I like them.

If you are a beer drinker, they have a good selection of big names and smaller craft beer.

Stella was friendly and chatty and took good care of us.

We'll be back!

Great little spot! We were walking along Queen West, desperately looking for some shade, a drink and a quick bite. Also complicating matters, we had a tiny dog in tow that would have to either be on the patio with us or tied within arm's reach. Enter, H Bar's tiny 4-seater patio. Apparently there is a back patio too but with the front, we had no dog issues! The back patio may be licensed soon as well, hot tip. 

Tried the deep fried pickles and spinach dip and I was really impressed! The picked were perfect little coins, like chips, in a yummy ranch dip to cool it all down. The snack menu is not too big, but had all the favourites. 

I also came here once for a birthday party! The birthday girl was able to rent out the whole top floor and it was perfectly suited for everyone. Centrally locations, not too expensive drinks, space upstairs and downstairs. Everyone was feeling very, very merry that Saturday night a fews months back.

Was going to go with 4 stars but you know what, the unexpected experience we had her is deserving of 5 full stars. We were out for a walk on Canada day and were looking for a place with a patio to have a drink or too, as we walked down Roncy a glint of light caught my eye through the open doors of Round the Horn and I got a sense that this little bar had a garden patio in the back. We walked over to inspect and low and behold my guess was right!

A cozy little spots with tons of seating amifst big shady trees and a nice private fence. It felt like we were in someone's backyard having long weekend beers (which I guess we kinda were).

They had a great wine list but also ample beer selection in both conventional and craft varieties. We all got something we loved.

We were hungry shortly thereafter and were a bit surprised to see that despite pub staples like nachos and burgers their menu was dominated by... hot dogs! Hot dogs in every possible topping combination from german oktoberfest bratwust to coney island dogs and everything in between - and CHEAP!

I started with a fresh house made baked pretzel with mustard, wow!!! Incredible! Then went with two classic Coney Dogs (with cheese and chilli) and I felt like I was at a ballpark in America taking in a baseball game, I mean pretzels, hot dogs and beer - all for fair prices?!?! What is this place?

Some call it a place Round the Horn... I call it a little slice of heaven just round Roncy

Eatcrest Out

Don't think we'll be returning as the food was pretty disappointing, but the service was good so no complaints there (although, there were only a few other tables when we got there). 

Our main complaint was the Greek fries because they were incredibly soggy, even the ones that had no sauce on them. They all had the texture of mashed potatoes which is pretty crazy since you'd expect a wing place to know how to properly fry a batch of fries.

We also got 2lbs of wings - one lb Thunder of God which I have no complaints about and another lb of Hail Caesar (garlic parm). Definitely not the best garlic parm wings we've had. Not sure if that's how people like them but they were drenched in sauce (assuming butter is the main ingredient of it) which made it feel like we were eating butter with a side of wings. 

The bill came to $50 for 2 lbs of wings, 2 drinks and an order of fries. Definitely pricey for the lackluster quality of food you get.

Service: 5/5
Food: 2.5/5
Value: 1/5

I have been here several times and had a blast everytime. This plca is packed all the time but there is always room to sit and relax. The food here is very expensive but its tasty. I loved their poutine

It's too bad that you guys still give out straws without being requested our group HATES using straws and yet we were all given them dispite saying not to in our drinks. You should really rethink how your company deals with straws. They are a thing of the past, not the future. At least the drinks were tasty and games were fun.
Was surprised at how quick and friendly the service was. Was there with four people and everyone's food came out delicious.

Mediocre experience at this location. Was disappointed with 2-foot nachos, which I expected would be more than 15 sad chips laid out in a line on a 2-ft board. Service was not good either. Waitress was rude, and made her disappointment very clear when my friend and I tipped only 10%. Waitress walked off without a word after slamming my receipt on the table. No "goodbye," "thank you," or "have a nice evening." Very unimpressed. Tips are earned, not given out. Likely will be not be returning.

I an absolutely disgusted with the level (or lack of) service!  There was only one server for our party of over 40 people and several other tables.  We arrived at 6 pm, people did not even begin to receive their main dishes until after 7:30.  They packed us in like sardines and forgot drink and food orders on multiple occasions!  The only thing done to address our frustration were a few complimentary orders of garlic bread!  I would never arrange another get together, recommend or patronize this establishment again!  Disgraceful!  The only reason there are any stars is because I was unable to post this without selecting at least one!?
Absolute worst. Do not come here. Unfortunately, our waiter had no idea that the host treated us so terribly. He was fantastic.

Summary: I like going here for the arcade games only as student pricing (university or secondary school) is around $15 for about 1.5 hours worth of play. Note they have a ticket /points based system- not time based. *See more for pros & cons list
Pros: fun games, cheap arcade - costs little to play a lot, big space, beautiful outside scenery, cool toys for arcade points /tickets
Cons: too busy at times, costly food and drinks, staff are not that helpful, staff too busy, restaurant and arcade sometimes too busy, games get boring,

Came here again exactly a month later on a cold winter Saturday! A group of 5 of us came in at 9pm and were immediately seated not at the bar section. This section was particularly empty, and I am blaming it on the weather! We were served by Roger and he was INCREDIBLE!!! Each person originally had something they wanted to order but when the last person ordered and asked for the the soup of the day and he said it was "Crab Chowder", 4 out of 5 people in the party decided to change their order to try this crab chowder! Roger was SUPER COOL about the change and was not a single bit annoyed too. Awesome server!!! 

The crab chowder was underwhelming. It was spicy! not really what I was hoping for. I also tried their loaf of garlic bread and it was good. The traditional poutine was delicious and it came out like a brick! How interesting! 

This location is definitely my go-to as it is just across from Union Station!

This is one of my favourite places to eat when I go to Toronto with my family. They have a server there named Paige and she is the most enthusiastic, funny, outgoing server I've ever had. Only complaint is that the restaurant was doing work in the winter on the outdoor patio so they kept opening the door which was right beside our table. Other than that, the service was great and we were seated at a table within less than 3 minutes!

The Rec Room exceeded my expectations.

Due to the wide variety of games and weather you're old or young will love this place. The location is so creative inside of and old train round house gives the building history and wisdom, all while seconds away from the CN tower and the home of the Blue Jays, Rogers Centre. On top of all this there's amazing food there ranging from 
Steak to Fish and chips to Pizza. 

The Rec Room is an amazing place to bring family play by yourself or with friends I strongly encourage you to go here.

Great place to go with friends for entertainment. As far as the food is concerned, I was pretty disappointment. I've been to the Rec Room for food and drinks about 4 times before and was pleased with the service. But this time around, I'm disappointed. Usually we would get complimentary popcorn, but they ran out. There were no coasters for our drinks, so our tables were extremely wet. My buffalo chicken bites were extremely soggy and cold. My Cesar salad only had Cesar dressing and lettuce. There were no bacon and no Parmesan on my salad. (I asked for no croutons). The artichoke dip did not come with a side of kale like it says in the menu. I had to ask and paid extra for it. The waitress did not seem too happy that I had all these concerns and I could tell because I saw her roll her eyes when she left our table. They were nice enough to take the chicken off my bill. But I should've said something about my salad because it was definitely not a Cesar salad. But I knew if I did, the waitress would really not be too happy. We were told that there has been changes to the menu. Which is why our food arrived differently. Yet the menus remain the same from the last time I was there.

We were in the area on a recent Saturday afternoon and I felt a hankering for a poutine. I felt pretty confident that a place like Union Social Eatery would have a poutine on the menu, so we went inside and snagged a sweet booth near the back.

And indeed, I did order the Pulled Pork Poutine ("Aged cheddar, jalapeno-Monterey Jack, bread and butter pickles, crispy sweet onions and hand-crafted gravy").

It arrived shortly after and it's a decent poutine. There were a few obvious problems, though. The main issue here was that the dish didn't arrive to the table hot. It had clearly been sitting around for a while, and so the whole thing was just slightly hotter than room temperature. It's not ideal.

I should also note that the concoction was very, very sweet. The pulled pork had clearly been prepared with a sugar-forward barbecue sauce, while the naturally-sweet bread and butter pickles only exacerbate this feeling. It almost felt like a dessert poutine.

But it's a poutine, so I enjoyed it. The plentiful cheese certainly didn't hurt, nor did the perfectly-prepared fries. I just don't know that I'd ever order it again.

Visiting Toronto from Atlanta and I had to watch Mexico play vs Costa Rica for the Gold Cup. I called and asked if theyd be showing the game and the guy that answered checked to make sure that they had the channel. Once we were there they even put the volume up so we could hear the game. While we were there we ordered wings, nachos, fries and jack and cokes. Everything was delicious and our server was so nice!!

I've been here a handful of times since they've opened and have always had a decent time. 
Most recently my friends and I came here for New Years Eve and it was poorly planned. They were very slow to let people into the venue. We had to wait an hour outside in the rain. By the time we got inside, we wanted to do coat check but it was closed because they ran out of coat hangers... so we had to carry our wet jackets around with us. The bars were packed and we gave up after 15mins of waiting and trying to get a bartender's attention. We headed to the dance floor closer to midnight and everything is pretty disorganized. We missed the countdown and balloons were suppose to drop but there were problems with releasing them. 
Other than the mishaps we had a decent time. We were able to play pretty much all the games we wanted to. 
I would probably still come back to the Rec Room but on a regular weekend and not during a special event.

10 out of 10 for the  pulled pork sandwich with yam fries. The pork is so tasty and juicy and the yam fries have a buttered crunchy texture. It is a massive portion and can be shared between two people if you just want a regular size mea Very yummy! I am glad a found a place with great pulled pork sandwiches near my home. I also tried the beef brisket sandwich and it was 7 out if 10. Their burgers are massive and delicious. It is also nice to go there to support new local business.

WHAT A COOL PLACE!!!!

40,000 square feet of GAMES is a gaming dream! The game selection is awesome, I love that they have a live performance venue, food and drink was great, and the bathrooms were spotless.

This was my second time at Union Social Eatery on St. Clair. This visit was just OK. We were pleasantly greeted by a staff member upon entry and our server was friendly and attentive.

The food however is, meh. Not horrible but nothing I would be quick to return for. If found the balsamic
on the appetizer flatbread to be far too sweet (but that may be just my person taste). The calamari was cooked well but were very, very small. They came with two standard dipping sauces (Thai chili, and a dill one).

My spinach salad was good. Not too much dressing. I did add a BBQ chicken breast. I anticipated it to be freshly cooked and warm but it was refrigerator cold and heavily coated in BBQ sauce. (Not sure it was actually barbecued). I would have preferred a plain portion of chicken as the BBQ sauce wasn't my favourite combined with the vinaigrette.

I had a mojito to drink. The menu says "muddled to oder." Let me tell you, this was nothing more than a prepared tinted green sugary "mojito mix" and some mint leaves thrown in. There was no muddling and this was not an authentic mojito. I did kind of expect a prepared beverage but gave them the benefit of the doubt based on the menu description. 

With that said, it seemed my other dining companions enjoyed their meals.

The food is nothing special but there are enough menu options to satisfy many tastes and this would be a decent place for snacks and after-work drinks. And as I mentioned in the beginning, the staff was very good.

This was a fantastic restaurant! We tried the outside restaurant but there is one inside with the games. The outside is located right next to a train museum which was lovely scenery and it also has a magnificent view of the CN Tower. The hostess was very nice and so was our server. There aren't many food options on the menu but it's a good general selection of food and they've definitely mastered the skill of it. They could the burgers on outside grills so that was a cool feature. Everything was well prepared and I couldn't have asked for better! It was a lovely experience and if I'm in Toronto again I'd totally go back. If you're visiting and don't know where to go, definitely try out this place!

Great atmosphere and love the games!!! They have a good selection of games but it could get crowded, especially weekend nights. Price wise, it was ok. We usually buy the max amount which is around $30 and it lasts us a good 2-3 hours. The prizes now are not as good and I have yet to trade in my tickets for something I like.

Hubby & I had the day off so we came here on a Thursday for lunch. The food was decent. I had the classic burger with a salad. Hubby had the sliders & popcorn chicken. We shared a side order of fries. I liked all of the food except for the fries. The fries were subpar in my opinion. It's weird because I've been here once before for a work social event & the fries that time were delicious! The waitstaff seemed busy. Not sure if it's because of the company event going on. Our waitress was nice but she forgot the coffee that hubby ordered. At least we didn't get charged for it. 

Anyway the place was a bit busy as there was a company event being held. Plus all the random people there too. There was a good amount of large groups. We had to wait 15 mins for a table even though when we were seated there were still at least 3 empty tables that didn't seem to be reserved. 

After lunch there was a variety of games we tried. I liked the Kung Fu Panda game. We didn't have time to do the Star Wars VR game. So we'll have to come back to do that another time. There were some pinball machines, shooting games, & also simple games that kids could play.

This place is super noisy so if you're sensitive to sound this might not be the place for you. I could only stand the noise for so long before I started getting a headache. Bring some headache medicine with you!

Not a bad jack astors location. I go here all the time. Half the time servers are nice, other half they're rude. But for the most part not a bad place. The drinks menu has a lot of variety. The blue lemonade iced teas are my favourite.

On our visit to the Rec Room we were very impressed and excited with what we have seen on the menu for lunch. The Pizza is a very good portion size and tasted amazing from what the table was saying. I myself wanted to order the Ribs but I am gluten free and the waitress did notify me that the sauce is not gluten free... This was a bummer but I did end up getting the steak in which I was extremely satisfied with the taste and quality. This place also had an amazing arcade but we did not participate during our visit. Next door is steam whistle and across the street is the CN Tower, Aquarium and Blue Jays stadium.

Good scratch kitchen that's opened in the Yonge and Sheppard area.

Food is well-made, good portion sizes and tastes great.

Good beer selection, and lots of TV's for watching sports.

Food I recommend here:
Little Monster Burger
Fried Chicken
Tuna tacos
Lobster roll

So we have been going to Via Napoli since opening.  We have been loyal customers and have recommended their pizzas to several of our friends.  Just yesterday we took yet another friend to eat here and when we got our bill it was extremely high.  Our server never told us the cost of the wine that he pushed onto our table.  The bottle of wine was $85.00.... and the price isn't written anywhere on the menu !!!  Funny thing is this same bottle at lcbo costs only $27.00.  The bottle was sneakily pushed onto us and we felt like we were taken advantage of.  We spent $200 on pizza and drinks for 3 people... and we have been loyal customers.  When we called to discuss this the owner didn't care and acted like it was justified for the servers to be so sneaky.  We are no longer coming here and we don't recommend it.  The pizza is good but the service is awful.

5 stars for the cheapest 20 ounce pint in the city. $4.87 for a pint of COOL lager. You just can't go wrong here.

Food isn't too bad either and the place is clean enough.

Seems a little iffy from the outside but worth it in the end.

Jukebox with the classics too.

Go here if you want to save money. Waddup!

I've been here a few times and have had an ok experience. 

The Game Area:
On the weekend the game area is really packed. It's so packed that it takes over an hour to get into the Rec Room and then you have to wait in huge lines to play random games. Don't even think about the basketball as you might have to wait an hour. The area is also really crowded that it might make you feel claustrophobic. 

I recently visited the rev room on a Sunday evening and it wasn't as busy. There were still lines to play each game but we did not have to wait an hour to load our game cards. 

The Stage:
Recently I discovered the Rec Room has a huge area in the back for private events. We came to the Rec Room to watch the magician illusionists and the back room is huge and so cute. They have European phone booths everywhere for photo opportunities and nice circular coaches surrounding coffee tables for large groups. It felt like a fancy lounge. I'd love to venture back to that room for more events. 

The Parking:
There is one lot close to the Rec Room and it costs about $30 to park for the evening. We were shocked. I'd definitely suggest the TTC or parking further away and enjoying a nice stroll to the Rec Room. 

The Restaurant:
The last time we tried to dine at the restaurant we waited the suggested hour and were then told it would be a few more hours. We were famished and went someplace else to eat. It's definitely difficult to get a table here over the weekend. 

The Bars:
The drinks are good but pretty basic. They don't have too many fancy cocktails. I ordered the coco loco drink, which featured coconut water, tequila and some other ingredients and I found it to be really strong. 

Snacks:
They provide guests with free popcorn. You just have to ask. Tonight it was really salty. I'd give it 2 out of 5 stars. 

Would I Return?
Possibly but I really prefer Dave and Busters. Don't forget to collect your scene points.

was lovey afternoon and wanted up and entered the place and no one at the front so made way to terrace... (Had been here several times over the rears) was 5 or so tables empty and took the clean one... short girl with long dark hair and eyes comes and tell me that that is not my table and for someone else.. says to go to front. Went to front and she was there... asked her for a table... says you have to wait 1/2 or so. There were not that may people... and at least now 4 tables and no one else in the lineup and tables just needed to be cleared was all..(2 minus task) .. this girl was not at all nice and did what she could to piss off people and be rude... rimes with stitch but begins with B.... nasty people like this should not be in the service industry and hidden somewhere out of public as i have been to this place many times to have a beer and eat and people watch and this ultra rude person went out of her way to be unaccommodating.

Unfortunately this place has really gone down hill since they opened....
1hr for food on a very slow Sunday night.
I ordered the full rack of rib special but the ribs were really lacking meat... And the side of vegies was mush.
Mill st.organic beer was Flat...
I was asked to pay in cash for a10% discount? What is up with that? They should have offered me 13% or at least 15% of if they are not declaring the income...
Mediocre experience at best.

First time at this location and it was disappointing. Food was not bad pretty average, drink prices are pretty average. They get 2 stars because service was so slow as we were 1 of only 2 tables he was serving. The Rec Room at Square One was way faster even on a Raptors game night during the finals. I was very disappointed with the service here. Many things that we asked for was forgotten or had to be reminded more than twice. The food itself was also slow to come out and there wasn't even many tables during our tie of visit. We also had to wait over 30 minutes for a table when clearly they had over half their restaurant empty I see no reason to have to make us wait and other people behind us wait, I had asked if the tables were reserved and was told no. I would recommend you either go somewhere else to eat or if it's the games go to Dave and Busters much better service and games. I would recommend the Square One Rec room if it's Rec Room you're looking for.

The Rec Room is always a bittersweet experience. It brings a much needed "thing to do" to the Downtown Core. For those that don't know, it's basically Cineplex's version of Dave & Busters, but more corporate, and nicer.

The Rec Room is always packed, and it doesn't help that they squish all the games into a really tight midway. Seriously, there's no way for you to walk through the midway without bumping a kid or two. 

The food is pricey, but decent. The complimentary Cineplex popcorn is a nice touch and always serves the role of an appetizer for me. Drinks aren't too bad either; in fact, my friend complained that our Rum and Cokes had 'too much' alcohol...usually, people complain that there's too much Coke!

A pet peeve of mine, every time I come here, is that they seem to open and close coat check whenever they feel like it, even if there's plenty of room for more coats.
They gave me a dirty glass. They wouldn't take my healthcare even though he's seen me before. We had a dinner party, 2 out of 8 didn't have ids. He refused to serve all of us. Very dark place

My husband and I decided to take a chance on this new restaurant one evening and we were so pleasantly surprised! First impression: cozy little restaurant with an owner who greeted us right away. The servers were very attentive and friendly.   The front of the restaurant was more of a cozy dining room but the bar at the back of the restaurant had a more casual atmosphere with what looked like regulars coming in for a beer. 

The pizzas were so amazing! Perfectly cooked and thin with a very fluffy and soft crust. We ordered 3 pizzas between the 2 of us so we obviously had leftovers the next morning but I was so surprised that the pizza was not hard and stale the next day- the crust was still chewy and delicious. I posted photos but can't remember exactly which pizzas we ate (this visit was a few months ago) but I do remember that the special had sausage and potato but the potatoes were so delicious and different from any other potato pizza we've ever had- they were a little mashed up and tasted like buttery goodness. We asked for some spice on the side and received the chili oil, which definitely had kick and flavour- highly recommend!

Came out to this location to enjoy the rooftop. It was my fiancés birthday and we decided to celebrate this big day here. Trevor was a great host and served us very well, however his support team messed up our drinks and food orders. We ordered vegetarian food and were served non-veg. We ordered large drinks for the ladies and got them in small size glass. The team was a bit disorganized, however Trevor made up for it by coming through with a birthday brownie. The two stars are deducted for two reasons: order mess ups and for not being able to sit at the open rooftop area. The food was amazing! I would recommend this place for the food, however the quality of service needs improvement. Time is something this location needs to understand. I am visiting and time was something that was a limited resource for me. Delaying my order and messing it up had an impact on my plans. Overall, great food with okay service practices.

Amazing place with the worst service. If you happen to visit the rec room and come across a server named Queyanna, just RUN. She was rude and lost. They had good food but was not worth waiting for an hour.

Location: Mississauga

Great concept!  and in a beautifully renovated building. 

The Rec Room has a very similar concept to Dave and Busters - an indoor arcade sort of place for all ages. I really like that they allow you to allow you to take your drinks with you while you play the games. 

We came here on a Saturday night and it was was packed! 
We were a group of 8 people, and found it fairly easy to find our way around. 

We spent about a good 3 hours here enjoying the games, drinks & each other's company. It was a nice change of pace from the usual dinner and drinks. 

Side Note: 
- Coat Check is FREE you just have to give you phone number and their software sends you a text with your coat check info.

 - Your wristband does NOT expire, if you don't end up using all your tokens, you can keep the wristband and come back another time. 

I only two things that bothered me here were at the front counter, when I asked the cashier to check my balance, she said she could not. She could only add to my balance. I understand that there is a credit check machine nearby, but it was super frustrating to stand in line to find out this information to only have to stand in line again after checking my balance. 

The only small detail was that I noticed a lot of these games are in very close quarters. When you're in a group, it's easy to get lost or it can become pretty cramped while you're waiting for a game. I understand that they have limited space for the game, so there's not too much they can do.

The best beef brisket sandwich in the city! Smoked in house. It was so succulent! Choose between multiple sides. The onion rings and fries were amazing! Also ordered the beet salad with goat cheese and walnuts. Soooo Good! I will be back!

The rec room has a wide variety of games and although busy, the wait wasn't too long.  My favorite experience was the virtual reality simulation.  The allotted time is around 15-20 mins but it will get your heart racing from the thrill of the adventure.  Great place to bring your family for a fun filled time!

This is a cute place to go for food and drinks. The interior is nice and the food was very good. A group of 5 of us went and shared a bunch of apps which were all very good. We had the calamari, roasted vegetable flatbread, smashed avocado dip, Parmesan fries and the Korean bbq tacos. The most delicious was definitely the tacos and I highly recommend them. The only thing that this place had that brought the rating down is that the service was quite slow and our server definitely didn't check in with us enough. We pretty much accepted we would not get water refills. But that aside I would go back for the food and the vibe.

I went there for a work function and it was a blast, but mainly because I didn't have to pay for tickets. We had a limited menu and I chose the mac & cheese with bacon that was very good. Their full bar is also a good option

Really fun arcade/bar/restaurant right in the middle of everything touristy in downtown Toronto. It is a converted/reuse of old silos, which is totally great! You buy a wristband that is reloadable. The card attached can just be detached as it is not scannable at the games (an 8 yr old explained that to us when we had issues scanning). Haha! We were able to use the coat check to check our stroller for free. Super awesome to be able to drink decent wine and walk around while the kiddos play. We grabbed a pizza to go and it was wood fired and delicious. The prizes were pretty fun and we were lucky enough to have someone give us their leftover 400 tickets so our 3 yr old could get a Raptors bear. I love Canadians!

Was here for lunch with some coworkers yesterday. Just like every other Jacks. Service was very good, for a group for 7. Our waiter was friendly and nice. I had the superfood salad with Falafel, which was tasty. Everyone in the group was pretty satisfied with their items. Been here a few times now and is a great location for food and drinks downtown, so close to union station.

Went here for lunch with coworkers. Used to be Moxies. The food was mediocre at best. Neither of us thought our meal was particularly good. The service was slow and the restaurant was pretty empty. The decor is a bit funny for a restaurant. Very bright inside large tables and seating that resemble a cafeteria or food court more than a restaurant. Don't see this place lasting much longer

Spent the day in the city and we were starving. We stopped in for a quick dinner before heading back home. I tried the quesadilla stack chicken sandwich. It was really good. We also got a fishbowl to share. The server was really friendly and had no problems splitting our bills. I also am not from Canada but it was cool to see they give you vinegar for your fries!  Coleslaw was good too

This is one of my favourite spots to go in the Yonge and St.Clair area. It is in walking distance from where I live and the menu has so many different options that always satisfy my cravings. I love how it is so nice and cosy in the restaurant no matter where you sit. I am usually always very cold but union social is always nice and warm no matter if you sit by the window or in a booth or at a standup table. My favourite meal is the burger, it is homemade and absolutely filled with flavor. It takes a bit of time for the kitchen to prepare it but it is worth every minute I wait. It can get pretty busy around lunchtime because a lot of businesses are in that area and everyone is discovering this restaurant so be patient it is worth the wait.
Over charged for beer that was already above the pale in terms of price. Would be wary.

Ok. So this place (arcade wise) is really cool. Games all work and are mostly digital. Best arcade for family I have seen. The restaurant...... on the other hand... oh. Dear. God. After we got sat someone brought us water and popcorn complimentary. Cool, right? THEN it took 20 minutes for anyone to come back. We finally flagged down our server, who, looked like a deer in headlights. He was so stressed out he just said "omg, I'm so sorry." Then he was so embarrassed, I think he ignored us all together til our food came out. I ordered a beer... never got it.. when we finally got our food, it was delicious (I have to say) but once again, never saw our server. Finally had to flag him down to let him know my sister and her husband never received her pizza. He said "I'll see if I can get it comped?" What do you mean you will see?!? They never got it!!!! Literally, worst service ever. Save yourself the time or hope that guy got fired.

In all honesty The Rec Room is CRAZY overpriced for the experience you will get. The "arcade" is mediocre at best, I'm sure Chuck E Cheese is better. Security are rude and entitled. Went here a while back to get food and play games, only to be let in at first than kicked out after for being under 19 at the time. Which I was not even drinking and was only trying to eat here and check the place out nor was I told it was "19+ after 11pm" considering it is a family friendly restaurant. Security rudely "escorted me" out after treating me like a criminal. Now 2 years later at 20 years old I would still NEVER go back to this overpriced DUMP. Seriously calm down on the security you're not an airport. A lot of places get ruined due to their egotistical "bouncers". Plus the place was nearly dead and had poor service. I suggest you go to Playdium, or save your money and go to Tilt arcade. Anywhere but this money grab. Not to mention I was trying to enter around 9:30PM! Your security is a bunch of pathetic and useless twits. Had one bald guy laugh and give me a snide smirk after explaining to him that I wasn't even drinking. I wish I could give it a -10 review. SECURITY WILL HARASS YOU

Went there in a party of 3 around 7pm. We got seated right away despite it being pretty busy. I ordered the beached in a bowl fishbowl. The fishbowl comes with 3oz of alcohol for $14.99 and comes in a variety of flavours. Beaches in a bowl contains: Malibu rum, blue curaçao, pineapple and mango. To go with the fishbowl i ordered a pan bread with no cheese, something i had been looking forward to all day. Our waitress promptly tells our table they are sold out of pan bread. Confused i ask how that was possible, it's bread can they not just make more? she said it takes 90 minutes. I said that was fine i still wanted it but she never wrote it down, she also never apologized for not having it or suggest something else to eat in the meantime. We ended up getting nachos which were ok, very forgettable. We never got the pan bread despite being there over two hours. I'm a big jack Astor's fan but this trip was a major let down.

Never again! Used to be a regular customer here and couldn't say enough great things about The Rec Room...now my friends and I will never visit this place again, and tell our friends to steer clear.
Was here on a Friday night for a friends birthday, I had only one drink because I was driving. While coming out of the bathroom I slipped on a wet stair. Rather than noticing the obvious safety hazard and cleaning the stairs, security approached me and told me I had to leave because I was too intoxicated. I was almost too stunned to speak, and my husband who witnessed this came over to explain that I was a designated driver, and had certainly not had too much to drink, and we both pointed out the wet stairs that caused my fall. Security refused to listen and roughly escorted us out of the building as if we were criminals...they almost didn't even let us get our coats from coat check. 
Our friends witnessing this were in shock, and it was a humiliating experience to be walked through the venue, in front of (very much more intoxicated) other patrons like criminals.  Disgusting power tripping security. Will never be back.
Bonne bouffe!  Bon service!  Le steak dans min fajita bowl était tendre et délicieux, Un peu épicé.  L'ambiance était excellente!

Favourite place in Toronto so far. 

Came with my 11 year old son, we got a deal for 35 dollars and we were here for 2 hours, 3 including our meal.  He too a turn on the void VR which was an extra 40 dollars, I found it a little pricey but he loved it!

Horrible service, we asked to be moved to a different table before we sat because it was directly in the light and the table wasn't cleaned properly. Host put down our menus said a rude comment and left. Then it took them 15 minutes to serve us water and our waiters were very demeaning. 
Otherwise nice patio area that looks out at the city and okay food 
Would not recommend this location though as staff are unprofessional, at least the people who served us today.

Food literally has no taste. Decor is quite nice service was decent. The lady manger made me feel a little uncomfortable with her walking up and down the empty restaurant. If the food tasted better I'd def go back. But for lack of taste I'll stick to union social.

Been here a few times and this place is MASSIVE.  Tons of seating..if you have a large party - this is the place to go. We had our Superbowl party here and not an issue. We got the more private rooms in the back...way way back.  

There are so many games you can play in here...you'll never get bored.  For a place this big, the amount of staff they have is amazing - service was never really slow or lacking, especially considering it was a full house Superbowl night. 

This of this place as a slightly more upscale place than Dave & Busters.

Great place to come by for some food and drinks if you are in the area. Very friendly and accommodating staff. My waitress modified one of the drinks I requested due to a personal allergy. She was extremely kind about it and not rude at all- even asked me for a back up drink in case they couldn't modify my first choice. I for sure recommend trying any of the Fishbowl drinks they have. All of them are quite tasty and they even have a sampler with four different varieties. Speaking of drinks they have a great selection of beer on tap and a decent amount of cocktails if that's what you prefer. Overall a great place to visit on a sunny day out or with colleagues after work.

Was a great spot to watch UFC at, since they have a big screen that comes down and 60+ TVs around the restaurant. I've been here a couple times now and the food has always been to die for! This time I got the beef dip with a salad and the beef was very tender. The staff was friendly and very accommodating, and kept up with the tables pretty well considering how busy it was. 

My first time coming I got the BBQ whisky beef melt and it was to die for! Probably going to be one of our main places to got to watch sports events! Prices were reasonable and foods always delicious.

Coming from the states, this is kind of like Dave and Busters but better. The games were fun and there were multiple bars so getting a drink was easy. We went on a Friday night and it was pretty packed. The food and service were pretty average. We would definitely come back though.

One of my favourite "go to" places to eat. Service is always great (even had the manager come around to say hello to guests a few times) and haven't tried any food I haven't loved. You can tell they really care about food and their customers. Go for Saturday brunch and try the caramelized banana French toast or the steak, eggs and hash browns. In the evening the pasta is fantastic, the steak done really well and the hamburgers are everything you're looking for. Worth the visit!

Draft drinks were served upsized which we ended up paying for - should have asked when we first thought the cups seemed bigger. Calamari and pizza were under seasoned and lukewarm.  We were there for mentalist show (2/5) and not the arcade. At least they are consistent.

---

And we didn't get any popcorn!

Yeah, just don't come here for food, or drinks. 

Free coat check was nice and the app they use is pretty modern and the games were just OK. There's always a wait for popular games (as expected) but I'm not sure why they have the pool and ping pong and foosball table at the back. On 3 separate occasions, there was an event that completely restricted people from going to even play it. As for the games, they're well maintained so no issues there.

The food though? Lol. Friend ordered a medium steak and it came out cold, grey, and well done. He had them take the steak away but then found a hair in his sides. Forget it, switched to a burger instead. I ordered the short ribs and it was sad tasting. Who decided to have asian inspired dishes without cooking it properly? It was also cold, grill marks but no char (how..).

And drinks? Expensive and busy and interesting. My friends sat at the bar and ordered a couple rounds. Some other patrons came and sat beside us an ordered one round and were immediately given complementary popcorn lol. What the hell.

While in Toronto for a long weekend, we went here tonight(Sat night in Sept) the food was mediocre at best. I heard a security guard describe it as "an Applebee's" and I thought, he is right! I had the Cobb salad which included chicken that I swear was turkey and so dry it was gross. 

The arcade: Also, the only reason this review is a 4/5. There are so many games and very reasonably priced that it makes this place awesome! I would consider this much nicer than a Dave & Busters.

To management: The service and food really need work. If you get that in order, 5/5 for sure!

Finally went to the Rec Room Downtown Toronto for my nephew's 6th birthday. My honest opinion overall it was...eh...okay. When we walked in the place looked big however when we finally got a chance to walk around the aisles were a little small and there weren't as many games as I hoped. However there was a large dinning area. We went for a Saturday lunch around 1:30ish. There was plenty of seating however we still had to wait for a seat. When were were seated we waited quite sometime to for our waiter to attend to us. It was a little disappointing seen as how there weren't a lot of people eating at that time. When we ordered our food, it again took quite some time to arrive. 

For our lunch we ordered a Cobb Salad, Chicken Lettuce Wrap, Large Pretzel, Ceasar Salad, Salmon and Avocado Sandwich, Calamari and Stacked Taco Chips to share. The food was just okay. The best thing I enjoyed the most was the real large pieces of bacon in the salad....yummm it was delicious. Otherwise, nothing special about our food.

I guess this is mainly just a place to have some drinks and chat. There were some TVs around but not large TVs.

Well now I can say I finally went and I probably only go back if my nephew wants to go back for the games.

First time here were from outta town so we were looking for somethin to eat and we found this nifty spot with a arcade as well for dinner we had the southern chicken sandwhich split in two as well as a side of wings I MUST ADD THE DIP THAT CAME WITH THE WINGS WAS GREAT IDK IF IT WAS A BLUE CHEESE RANCH BLEND BUT IT WAS SPECTACULAR

Jack Astor's, always something on the menu to please everyone. We came here for a show at the ACC, this JA was the perfect place located nearby for our group to duck in for a quite bite and drinks afterwards. Had the nachos which were good, not complex but still done well. This region fills up quickly so were were lucky to be able to walk in and find a table immediately. The server we had was spot on and the food arrived very quickly! Hit the spot.

Came here during game 2 of the NBA finals and it was one of the best experiences I had watching a game outside of my house. Our party of 4 came 2 hours before the game and still managed to get a decent seat to view from - yet alone get seats as there was a huge crowd later who would have to stand in the bar section to watch. Aside from the complimentary popcorn, we ordered one pizza and a plate of popcorn chicken with chipotle sauce. I only had the pizza but I thought it was above the many pizzas you'd receive from an entertainment establishment - it had mozzarella cheese, arugula, sausage, and grilled bell peppers. 

Being only a walk from the Scotiabank arena this is the place to be to watch a Toronto game if Jurassic park isn't your thing. Aside from that, they have a huge array of games to play one of my favourites being their 4-person Mario Kart.

Awful experience. We entered and were told it was 45 minutes for a table or you can sit at the bar. We sat at the bar but got no service for 20 minutes. Then when we wanted the check we were ignored. Game area was full of drunk idiots hogging game machines. The place needs to know when to cut people off and the waiters can not favor other people because they are more attractive than other customers.

It's a favourite of mine! The location is great, especially the patio. Inside is normally pretty dark, but I think that's the vibe they are going for.

The fishbowls are amazing, definitely recommend! They are a little pricey, but it's a fun drink you could even share if you wanted (most people don't).

I always get the Buddha Salad and sub the chicken for tofu. It's a great salad, there are fruits and nuts, and the tofu adds a little kick of spice. 

My boyfriend loves the Holy Smoke BBQ Burger with Parmesan Truffle Fries. The fries are a premium side, but are amazing. Not too salty, but the flavour is great!

We really wanted to spend a lazy Saturday afternoon on a patio, and one of our friends suppresses The Rec Room. The patio was super cool, we were right under the CN Tower, and beside the train museum. That was the great part, it only got worse from there. It took our waitress 20 minutes to come over to see what we would like to drink, then another 20 minutes to come back with our drinks. We ordered food, then after 30 minutes we were told that we could not order from their regular menu and only their patio menu. It took an hour and a half for us to receive our cold food. If you're going for drinks I would suggest the patio, if you want food, go inside the service and selection is much better

Came here last night to catch up with a friend. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Got some nachos, a pitcher of beer, and shots of tequila. I was not impressed by the food (I had a stomach ache at night due to old ingredients). Our waitress was blonde and had a really bad botox job on her lips (they were uneven). She didn't look me in the eye for the entire duration of our meal. She barey checked up on us and everything came out super slow. I don't understand why it takes 15-20 mins to pour a pitcher of beer. It was also very loud so I felt like i had to yell to talk to my friend. It was a waste of $39 that could have gone elsewhere. There are many places like Kelly's Landing across the street with better waiters and a quieter atmosphere.

Came by on a Friday night for some dessert. It is probably one the best kept secrets as a place for a quiet dinner. It is quite easy to get a table and there are many TV's around to catch a sporting game. We came by for some chocolate cake and was not disappointed with this chocolatey goodness.

Was visiting here from the states.. Sat at the bar Jonathan was Great!! I ordered the for starters I love Peach and the "Peach Don't Kill My Vibe" was outta this word OMG!!! So good! I ordered the beef ribs I believe... it was so juicy and tender, I could probably cut through the meat with a butter knife it was so tender... Great Experience overall!

What can I say!!!! This place has the best STAFF on the planet! They were super friendly and kept us entertained. The food is sooooo on point and the fries were magical! I only wish we had something this awesome near me in the states!
Great time with the family at this place...   food was good and drinks were good too...  large screen TV to watch some sports going on.

Came here with my entire team to celebrate a
Staff members birthday.  They are still relatively new and the service reflected it with a few mix ups of orders and a longer than usual wait for our food. However generally the space is conducive to large group gatherings and the pricing of lunch specials (half price wings on Thursday's) are good enough to make us come back at a later time.

If I had to sum up my experience with two words, it would be 'Zero Flavor'.

Great location, friendly staff but all the food tasted bland. Each meal with the exception of the kids meals is a minimum $17 and the taste, well....there is no taste.

I ordered the 'Chicken Clubhouse's and it had absolutely zero seasoning.  My friend ordered the 'Classic Ceasar' and at first glance you couldn't even see the salad dressing. It was completely watered down. For the kids meal we ordered the chicken bites and a cookie for dessert. Both items had no seasoning and no flavor.

How do you ruin a chocolate chip cookie? It was hard and flavourless. Almost as if it had been sitting around for a couple of days.

I don't know if I will go back to Jack Astor's but I definitely won't go back to this location.

Sorry JACK!

Horrible food, terrible service, low life crowd. Perhaps if I purge my stomach I will forget the experience. Begs the question, why would anyone but an alcoholic attend such a fine establishment. Retire this bar.

Went there on a Tuesday with a party of 10 & they told us the wait would be 1.5 hours. The restaurant was empty. However Caroline outside was wonderful. The inside was empty all night!  Poor customer service. We would have their biggest bill for the night!  Their loss!!

Visited during Toronto International Auto Show event yesterday, approx 1:30pm.
Ordered a burger with bacon, and the wife had a chicken wrap. Both orders with fries. The burger was cold, had a stale slice of tomato. The bun was very cold as if it came out of the fridge or something. The chicken wrap was also cold. Server was polite but overall the food quality was very poor. Also ordered a bottle of beer with a chilled glass, the glass came wet and with water in it and the bottle of beer was cool not cold. How hard is it to server beer with a chilled glass ? ! The food we ordered was inferior both in quality and preparedness compared to a fast food place. We still provided a 15% tip on a $51 bill because we're good customers even if it was the worst downtown dining experience experienced ever !

Had lunch today with 3 other friends after visiting the car show. 
Service was quick, our waiter was pleasant and friendly.
Food portion was small and not very tasty at all.
Would not recommend!

This review is only about the venue and the games itself.

Came here last night with my friends, had high hopes of playing fun games, but a lot of the games were mediocre. I liked the fact that they got rid of the "ticket" system and everything is stored digitally in your wrist card - though you could lose it easily if you don't tie it tight enough...

My friends and i walked around the place and pretty much played with each game once. There's not much variety compared to Dave and Buster's or my childhood favourite ~pLaYdIuM~. A lot of the games were out of service when we went. Like the air hockey, some shooter games were glitchy and didn't allow us to move forward. The arcade area was really cramped, and it was hard to navigate through the crowds of drunk adults. 

Had a Daura Damm at the bar - which I'm so grateful for because of my gluten intolerance. Not a lot of places have options for gluten free/removed beers. I keep reading reviews where the food here is good though, but a bit pricey. Maybe i'll try that the next time, since i have a couple credits leftover from my card.

Wow this place is really cool.

It's super loud and lively during game time and they have really good food.

We tried the mesquite BBQ wings, nachos, and poutine.

Everything was really good. Have you ever had nachos where there were not enough chips for all the toppings? Neither had I until we ate here. Yum! 

We all loved the poutine we had to order more. The gravy was herb-y, I think it was thyme that they used in there, it was really unique and really tasty. 

The beer was flowing constantly, and even though that place was chaotic, our waitress checked up on us all the time, always got our orders right... she was soooo professional. Woooow!

We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures. Definitely recommend this place, craving their poutine right now!

The restaurant is very spacious. The bar area is very inviting, makes you really want to have a drink here. The dining area is also spacious with lots of TVs. It is also great for larger groups.

We are surprised to find that it's not busy all during lunch time. 

We ordered the Tuna Poke and Fettuccini Mushroom. The food came relatively fast. The portion is not big but is reasonably priced. The taste of both is good, not spectacular. 

It's not a bad place to have a company function or with larger groups. The best thing about this place is it's spacious layout, not the food.
Had my wallet stolen there in early September.  Staff was uninterested in helping me find it or identifying the potential suspects.  Won't be back.

I'm visiting Atlanta Georgia and found this spot on Yelp. It's NFL draft night and I the staffer found the game for me. 

The wings were tender, no tender and good! I'm a wing fanatic and they were off the chain!
Food is ok, pretty decent pub food. Definitely a good destination to catch a game. It's god a great pub feel and everyone is always friendly.

This was probably the coolest game bar I have been to. For Americans, I would compare it to a Dave & Busters, but a little more upscale. They definitely cater more to the food and beverage side, and the place was HUGE! 

We came here after dinner, so we didn't try out any of their food menu. I did take a peak at it, and saw that they do have a lot of options. The place was also very busy, and people seemed to be really enjoying their meals. 

We stopped at the bar and grabbed a drink, and then took our second one with us as we explored the game section. They had A TON of different games to choose from, so we decided to buy some credits and have fun!!
You get a bracelet that keeps track of how many credits you have, and you can also reload them at any time. 

We stayed for a couple of hours, and then cashed in our winnings for a prize at the shop on the way out. They have some pretty cool prizes, but we weren't THAT good, and settled for a bath bomb lol. 

Overall, this place was super fun and definitely perfect for a date night, family affair, or just a cool spot to hang with friends! I would recommend 100%!

At the risk of sounding basic, I was pleasantly surprised by the Rec Room.

Right off the bat, they have a terrific location going for them being situated by Rogers Centre and inside the old Roundhouse. It's very nice inside and also massive. The layout effectively has three areas: 1) video games closest to the entrance 2) general dinning area in the centre 3) Big  screen with stadium seating at the back.

On video games alone, it might just be a '3'. There's still quite a good number of games, but it could be far better if they didn't have so many ones solely focused on winning tokens. I'm not even just talking about skeet ball (which is classic), but probably two dozen games that have little to do beyond luck and hoping to win a jackpot - basically glorified slot machines.

The event area in the back was quite impressive and the projector screen was massive. There are also seating areas off to the side a bit out of the action and not facing the main screen. Each table is paired with a fairly standard size screen. It would be fine depending on what someone was looking for, though that didn't seem to be clearly communicated to our group in advance as we thought we'd be facing the big screen.

I was really impressed by the food. That was in due part that I had low expectations, but all things equal, the food all seems to be prepared fresh and not "fresh out of the freezer". I even thought the value was pretty good considering it's location. IMO, they do better than a lot of the other chain restaurants in the downtown core and even some other stand-alone locations. Pretty good beer menu too.

Service was exceptional and we were checked in on regularly throughout the 3+ hours we were there (it was the Superbowl).
This place is awesome, it has a huge bar and dining area. Along with varies amount of arcade games. It is located right near the train museum by the CN tower! Had a great time

Average Bar - been here multiple times as I work close by and my colleagues love to come here to snack and have a drink. 

The one thing I always get is the chicken fingers and fries. I would upgrade the fries to truffle fries, yum!

Came here to play a couple of games with my fiancé and decided to stick around for some apps and drinks. The rec room is part of the Cineplex company but elevated; it's fully licensed with plenty of arcade games to play.

We ordered one of the Belgian wheat ales, their skillet tortilla "nachos" and their pork belly baos.
The Belgian wheat ale was definitely lighter than shock top or Belgian moon, and had hints of chamomile. I always judge a good bar by the type of orange they provide with, and for Belgian wheat I expect an actual orange wedge. Unfortunately they don't provide orange wedges, only orange half-wheels. Lots of citrus flavours of notes which I enjoy, however lots of places including this one do not include the proper orange wedge which makes if fall short for drinks

The skillet "nachos" was interesting; Instead of tortilla chips they were actuall full-circled tortillas baked and layered with various cheese sauces and toppings. I ordered it with the pulled chicken, however be sure to ask for it dressed in a sauce like bbq otherwise it would just come dry. I didn't expect the nachos to be so small for the price, especially since Cineplex VIP cinemas nachos are comparatively the same price however the nachos come LOADED with toppings and cheese.

The "baos" were average but nothing special. It had the addition of pickles which isn't traditional and did not add to the dish, rather the pickling overpowered the steamed baos and the pork belly. The Bao itself was very thick and the ratio of meat-to-Bao was very off. Too much Bao, too little meat. In no way does it compare to a traditional pork Bao however it was a good attempt at a fusion food and I can see how it can be popular with some people.
Great neopolitan pizzas! The chef is very passionate about his food being authentic. The atmosphere is very casual and home-y.

Popped into this bar one Saturday night to catch the leaf game. One of the best places to watch a sports game in the city in my opinion. Lots of TVs, great atmosphere and friendly servers that ensure your beer is never empty. 

Only downside is getting a table. The place is very popular - so make sure you arrive early if possible. There is standing room available. 

For food we split some appetizers, but recommend getting any of their nachos. Perfect for splitting between 2/3 people.
Went after a lax game and it was really good! Had a great server! Only thing was a couple girls were yelling but besides that it was great!

Came here last week and wasnt a good experience. our server (cant remember his name - he had a british accent) was sort of rude and looked to be in a rush the whole time - well get to that later. As for the food, mediocre at best. Fries were cold and over cooked and the burger was dry. I request extra cheese but it came with no cheese at all and since our server seems to busy i didnt bother to mention. Near the end of the meal it all made sense. We witnesses our server giving some of the cusotmers small baggies, but couldnt tell what it was. Then the table beside us also recieved one and it was clearly filled with white powder. I geuss this place is concentrates their efforts more on narcotic profits then is does on being an honest business. Will not return.

I don't post frequently but want to put out a warning to others who might be curious to check this place out. Don't.
Unless of course an utter s***show is what you consider to be a fun time.
The major issue is the set up around the gift store and purchasing area. Essentially this section is total chaos. No defined queues for purchasing (where they have just the one point of sale system) and the prize redemption registers (which there are two of). After waiting in the queue to make a purchase I finally made it to the front I was at a redemption register and that I'd have to go and wait for the girl working the purchasing register. When I expressed my frustration at the situation I was curtly told that it wouldn't of been an issue if I'd been in the correct queue. When I enquired as to how I would know that due to lack of any signage they simply shrugged. So yeah, don't do it.

Union Social can do no wrong!
The food is great, as is the staff!
Full of positive vibes !

My flight arrived late in Toronto and so rather than order the hotel room service I decided to try Jack Astor's through Skip the Dishes. This was a regrettable mistake. I chose to go for the seared tuna rice bowl because I wanted something healthy and it was late so I wanted something light. Unfortunately, Jack Astor's was busy and they kept repeatedly deferring my order - 3 times to be precise, and when it arrived (after about 2 hrs) the tuna was so badly over cooked and the food was in such a mayo-saucy-mess (hardly healthy or presentable) that I found myself wondering if they had deliberately made it this way, and if so, what else would the cooks do to the food?  

I couldn't eat it, and all I can think of is the just the waste this whole evening has created.

Not interested in eating here, sure it's FINE...
As far as a bar, simple; tv and alcohol.  More locals, so better vibe.

Came for dinner...Ordered the poutine which was cold...cheese beer soup was cold....chicken wrap with goat cheese was good after taking the overage of lettuce in it out.  Caesar salad had ONE crouton and hardly any dressing.  No salt or pepper on the tables.  Waitress never came to check on us during the meal after food was dropped at our table.  Really disappointing dinner.

Newly opened in the North York area, this restaurant has lots of seating and tv screens to watch your games. Their menu includes all of your usual comfort foods and drinks, and they're all averaged priced. While tonight's Valentine's special included a steak, it would be nice to have it available on a regular basis.

Its an OK place with OK food. Lots of space for bigger groups no problem getting a table (because no one is in there even on Saturday evening) and lots of TVs with sports in the bar area. Good selection of drinks and draft. Service was decent. 

But food wasnt anything special. Brisket was good but not as good as the top BBQ places in the city. Crabcakes were not bad. Fish tacos were also ok but could have used a little more spice. Everything was maybe $2 or $3 more than it really should be. I guess they have to pay prime rent for such a big space and that cost gets passed on to the customers. 

If youre looking for this kind of food in the area and you have a big group and dont want to go to a crowded place Rally will work well for you. But this hood has so many food choices i cant see this place surviving based on what they have to offer.

We stayed at the fairmount hotel during our stay and wanted to eat somewhere near the hotel with the whole family.

We saw Jack Astor's while heading out and gave it a try. 

The staff is very friendly and we had a great time there.
 
The price is very reasonable even for the drinks. The food was very good too.

You should try it.
This place has amazing fries. Bartender was awesome and went above and beyond! Thanks!

Good atmosphere; especially if you are independent of the need to ask for help (from a staff member).

Good ground-level patio.

Beyond meat.
The food was great, the staff was great, overall the restaurant was really professional and a great place to hangout.

We were at Dog and Bear on Saturday night and the place was packed. Had to wait for 15 min at the door. Overall, we had a good time and the food was decent, I got the roasted red pepper sandwich with french fries and gravy and enjoyed it. Good beer selection. The downside is that the place is quite dirty, I stepped into some spilled drink on my way to the table and the table itself was quite sticky. Yet, it's a good place to watch a sports game if you are not too picky about cleanness.

Jacks is always a good time, their servers are fun and some are really entertaining. We went to this location for a friends birthday. We ordered some chicken parmigiana, salmon with jasmin rice and I got the holy smoke burger that I substituted with the veggie patties. This wasn't as delicious as I had hoped it would be. This burger was meant to be eaten with real meat patties, it makes a huge difference. The vegetarian menus they have on the menu are fantastic options, I highly recommend you try those, rather than doing what I did. I also didn't like that they only give you the second patty for the veggie sandwich when you ask to jack up the burger. They said the veggie patties are heavier so they only give you one patty. 
The salmon was cooked to perfection, it was moist and flavourful. The pasta was also delicious, the bow ties are one of my favourite shapes. At the end of the meal we had the servers sing the birthday song, and they brought us a brownie with whipped cream and a sparkler. Jacks I think is a little on the pricier end, but straight off the menu items have worked well for myself and my friends in the past, I would stick to that with very little mods.

Came here a couple times for the Raptors games. Overall a good atmosphere with lots of beers on tap. I especially liked their specials. The only reason why this is not a 4/5 is because the couches seemed a little dated.
The customer service at this place is horrible! There is a bald headed 'manager' who was rude and not accommodating to our group. I would not recommend spending any money at this venue!

This place requires you to be a Jack@$$ to appreciate it. Sorry folks there was little to speak highly of. 

Let's start with the ambience ... you can sit inside in a bar or on the street. You pick, but the lesser of two evils would suggest going across the street.  

Drinks are fine. The fishbowls are a cute idea if you are looking for a sugar high, drinking more than the bladder can handle and booze that you can't taste. The beer flights are a cool idea, too bad the beers taste like I brewed it in my bath tub. If you want water bring your own (keep reading I will explain later). 

Food is edible. The bowls have plenty of rice, not so much taste. The salad is a full bowl of lettuce but certainly not much more. Kids food is more like what is served at a military academy ... over cooked and flavorless. 

So why should you bring your own water you ask?? Service. Simply said, service. It is so easy to give good service, and they miss the mark consistently. Nothing is served together, it comes with out a smile and basically "who got this" as opposed to something more enticing. 

One positive. The chocolate cake comes with kettle corn. That was a nice treat ... hopefully they can build on that. 

In conclusion Jack@$$ters is fine if you keep you expectations low and are not hungry.

Went here yesterday Saturday as part of our Toronto city adventure trip. We got there at 11pm and it was packed, they have decent games, almost everyone is playing, it's easy to bump into people because of the closeness of the arcades. 
The cocktails are sooooo weak, I got a "living my best life" signature cocktail and I swear I didnt taste a drop of vodka, it just tasted like iced sugar juice. Same for my husband's drink he got one of the signature mules and it just tasted spicy. We paid $23 cad for both. 
We werent able to go to the back where the dance floor would be. 
All in all fun ambience, but probably wouldn't recommend drinking at at the bar unless youre getting beer, wine or shots.
Was amazing. Can spend a wonderful time with family with a reasonable budget. Worth trying.

I would rate Jack Astor's a little higher than your average bar, but it's still just your average bar chain.

After a long day in the city, a local from Toronto suggested we go to Jack Astor's (since we had no idea where we wanted to go.) Upon arrival, we were immediately seated. We ordered the wings and quesadillas. Our food arrived relatively fast. The quesadillas were pretty good, would order again. The guacamole was also memorable. The wings were a nice interactive touch as the waiter tossed then in the sauce right in front of us. Overall pleasant experience, would recommend! 

(My friends actually went back two nights in a row primarily for the quesadillas.)
I'm so happy that I chose this place to meet my friend for lunch! Amazing food with amazing price! This is a must stop for Italian in Etobicoke!

The orders are overpriced compared to the serving size. Food presentation is of expected high standard. Serving time is longer than acceptable. The waitress that attended to us is not at all jolly and accommodating. You would feel that she's into the work just to get paid. One does not get the welcoming and hospitality vibe from her.

The Rec Room is a great place to hang out and have fun if you are there for the first time. After a few times, it seems to get a little boring. I think it would be a good place to watch a sport game though.

This place made me decide that from now on, anytime I go out to eat, I'm taking my own napkin and cutlery with me. Early into my visit, I witnessed one of the staff grind a bunch of cheese from the table side cheese grater into her hand, work it into a ball, look around to see if anyone was watching and then popped it in her mouth. What made it worse was she then picked up cutlery freshly wrapped in napkins and moved them from one spot at a work station to another. She didn't wash her hands before doing this. I was disgusted and now realize that I don't know who or what has handled the cutlery that I use at a restaurant and will be bringing my own from now on. The staff at this place were so annoying except for my waitress. As soon as I entered the building, the "Hostesses" (who just stand around talking) heard that it was just me in my party so just waved their hand dismissively towards the tables I could sit at. I sweated myself. My waitress was good, friendly and chatty and checked in on me often. There was a ton of staff that would stand at this one work station and talk and open the service only door. They did this a couple of times for no reason and it blasted cold air and wind towards me since I was sitting right there. They were throwing vinegar bottles to each other and talking about plans after work. It really turned me off. Overall, the food was good and the server I had was good. It was the other staff that turned me off. If it wasn't for them, I would have rated higher.
There is a lot going on with the arcade and the bar, but I found the food to be pretty decent. I got the pesto noodles and had a few slices of pizza, which was very heavy. Overall decent experience

This should be a zero.
So I am sharing this as I live locally and have frequented this location many times - it is your basic pub/bar.  Great for watching sports and catching up with friends.  But...a family member of mine went to this bar, a wonderful and amazing woman in her mid-thirties...a professional health care worker...and someone that does not ever get in trouble...EVER!  And she called me at 2am last night (as I was home working all night) extremely upset and shaken...she was at the Dog and Bear for her friend's birthday but was sitting at the bar watching basketball and having a drink keeping to herself and out of nowhere a bouncer came up behind her and said "you are the chosen one" and physically grabbed her and removed her from the bar and threw her into a back alley...for absolutely NO reason.  She was not drunk. She was not talking to anyone.  She was having a drink and watching basketball and then was physically assaulted by a bouncer.  First, Dog and Bear I plead with you to respond to this as my friend, a young woman, was 1. Physically assaulted by one of your employees and 2. As a young woman you put her in danger throwing her out of the bar into a dark back ally.  This is such a shame while also completely disgusting...as I have frequented this place enough to know that there are all sort of drunks and loud guests...there are street people who harass you and you enter and exit the place, and I have never seen anyone asked to leave so that this happened to her is both terrifying and disgusting.  You have lost my patronage and I will certainly be warning all women I know in the area and their partners about this incident.

Terrible food! Overpriced drinks and disgusting service! We ordered a variety of dishes including a pizza and every one of them was bland, plus the pizza was soggy. The Italian owner/chef is arrogant and rude and spends most of his time feeling up his girlfriend. Much better places to spend less money in for higher quality.

It was an okay experience, not bad not good.

Very nice atmosphere and service, the problem is the food potion size for the price of the food. For what you pay I believe you should get way more. That being said its nice to go to in a hot summer day for a couple of drinks, and I would defiantly recommend it for that. But not just for the food.

We came here for a friend's birthday party. We both got the killer chicken sandwich, but boy were we disappointed. The chicken sandwich tasted like a dry piece of chicken with a bit of bbq sauce. We were really expecting a decent meal for the price that we paid, but we got a sad little chicken sandwich. We won't be returning again unless we have to for another gathering.

Happy hour is great for drinks but watch your bill on food. The price is different from the the menu which the server acknowledged, gave some bs reason and then removed the extra charges. 

Assuming either the server adding these then removing once the customer pays, pocketing the difference - or restaurant wide practice
