This is slowly becoming my go-to place to watch live fights. It's not OVERLY busy and not dead either. The drink choices are more than fair and the food is delicious! Service is always friendly with a smile.

Yes, the famous Jack Astor's. Funny how this used to be my ultimate favourite bar and grill restaurant. Then I started to notice the food quality was going downhill. 
On my last visit (Wednesday) the servers were clumsy. One of them was quite rude to me by giving an attitude, and I was just asking her about a dish they brought out that I didn't order.
Would not come back, at least not this location.

This is a great, casual bar. There are some game tables in the back, which make for some fun activities (especially this neat shuffleboard-type one) plus a bunch of screens if you want to watch some sports. 

We usually come here just for drinks, but the Hubster and I came for dinner the other day and man, it did not disappoint. Their wings are quite good, but the big winner were the kimchi fries. They. Are. FANTASTIC. They were so good that I actually kind of neglected the wings (sacrilege!) I would go back for those alone. My friends who are regulars say that all the food is great and that they dine there often. 

Definitely a great spot for a casual hang out with drinks and food.

This is a family-friendly restaurant/pub. Kids can play arcades while parents drinking. I have ordered a hamburger and requested "No pickles", and my friend asked another hamburger without any request. However, the server brought mine with pickles and friend's with no pickles. Additionally, my son's coke never came until we asked again.

Games are great but tokens aren't cheap. It's overall a great, fun, atmosphere that's good for larger groups. If you go just for games it's cool because there are various walk-up food and drink bars. Yes - you can walk around with a drink. 

In terms of the restaurant - we did a sit-down meal here once, and the food is okay. The fish and chips and burger were big hits at the table but the healthy options (we tried 3 of I think 4 salads) were very lack-lustre. Also, it was a bit busy and the service was crazy slow! Our server disappeared after dropping off menus and we had to get a busser's attention to go get her for us. That was a bit disappointing. 

We'd come back, just maybe aim for a weekday or less busy time (better for not having to wait for games too!)

A for atmosphere! We sat on the patio in the cool train station. After a long day if walking, we read the reviews and decided to try it. We walked through total loud zone arcade to sit on the patio. The server was extremely slow. Let me just say we asked for utilities, yes needed those to eat, she brought them out and then had to go back for napkins. OK, back to sitting on the patio, she said ya down and gave us the "inside menu" in addition to the patio menu. Of course we like the outside patio menu and their response "you can't order from that! We just give you that for drinks menu." OK r u serious!! Bait and switch! Print a new drink
Menu or offer both menus. We ended up ordering from the "correct" menu while meanwhile the table next to us out smarted them and got the pizza to go and ordered drinks outside. Pissed me off but good for them. How ridiculous to show ya multiple menus and then tell the customer "no!" Number one rule in customer service NEVER TELL THE CUSTOMER NO! Ok you can see why I'm unhappy. Thank goodness the atmosphere was cool because the food was just OK. We split a burger which was OK, the kids got a salad and they forgot the grilled chicken (needed GF) and got the grilled chicken sandwich. Once again all OK. If you want a cool place for drinks, this is your place but go somewhere else if you want good food. They need to make some adjustments.

This place was so good!!! The service was amazing. We were cold outside so the waitress turned a heater on for us which really warmed us up. The view was beautiful! The waiter found out it was my birthday and brought me a dessert but didn't cause a scene or sing any songs to me because he told me he could tell "I'm lowkey/didn't want a scene" which was so true and I appreciated so much! One of my pet peaves eating out on my birthday is the awkward happy birthday singing which I dislike. So he was so kind to kindly drop it on our table! The nachos were so freakin good!!! We all have our own dinners but everyone was eating the nachos more than anything else and we literally didn't leave a crumb! It was so good. The other food was great too and refills and every so often checkups were great. Loved the service. It was like $120 for 3 of us in case anyone was wondering for price references, 3 dinners, 3 drinks, an appetizer to share! Would return!

Yonge/St. Clair has many options for restaurants, etc.
I have been to Union Social Eatery on 3 separate occasions. My first 2 visits were decent and the food was good. This third visit was okay. I tried the almond-crusted chicken tenders with a side Caesar salad. The chicken had potential but needs to be marinated and the almond coating should be crispier. The Caesar salad was decent, it had the right amount of dressing. I had a Diet Coke/Pepsi to drink but it was flat. I didn't want to kick up any kind of fuss but I thought I would include these points in my review as constructive criticism. Service is usually good. Despite my seemingly minor issues, I will likely return given this restaurant's proximity to work, not to mention the 3 or 4 large screens which would make it an ideal venue to watch sports.

I'm not sure why it's not as frequented here, maybe because it's so tucked away. I like the ambience, it's great for large group events, and small get togethers. I like the nachos here, even better with adding chicken. I also surprisingly like their Brussels sprouts, fried and flavourful. Check them out if your around the yonge and sheppard area. $$

First off, The place is gorgeous!!! Numerous games and the tokens to play video games seem to last forever!

Reservation: the call in to reserve was simple and not Difficult, when we arrived I sent my friend in to check in for us while I parked. My friend told me the hostess didn't acknowledge her for close to 4 minutes and was rather rude, playing on her phone or iPad the whole time.

Service: we had a table of twelve that came in sporadically through the first 1/2 hour of our 2 hour reservation. Our sever was pretty slow and inconsistent with his timing for it not being to crazy busy. He seemed distracted and having a bad day so I can't say too much beyond that

Kitchen: our above mentioned 12 person reservation with staggered arrival made me realize how bad this kitchen is with their organization. I was the first at the venue and ordered a 6 layer tortilla thing, everyone else ordered when they arrived too ... I waited 45 minutes ... while everyone else received their food first ... it happens I guess but I did expect a better timing on a simple dish

Beverages were a great selection, a tad pricy but you have to expect that for the location and such

Now; to the food:

Good
- burgers looked and tasted amazing, cooked perfectly
- pizza was phenomenal, great topping layout and even sauce distribution 
- falafel was great, filling and very tasteful!

Bad
- Cesar salad was literally lettuce, croutons and a dollop of dressing. No flavour.
- the rainbow salad was expensive and lacked creativity and flavour .. it was just an over priced veggie tray basically 
- 6 layer tortilla appetizer seemed like it was a combat back from old El Paso that you can buy for you house for 2.99 at metro. It was bland and soggy 


In closing, I would definitely go back to try their burgers and video game but only if I didn't have anything better to do

I went to Rec Room this past Saturday and I was disappointed in how much space was given for the arcade games. I expected more games but the space was 20% games and 80% lounge/ eating space. The price is fairly good for credits aka tokens to play the games. HOWEVER, I had my phone STOLEN from my jacket pocket that I had on me. So make sure you have everything on you in a safe place so pick pocketers don't steal yo shit. 

While I was looking for my stolen phone I also lost my wristband that had 200+ credits on it and the lady at the front who sold me the wristband said she couldn't do anything except give me 15% off another purchased wristband which is CRAZY. 

Thankfully another employee who saw me crying called the manager and he was able to reimburse me a small amount of credit. He told me I should have registered 
My band but I never even heard of registration because no one told me! 

I asked him why they didn't tell everyone to register and he said because most people come back know about it. Rec room is in the middle of the most touristy area and your telling me most people who go know about registeration?? I also did not get my phone back.
I've tasted 4 different mains, 1 appetizer and 1 dessert. The food looked good but tasted bland. The service was good.

Went to a game at the Rogers Center and stopped in here after to let traffic dye down. It was very neat inside. Slot of stuff to do. You can play video games, eat, drink, or shop in their little store. Glad we stopped in. We did but eat here. The bartenders did not smile, and only seemed to wait on us when they felt like it. We weren't allowed to run a tab, so we had to keep paying after every round. Didn't like that too much either, but oh well. I would go back here if I was the area.

This Friday night second time we went there with my friend. Around 1:56 am we were outside for smoke. When we try to get in security dont give permission our friends and stuff were inside. If is closing they should say first. My boyfriend said our friends and stuff inside security said she will stay i will come with you. i stayed outside. my bf went with security when my bf reach our place he push him to until out it is physical abuse we didnt do any thing bad other securities say sorry. but it will not change anything. it is super annoying. All of us human we try to kind everyone he abuse us please somebody find solution for that. He cant behave anyone like that. People going out for having fun not abusing. we dont make anything wrong i will never go this place again but other people dont deserve to experience such a bad thing like that! Thank you interest

The Rec Room is located at the most western part of the historical train roundhouse on the south side of Brenmer between Rees and Simcoe across the street from the Ripley's aquarium.

I've never been to Steam Whistle and I've never been to the Rec Room.  In fact I barely have been on the grounds where all those small trains have been on the southside of Brenmer so I really had no idea of this place.

One of my friends decided to host a little get together at the Rec Room for the Superbowl so it was my first time and the place is really kind of cool.  It reminds me sort of a Dave and Busters and for the downtown core, this place has an absolutely huge footprint.  While there's multiple dining areas, a large dedicated game watching area and an arcade with a tickets rewards system it very well is like a grown up version of Chuck E Cheese.

The games are accessed via wristbands which are loaded near the main entrance with a variety of pricing for credits.  Games have different pricing so the Indy simulator takes something like 20 credits (equivalent to 5 bucks on the lowest plan) and some only take 5 or so.  Basically these coin up type games are all revenue connected via their pay system network so there's no actual money required at the games themselves, just the wristband swipe to deduct credits to play the games.  The games are quite contemporary as well.  Higher def screens, up to date games and the kind of games you won't see or play on a home console type system.  Other games of chance are the kind of games where an accumulation of tickets are traded for prizes at the redemption store.  Such prizes as Pops (the collectables), candy and other toys are available.

The food varies from sharable appetizers to sandwiches, pizzas and even entrees like steak etc.  The drink menu also has a variety of cocktails beyond just beer and wine.

The area we were seated in was an area near the back but to the side so we didn't have a view of the super large projection screen but we had our own little boardroom type table with a large screen.  The back side room had about 6 of these set ups.

The food was good.  I had ordered the 310 burger which was a double burger and I added cheese and bacon.  The fries were fresh cut.  I liked the food but it wasn't cheap but it certainly wasn't poor quality.  A 60oz pitcher of Goose Island was 26 which wasn't outrageously priced.

I had a good time at the Rec Room and it's certainly a great place to have a get together especially it if involves game night for any sport.  Being that it was the Superbowl the place seemed to have Budweiser sponsoring the evening and they offered many free prizes and other promotional NFL items.
Great spot for a Saturday night out or a Sunday dinner! They have a yummy food selection and an ace beer selection. There is always a good atmosphere here!
Had a wonderful time at this place food and games what more can I say  A pizza was absolutely delicious and I love the little bags of popcorn
Been here once. Nice local bar. Beer was good. Kind of small but good for locals. Wouldn't go out of my way for it.
Good food. Server worked hard to keep us happy - super loud atmosphere. Loved the popcorn in advance and kid friendly menu. Just didn't love the noise..
This business is closed over 8 months ago.  It's an LCBO on location.    Not sure where to hit button for this for yelp IT.    Not surprised it's gone. Because the food was awful.

This location called me 48 hours before the raptors game to tell me that I had to be there for 5PM for my 8:30PM reservations. They are slapping a $50 per person (6 people) cover and entree minimum per guest. That's about $500+ They are guaranteeing themselves. What a poor business practise to change your process to boost revenue during a city unification time period. Embarrassing. Poor organizational efforts. Unable to honour time slots and no care for their patrons.

We came for a fundraising event to the downtown location on a Wednesday. Underground parking is just outside  but easily accessible by transit.
The place is huge! There was a coat check when we entered...they sent us a text with our coat check number so we didn't have to worry about losing those little pieces of paper that you normally get.
Plenty of games to keep you busy but our event was in the large area at the back. There was a stage with a band and dancers, several food stalls everywhere and a large bar on the elevated level.
I can't comment on their food as our event had food from various restaurants around the GTA.
The washrooms were clean and had several stalls and a sofa at the entrance in case you needed to rest your feet.
It's a busy, loud place with many post work groups present.

The Rec Room is located right in the middle of all these tourist's attractions is a cool concept!

We dropped by around lunch time on a Saturday afternoon to kill off some times and it was a lot of fun. I love those simple carnival games that doesn't require too much skills because I am not really good in video games. 

The arcade area as mentioned by other reviewers packed too many machines in a small area. I can imagine how uncomfortable this can get if the place is crowded. 

I didn't eat or drink here so cannot comment on the food. The patio is nicely set up with the great view of CN Tower and the Toronto downtown landscape.

I will be back for some more fun as I still have some credits left in my account.

its a great place to watch soccer or any sport really fun atmosphere during big games i remember UCL Final it was really fun to watch when you see there are supporter or your team and there supporters of opponent if you are behind or losing they cheer if you are winning then others are bitting their nails lol its fun and food is great you wont be disappointed

I was on an overnight layover in Toronto airport and took the Pearson express to Union station.  Walking out of the station, and I caught sight of this huge sign in red.  It was a huge sports bar with a large seat around bar.  I liked the bar seating.  The bartender was pretty friendly and took my order promptly.   The menu looked impressive.  I ordered a dish called Poutine.  It is basically french fries that are loaded with cheese and different condiments.  It was a pretty good dish.   For dinner I ordered steak and Ceasar salad.  The steak was well done and came with a creamy sauce.   Good enough food for a sports bar.  The bar was pretty busy with locals it seemed.   Good experience here.
The worst pizza ive ever had i cant even start to describe how bad this restaurant is and staff are not much better
Great restaurant with awesome service. The owner gave us a complimentary dessert which was amazing. Definitley recommend!

Went here for lunch before going to see the Yankees play in Toronto. Honestly we were not expecting much kinda bar food. They exceeding expectations which was nice. I got a chicken cobb salad with bacon and avocado. The Dastardly  Wife got a chicken BLT and she said it was "really good". I thought my salad was tasty (for salad anyway ). We also got beef short rib sliders with pickles and slaw. They were quite good as well. The breading on the sliders was exceptional as was the bun on the chicken BLT. The kids got chicken fingers and they were what you'd expect nothing great but nothing bad either. It is a bit pricey but it's directly across the street from the Rodgers Centre in downtown Toronto so it is what it is... All in all we'd go back.

I've been here a few times and I usually have a lot of fun with friends and/ or family! 

Recently I had the drink; Peach Don't Kill My Vibes and I thought it was good! It definitely had the peach flavour that I love but it wasn't overly sweet because of the lemonade kick that was also in there. I would recommend the drink if you like fruit drinks that don't have the harsh alcohol taste to it. 

I thought the games were fun! There were a lot of options to choose from. Me and my boyfriend also went there on the civics holiday so the fact that they were open was a plus. They also had a deal of 170 credits including the game bands for $25 where they also allowed us to use the student discount on top of that. 

Thought the employees there were really nice as well as one of the game chip in the wrist band broke so all our points were lost as we knew we had ~2800 "tickets" on it. They called their manager and she was a pleasure to talk to as she topped it off to 3000 tickets as well as added 20 credits onto the card. The man before that.... we'll let's just say that he made that fun experience only a 4 stars cause he made it sound like we took someone else wrist band because through the process of the wrist band getting passed on from employees; the credits that we checked 5 minutes ago did not match the one that he scanned. Not saying it's his fault or anything but we could have done without being accused of things. 

Was a little bit crowded and there was a wait to eat at the restaurant there so we didn't bother waiting but was still a fun experience! Would probably go again!

This Rec Room has a lot less to offer than the other rec rooms usually do. There aren't that many games, and half of them usually don't work properly, causing you to tap your card/wristband several times before realizing the machine doesn't work. The virtual reality, in my opinion was very fun but not worth it at its price. It's $40+tax per person, and you are in the simulator for about 10 minutes, where you play a game according to the film they are showing.

It was amusing walking into this arcade bar past bouncers with ear pieces, dark glasses, black suits and red ties. I'm not sure how much violence erupts over Pac Man or air hockey, so my first impression was "This place takes itself way too seriously."

I joined a large table group and, during the 90 minutes I was there, didn't talk to a waitress. You basically have to grab her to get her attention, which might be what the men-in-black-suits-and-red-ties are for. Other waiters/waitresses won't take your order. Only the one who's ignoring you will take your order. A few of us complained at our table, but the response was "Yeah, sorry about that. It's busy right now." Which would be more believable if the tables next to us weren't empty and if our waitress wasn't standing idly ignoring us whilst others at our table were paying their bill.

At the 70 minute mark I got a water glass by stealing one from the bar. The men-in-black-suits-and-red-ties didn't catch me, thankfully. Another member of our group waited over two hours for her club sandwich and it apparently arrived cold and didn't taste very good. She offered me some, but I was refusing to eat there on principle.

I thought this place would be chill like other arcade bars in the city, but nope. This place combines the worst of Entertainment District entitlement with the rip-off feeling of the CNE.

Staff extremely courteous and kind. James who I believe was one of the managers came and checked on us several times to ensure my girlfriend and I are enjoying our time and that we are satisfied with the food we ordered. 
Thank you!

Lunchtime it gets packed as opposed to the Thursday night before where there were only a quarter of the people there! I had to return because I left my wallet behind. Drinks are standard, their sandwiches look yummy. Shall definetely return.

Meh. Food was okay. Portions were small for what we paid for. Service was fine. 
Wouldn't be bothered to return.

It's fun so don't moan about it..

Love a visit here and I don't want to brag or anything but NOBODY has popped more balloons then me or dropped more balls...just don't expect to get anywhere near the dance game thing as that's usually fully packed out by some meffs who think they're on a talent show.

Snack food is decent with loads of poutine and great pizza and the beer selection is very good too

My only issue is that at 22-25$ for 2 drinks I never leave without dropping 150-200$ but then again maybe I just have no self control.

PS - feel free to give me your points as I'm saving them up for something extravagant

This was our first experience at Union Social (on St. Clair).  It was a warm night, and we were lucky to find a table by the large window that opens onto the sidewalk.  If that were not available, we would have found the place far too noisy.  (Maybe that's a reflection of our age -- 69 and 71 -- but the noise inside the restaurant when we arrived around 7:30 pm was so loud that we could not hear each other.

Service throughout the evening was agonizingly slow -- and the place was not even full.  Our drink order was taken fairly quickly -- and then seemed to have been forgotten.   We sat another 10-15 minutes before the drinks arrived.  We then placed our orders.  We started with edamame, which was excellent, and arrived in reasonable time.   Then the real waiting began.

It took ages for our main courses to arrive.  We were pretty sure they'd forgotten about us.  My wife had the curried noodle bowl (forgot the name -- maybe Panang?) and I had the fish and chips.   The wait was ridiculously, and frustratingly, long.  When the food finally arrived, our server apologized for the long delay and said the kitchen was overwhelmed with take-out orders.   One would think that the customers sitting at tables might have some kind of priority --  but not so.   A young woman who was presumably the manager on duty also came over to us to apologize for the wait (which was the right thing to do), and said she'd be back to check on us and see how everything was.   She never returned.  I did not request any special treatment, but I have to say that most restaurants would do something to compensate for a bad experience -- such as making the drinks complimentary.   Not here.

The good news:  my wife did like the noodle bowl.   Unfortunately, no such luck for the fish and chips.  The fish itself was devoid of any taste, and the batter was also almost tasteless.  Tried adding lots of lemon but it didn't help.

Finally, we finished, and waited for our bill.  This also took a very long time, despite the fact that I kept scanning the restaurant for any sign of our server.   Finally got it, paid up, and left.

We went with great expectations, but the experience was a big disappointment.   We are not planning to return.

Yep, as stated by another reviewer, for Americans much like D&B but more upscale. Can dine outside with a smaller menu and the view of the train museum. Can dine inside with the noise and larger menu. You get a small bag of popcorn to snack on while waiting for your food. Food was meh; basic bar food. One of us had the burger, added a fried egg. He said the egg was the best part as the burger was over cooked. The other one of us and the chicken club sandwich. Bread was rock hard on the bottom but the flavor of the bread and sandwich was good. I had the chicken bites. Meh. And we shared a side of man n cheese - skip it. Service was ok. It's probably best, and certainly cheaper to just come in to play games.

Overall an amazing experience. First of all our food was really tasty. My boyfriend had the steak and it was cooked to a perfect medium rare and presented well. It tasted fresh and the meat quality lived up to its higher price. I had the macaroni and the calamari and though I would have added more salt to the calamari... that's personal preference for sure and the server was happy to bring me some salt. That's the other thing that made the meal so great, our server was really really nice and super attentive and just bubbly. I've seen lots of complaints that it's too loud in there but in my opinion it's just a hopping place that's got lots of energy. If you're looking for library level peace just don't go here. 

The games are super fun and we had wayyyy too much fun playing them, the music is great, even the prizes for the games were great like a Kylie Cosmetics makeup palette?! That's so cool!!! 

This whole night was definitely something to remember :) and I would recommend this to everyone except probably families with younger children. People have drinks all around the arcade and are a little drunk. Definitely fun for young adults to older patrons but wouldn't recommend (at least in the evening) for young children.

The Rec Room is a great arcade and doesn't deserve a 3 star rating. The main reason I'm giving them a 5 star is the staff. The one person didn't charge me for the nascar simulator that costs 20 credits and then when I was garbage and kept crashing the person had a lot of patience with me. There was the Star Wars Virtual Reality (which wasn't involved with the game pass payment) and it was really fun! You are a stormtrooper and you have to obtain something that could destroy the galaxy I may sound stupid when I say this but when we were traveling over the lava on some platform I felt like if I walked over the edge I would fall into the lava. This was my experience at The Rec Room! I totally recommend it for a family that doesn't have much to do in Toronto!

Pros:
Restaurant, Arcade and Lounge all in 1
Free coat check

Cons:
Jack of all trades, but not great at any one thing
No private parking

The Rec Room is a great idea in theory.  A restaurant, arcade and lounge all rolled up into one location.  They do a decent job of it, but nothing truly excels to make you consider it over other businesses in either field.

We were invited by a family friend to celebrate a birthday at the Rec Room.  I've heard of the place and what it offered but never really had a chance to go until now.   

The Rec Room is located just across the Skydome (It will always be Skydome to me).  As such they don't have their own parking, which is sort of understandable considering it is downtown.  However, because of it's proximity to Skydome and Scotiabank arena, if there is a sporting event happening during the time you're there, expect the parking lots to jack up their prices a little/a lot.  The Leafs were playing the day we were there in the evening.  Luckily our party was for the afternoon.  The parking lot we chose was $12 until 6pm.  When we were leaving the prices were jacked up to $30 for the leaf game. Something to be aware of.

As I mentioned before, the Rec Room consist of 2 restaurants, an arcade and a lounge.  Our party was in the restaurant and arcade sections for the most part.

- The restaurant:
The food for the most part was decent.  Expect to spend about $30 on food alone.  There's a kids menu at $12 which was probably the best value if you ask me.  The food gets the job done is the best way I can put it.  My wife got the salmon and as you can see from the pics, it's on the smaller side.

- The arcade:
I'm a gamer so the arcade part was the main attraction for me.  The arcade runs like a Playdium or Dave and Busters.  You purchase tokens on a card or wristband and you play the games using those tokens.  In terms of game selection, I found it a bit lacking here as a gamer.  There were far too many reward games that literally last less than 30 seconds.  They had about 10 true arcade games here that you could play with a group of friends at the same time.  The reward games also cost a lot token wise.  One of the kids at the party burned through 200 tokens (About $30) in less than 10 minutes.  I've gotten a whole days worth of fun on $30 at Playdium and Dave and Busters.

The best part of the Rec Room is the staff.  They were all friendly and super helpful throughout our visit.  They have a free coat check which is super convenient because of the kids.  Our waitress was amazing.  She was serving 2 other large tables as well as ours and she was on the ball all day.  She made our visit.

The Rec Room is a jack of all trades but unfortunately doesn't excel at any one thing.  If you're in the downtown core, it's worth a try.  I would make the trip to Playdium or Dave & Busters.

I went hear for the first time with a couple of my coworkers on Friday first impressions I thought it was a laid-back environment and great atmosphere! I end up ordering a steak and a Mojito with some fries the steak was cooked properly but I found the Mojito could've had more vodka and the fries were a little bit over done which is why I took a star off! 

I really took a star off because when I was paying my food I am mistakenly skipped the step to tip the waitress and the waitress was really looking at my receipt and asked me if I like my food and I said yes and she was like oh well next time you should tip which I found really rude and uncalled for because I seriously was going to tip her if I was able to redo it but because of her attitude I didn't!  

I'm seriously debating if I wanna come back to this restaurant weather with my coworkers or even with friends or my boyfriend because some of the staff is a bit questionable.

Went here for drinks after work.  I ordered one of their cocktails but apparently they had no ingredients for it.  I asked for another one and the server said there were no ingredients for at least 3 of them.  Um ok.  
My coworkers said the beer they ordered was flat.
The server was nice but also said it wasn't her fault.  To her credit she tried to make me another drink.  In any case the drinks we had weren't worth the money.  We were scouting for new locations to have regular drinks.  This place does not cut it.

If you're looking to waste a lot of money or to eat just mediocre food, this might be your place. 

This is the adult version of Chuck-E-Cheese but you get all ages here. It's incredibly loud and so busy you can't even get to any game. 

I wouldn't recommend this place as most games are 6 credits (you buy credits and load them onto a card) and last no more than 10-25 seconds. There are no two or three tries and the money gets eaten up quick. 

You play games to win tokens to trade in for quite a terrible selection of prizes, many of which are for children. 

This place works for parents who have extra money to spend to sit at the bar while the kids play on the games. 

The thing that really turned us off is the amount of 'men in black' or security guards were at the doors. When we walked in, we thought we were going through airport security. It was quite disgraceful in my opinion.

Union Social is a large restaurant with lots of tv screens and a menu with a good selection of burgers, sandwiches and salads. Good variety of appetizers too so something for everyone. Bar menu is very good with traditional cocktails and some house specialties, as well as beer and wine. Service is friendly and attentive. Food quality is middle of the road but price is right. Good spot for drinks and snacks.

Hubbie and I went for dinner here last nite. Staff was very friendly. Megan was great server. I had the avocado dip which was yummy. Hubbie  had the buffalo chicken strips. Very tasty. Usual drafts on tap. Only real dislike was the fries. Too over cooked and skinny and not accessible washrooms. Still will be back!

Service: 10/10!! Despite being incredibly busy, the staff are accommodating, welcoming & friendly. Quick to Cater & Professional.

Venue: 10/10!!!! By far the best view of the Yonge&Dundas Square for the best priced food&drinks. Plus the consistency of a well-known franchise remains a safe bet.

Dessert: 10/10!!!!
World's smallest Brownie - Delightful with a scoop of IceCream but maybe DON'T order this dessert. As funny & cheeky as it is... It literally is a tiny brownie piece.
Dipping Donuts - OKAY... This is not a carnival-level dessert. It is an incredibly savoury & sweet treat that has a slightly hard exterior with a very chewy&soft interior that mixes well with the 3 different dips. Definitely a must!

Drinks: 10/10!!!! Plenty of beer on draught as well as craft beer selections. The fishbowls are delightful as well.
I've been throwing in league at BATL for 2 years and I booked my first event for my boyfriends birthday, we all had a blast! Regan & Daryl are great coaches and awesome people :)

I like Toby's for karaoke on Fridays( it's also on Thursday and even Sunday, I think). Sheldon is a good host and keeps it fun and Jason Rolland also runs it too. It's a young crowd which is honestly not great for me but it's a fun atmosphere. I've tried some very good food items at Tobys, the Cobb Salad is excellent and loaded and the pasta primavera is really good too. When people go to a sport's pub they don't always expect great food but I think Toby's exceeds expectations. The staff is mostly good but sometimes the bar staff needs to wake up. I've literally stood by the bar for a very long time waiting for a drink and not being served. So I've walked away annoyed.  I understand being busy but pay attention to the customers better. I'm 6'5" so I'm not really hard to miss. Also I'm glad they got rid of the washroom attendant. It seemed odd and almost ironic to piss in a graffiti filled bathroom and then be met by a washroom attendant. I also never had change. Other than these little "quirks", Tobys is a good place to enjoy a sports game or if you're like me, karaoke, some pints and food.
I love n.k.o.t.b very much so I don't just go to hope to see one of the band members. I enjoy the food alittle price for my liking but you do get your money worth

So coming here was a last minute decision,  I was headed somewhere else to eat and saw this. I remembered they had good wings when I visited in the past at different locations so I said why not.  Went on a Saturday during the day and it was not packed at all, only a handful of people which was surprising since the area is so busy and other restaurants were packed. Anyway, waitress took a while to come over to us. Over 10 mins. Ordered wings, medium and some smoked  wings. They were NOT good like I remembered   I got a side of fries,generous portion. I probably rounded up to 2 stars because food just wasnt great...Ok at best.
 I'd skip this place next time unfortunately.

Service was okay, but the burger didn't taste like anything. It looked almost like pork or something, not hamburger is meat. I'm sick of places serving mediocre tots too. These were just regular tots and my school lunch did as good of a job. I'm sorry but I'm this place seems more like a hobby. Please make tastier burgers. 
The Ketchup was out, the waitress stopped serving water to us in the end- I was extremely dehydrated.  I will not go out of my way to go to one in Pittsburgh.

Been coming here for years to watch raptors games. Years. Now it's the finals and we walk in 2 freaking hours before to get seats and someone cuts us off saying how many people. There's 2 of us. 2 more are coming. He says he can get us a table but if our 2 friends don't show up in 15 minutes he's going to move us.

Poured money into this bar for years and this is how they disrespect their clientele because they want to make just a little more buck on their customers? Cheap. Cheap. Cheap owners and rude ass customer service because they are so damn greedy they want what? An extra beer? They won't even make it because the place was half empty when we went in. Never going to this hole again.

Two weekends ago, my girlfriend and I spent a long weekend in Toronto. Our Airbnb happened to be across from this restaurant so we thought we'd check it out for lunch. 

This restaurant far exceeded our expectations. We were drawn to the restaurant because we have both seen the show and are Mark Wahlberg fans. The aesthetics of the restaurant are just as expected - sports bar vibe with a lot of Mark Wahlberg movie decor. 

Once we got our Wahlberg fix, the restaurant continued to impress us. The servers were great - welcoming and very friendly. To top it off, they make a great burger. One of the best cheeseburgers I've had in a while. Between the decor, the great wait staff, and the amazing food, this is a must try restaurant!

Worst service. Shitty food. 
Waiting forever. Hope you didn't want to make your afternoon plans on time by a long shot.

Beer, wings and sport - a simple and satisfying concept (I don't ask for much)

However in Hooters this was a disappointing affair, the meat on the wings was tough in some and chewy in others, the beer was flat and it was like sitting in my school teachers cold dead heart with no heating

The only redeeming qualities are the ample TVs full of sport and the curly fries which are just better then normal fries (so that wins a star for me)

PS - expect the welcoming to be colder then your latest catfish

Axe-llent service! A well organized activity! The coaches were friendly and they lead your group in a mini tournament! Venue was a little out of the way but a surplus of parking was available. 
Thanks BATL!

Food is good, but the waitress charged us reg price wings when we ordered lunch wings. She defended herself saying we pointed on the regular menu but we specifially said we wanted the lunch wings and even ordered drink because she mentioned we have to order drink to get the lunch price.

Anyways it's not a big deal but i wish she would just said she forgot and I would've been fine with it.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Service is not welcoming, beer is watered down, and the chicken fingers tasted like a mix of plastic and bread. Would not recommend. Spend a few extra bucks and head up the street to Eleven or Real Sports. Plus waited 20 minutes for a glass of water??
Great atmosphere. The staff were very friendly  it's a great place for corporate functions and team building. Definitely a place to go if you haven't tried it

I'm not sure why this location is rated so low... But the few times I've been here, it's always been great.
I always get their honey garlic wings with fries here and it never fails me. Always delicious, cooked all the way through, saucy, lots of meat on the bone, the fries taste great and always a great server.
Honestly, there's not much to say other than that it's amazing here and I've never had an issue the few times I've been here in the past.

We've been wanting to try Wahlburgers since it opened up. The service is great. The food is mediocre. The Mac and Cheese was worse than Kraft Dinner, barely any cheese, plain macaroni pieces with sprinkled crust on top. And the sauce? Barely anywhere to be found. If you like Mac and cheese do not order theirs! 
The onion rings made me want to cry. Who would call such an atrocious thing an onion ring? On the menu they stated the onion rings would be "skinny" but we did not expect them to be the dust of what once used to be onion rings. They were crumbles, like remnants of what once was an onion ring. They were like fried onion bits you sprinkle on top of dishes. 
I tried the chicken burger which I quite enjoyed, and we also got the double stacked burger. Luckily the burgers were great or else I would have up and run!
The reviews nearly scared me away, but everything we ordered was delicious. We had burgers, mac n cheese, onion rings, and poutine.

We came for dinner before a hockey game...it wasn't too busy and we were seated quickly.  Ordered poutine which was ehhh ok.  The burger I ordered was tough - almost like it was frozen or over worked when mixing spices into it.  It was dry and overcooked.

OMG! I almost forgot about this experience, but the app gave me suggestions for places near me. The only memory about this place, that when I was sitting on the roof with my friend I almost getting grey when I saw the mouse near our table. It was last fall, but I still really afraid to go there.

We were visiting Toronto from Southern California to see a Blue Jays game. Decided to go to Hoops after the game. Such terrible service. We got the wrong drinks, food took forever, and they never put the game on that we requested. Super disappointed.

I was so excited to try Wahlburgers due to all the hype, but was unfortunately let down. The burgers and fries were average at best. The poutine was barely had any gravy and cheese curds. Better than a fast food joint, but there are much better options around for the same price.

Great place for watching the footy! 

Full of TVs and playing most of European games in as good an atmosphere as your going to get so far away from home.

Beer selection is decent also and with a couple of beer specials on every day it makes it a little less expensive too and a chance to try something different too.

In terms of food it's decent for bar food also, good options and the simple Curry with Fries makes for a great sharer.

PS - if your greedy like me then get Curry with Fries and Fries because who actually likes sharing!!!
Best national burger chain in my mind. I never have anything bad to say about them. Food is good , I've tried almost every burger on the menu. Always a fan.
There were nixed reviews. The pizza was a 5 but the burger a 3 for not being season. The beef dip was a 3. Fries were really good if hot.

This place has been going downhill for ages now, but my last visit this past Saturday has been the worst yet and I couldn't imagine going back if you paid me.

Never mind the outdated and in some cases faulty TVs or the dirty tables...no worst of all is the service.

We went to watch the early kick off at 1130am, ordered the breakfast and coffee (we had to wait 10 mins before getting service but thats fine)

Things went bad when we didn't get our coffee at first, i had to ask again for this after the food had already come out...i then had to send 1 coffee back as there was lipstick marks on the cups (disgusting)

Then later we realized that the other cup was dirty too with dry coffee stains down the side...again I asked the server to take it back only this time she sassed me about it and walked away as i was mid sentence...the girl didn't come back and we left.

I can only imagine she reacted this way as I had already paid in advance and tipped her.

There bad service doesn't end there though, I complained about the above incident via their Facebook messenger and got a reply which to me basically said 'WE DONT CARE'

See attached photos of how richly they value my business.

All in there is so many sports bars now showing the footy this place doesn't have an edge apart from an appealing name.

3 stars because the hostess sat our group quickly and was able to swap the rum for Hennessy in our Piña coladas. We ordered wings to eat. the honey garlic flavor is on the sweeter side. the Cajun is a dry rub but doesn't really have a kick or flavor to it. The hot wings are a strong, okay. That has that kick I was looking for but overall the wings were ehh okay. It also looked like dark meat which is not my preference.

Alright so this is the second half to a previous review I left back when we were fresh on our road trip and ate at Wahlburgers in the mall oof America. Well by luck we ended up staying right next door to this place and decided that the two nights we were here we'd eat at Wahlburgers every night. The thanksgiving burger is amazing definitely one of my favorites!

Worst cauliflower wings and garlic bread I've ever had! Their "garlic bread" is just breadsticks with garlic powder on it. Their "cauliflower wings" are basic breaded and fried cauliflower with just a small sprinkle of Buffalo sauce. What kind of wings aren't coated in sauce?! Avoid if you enjoy food!

I have never written a review before but had to because this place is so terrible.  When we walked in I knew I should have walked right back out.  The temperature was so warm when we walked in and were seated at a table right next to the thermostat that read 89 degrees Fahrenheit.  I then went to the bathroom and it was really dirty.  I went to wash my hands and the faucet was literally broken off and sitting next to the sink.  
I went back to the table and ordered a beer.  The waitress said that Bud Light cans were on special so I ordered one.  I asked for a chilled glass with it but she said they don't have chilled glasses.  When I received the beer she also brought me a chilled glass.  I said oh thank you for the chilled glass, I thought you didn't have any.  She said we do but we can only use them with Heineken.  However, I brought you one because the beers aren't very cold.  I then poured my beer and took a drink.  I think there was soap or cleaning cleanser still in the glass...gross.  We ordered our food and we weren't surprised that it wasn't good.  Everything came out piping out but very over cooked and some of it was burnt. As we ate, dirty dishes remained on our table.  My children had kids meals that were supposed to come with ice cream but the waitress said they were out.  Huge disappointment for my kids!  
We will not be returning here.  The place needs a serious remodel and repair and the food is terrible.  So many other great places to enjoy in Toronto so don't waste your money on this one.

The food was good, but this is one of those restaurants (like Johnny Rockets) where the burger doesn't come with fries. That kinda bothered me. You have to buy you side separately. Also the poutine we ordered was pretty small. However that being said.. The service was great, the burger was very good and food came out fairly quickly. Not sure if I'll be coming back though as the price is a little on the high side, seems more of a place for tourists.

You gotta try it at least once though!

With a name like Hoops Sports Bar and Grill, you would think they are big into basketball. That is what I assumed too, but I figured, better make sure! So on April 19th, since both the Leafs and Raptors were playing at the same time, I called ahead of time to ask whether they would be playing the Raptors game. The woman said that they would for sure be playing the Raptors game, although they may have to split the seating and have the two games in separate areas. Sounded good to me, I know it's tough to find a bar that will show the Raptors game, so I was glad to have that guarantee. I even double checked, "Are you SURE that you will have a section that is dedicated to the Raptors, WITH SOUND?" To which she replied, "Yes, we definitely will."

Fast forward to when we arrive. We are told that there is no basketball section, this is a Leafs game only event, and basically to get out. They offered to put the Raptors game on the little booth television. If I want to watch the Raptors game by myself, I'll stay at home and save the $50 in overpriced beer and bar food. Which is exactly what I did, went home, disappointed that Hoops cannot deliver on its name, and broadcast basketball games to basketball fans in Toronto. So be warned Raptors fans, even at Hoops, you come second to the almighty Maple Leafs. For Hoops, I recommend you either get your servers on the same page when they are answering the phone, or re-brand your business' name to Pucks.

Just Now. Sat at a table. Received zero service. Waitresses survered other groups that came in after. I told a staff member I was leaving because I received no service, she  would rather chat up another customer then do her job. She did not care or apologies. First and last time here.

After biking past this place for years and tasting it through my nose, I finally decided a friend's visit was time to go and check it out.

The service was friendly but very slow. Our crew had two small kids and there were some spills and the waiter was very good about cleaning them up, even the ones on the floor. The staff were friendly, but again, service took longer than it should have.

The food was just okay. I don't think anyone had was better than you'd get anywhere else. I had the OFD (Originally From Dorchester) burger with onion strings which were actually very good. They're essentially a basket of French breaded onions usually served on a burger but in this case on the side.

The burger was in all honesty, good enough but pretty standard. Nothing that special. Friends had the Thanksgiving burger which was the same. Good, but you could make it at home pretty easily.

The taters we're good. The Mac and cheese was canned sauce. Not good, but the Mac was cooked nicely even though it's more than likely frozen and microwaved. 

Won't go again, but it wouldn't be an outright refusal, it's just very ho hum.

Ever thought to yourself and come up with the idea to throw axes? Yeah most people don't, but I'm not most people. After arriving in Canada after a long bus ride. The only natural thing for a girl to do is blow off some steam. So I did a search and found an axe throwing location. We made our way there and we were greeted by super awesome friendly spectacular wonderful people. It was our first time axe throwing, and they were very eager to give us newbies, a tutorial we'd never forget. Our night was full of laughs, jokes, and booze. Of course axe throwing as well! Eventually I got over holding back. Seriously don't hold back, it won't stick to anything. The axe is not going to bounce back and hit you that easily either. You are told to throw at a safe distance. Coming here was an excellent decision and we'd come back anytime. If you are curious, just do it! You won't regret it, but I'm also not you so, I don't know if you will regret it.

HEY it's hooters !! what else are you gonna say ? I like the wings !!!! AMAZING,AMAZING!!!
 but as I was sitting there looking around, it dawned on me, am I at a gay bar ???? everyone there are dudes !!! so I ended up looking at the shorts , but that's not cool because I feel like a perv, so...I dunno

It was by complete accident we stumbled upon this Whalburgers considering we wanted to try one and the best way I can describe our experience is we can not wait to have it again soon!! The burgers were absolutely delicious and filling. I have to eat gluten free and they do offer a gluten free bun that was by far the best gluten free bun I have ever had! The prices are very reasonable but I did find they lacked fries for the price you pay on those. Service at this location was slightly disappointing but that did not set back the experience what so ever. Highly recommend this place if you get the chance.

Since this American burgers joint opened I've been meaning to trying it. 

The customer service was good but other than that I can't say there's much else to pull me in

The burger was disappointing. Really dry or overcooked. Not juicy at all. The tomato was 
what I'd call juicy lol

The Sweet potato tots were not bad. That and the chocolate milkshake (frappe as they like to call it) were the best of what I had but they were by no means standouts and something I could easily acquire elsewhere and better tasting.

I'm glad to have tried it but can't say I'd eat there again.

Came in expecting great food and drinks before a Blue Jays game and was extremely disappointed. The servers were running around like chickens with their heads cut off, drinks took 20 mins to be delivered (none were alcoholic), and when we got our food 30 mins after we got our drinks, some was cold and incomplete without items that were listed as ingredients on their menus (i.e. corn salsa, aioli, etc.). We finally decided to eat what we could and just get the check and leave. To top off this experience, when we had to sign the credit card receipt, the server gave us a yellow crayon to sign off with. Not great. Will never go back.

Been a few times here but today was the worst.  Not that busy when we went and promptly taken to our seat but we sat 15 mins with noone coming.  Finally a girl comes and says "sorry your server busy can I take a drink order" I said we are ready to order food with our drinks. The girl pulls a face and rips a receipt paper off all ticked off and inconvenient.  We get our food which is good of course, it always has been good but due to then getting ignored after being served and having to prompt to get our bill or table cleared.  Btw what server we were to get idk as it was a bartender I saw (she was good) a guy wondering aimlessly and that pulling face girl. Service sucked. Food was good but that was it.

We took a burger as snack since we just had dinner. It's not worthy the hype! The burger was very greasy.
The order came pretty fast....maked me wonder if it's fresh or premade and reheated burger. We had the Mom's sloppy Joe and added the poutine as an extra. The poutine lack sauce, cheese and salt, the sloppy Joe was ok. Nothing special.

Sorry Mark. Love your movies (and F45) but the burgers are just OK.

Nothing bad, but also nothing that stands out. Good if you need a beer and a place to watch the game. But, I wouldn't move mountains for a Wahlburger.

Went to this location with a group of 9 of us after the Jays game wanting to drink some more and eat some more. We were seated outside on the patio and thank goodness we left the game a bit early because it got packed afterwards. Decided to get a bunch of apps with one of my friends to share and they were all mostly delicious. 

I LOVED the Cider Sangria that they had. It was so refreshing and the cider helped cut the taste of the wine and it was full of fruit!! 

Mozzarella Sticks - super cheesy, perfectly fried and great dipping sauce

Cauliflower Bites - perfectly coated and fried, not mushy at all, love that you can choose your own wing sauce as a topping. I only wish they had tossed all the bites in the sauce and not just sprinkled it on top because the ones on the bottom had no sauce at all

Jalapeño Poppers - didn't have jalapeño pepper in them, I think it was a red pepper, but they were still good

Garlic Sticks - these were our least favourite. It was more of a stick with a sprinkle of garlic than anything else. I wish it was seasoned better and tossed better because it really was just eating a stick of fried dough

I had never been to a Wahlburgers before and I have to say that I enjoyed my first visit. This location just up the street from the Rogers Centre apparently has not been open for too long. It's down the road from the hotel at which I stay when I visit our Canadian office and I had never seen it until this trip. It is apparently the hotel restaurant for the SoHo Metropolitan Hotel.

The dining area was spacious and the atmosphere relaxed, as you'd expect for a casual burger joint. The menu options were more than adequately varied for the type of place it was. I had a Turkey burger with tater tots, which I thought was quite tasty. My colleague had a Double Decker burger with fries, about which he was also quite positive. He also had ice cream to finish while I had a coffee. We both felt the food quality was quite good and the service was excellent. Our waitress was pleasant and efficient, and the food came out quickly after our order. The prices were not bad for everything we had. The final bill with food, drinks, tax and tip was about $30 CAD per person. This was a little over $20 USD per person with the exchange rates at the time. That's about right for a gourmet burger place from my perspective.
Went there to watch a basketball game and had their all you can eat wings. Overall It's an sub-par experience.

This place was awesome as always, I went on Monday (Thanksgiving) for AYCE with no disappointment, our server was Erin and she was awesome, she always made sure we had our orders placed and took care of us at all times, the wings were great as always, knowing that people like Erin are there keeps me coming back, thank you Erin and thank you Hooters for the wings....until next time...
Great laid back atmosphere to watch EPL games. Decent beer selection and the food was what to be expected.
Absolutely horrible manager. Lied to us about the price and made us miss a sporting event. Treated terribly and with disrespect. Never go here ever.

Waited 5 minutes till a server acknowledged me. Then waited another ten minutes till we got a table. We got our food it was good. But the server ignored us for most of the time. Only coming by to give us our bill. My friend needed change so we had to wait quite a bit till we asked another server for her change and eventually they brought it over. The food is good but I doubt I'll ever go back. Not really worth the wait

Best food I had while visiting Canada. Our waitress was not only friendly, pleasant and polite but she was attentive and patient. I enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and the drinks. The place was so good that although we thought that was going to be our last meal of the day, we went back in before heading back to NY on the same day.

Definitely planning to visit again. 

Thank you for making our first trip to Canada a memorable experience.... and a delicious one.

Came for brunch on a Sunday morning. Food was good but service was awful. Waited 40+ min for breakfast even though the restaurant was not busy whatsoever. Waitress never came back to ask if we wanted refills on coffee & water. A shame that the food was so good but the service was awful.

This place was awesome. A couple of guys I know always talk about how they go here whenever they visit Toronto, so naturally I couldn't pass up visiting myself. When you walk in your greeted by green W's everywhere and pictures of the Wahlberg brothers plastered on the wall. The menu is filled with all sorts of Wahl goodies and burgers. I decided when in Rome and went with the "Eh" burger and "Poutineized" my side of tater tots. The burger was a nice juicy 8 oz with peameal bacon, a fried egg, and other fixings. The tots were as you expect. Golden delicious and topped with cheese curds and gravy. It was everything I dreamed of and more. My first meal in Toronto was as Canadian as it gets. There's a pretty good amounf of menu options here and they were very helpful with gluten intolerance allergies. They do have gluten free buns available which I did not see listed on the menu. My girlfriend got a portabella burger on a gluten free but with a side of sweet potato tots and wahl sauce, and had nothing but good things to say about her meal too. Definitely worth stopping by for a good burger if you're in the area. Can't wait to go back.,

This was AMAZING!! The first thing I noticed was the beautiful decoration and atmosphere! We got seated in a booth in less than 5 minutes! The customer service was amazing and our waitress was so sweet. The food and drinks got out to us real fast. I got the thanksgiving burger made by Mark. Let me be the first to tell you that was the best burger I have ever had! The portion sizes we also spot on! I left completely satisfied and full but not too full that my stomach hurt. The prices were astonishing and so cheap for what you're given! Over this was an jaw dropping experience and a great dinner! Build one of these in Buffalo please!

Would I come back? I don't know. Maybe?

Yes, because the location of this St. Louis Bar & Grill is convenient for me. It's located near the Roger's centre and below a condo building. It was a Tuesday evening and surprisingly, they did have their half priced wings promotion. I overheard from a server talking to another customer that night that it had something to do with the Jay's season being over and that they don't have promotions during game days? The Leaf's season has started, so now, does that mean they'll revert back to regular pricing? I'd recommend calling beforehand as other reviews have said that they don't honor that promotion. 

Maybe, because food was actually quite tasty... when my order was correct. 

No, because the service and the servers were subpar. I understand the 40 minute wait time on a Tuesday evening at 6:30pm. What I don't understand if how they decided which party would sit at which table. This location had booths, tables with chairs, high tables with stools, tables that could separate to sit parties of 2 and tables that couldn't separate and seated four. While waiting, I saw parties of two assigned tables that seated four. To me, it makes more sense to seat parties of 4 at tables of 4 and seat parties of 2 at tables that can separate into two. 

After being seated (we were a party of 2), we knew what we wanted to order but we didn't get to speak to our server until another 15-20 minutes after she took the order of another party (who were seated after us!). When our wings came (we each ordered 2lbs), one of my flavours wasn't what I ordered. Our server apologized and came back with the right order, but it just tasted like they put the new sauce on top of the incorrect order. 

Hmmm. I'm torn. Would I come back? It's a maybe for me. And it would only be on a Tuesday when they have half priced wings. And after 8:30pm.

I think I found my new favourite pub!

I came here yesterday with a couple friends to grab some food and drinks. We decided to take advantage of the nice weather and check out their patio. 

Their patio is a hidden gem! It's decent sized, private, has a flat screen TV & has nice tables/umbrellas for shade. 

We ordered:

Onion Rings - $6.99
Buffalo Chicken Fingers - $12.99
1 lbs Honey Garlic Chicken Wings - $12.99
Shrimp Bruschetta Linguine - $12.99
Chicken Club Sandwich - $12.99
Steak Sandwich - $13.99
 
All of these dishes were delicious, and let me tell you they were definitely made with love! The portions are HUGE and they're so affordable! The presentation of these dishes were also a plus.

I had the steak sandwich, and it was really yummy. The steak was cooked exactly how I asked for it (medium rare) and it was so juicy and flavourful with the grilled onions and mushrooms. 

My boyfriend had the Shrimp Bruschetta Linguine and he said it was very flavourful as well.

I love the vibe of this place, the food is delicious & our server was very friendly. I will 100% be returning.
Lol cheap but dingy place and almost impossible to get service on busy days. You have to stand up and wave people down to get in and out of here

When I planned my trip to Toronto, I was looking for quaint Irish pubs to check out some local talent. Great food. Great music. Those were my goals.

I had forgotten about Lucky Clover until I stumbled upon it while walking back to my condo on Friday morning. It was hot. And I was starving.

It was 11:20 am and the restaurant was empty. I think that should have been a sign. There was no one to greet me at the front entrance. I waited a few minutes before a friendly waitress came to seat me.

Service was just okay at first. But as the meal progressed I didn't see the waitress again until I had long cleared my plate. I also had to remind her about ketchup for the potatoes. Which were disappointingly bland. How do you screw up potatoes fries?

I ordered the Eggs Benedict with sausage and bacon. Now - if you look at the picture I upload, can you tell if it has sausage or bacon? Nope, me neither. And that definitely was not hollandaise sauce on top.

This would be my last meal in Toronto and it was extremely disappointing. I should have stuck with the salad bar at Longo's - because their food was simply amazing.

Service: I'll give it a 3 star for being friendly, but awfully slow considering the restaurant was empty.

Food: disappointingly bland. How can anyone screw up a simple classic like eggs benny?

I called one day before to make a reservation for the raptors game and they said okay!
The next day I went and a mean woman (she's a bit overweighted, about 40 years old, has a birth mark on her right hand, and blonde) was like we don't have a reservation for you, and she wouldn't give us a table but then she was like I'll give you a table, but she gave us a spot where we can't even watch the game.
I said, "but I called yesterday and made a reservation so I can have a good spot " and then she started talking in a REALLY REALLY REALLY mean way. she said "go to any other place, I don't have time for this and I have 10 hours of work" then she left us!!!
I stood there for like 3 minutes not knowing what to do and then a nice employee came and gave us a good spot (I appreciate her help)!

The food was extremely bland. Wait staff didn't know any thing about the menu nor did they understand basic drink terminology. A bit indifferent when asked to verify meal details. Very disappointed in this restaurant!

I've had walhburger in the states and it was really good the burgers at the toronto location are smaller and dried out. Also we were served sodas that were flat and when we told the waiter instead of saying right away he'll replace then with his ugly attitude face he said "really? That's not possible" he left the drinks on the table and went to the bar and tested the pop himself then he changed the co2 tank and came back with new drinks and still didnt apologize just said you were right and smirked and gave us new drinks. 
Never going back to this place again and because of this experience will never give and walhburger location our business again.
Had a burger at this establishment earlier this week.  It was not memorable and took forever to arrive.  I arrived around 8:00 on a Thursday night and only a handful of other patrons we dining.
Long Island had absolutely no alcohol, sex on the beach was watered down. Service was horrible. Wouldn't recommend even on my worst day. McDonald's would be a better option.

Had one of the worse experiences here. Came in late for a birthday drink, it was empty and they sat us next to pool table. A very drunk party was playing and very drunk women hit multiple members on our table with a cue stick. We complained and the waiter responded "well you are sitting next to a pool table". Sitting next to a pool table, I do not expect to get whacked in the head repeatedly. Plus the restaurant is empty, why even seat us there. The lady yelled profanities, was climbing on the table, an insane nuisance. Instead of doing the respectable thing, the manager told us both to quiet cuz he didn't want to deal then sat us in a back corner. Really surprising to see people deal so poorly in the service industry. Really ruined our night. So here's to hoping they won't ruin yours!

We came in and were greeted promptly and seated immediately.  Very friendly and attentive servers.  A easy to ready menu, prices reasonably.  Food came quickly and was very good!   We particular enjoyed the Sweet Potato Tots.   

While I don't drink myself, my son tried a couple of local crafts including their Wellington Stout. He spoke very highly of it

Star power or not....a very good restaurant regardless.  Thank you!
Since I am from the states wahlburgers is great there but here it's disappointing the food lackluster but the staff where fast just felt there would be more to it
Best chow and coldest beer on tap, what else can you ask for! Food tastes like homemade and generous portions

This is my favourite restaurant pub, great atmosphere for families, groups of friends and individual just looking for a place to have great traditional pub food. 
Has interesting entertainment and everyone seems so friendly and happy to be there.

What a dump. This place is a train wreck. I was visiting from out of town, and this place was recommended. To start, the menu is so worn its time for a replacement. The menus have a hard cover, and the corners/binding are worn through, exposing the cardboard underneath. We ordered drinks, and my friend had something floating in his draft beer. We ordered appetizers and food. The plates are embossed with the restaurant name, but the embossing is clearly worn. The cup that the sauce came in, is embossed with the name of another restaurant, "Lucky Clover Sports Pub". Our food arrived with our appetizers, even though we asked for them to be separate. I ordered a burger and expected the waitress to ask how I wanted the burger cooked. I prefer my burger medium, but she never asked. My burger arrived with a packet of relish, and mustard. I had to go search the empty tables for a bottle of ketchup. The bottle I did find looked like a small child had played with it. I had to wipe the ketchup bottle first to avoid getting on my hands. As I sit in the restaurant, I've been sitting with an empty beer for 20 minutes.


UPDATE: Waitress finally came over to ask if I wanted another beer.

My family and I went for a quick brunch after visiting the aquarium. I ordered a Toronto (salmon) omelette based on the server's recommendations. My partner and kids' food was fine (London omelette and cheese pizza). The fish in my omelette tasted rancid so I politely asked for a menu to order something different. I ordered the classic breakfast (scrambled eggs, white toast, and pea meal bacon with potatoes. I never said we wouldn't pay for the gross omelette. I just asked for something else to eat. When the server brought my new order out, there was a dead cockroach (see photo) on my plate, at first glance I thought it was potato. I can't help but think it was intentional as it was clearly lying on the plate?!? The server was very nice and apologetic, and someone who I assume to be a manager took the plate and mumbled about asking the kitchen staff. We asked for the check because we were horrified and just wanted to leave. I offered to pay at minimum for our drinks, but we were told twice by the server not to worry about the bill. I'm not one to leave a bad review but I feel so gross my family ate food from this establishment.

We had a great team building here in August that we've book another event for this month.  The atmosphere was great, drinks and axe throwing looked a bit scary, but we had Sara H. teaching us the correct techniques.  Sara had awesome energy that really got our team into the groove!! Would highly recommend this location and Sara H to be your instructor.  Hopefully we get Sara again for our next event!

The place was almost empty and I overlooked the "please wait to be seated" sign and got some lip because I sat down myself wile 3waitresses were chatting at the bar...
No problem I thought... ordered a beer and a burger, beer was good, burger was average to below average for a $11 burger excluding fries...
Hate to give this place low stars since I was kind of excited to try it out for the 1st and sadly for the last time... 
Mark, you can call me and I will let ya know why the burger wasn't as expected...

Charging $200 as COVER for the Raptors Game? You vultures - I hope your bar is empty for the game. Are you seriously going to try and rip off Raptors fans like that? 
I could even understand a minimum spend - but you're charging fans $200 as a cover just because you happen to be near Jurassic Park? Get outta here.
Its a below average sports bar, with terrible food, not great service, with its only selling point being its proximity to the stadium where the Raptors and Leafs play. And now their gouging of fans who are showing up to support their team is the last straw.

We were immediately seated and waited over 10 minutes for a server to come over. During this time, two tables very near to use was served and cleared and paid their check. When we asked for help, the server was polite and offered to take our order right away. Without her politeness, it would
have been a 2 star review. Food was a little cold and needed hot sauce to give it some flavor. Not sure we would return

Wow was so excited to eat what I heard was an amazing burger. I have seen the show love the team and brothers but very disappointed. Got the "Our Burger" thinking it would be the best. Completely over cooked. No over had to add a ton of salt and pepper to even get a flavor. The bu is WAY to big for a 5oz patty unless you use a much bigger thinner party. The bun was either old or not properly warmed to support the condiments. If there was government cheese the government kept that as I didn't see any or that cheese. (Read it like forest gimp is saying it)

Poutine tots were the best part of the meal. 

Veggies on the burger were fresh and really well cut and perfect amount applied.  

I was really looking forward to the "homemade pickles" but I have to say they underwhelmed and would rather fresh cut fresh pickles and you will have a winner. 

Well I've been here and done that and hope you can avoid the same reality. 

Service was great very attentive

My husband and I came here after spending a good part of the afternoon at the distillery, and before the Toronto islands. We split an Our burger the day before as a snack, and was pretty impressed. It wasn't as greasy as burgers can be in the states. I wasn't sure if I'd like the sauce, but it was really tasty. So we decide to try it today, big mistake....

We sit down, and were pretty much ignored and didn't get our drink order taken right away. And when I got my drink, the soda was flat! I got something else, that was flat too. It took us 15 minutes to get our drinks. 

Then, when the food came, the server (not our original server) almost gave our order away to another table!  I panicked and made sure we got it. Food was good( got my own Our burger this time with fries). Poutine tots were good, BUT fell apart fast. I also noticed a table behind us waited 40 minutes (!!!!), and had to leave without getting their food because they were late for a show.

It just seemed really disorganized, chaotic and not very well run. 

Our whole trip to this beautiful city, I made some great calls on our food choices... but unfortunately for this place I struck out. Food tasted good but you guys need to step up your service and being prompt. Especially on weekends, when there is a sporting event. Anything but fast isn't acceptable.

I came here as a last second to catch the Raptors game.  Beers were good no complaints there, the food on the other hand stay away stay very very far away it was horrendous we ordered ribs expecting some actual ribs and it was little pieces of deep fried pork rib scraps and the chicken wings dont even get me started.

This place not only has horrible service, but even worse food. Their pizza is literally a frozen pie and they still took an hour to prep it. We ate it because we were hungry and didn't have time to go somewhere else. Whilst the waitress was taking the bill we complained about the food and the waitress took our complaint to the manager. He didn't even have the courtesy to show up and apologize relaying the message that "we'd eaten it" and "there wasn't anything he could do". Anyways I can only imagine how repulsive the rest of the food is. Never actively hated a place as much as this, would recommend you never go!

We were in Toronto Pearsons Airport in Canada and we happened to find this place while going to our gate. We had been wanting to eat here since we heard of it but unfortunately it was a disappointing expirience. When we first walked in, the hostess told us to sit anywhere we like. But right at the entrance there was 5 tables completely dirty, still with dirty dishes from previous clients. And must of been there for long too. As we walked further in there were more dirty tables. We finally seated at this high table to which it had 2 dirty glasses still sitting there. There were like 6 employees there on floor but none trying to pick up the messes. Once we seat down I had looked over and at the register behind us there was a stack of dirty dishes there too, like wtf?!?!... Is it that difficult to take it to wash?  We sat literally for 20 minutes before anyone even came to our table. I had to ask for menus so at least we can entertain ourselves while waiting. Once we finally order, thought ok will get food soon but no... It took 40 minutes to get our food. We were there for breakfast, Food was ok, nothing much to say about it. As for the waitress coming by every so often, it was unheard of. Unfortunately, it was an awful expirience. I was looking forward to it but it fell way short than expected.

It was ok and I struggle with this rating only as I'm used to giving stronger props in my experiences. Above and beyond everything else our waitress was the BEST poor thing. I know we were working her and she was just super accommodating and kind and patient. NO ONE was in this restaurant. Maybe that should have been a clue. Still, I cannot stop raving about her so Hoops wasn't great but SHE was....

Chicken tenders - dry. Quesadilla was the BEST we did love the shredded chicken and it was stuffed enough to share among the three of us. Huge fan. The pizza. I am all about pizza - so disappointing. My best friend even asked IN THE DARK as we were watching the game, is that a FROZEN PIZZA? Right. So while I did have two slices hoping for a better experience with the second slice after trying the first I have to admit we LEFT the rest of the pie there. Who does that who LEAVES PIZZA? 

Hoops. You need to step it up with the food. We almost hit Elleven down the street and while I'm certain that would have cost more I suspect they are gonna keep killing you with the poor food. One waitress can't carry all. She was so kind to us....

Stopped in here today for breakfast, sat for over an hour before our food arrived. Wait staff was shockingly under supported, no bar staff, under staffed kitchen. This manager should be held accountable. When tables need busing & manager is just watching his staff struggle he should be embarrassed. Absolutely hung his staff out to dry.

We came to Lucky Clover bc it was one of the only bars playing the Raptors game with the sound on when the Leafs were also playing. It looked promising from the outside and the decor. Our waitress was wonderful - very friendly, welcoming, and took good care of us.
