The kitchen on the other hand needs some improvement. The fish and chips were extremely disappointing. For $21 the size of the portion is ridiculous. There were two pieces of tiny fish...probably the same size as frozen fish sticks you find in the grocery store. The fries were soggy and a very small portion. The kitchen had also forgotten to give us tartar sauce...a necessity for fish and chips. How do you forget tartar sauce for a fish and chips dish? The cold slaw was stale and you can see from the color that it has been sitting in the little cup for a while already (prepped ahead of time). 

The seafood linguine was much better than the fish and chips. $22 with chunks of salmon, mussels, calamari, and big pieces of shrimp. I liked the rosé sauce - it's nothing fancy but it was tasty and homey. I also appreciated the big pieces of shrimp, but the salmon chunks did not taste very fresh. 

I wish I could like this place more but I think some improvements are needed in the kitchen.
Awful service. Took 45 minutes for our sandwiches to arrive. Dont attend on busy evenings (i.e concerts) clearly they dont know how to staff properly.

Good food and great service. Ordered delivery and received the wrong flavour for one of our pounds of wings. Called the restaurant and they made up for it and then some by sending a generously portioned replacement over right away.

My husband and I came here one Friday night. It was a good thing we made reservations because there was a concert next door and a lot of people were hoping to get a seat. 
Our waiter was really friendly and attentive. Not too many beer options on tap, but enough for for us to find a beer we each liked. 
My husband ordered the Sidebar burger with fries and I had the crispy chicken sandwich with onion rings. The fries had dill on them and they were perfectly seasoned. The batter on the onion rings was fluffy and didn't overpower the flavour of the onion inside. I only had a small bite of the burger, but it was really fresh tasting. My chicken sandwich was incredible. There was quite a bit of mayo on it, but it really balanced out the crunch of the kale slaw. 
We don't normally spring for dessert, but we had the ice cream sandwich. The cookie was a bit too hard and the ice cream was too plain for my personal taste. Still, we didn't leave a crumb behind.
Really beautiful restaurant and a great place to go for date night.

Ordered poutine. Got fries.
In restaurant service was impeccable as always.
Burger specials are a treat

Love this quaint little spot. We've been twice and both times were excellent. Great selection of cocktails. The burger is fabulous, delicious skinny fries and definitely check out the fried chicken sandwich! But above all else please save room for dessert and get the icecream sandwich. It is perfection. If you don't play nice when it comes to sharing dessert like me, you're probably going to want one all to yourself :)
amazing chicken wings, not too pricey and very nice staff. i recommende getting the wings grilled it gives a nice bbq flavour

Our waitress was great, but I could not get past the flies/gnats that hovered over our food. Management needs to handle this issue immediately. I'm here on vacation and was hoping to get a good pub meal right in the cerner of downtown Toronto, and was extremely disappointed by this experience.

I go to st Louis every Tuesday for the past couple years , recently had a terrible experience with the new waitress that has purple hair. I never had any thing bad to say about the restaurant but I will not return there while she is still employed at the bloor location.
Beautiful patio up front. It's pretty spacious as well! I ordered the southern fried chicken sandwich when I came in

Delicious food at excellent prices makes St. Louis my first choice for wings, ribs and burgers. And with daily specials, there is never a bad time to head to St. Louis. Plus, if you're with your team they provide complementary nachos.

Just go for drinks. Food is mediocre. Service is okay. I just grab a beer and a couple of shots once in awhile here since its a walking distance from our condo. I wish this could be replaced by a reputable chicken wings restaurant;)

It's never a pleasant thing, giving a negative review to a small restaurant like this one. But it's hard to find positives when the food is just flat-out bad.

We showed up around 6:00 on a recent weekday armed with a reservation, and were quickly shown to a cozy table near the back. (It might've been a little too cozy, as we were seated mere inches away from other diners.)

I quickly settled on the Crispy Chicken Sandwich ("brioche sesame seed bun, southern fried chicken breast, kale & swiss chard slaw, tomato, baby swiss cheese, mayonnaise") as my entree, and I asked for onion rings as my side.

It was apparent right from the first bite that I was in trouble. The most obvious problem here is the sogginess of the sandwich, which, given the word "crispy" in the name of the concoction, was especially off-putting. There was absolutely no crunch to be had here, and that was what I was in the mood for (and wouldn't you be if you'd ordered a "southern fried" chicken sandwich?)

The rest of the 'wich didn't fare much better, as all the components were either offensively bland or way too soft. The lack of texture was pretty much disastrous, and I ultimately found that the sandwich reminded me a *lot* of the chicken burger at Burger King.

The onion rings fared even worse, if that's possible. They, too, were super soggy and without any deep-fried deliciousness, and the breading was tasteless and underwhelming. Also, the rings came with ketchup, which is just such an amateur mistake I don't even have the worse.

Having said all that, the service was extremely friendly and efficient, so I might return to sample some of the joint's cocktails. Doubt I'll ever order food again, though.

It is your typical deep fried food and beer menu. There is no variety whatsoever and most dishes are either deep fried or drenched in condiments. Good selection of drinks: beer on tap, cocktails (Caesar was quite good) and even wine. Service is always good.
Suggestion to the owners: times have changed and people want some good tasting but also healthy food. Add some sandwiches/ salads to the menu

Came here on a weeknight around 7pm and were seated right away. We had the mozzarella sticks to start which were quite good. I had the Caesar to drink which I also enjoyed. I had the crispy chicken sandwich with onion rings as my entree. It was fine, nothing special. Service was attentive. 

Overall this place was kind of boring. I find the menu uninspired. I have no desire to go back because there's nothing else in the menu looks interesting.

Atmosphere/Service: 
Avoid at all cost. Stepped in and waited 5 minutes for a waitress to even tell us to sit anywhere. AND they weren't even busy! Literally only had 5-6 couple tables among two waitress with several that weren't even cleaned. Because they didn't have any clean tables inside we decided to go sit on the patio. Again there weren't any cleaned table but we decided to sit on one that was cleared but not cleaned near the entrance. There was only 6 tables out in the patio also split between two server. We sat there for 10 minutes trying to flag one of their servers down but they didn't even look at us at all. One of the waitress did come by asking if we ordered the beer in her hand but after that NOTHING! So we decided to leave after waiting for another 5 minutes. When we got up, one of the waitress approached us and we were just like "no sorry, we waited 15 minutes already. Maybe we'll get water elsewhere". What poor service for a place that wasn't even busy at all! We weren't asking for the world. Just a "hi. I'll be with you shortly" or even a "I'll get you water" some sort of acknowledgment 

Menu/food: 
Didn't get to eat anything or even DRINK WATER due to having to wait 15 minutes without even a "hi, I'll be right with you" and two attempts to flag any waitress down.

Overall: 
There is no overall. Just avoid at all cost unless you want to sit on a dirty table waiting for a hello from anyone in the next 30 minutes.

Service is good and food here is actually really consistent. They always have food and drink specials, so you really get the best bang for your buck here! Wings, fries, ribs are staples here. Recently I had Greek fries and they were delish! The taco salad was surprisingly fresh - would definitely order again!

If there was a way to give no stars I would! I came from the states and wanted to get something to drink with the groom. When we tried to order drinks they ID'd me which is fine, but it's what they said next that didn't make sense to me. The manager came up and denied me because it was a United States ID (Government issued). He told me that I have to use my passport which I thought was very idiotic because If I'm out drinking and I lose my passport; I'm going to be stuck in Canada for some time. It killed our whole vibe and we swore that we will never be back. 
(I'm 22 and the legal limit is 19)

So if you're looking for some place to get a drink or even food I recommend you don't come here.

This took place on the 13th of septem

Came here for the patio and the patio is fantastic. We had a couple snack the jalapeño poppers and the St. Louise poutine. The jalapeño poppers didn't actually have a jalapeño in them, it was a pice of a red pepper and some kind of cheese blend. They were breaded really well, a real hard breading. They really didn't have much flavour and were served with sour cream. The poutine was a real mix of a lot of different flavour, too much flavour I think. I'd maybe order it again but with the wing sauce and dill sauce on the side. Most of the cocktails seemed sickly sweet so I ordered the red sangria, it wasn't bad and I'd order it again. Patio is nice, I could hear the traffic I Yonge street but we were also mostly  sheltered from the sight of it. Service was ok, its what I expected from a chain restaurant. Our table ended up full of empty cups and glasses to the point that we just stopped ordering and got our bill.
Good food, super fast service. The staff are great and very attentive.

Was waiting for over an hour, (3ppl) when a table for 4 was available, a guy that walk in half way thru our wait time takes the table without being told by the waitress to be sat, when we told the PURPLE HAIRED WAITRESS about that she said " he's a regular" and here I am coming every Tuesday! What am I chop liver!! Terrible service!

I had a very minor hiccup when I came in and I wasn't even worried about it but Avery and steph went out of their way to make us feel welcome and gave me a great experience. Then we ordered food it was amazing hands down a place to check out!!!!

A friend and I stopped by this location last night and we had a really good experience. 

The Ambiance:
This location has a really nice patio where you can dine in and enjoy the heat & sunshine during the summer months. 

The Employees:
The employees are super friendly and kind. They continuously checked in on us and we had a really positive experience. 

The Food:
The restaurant has a great drink and food menu. They have different specials each day of the week and have lots of healthy choices, in addition to old time favourites. 

I noticed a Citrus turkey salad with avocado on the menu and a chicken Mediterranean salad. If I wasn't full when we arrived, I definitely would have ordered one of those. 

My friend ordered the Mediterranean salad and she said it was really good. It featured chicken, hummus and lots of vegetables.

I ordered sweet potato fries and they tasted really good. 

The Drinks:
We both ordered Smashers. My friend ordered the vanilla whiskey one (neither of us could really taste the alcohol and it tasted watered down) and I ordered the one that was supposed to have pineapple and taste like a piña colada. I ordered it as a virgin drink since I was taking some medicine and advised not to drink. It tasted very light and I wish it tasted more like a piña colada. 

Would I Return?
Absolutely but I would try a different drink next time.

I always enjoy the wings at this establishment. So many great options to choose from and reasonably priced as well. The servers are always friendly and quick to help with whatever you need. Really enjoyable dining experience every time.

I usually have a good experience here but went for ribs the last time (instead of the usual wings) and regret it. After waiting 45 mins for food, it finally came out and the ribs were COLD. Everyone who ordered ribs at my table had cold ribs. Not room temperature; it was actually cold like it came out of the refrigerator. The most disappointing part is that now I know they re-heat their food and that's definitely not something worth going out and paying for. If other establishments re-heat their ribs, at least they do it right that I am oblivious to it. 5 stars for the wings and service, -3 for the terrible experience with the ribs.

Came here with my boyfriend for a casual dinner. I had to St. Louis jolly rancher drink which consists of 1.5oz of alcohol, vodka, melon liquor, blue curaçao, cranberry juice and margarita mix. It was delicious and tasted just like a refreshing watermelon. Food wise we had poutine, jalapeño poppers and buffalo flavoured wings. The wings had good heat and flavour. The size of the wings themselves are on the smaller size but you receive a decent amount of them for the price. The service was lacking even though it wasn't very busy but the free wifi helped that. They do have several tv's so it's a great place to watch sports. Very casual atmosphere. The poutine was decent. Not great but not bad either. I do not recommend The jalapeño poppers as i prefer the ones with cream cheese inside instead of a marinara type sauce that lacked flavour. I'd give this place another shot but not for awhile.

Went there during a playoff game . Got a nice table .. great deals on food ..and drinks. I LOVED THEIR Mississippi honey garlic boneless bites and pair it with sweet potato fries... the servers are incredible. They are fast . If customers know it's going to be busy the kitchen works hard to put good quality food out

This place was pretty good before but since it has been bought over by new management, things have taken a turn. I noticed that the bottom line is cost and will make decision regardless if it means upsetting the regular clientele. 

-The French fries used to be so good and now have switched over to Costco fries :(
-prices have increased
-i used to ask for Cajun dust on my fries (free) and now they will charge whatever they want without telling you. I had two orders of wings with fries and Cajun dust, one charge was 0.45 and the other was 0.48

Just don't expect much from service, it's super slow, they don't bring you plates and napkins or utensils all the time... And eater or drink refill will take a long time. You're better off going up to the servers at the bar and asking for what you want...basically serving yourself 

On the bright side the wings are still pretty decent, I like the spicy chili flavor.

Tip: check your bill carefully, ordered one drink and they charge 1.5 drink.....

I came with my 4 yo son and 2 friends for Saturday brunch.

Service = Adequate.  They were slow to do/get things.  We waited a long time for our brunch.  No apologies or check-ins.  Took a long time for them to check in on us.  Even for the bill.

Food quality = Good.  Things tasted good.  Probably the best tater tots I've ever had.  Steak was done properly to my request.

Food value = Terrible.  All the dishes were tiny.  The only person that got full of their order was my tiny son.  Even a skinny average heighted woman with a small appetite wasn't full.  They took so long with our food, we couldn't afford the time to get another order in.   The menu/restaurant should offer these as "regular" portions, with the opportunity to upsize to "large" (by that, I mean regular) for $x.  Instead, I'm just frustrated and angry over being fed like a child.

I would not return based on the value problem.

The best classic poutine that I've had in a long time! With it being so close to me, I hadn't considered going there, because we all tend to overlook our neighbourhood gems, but once I went I loved it! With amazing vegetarian options and music that you can bop to while you look at the rock and roll decor, it's a great place for a pop in dinner or a pint.

You'd be doing yourself a disservice by going here. Nothing here is worth your money, from the attitude at the door to the food they serve- a through and through disappointment for your money.

Or better yet, try it and let Yelp know. This place is a money grab with no value for money.

Aviod this bar if you wanna watch sports. We went to Striker in good belief that we'd catch the Leafs game.. Instead we met a full on quiz event and NO hockey on any screen. Very disappointing seeing as this place was told to be a sports bar.

Convenient location right in the heart of downtown and minutes away from Union Station. Pick 6ix Sports is certainly a nice place and is larger compare other restaurants and bars. The service is good. The food is only ok but the price is on the higher side.

A British style restaurant for Canadians.

I wanted to make sure I gave this place a fair review, therefore I visited for both breakfast and a Sunday roast dinner to ensure it got it's proper due.

What lured us into this establishment was "the full english breakfast".  To my poor boyfriend's (who is British) surprise, the english breakfast did disappoint.  The beans were not Heinz, the mushrooms were mixed into the beans, the bacon was an American style bacon, the black pussing was mediocre and the sausage was a run of the mill sausage...not a proper English sausage.  My corn beef hash was ok...I was expecting the potatoes to be smaller...like a proper hash but they were quartered at best.  Therefore, breakfast was a not return for us.  

When I booked the reservation for breakfast, I also noticed they do a proper Sunday roast dinner therefore I made a reservation for that as well.  Back we went for our Sunday roast.  The appetiser of the scotch egg was done to a more gourmet style than traditional...which is just a personal preference.  The pork scratchings were really nice....even my boyfriend who doesn't like pork scratchings enjoyed them.  The roast was a sirloin roast that was cooked nice.  The roasted potatoes were mediocre and the yorkshire pudding was excellent.  We noticed they had a sticky toffee pudding which is always a must for us.  Again, personal preference on this one as well....I enjoy a golden syrup on my sticky toffee pudding and this one was served with a black treacle.

The service was average at best.  The place was not busy and when we get our appetisers before our soft drinks, there is a bit of an issue with that.  

Will we be back...we will probably give it another try as we saw a great plate of fish and chips being delivered to another customer...but it will not be a constant in our rotation of restaurants for breakfast.

Sandra and the rest of the staff are top-notch.

My personal favorite beer was the Muddy York Hefeweizen, but their selection runs the gamut from light water to heavy triple-IPA (might be hyperbolic but you get my point).

Too long did not read- this place gives you sports and it gives you beer. If you walk away complaining, the problem is probably you. "Come through, fam."

My visit to Two Dogs was on a Raptor's Finals night. I give it that they were busy, but they were unprepared. There were only a few front staff members and they were all super busy. We were seated upstairs at the pool table which had a cover on top. I think on a regular night the TV viewing areas would be good. After being seated I had to find the waitress and go up to order. We asked for water that never came. The biggest disappointment was that my top four beer choices were unavailable. I feel like this should have been something they told us right away, they were even out of their Two Dogs house beer. We ordered some nachos because we were hungry. They were okay but expensive. The food we saw being served to others looked terrible with small portions. I would like to give Two Dogs another chance, but I just won't be back here. A sports bar not having half of their draft beer selection during the playoffs is a major mistake.

Did a group event here using the "Feasting Menu" which is promoted in their website but not yet reviewed anywhere I could find. There are many feasting choices that have varying minimums (8 for prime rib roast, for example). 

The feasts are served family-style, and came with lots of sides, gravy and veg, and a plate of excellent Yorkshire puddings. 

There is a private room available that is best suited to a group of 10 or less (allowing you to draw the curtain), but we squeezed 12 in with the curtain open. 

The roast itself was very good: good meat, well seasoned and cooked proper rare. It is expensive (about $39pp, but the traditional roast also looked good in Yelp pics and about $10pp less), but we got a lot, and there was no fee to bring an outside cake, which could save you a ton over buying everyone a dessert (with 10 people, that could add $100!). The other alternative we'd considered was "House on parliament" which is quite a bit less (under $25pp and includes dessert), but not prime rib and no reservations.

The hand pulled rotating cask ale is the way to go for a drink: it's larger (20oz) and a little better deal ($8.75) than many of the other options, and a hand-pulled drink isn't something you find many places, so must-try (the beer is less gassy, and pours with a nice head - made for feasting!)

Parking isn't easy, but if you're lucky you may get a street spot right outside for $5/hr.

I make it here once a year for the past five years. The service is always top notch and the atmosphere is exactly what is suggested by the name. The food is always good. The only complaint I've had recently is that the sticky toffee pudding recipe is using too much black strap molasses (molasses isn't usually used in sticky toffee pudding). Beyond that, it's always consistently good.

Pick 6ix is a very upscale sports bar at Yonge and Wellington so convenient for workers and visitors in the financial district. Lots of tv for watching sports. There's booths, high tops and tables. Nice bar area. I think they are stilling working out some start up pains, like lack of bar menus, printed food menus, etc. Menu is basic pub fare. Our first two choices of beer were unavailable so that's odd. Food was just so so (everything we ordered was overcooked and dry) although the burgers delivered to a neighbouring table looked really good. Service was cheerful and attentive. Good place for drinks and snacks for watching a game.

Food was decent but the service was abysmal. 
I'm basic and take pictures of my food so I have time stamps of the night. 
We as a table of 4 were seated at 7:30 and our server was fairly fast at bringing us water which was nice but sort of rushed us for ordering our food. 
Around 8:00 we got our meals and everything was going pretty good. 
Should also note there was a table directly behind us of 4 gentleman who our server kept checking up on about every 5 minutes. 
Around 9:00 we were left high and dry with no water or anyone checking on us while we continue to notice our server checking this table consistently, and as we try and get her attention she just walks in the opposite direction. 
After an eternity we track her down and ask for the bill, she apologized for the wait and told us she'd be back with it. We watch her go grab the machine, then drop it and pick up a trey of beers and then walk away to serve it to another table. After 20 minutes of waiting again she returns and we finally get to end this nightmare. 
If you're ever planning on catching the game here, or passing by and curious like my group was, there's better places nearby.

My experiences here keep getting better and better! I simply love this place. I re-visited this place for the second time this past weekend. This time, I got sit inside. I ended up ordering the chicken sticks (which are actually chicken fingers) again but ended up expanding my horizons as well by ordering the cauliflower wings. I normally hate cauliflower but these wings were fabulous! One of my favourite things about this place is all the magnetic letters that you can play around with on your way to the bathroom. I also like that there are many board games such as, Cards Against Humanity, that you could play. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for a solid spot on the east end!

FOOD REVIEW: Fries were great. Wings were breaded and soggy. 
DRINK: I ordered a Caesar and it was very tasty.
SERVICE: Horrible. Granted we were there later on at night, but the waiter was rude and bad at his job. 
ATMOSPHERE: downstairs was nice enough but upstairs was a smelly, sweaty mess with drunken college students singing bad karaoke and cash only.

These were the best Caesars I've ever had! The toppings are an extra bonus!

I also had the pulled pork mac and cheese, which was great but the mac wasn't as cheesy!

We went for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night and it was back to school week so the place was full of university students.

We will definitely be going here again but not in the evenings as the crowd was way too young for us.
Great pub atmosphere upstairs is quiet and casual.  Food is excellent and service was great!

Pretty ... but Pricey 
Went last Sunday - very pretty two floor pub but very much on the expensive side also.  I had the chicken pie at around $20 - it was ok - portion was small for the price.   Drinks are pretty expensive - glass of white wine for around $12-14 - mixed cocktails over $12.   Beers are priced on the high side too - local lager was $8.75 for a draft pint.   The server rhymed off their bottled beers and I didn't recognize a singe one very obscure labels.  Service was great.  I would think twice about coming here again for dinner due to the dinner cost.

I don't think I'm EVER stopping by this place for a drink. The bartender(s) are just rude. Period. Not sure what they expect, excellent tips maybe?? But they're simply really rude. And moreover, of all the pubs I hit, this one has a distinct racist undertone. I can't back this up, of course. But the feeling is there. Hence, as far as I'm concerned, Duke's is done for me.

Another amazing stop at Duke's. Asked our waiter for a suggestion this time. It was between the fish n chips or the burrito. He suggested the burrito and I am so glad he did it was DELICIOUS.  It is crazy, I thought, when it came with a steak knife. But I went with it, and you need it to eat this burrito. The flavours out of this world. A must if you stop in to Duke's. They have amazing fries, make sure they ask for them well done. The sweet potato fries are delicious. Can never go wrong wth their home made chicken fingers. 
When in the downtown Toronto area make sure Duke's is a place you stop. Great selection of craft beers, great rotating taps.
Awesome wait staff, so friendly and always willing to suggest a great meal or a beer to match.

So first off, I love this place. The seating, the layout, the ambience. But let me not get started on that Mac and cheese. I'm American, so that Mac made me feel like I was at my grandmas house on thanksgiving day. It was that good. Think it's only served with the buttermilk fried chicken and bitter greens, but even then the entire entree is perfection. I will suggest this restaurant/bar to all of my friends coming from the United States because I know that they will love it. Great music as well, considering I assumed it would be majority hip hop playlist. Shoutout to our waiter Harry Klasen, very patient and funny by the way

One of my favorite places to go when I visit Toronto. Let's start with the fact that drake opened this place! The vibe is so cool - the food and drinks are great. I heard it's more of a sports bar now - when I went it had more of a restaurant and lounge feel. All in all - check it out!
Had an amazing evening at Score on King and really enjoyed the burger with bacon and onion jam, so tasty!  Drank lots of Ontario Rose' and enjoyed fantastic service.  Thanks for the fun evening!

Came in for happy hour which is anytime before 4 pm. It was not busy at all. For their happy hour menu they only have $4 PBR, Bar Rails, Apps that include Small Poutine, Nashville Hot Onion Rings, (4) Chicken Wings, and small Slider. 
The food was okay. The Onion Rings have a ton of sweet southern batter, and are pretty oily and filling. They have a bit of heat.
The slider (1) was really small and served with fries. It was like a quarter of a hamburger.
The wings were good and I recommend dry rub and sauce on the side. But at $1.00 a wing not a great deal.

Dropped in with a friend again for drinks Friday night. The place was full and we got a seat next to the door. 

Service was kind of slow, but they were full so that's understandable. Our server seemed a little annoyed when we said we just wanted drinks and no food. 

Last time, I got the tub thumper cocktail but it's not on the menu anymore. Went with a vodka cran (this place does not skim on the alcohol).

Our server disappeared and didn't come back but another server was able to help us. 

Got a little hungry so I ordered the chicken fingers (which came with a salad). Salad did not seem to have dressing, but it tasted ok. Chicken fingers were a little spicy.

Fun place to hang out and enjoy a beer and snacks! Well, ok I don't drink beer but they have awesome old fashioned's  on tap for 11$ which is makes me sooo happy. They do have quite an extensive beer list since that is the demographic this place targets anyway :). Onion rings are crisp and hot, nachos are yummy, guac is ok (a little flavorless), calamari good . Had a lot of fun after work with co-workers. Good laid back atmosphere!

Came here for a work event. The staff was very accommodating, and our team had a lot of fun. The drinks were amazing. Food was alright. I got the chicken fingers which were pretty good. Fries were soggy and not that good. I also tried some of my colleagues' fish n chips, and nachos. Those were also average. 

The games provided here are great, and the vibe is amazing too. Would high recommend coming here to play some games!

This place is a joke. Would give 0 stars if possible, service is horrible....Drake should stick to music.
Do not go.

I would give this place no stars if I could. The staff have no idea what is going on and I am to assume this stems from management not having a clue. No hosts when we walked in, despite having many bartenders it took us forever to get a drink and the payment situation was a nightmare. Never going back.

So we returned from eating at this very English and charmingly quaint pub sampling their ploughman's meat feast, chicken caesar salad and sticky toffee pudding.  Liquid libation was 2 cans of dry cherry cider.   What strike me as odd was that the place was nearly empty except for another couple in the dining room on a Saturday night.  The upstairs patio had one table occupied.  The outside patio situated at the front of the restaurant had a bit more diners.  The ploughman's feast was tasty especially the potted chicken spread.  The best part of the meal was the sticky toffee pudding.  Very little and pricey but it was the best we've tasted by far.

came here for a birthday and i wasn't overly impressed at this place. 
my friends had booked a room for the party, and a member of the staff gave the room away to a bigger party, so instead of having access to all sorts of games, we were reduced down to two sets of couches and two ps4's. this basically was an event where i stood around just chatting to friends, as the party for us was 20 people and all of the couch space was taken up. i wasn't too happy or impressed with the whole layout either, as we could hear everyone in the other room hoot and hollering away. the worst part of this visit was the bathroom, which i might say is in the top five worst bathrooms i've ever been to, the bathroom is solid black, not all of the lighting works, AND some ceiling tiles were missing. 

transit options is the 512 st clair streetcar and the st clair station on the YUS line, both options with a bit of a walk. parking is in the area with some side streets and private lots nearby. 

Did not feel comfortable at this place at all during my visit and i will not be back on my own merit, staff seemed to be completely oblivious to my friends needs when they went to the bar for food and drink as well, and the staff kept zero tabs on people walking out with drinks to smoke on the patio (code violation?)

The atmosphere of this place is super good. Has outdoor seating with heaters, a million TV's and pool tables. The food is priced fair and has some good options. The pizza is okay (5/10) but I also got a swordfish sandwich that was amazing. Would definitely recommend this place in the heart of Toronto.

Not the best food, great atmosphere, good music, meh food.

I would of scored lower due to the service but our waitress is doing a great job of providing customer satisfaction and does a great job of being real and seeing our concerns

We had a group of 6 in town for the weekend and were looking for a place to watch the English Premier Saturday AM game and grab some breakfast.  

Jackpot!  Upstairs is a large flat screen with a bar, comfortable seating and a dozen or so tables.  Staff was more than accommodating, food was delicious and mimosa's completed the morning.  

When in Toronto again we will be back for sure!

I heard you like Spicy Caesars.

How about some HUMONGOUS Spicy Caesars? Would you like that?

Oh you like hot wings too??

And Eggs Benny? 

Delicious Brunch in general?????

Me too. I had it here. The staff is pretty awesome too. 
Pretty sweet that you don't need to go down 3,746 flights of stairs to get to the washroom at this pub like you do in 99% of pubs in Toronto. Also the walls are covered in alphabet magnets so the little child inside you can spell extremely mature words to your hearts content!
LOVEEE THIS PLACE!!

P.S. First!

Duke's Refresher Bar was so good. It wasn't one of the recommended restaurants we had planned which made it a happy surprise. 

We were looking for a quick bite after arriving in Toronto and Duke's was right across the street from our hotel. When we walked in there was only one other person sitting at the bar and absolutely no staff in sight. We didn't have high hopes but thought to sit down anyway. Ambiance was that of a dive bar, but instead of giving off a dirty feel is was more cozy. Eventually someone came to seat us. As you can see... this is not the beginnings of a 5 star review. Well, just keep reading. 

The menu is really cool. They have different record covers and inside is a disc with the food options. That is pretty unique. I ordered the cider along with a burger and my fiancé ordered the flight. The flight is actually a pretty good deal if you want to try different beers. The food is presented really well, but the taste is amazing! This has to be one of the best burgers I have ever had in my life. My fiancé ordered the spicy chicken sandwich. He raved about that as well. I didn't try it because I have a delicate pallet and didn't want the burn of the chicken to ruin the taste of the burger... because the burger was so good! It was juicy and flavorful. You don't even need a lot of toppings because the meat itself is so good. When he tried my burger he admitted I got the better meal, so if you go the burger is a must. 

Overall, definitely come check this place out. Whether its for late night eats or lunch you should try to make some time to try their burger. You won't regret it.

I really enjoyed my visit here. They have beers on tap and good food. I got the Hangry Chicken sandwich and upgraded to sweet potato (best decision ever). They fries were the best sweet potato fries I have ever tasted and they come with a sauce that is out of this world. I love the atmosphere too - video clips playing on the background and even Disney's Hercules was playing other TVs. Definitely recommend this place if you are in town.

Went there for dinner and left disappointed.We thought we grab a bite before heading to Scotiabank arena. The waiter had no personality. And when we looked around us it seemed it was all around poor. We asked for drinks with St. Germain and she said there was none there. We turn around to look at bar and there's 4 bottles in the open. We order sliders and tacos, and I swear after few bites I was done. No flavor. Suggestion. If you are hungry go eat at Scotiabank arena. Same prices and you won't be disappointed.

Quality was good, quantity was POOR. 

We choose this place for Easter Sunday Lunch as we wanted a comforting roast dinner!  We were sat downstairs among other restaurant goers and to our dismay, when we were greeted by the waitress, we were handed a Brunch menu. This was obviously our own fault and we should have done more research as we were hoping for a varied British lunch menu for a special Easter Sunday meal. 
Nonetheless, we decided to stay and dine at this eatery as we were both hangry and thankfully, there was a Roast of the Day option on the Brunch menu to satisfy our Spud, Meat and Veg needs. 
Priced at $29, the dish certainly fell on the more expensive side, I mean, you might expect these prices on a  dinner menu, but Brunch? 
We were served our drinks straight away and it was about a 20 minute wait for said roast to appear under our nostrils and once it arrived, we both knew it would be devoured in a matter of minutes. We were given (and this is not an exaggeration) one thick cut of roast beef (we expected at least 2 or 3 slices for the price), two baby roast potatoes, and about 4 string beans and 4 - 5 chunks of carrot (which were under cooked) served with a Yorkshire pud on the side and a miserable drizzle of gravy. 
The waitress came over to check if we needed anything else and my partner politely indicated that the serving size was poor and we would appreciate more sides with our dish. She did not hesitate once she saw our plates, and swiftly returned back with a small side plate of roast potatoes (she must have forgotten about the veg) 
All in all it was an occasion so we decided not to dwell too much on the meal and asked for the desert menu which looked fantastic.
We both opted to share the Sticky Toffee Pud served with a scoop of vanilla Ice-cream and two Breakfast Tea's on the side, and we were not disappointed. 
Overall the meal came to about $120 with tip which was a little more than we intended to spend for Sunday lunch.
It was nice to try somewhere new and we probably won't return again, although the Pancakes did look good!

The best part of my experience at lunch was the service. Server and host were attentive and accommodating. Other than that , this place is forgettable. 

I wasn't excited to come here for a group lunch simply because of the uninspired menu similar to a lot of other places in that area. It's the type of restaurant that does a decent job of the classics (burgers, salads) but nothing you will be in a hurry to try again. 

Tried the tuna ceviche with nacho chips as a starter which was just ok. The mushroom and goat cheese "purses" were just ok as well. 

My main , ahi tuna salad, was just too salty and hard to enjoy. 2/5 

Guess I'm happy I tried pick6 because it's across the street from my work but I can't think of a single reason , food wise, why I would return.

When visiting Toronto, my husband and I spent two evenings here because we liked it so much. They had a good selection of beers - including some gluten free ones, which hubs appreciated. Their food was also fantastic. I got some Korean wings that were to die for. They played fun stuff on on TVs overhead, but we could still easily have a conversation. Must check this spot out if you're not into the club scene and just want a cool place to hang out after a long day of trekking around the city.

First and foremost, super friendly waitstaff from host to servers. A colleague and I were looking for some hearty fare and some good brews, and we found it here. 

One of the specials of the night was a steak and mushroom cobblepot (think pot roast mixed with Shepard's Pie, just not burned to oblivion like pot roast tends to be). We both opted for that special, and it was delicious. The steak was not overdone, the mushrooms were the perfect amount of firm, and the brown sauce/gravy was super tasty. 

I would definitely recommend this place, and next time I'm in Toronto I'll be back. No pictures of the food, it was gone too quickly.

Where do I begin? The unfortunate thing is that this restaurant had potential - the aesthetic is fun and funky and the seating is super comfortable. However, I was turned off when I noticed the menu prices (particularly the alcohol) was different in-restaurant than online. In my case, I noticed the Aperol spritz that I had planned to order was $7 more expensive than it said it was online. When I brought it to the waiter's attention, his response was "I know nothing about that". Expecting him to send the manager over, the table and I ordered our drinks (2 cans of beer, 2 cans of cider - switching my order after seeing the prices). We then waited 15 MINUTES to be served CANNED drinks. When the waiter came by for round two and a manager hadn't visited the table yet, we asked for the bill and I took matters into my own hands. I approached the manager and informed her that her menu prices in restaurant and online were different. She was shocked, and thanked me...calling her "menu guy" while I was still next to her and informing him of the mistakes. After getting off of the phone, she sent me on my way. No complimentary drink. No honouring of the prices I saw online. No apology. Just a thank you - for covering her ass after something she should've reviewed herself when the website went live...but it gets better. I ended up informing the waiter that I spoke with the manager, and obviously pissed off, he began to argue with my table about how good the drink prices are, and how it isn't cheaper anywhere else in the area. He handed me a menu and asked me to GIVE HIM AN EXAMPLE of a better drink deal in the area. I told him that I wasn't interested in arguing, we paid for our drinks, and headed to a bar down the road where the drinks were cheaper, and the service was much much better. The cherry on top was that my boyfriend was charged twice for our drinks. Do not recommend, will not go back. The menu prices online now match the menu prices in-restaurant, you're welcome. Summary: Drake should stick to the music business.

Clearly Drake is a fair weather fan, this place is a disaster. Dead plants..no joke...all the plants were dead on the patio. Service is a joke...im guessing when the Raptors make the playoffs he'll be back in town to "rep the raps".  Save your cash and walk down the street, esplande has much better bars where they value your $.

Really cool vibe inside, especially at night on a weekend. Convenient location downtown Toronto. Drinks were averagly priced, and made well. As weird as it sounds, I'd recommend the bacon caramel mini donuts. It's all the things you love on their own, put together in one weird but somehow functional combination. So good!
Tried this place for a second time. First time the food never arrived. This time what did arrive was cold. Worst service ever inattentive servers. Get it together!!

Pretty happy with the service provided here all night.
We had a reservation on the couches to watch the Overwatch game for when Toronto Defiant was playing. It was a group of 7 of us on one big couch in the corner beside the other couch that seemed more for 2. (We could have easily fit like 10 people on this one couch..)
I would have to say, the service was constant and nothing short of amazing. They got us drinks quickly, they provided the food as soon as it was ready and kept checking back at our area at least every 20 minutes to make sure we were ok (and to take away any cups we had finished with)
The nachos were average. The vanilla ice cream was worth its value and the chocolate lava cake had a little too much ice cream in my opinion, but was delicious!
Unfortunately, once the Toronto Defiant had finished playing, the place cleared out FAST, which was very odd...
Overall, I highly recommend coming here, even if you just want to hang out with friends and play video games!

Walked to this place on our lunch As we were looking for a patio bar ..simple menu and they simply do it good. Rated 4 stars because they asked us for ID which I understand for younger looking people but we averaged 49 years old .. overall I'd recommend it for ambiance and food
Such a cute spot and the besttttttt service. Our waitress Masha made sure we had everything we needed and was more than accommodating. Thanks for showing us a great time!

We came into this restaurant on a Saturday night. It wasn't busy at all. The host informed us they didn't have a server for the night. So we waited 20 minute while they sorted out a server. In the meanwhile, a server finally comes over and takes drink and entree orders. We waited 34 additional minutes for water, and soda. Our entrees came before the drinks. It wasn't until the manager was notified that we actually got drinks. Oh yea, they don't sell lemonade here either. Our food came to the table me boyfriend and i ordered a spicy shrimp pizza and wings. The wings were fried way to hard AND was cold as hell. Overall, food was horrible and service was beyond horrible. Save yourself the time and money and go to a establishment that you can get quality food and service. Needless to say i wont even entertain the thought of coming back.

Cute quaint restaurant with a Victorian atmosphere. There's outdoor patio seating right on the street and also a small patio on the second floor. The service was great and food came out fairly quickly but the food was just mediocre - nothing to really write home about.

I came here last week with a few friends. We sat on the patio which was nice with ample seating and heat lamps. In addition, the service was quick and attentive. We ordered nachos to start and I got the chicken fingers as my main. They were incredible and some of the best in the city !! I highly recommend this place: great food, good location and fantastic patio (I haven't been inside yet so I cannot comment on that).

It was my 1st night ever in Toronto and Duke's was around the corner from my Airbnb so we decided to try it and it was a very cool space & atmosphere. The record player menus were definitely unique and the burger I had was great!

First time coming here for brunch. I find it unusually quiet as it's usually noisy during dinnertime. 
Simply English menu. Portions are just nice, service is quick. 
But the fish pie is definitely better at the Oxley's in Yorkville. Cheeseburger I'd give a thumbs up! 
Ploughman's lunch seemed interesting, but sounds like the French equivalent to tartine. 
Maybe the weekend brunch would get me coming back.
Terrible service. I understand that they were busy tonight but they made us feel like we were an inconvenience by asking how much seating they had available.

Was back here for a company lunch meeting. This dish was better than the ahi tuna salad I had when I first visited but was also nothing special.  However kudos for the excellent sweet potatoes fries. Fav part of my meal.

Duke's is trying it's damnedest to be a dive bar. But all the tattooed waitresses, wood tables, and ironic signs in the world won't hide the truth: Duke's is a foodie's paradise.

Everything we had was great, starting with their epic mixed drinks and draft beers. As for appetizers, they had plenty ... but we were saving room for dessert (more on that later!)

I got their PBJ Fingers. To call them "fingers" doesn't do them justice ... unless they are based on the size of Andre the Giant's fingers. And, wow, the taste! The perfect mix of Spicy Thai peanut sauce, spicy chili jelly, and cilantro, with the perfect deep-fried chicken.

My wife's burger, The Woody, was also amazing:  American cheese, bacon, Duke's special sauce, caramelized onion, BBQ brushed and served on a house-made bacon focaccia bun. Tasty, crispy, goodness. 

But did I mention that amongst the choice of sides with your meal is a heaping bowl of poutine?!?!

Sometimes my wife has a great idea, and she did tonight: Two Desserts!  Kids and adults alike will love Krusty's Snow Balls: Deep fried cornflake-crusted vanilla ice cream, topped with chocolate & caramel sauce, whipped cream, Reese's Pieces, toffee pieces, pretzels, and marshmallows. And then  the dessert that needs no further introduction: Bacon Caramel Mini Donuts...

A perfect end to a perfect meal!

A super fun and relaxing atmosphere! I would totally recommend this place if you're looking for a fun time with friends. I stopped here for drinks after work.  The drink selection was good and the waitress was very helpful in making our selections. We ended up getting a pitcher of The Shamgria - Cider, gin, triple sec, honey ginger syrup, lemon and cranberry juice. It was a great summer refresher! The food menu seemed to be your regular pub fare, I would totally come back again to try the food menu out. The most memorable part was that the menus are vinyls put in 80s/90s band covers! To go along with the theme they were playing 80s/90s music too. I really enjoyed this place and will be coming back again soon!

Dropped in with a friend for drinks. Interesting bar playing music from the 80s, 90s, 00s and playing movies and music videos from this time. 

Ordered the tub thumper cocktail which was delicious! Service was okay, I had to flag the server down for more drinks.
Great food and staff with a cool atmosphere. Delicious food and good drinks. Nice unique place would visit again.

Treated HORRIBLY by our waitress "Michelle S."!

Came here after a birthday dinner at a nearby sushi place. 

We had a group of 8 people and only 4 of us were ordering drinks since we mainly wanted to get a few rounds for the birthday boy. That's when the waitress got upset and rudely demanded that all of us had to order at least 1 drink in order to stay. I had never heard of this rule before and neither has my girlfriend who is a local server. Even so, I would understand if the venue was packed and we were taking up too many spots, but this was not the case as it was far from capacity.

After that, she took a considerably long time to deliver our drinks (beer on tap). We tried to let it go and not let one negative interaction ruin the rest of our night. However, when it came time to settle we noticed that she added an 18% tip onto all of our bills and conveniently didn't mention it. I understand that it is customary to add gratuity to the bill for groups of 6 or larger, but I believe the standard is 15%. So it was quite presumptuous of her to assume above average service.

The most upsetting part is that we all got the impression that she felt she could finesse us and get away with it. I'd imagine this isn't the first time she's behaved this way and I hope it's not representative of the service level for the rest of Duke's staff. Either way it dampened the birthday boys night. 

I don't like writing these kinds of reviews but I hope Duke's management is made aware of Michelle's behaviour.
Super cool spot. Great vibe, great service. Went on a Friday and it was decently busy. Music was good.

I've been here a few times. I give it 2 stars for the staff, which are friendly. However, the food..... disgusting. And expensive. I ordered Mac and cheese and it tasted like watery cheese whiz sauce. I also order gnocchi another time and it was flavourless. Order spring rolls, they tasted frozen. So I recommend eating before you come here. 

Another thing I'd like to add is that the bathrooms are not very clean. I can only speak on the women's washrooms but anytime I've went they are not very clean at all. And they always have the bathroom door open to the rest of the place, and when you sit near there or pass it there is always a.... smell. Which is really gross considering there is food being served. 

Only positive is that the staff are pretty friendly. But I always see them on their cell phones behind the bar when there is customers waiting to be served. Overall experience is not great

We were visiting Toronto last weekend and wanted to have an English breakfast. We found this place and it looked promising, as well as it being within walking distance from our hotel which was a plus. We made a reservation for 1030 on a Sunday, but there was no wait Whitney we arrived and were seated immediately.

First, the service here is terrible! We were one of maybe 7 guests in the whole restaurant and it took forever for everything from our drink orders (coffee, tea and water) to our main course. I did order a mimosa while we waited and it came fairly quickly.

As for the food, I am British, so a full English breakfast (minus that black pudding, which was in the description but never came) I was excited for. The toast, tomato, eggs and mushrooms were okay. The black pudding never came and I wouldn't have had it anyway. Now, the bacon.. it was definitely not good bacon nor what you would've expected. The sausage was more on a chorizo side and disgusting and the beans were definitely not Heinz or cooked well enough. 

It was a huge disappointment from the service to the food and I wish I would have read reviews prior to going. I would not recommend for breakfast at all. Maybe their Sunday roast and/or fish n chips are worth it, but if the service is anywhere close to breakfast, I would pass.

Cool gay and heterosexual place pricey as heck. The bartender was real cool. I ordered one Long Island and a order of wings (half off wing Wednesday) my bill was $28 at a sports bar. I'm not cheap but really .

So cool! Love the funky decor. Lots of beer on tap, but unfortunately none I was particularly crazy about so I stuck with go to: gin & tonic. Food is standard pub fare, may be a bit on the pricey side for what you get. Great music including old school music: 80's 90's playing on overheard TVs along with other things on silent. Really enjoyed the laid back feel of this place. My third time here :) On a visit from L.A.

Very bougie sports bar. I only went because it's drakes place. If it wasn't, I probably wouldn't not. But it was good overall. Food was pretty pricey and so were the drinks. $18 cocktails... 

Group of 3 went. We made reservations which were not needed on a Saturday night because there were a lot of empty tables. DJ was really good, made the place really hype. They restaurant was really modern looking, even the washrooms. All gold and black. 

I ordered the calabrese pizza. It was a good size. It was $18. A little over priced. But it was really tasty. Also I had a mojito, I think that was $16. It was really good though. 

I don't think I would come back even though I liked the place. It was just out of my price range.

First off, Isabelle was our waitress and she was the worst of all time. Literally horrible. Literally the Gretzky of bad. Good luck being mediocre. #realleadership

Great music, sports on tv if you ask and super retro vibe.

The burgers here are excellent, the Mac and Cheese burger is my favorite. Wings and poutine are also great.

I'm a beer person and Toronto is a mad max style wasteland when it comes to a decent brew. Dukes has a great selection on tap and in cans. Lots of great rotating craft.

This place is my go-to in Toronto

Went here for late night drinks and appetizers. Would have liked a larger selection of ciders since there are so many made here, but the cider I had was tasty.  We had the chicken nachos, gauc, sliders, and poutine. Pretty decent food. The nachos were a little smaller than I expected. Would recommend for a stop on a bar crawl but not spending the whole night there!
This bar was nice. It was close to our hotel. The bartender were all amazing and it wasn't to expensive. After touring all day this is a perfect place to unwind urself with good music

Extremely upscale bar atmosphere. The service was excellent and the food was even better. Tons of variety and options for my vegetarian friends! I highly recommend the BBCG and the matcha tiramisu for dessert. Definitely on the pricey side, so come prepared.

Had the greatest waitress named Claudia, excellent suggestions on drinks and also recommended sites to see in the local area. 
Drinks served in old fashioned glasses, DJ during happy hour was a nice touch. Lots of TV' s all playing the same sporting events, i didn't come hear for the TVs came to hang out with Drake. He didn't show up, his loss

This bar was alright when we went here to hang out after having a lovely dinner elsewhere.
We came and were seated almost immediately.
Ordered some drinks, which came pretty quick and tasted fine.
It was extremely noisy in there and it was hard to hear the person talking to you from across the table.
They have board games too, which was cool.
AWFUL service. Incredibly rude and condescending staff. We asked to be put on a list for a table and they refused.

Big shoutout to Brian who was our server last week. He was very engaging, attentive, and responsive to our request. The food was fantastic which came very quickly and Brian made sure the drinks kept coming! Our group had such a good time, I came back the very next day with a different group of friends. I definitely would recommend this place for a good time. Ask for Brian, he will look after you.

Giving pick 6 5 stars due to the amazing hostess.. she welcomed us & made it seem like we've been there before and sat us down promptly :)) & I will be coming back for the buttermilk chicken & the fast seating!!  Also all of the tv screens help me keep an eye on the game which is a nice feature

Love this place! The patio was bumping all summer, great drink deals and not to mention their food is also delicious. Personally I recommend the American Burger or if you get there for brunch the pulled pork benny. Keep up the good work!

The decor at Pick 6ix was very lavish, and high-class; it was tremendous. 

The food and drinks however, did not live up to the expectation. Me and my friends all ordered different types of sushi, and none of ours was rolled properly. We all truly went as it was a Drake restaurant, but it did not live up to any of our expectations.
It's very loud here, but great vibes for small groups and catching sports games. Happy hour specials after 9pm (and before 6 I think). Love the Christmas lights and nachos.

Worst service I've ever had.   Food was less than mediocre.  I would never order the sweet potatoes fries or even burgers.  Terrible bartender attitude and service.   I would rate it less than a star but wasn't an option.     Not worth your time.

Great food. On vacation we always try different places. This time we ate here two nights in a row. Easy to get to either walking distance from Eaton Ctr or Uber 5 min.
Play older 90's movies and music and menu is on vinyl!

To give you some context, it was a booking done 3 days in advance with clear instruction that it was a bday dinner. It was a Sunday night for 10pm on a long weekend.
Honestly, theres no reason for the hype. Great food, terrible service. To sum it up (my original review was too long):

1. They were sold out of everything. Not once were.we informed of any of the sold out items (and there were quite a few).
2. They didn't have a server on site, so they pulled a hostess who (though very sweet) had no clue about the menu, messed up orders and couldnt recommend anything.
3. The "managing partner " (though I think he was our bartender) tried to make it seem like it was our fault because we "didn't show up earlier" and he "didn't know it was a birthday dinner". He clearly couldnt take ownership. It was probably ly the worst part of the night.
4. They tried to charge my friend 50% of a 40$ bill for tip
5. After trying to resolve the multiple issues that came up, they still lied to us. The managing.g partner was very much uncooperative in giving his title or any information to connect him to the evening (or to this review). We were lucky to get his name.

They tried their best at solving the multitude of issues that came up, but they fell short. If you want good food, this place has it. But that may be all you get.
Service is great. Enjoyed the drinks and food. Not great for watching the game as the TV's go in and out quite a bit. Happened all of the times I've been there. Other than that is a great place!

Lovely space and cozy decorations. Food was ok. The scotch egg was not the best... it was ice cold and super salty. My bf who's from England agreed. The main courses were better. We enjoyed the meat pie and fish and chips.

Absolutely amazing! Came here for game 5 and got seated at 7 without a reservation (grateful forever) and we ordered the pepperoni pizza, cheese pizza, mac and cheese, nachos, burger, and spicy chicken burger (i think) and they were all tasty and great portion sizes and reasonably priced (i think the mac and cheese was $10, pizza $14). The drinks were a bit more and the game was great. They had so many screens up and around- definitely recommend.

It was the fish and chips that drew me in when I found them on Yelp, but it turned out that the cheese burger (with stilton!) was what I ordered.

Busy enough that the host didn't want to seat my party of one at a four top, but he did suggest a seat at the bar and that worked out very well.

Friendly and fun service from the bartender who got me a cold draft beer (proper sized pint as well) and took my food order. Burger with fries took a while but it was fresh and hot and the cheese was sharp and melty. I enjoyed their ketchup but would have liked a bit more.

I had a great meal at the Q&B, would definitely return.

[Review 10965 overall, 737 of 2019.]

My go-to spot for watching anything esports related.

I have been here about 5 times and always have a great experience. Very chill spot to watch Overwatch League or anything popular on Twitch. Food is cheap and good value. I have played on the PCs in the back a few times and also a good experience. I am so happy there is a place like this in Toronto. New renovations which changed the name from Raiders to The Hive also made this place 10x better. Also have PS4's to play when you don't want to go HAM on the gaming PCs.

What an amazing find an amazing city. If you think it's a little hole in the wall bar and you'd be right but the service and the food is all made from scratch is literally out of this world. 
This is a  must stop for a foodie and anybody who likes the true hole in the wall local feel with amazing food.

Fantastic chicken fingers / vibes, mediocre other food and horrible server....
My bf and I were super excited to try this place upon hearing that they had some REALLY awesome chicken fingers and cool vibes. When we got there we were very impressed with the interior 80s vibe and all the decor. We found the menus very cool as they resembled records. The beer selection was also great here. We ordered the onion rings to start but found them to be a little overcooked with too much batter and not enough onion. As our main I ordered the chicken fingers which were fantastic and a garden salad as my side which was horrible IMO (totally regret not getting the fries). My bf ordered the beef tacos which were overpriced with 3 small tacos. The tacos themselves had limited toppings...pretty basic with just meat and lettuce..so he obviously was hungry afterwards. Our main issue with this place would be the server who was not very attentive and forgetful. Our first issue with the server was that he did not really give my bf time to order or really look at the menu. As soon as I ordered my food he immediately asked my bf what he wanted even though he wasn't really ready to order. In addition, he forgot to bring us a beer that we ordered and took a while to bring drinks despite it not being very busy. The worst part was that he did not clear our table throughout the night despite it being very obvious that we were done. For example, he did not clear the empty onion ring tower stand prior to giving us our main courses so it sat there the whole time along with dirty plates. Overall, this place had great chicken fingers but all the other food was mediocre and the service sucked. I would be giving this place a 2 if the chicken fingers weren't so delicious.

My girlfriend and I check out The Score on King after the Christmas Market at the Distillery. This was been on our "foodie" list since it opened due to the outrageous Caesars posted on social media. The bar is very cool loud music, sports on the TVs and a giant magnet board with magnetic letters to leave funny messages on the way to the bathroom.

It was a busy Friday and we got a seat at the bar due to a wait list for a table. They have deals every week and Fridays were 5 buck bar rail not bad I ordered a Vodka Soda. The bartenders were great very attentive and personable.

We split the F**in Chicken and Sticks which were basically chicken tenders and fries. They came piping hot. The chicken had a KFC vibe going. It was peppery and a little salty. The fries were crispy and shoestring a little like McDonalds but the flavor or KFC. I thought the meal was enjoyable and the chicken was nice and juicy.

I will definitely return to Score. It's a cool bar with drink deals, good service and cool vibes. It's a total recommend!

With a group of 3, we ordered the nachos, calamari, fries and buttermilk fried chicken. I personally ordered the Caesar salad alone.

The shared plates - was a perfect amount of food for us. The nachos were filling and generous. The calamari was just like any other calamari dish in the city, nothing special. The French fries were extra fried so it was like eating oily crackers (if well done fries peaks your interest). The buttermilk fried chicken came with Mac and cheese, which I found better than the fried chicken itself. Extremely bread-y with little meat.

The Caesar salad - was weak in my opinion. Something about it didn't sit well in my stomach (it was hard to eat). I would've preferred a stronger Caesar dressing, more Parmesan, and no capers. It was a good size on its own.

We saw the DJ for the first 15 minutes of our visit but the playlist was on fire for the rest of our visit (the mix of drake and rnb/hip hop classics).

We came here after the Christmas market and was able to be seated (at the bar) right away despite not having a reservation. Friday bar rail drinks are only $5 although pineapple juice is an extra 25cents if you add it to a drink. We got the chicken fingers and fries for $16 titled f**k yeah chick'n sticks. 

Described as "mango fire marinated free range chicken strips , crispy breading, dill honey mustard, fries." The breading was light and the chicken was juicy. Their spice blend had a unique flavor that reminded me of the 3 deli meat blend sandwich from Subway. Although that's not necessarily a bad thing it was kind of an odd concept to wrap my head around when I was eating the chicken fingers. The fries themselves were shoestring fries and came crispy which was nice.

They have music playing in the background but it was at a good noise level. Loud enough for you to be able to tell what song it was but still quiet enough to be able to here there person beside you.

This is a pretty lovely sports bar.  Looks more like a fancy bar...some great booths at the back, large bar, tons of tables everywhere and TVs galore.  There is the buzz about this place.  It looks great...but....

We only ordered a few drinks as we had dinner reservations elsewhere.  The actual server we had was quite lovely - I wish I remembered her name.  Super friendly and she looked like she was genuinely happy.

The overall service however, was lacking.  It took a while for someone to notice us and come over to take our order.  The staff just all kept walking by.  There is a lot of staff here as this place is huge....however it feels like no one knows what they are doing.

If i was close by in the area, maybe I'd stop by for a drink or two..but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
Tried this spot during my first visit to Toronto. Great food and wonderful wait staff. The curried lamb was definitely a good choice!

Great ambiance if you love an old character building. Personally I love the way old buildings offer several separate dining rooms each with their own feel and this place has that. The menu is rotating and seasonal. I got the chicken Cesar salad and the dressing and bacon were great, but it was dark meat chicken and I wasn't a fan of the fatty gristle pieces so most of my chicken went uneaten, next time I will ask specifically for chicken breast. The artichoke dip is great though. My boyfriend got their pie special and it was a steak and stout pie, which was very very tasty!
Two dogs is my favourite bar on the Bayview strip. Lovely hostess and the environment is great ! Best place to go for a pint by yourself or with friends. Don't miss out on two dogs !!

Pick 6ix is the newest Drake affiliated Toronto hot spot. I did not stop by when it first opened as a restaurant but it is now a full blown sports bar/restaurant (lots of TVs, there's a pool table, full sports bar food menu). The overall aesthetic is sophisticated and trendy - think gold colored cutlery. The burger is AMAZING. Perfectly cooked and seasoned with lots of melted cheese. A really good happy hour menu (available late night as well) makes this a great place to catch a game. 

Sidebar: for anyone looking for the Pick 6ix "Instagram-able" sign - it was not available. 

Pros:
Good happy hour menu (food and drink specials), great decor, good service, lots of TVs, burger is a must try!

Cons:
"Medium" flavor wings taste like tomato sauce.

A busy pub and restaurant who's staff goes a long way to address guests comfort and needs. From the moment we walked in and it was too busy to seat us someone came and gave us the option of going upstairs and grabbing a drink and we got upstairs to have a drink and it was full we were given the option of a few places to hang until seats opened up and then seats were given to us in a cute little milk that we were able to make our own until the table opened up very shortly there after and it was so cozy we decided to stay on that level rather than wait to get a placement at the level restaurant below. It ended up being a great choice we ordered off the pub menu bangers and hash and the pub steak burger with cheese and fries a couple of pints one of sour one of wheat ale both were excellent choices to accompany our food and the wait staff who had been kind from the moment we got up there were attentive helpful with  suggestions and brought samples of drafts to assist us with the choices we made. The volume level was great for catching up with an old friend without yelling but still feeling like a lively Friday night spot.

I went to this restaurant the other day and had a very good experience. As soon as you walk through the door you release how nice and decorated everything is, with the opening lined with tea pots. We went upstairs to watch the Manchester United game and it was even nicer, with plush chair and teapots surrounding the TV playing the game. The walls were lined with English decorations and decorative pieces. We each got the full English Breaky and it was pretty good, it was certainly complete with everything that makes a proper one although it wasn't great. The beans had pulled pork which is definitely not what were expecting, and the eggs were cooked very hard, but it was still all pretty good. Will certainly be back to watch United and have a cup

Visiting out of town from the states and of course the millennial local uber driver and the internet tells us to hit up Pick 6ix because it's Drake affiliated so my friends and I oblige. Went in on a Saturday evening while a Toronto Maple Leaf hockey game versus Detroit was in town and to my surprise there was no wait or crowd in the restaurant. We had made a reservation online but didn't end up needing it. 

Seated immediately and a waitress came right up with water. Not sure how common this is but the food menus were a laminated single page word doc. The drink menu was not printed but on a card machine and didn't list details of the drink only the drink name. Different servers presented us with drink and food menus and neither one were familiar with the items on the menu. Weird. Apparently the menus were new.

I did not have an alcoholic beverage. The menu item I ordered was a Wellington Beef Burger which came with french fries. The basics came on this burger (tomato, lettuce, mayo and pickles). Cheese and/or bacon were $3 extra each I passed on both. I was not asked how I'd like my burger prepared which I wasn't sure if that was a states thing or not but the burger I received was a bit over medium well. I enjoyed the burger and fries much. 

I would recommend this spot off of the food (burger+ fries) alone because it was good for bar food. There wasn't a DJ but the playlist going in the restaurant was spot on if you're a r&b/hip hop fan.

Ordered wings and Caesar salad. The Caesar salad came out with the wrong ingredients and didn't come back out for another 30 min. The "hot" wings were more like butter sticks with a hint of pepper and the extra hot sauce on the side tasted more like peri peri sauce. Way too many staff wandering around looking lost . Way too overpriced for the quality of food and drinks that you get.

Went there on a Sunday Eve for food & Drinks. The place was dead, just the loud sound of TV screens no DJ, nor music; Nothing.
There's no drink menu, you let the server know what you'd like to have. 
The food was tasteless and the look of it and the plating was so effortless and boring. We had steak frites  med/rare which was more MED rather than med/rare. Not seasoned,just a hard piece of meat. The seared Salmon was the same not marinated, and the look of mashed potatoes  on the side was like being dropped on the plate. The chef should be more motivated to present a plate in a restaurant specially in downtown TO.

Pick 6ix is a weird one to rate, a lot of buzz around it, I think it's a good place to visit for a destination dinner. Now granted I came in here when it was newly opened and I've read that they've changed their menu since. 

I for one really liked the interior deco, having seen the OVO nights at Raptors games, I kind of expected a similar vibe stepping in here and that's what I got up up'd a notch. What I had is not in the menu anymore but what I remember most about my meal there was just how huge cut the heads of broccoli and cauliflower :/

Our server was friendly, the cocktails were great, but the food was just OK. Not bad, but reasonable enough given the venue and location. I wouldn't hurry back here, but it's definitely a spot I'm open to visiting again since I hear it's gotten better now.

Almost never write reviews, but I needed to do this... Nice vibe. Great for groups. Nice staff. Ok beer and food. TERRIBLE cocktails... stay away, the worst old fashioned I have ever tried... I should have learned after the bad gin and tonic.  I ended paying way to much for bad quality Old Fashioned that looked like a mix of carrot juice, smell like orange juice and taste like pure OH, which I couldn't even drink...

Terrible service! It took them 30 min to take our drink order, another 30 min to order our food and and other 30 to receive it. The food was mediocre! I feel like this is the type of place to come get a beer and that's it.

Great location. Authentic Toronto branch. Nice service.  Happy...... 
Go to second floor patio !

The cocktails are okay.

I wasn't a fan of the scotched egg.

I hate writing bad reviews but unfortunately I got sick eating their food. The food tasted okay but by the time I left, I was left with an awful stomach ache. The restaurant is beautiful and it's a shame the food doesn't match. I would only come here for drinks...

I live near this place and was super stoked when they made their patio all pretty and generally revamped the whole place. It's a busy place, with no reservations (at least for smaller parties), but a pretty place to stop by the huge church or the corner and close to St. Lawrence market. 

Staff were friendly enough, and service was good, but nothing too memorable. Prices are what you would expect for Toronto bars, but they do have a nice selection of "pitchers" large mason jars of cocktails for 30ish bucks. The drinks were tasty, but definitely not super strong, and if you take a picture of the menu, easily created by yourself with basic ingredients and frozen fruit! :) 

The food was super disappointing, portions are really small, and the food is not inexpensive or impressive. I ordered the fried chicken, and in hindsight, I definitely should have gone to Popeye's two blocks down. The mac and cheese was adequate, but everything was luke warm and deflated. 

We also got charged for drinks that were not ours. When we pointed this out to our waitress, she was nice, but only offered to give us cash, and not other apology was really offered. In such a cutthroat market (aka. the Toronto bar scene), I definitely expected more. 

I will say, their pretty patio, and cocktail mason jars win them major hipsters points, but I don't know if I'll be rushing back anytime soon.
I've been here a few times for dinner and drinks with friends. Cool atmosphere. Like the decor. Great place to come with your friends for drinks any night of the week. Food is okay.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, and great service. What more can you ask for! I recommend the burger or lobster Mac and cheese. The server was super nice, love coming here when we are in North Bay.
This place has been awesome, from the service has been beyond 5 stars. Thanks to Marty and Saif... from a visitor from Florida they saved my Sunday

Had dinner at the upstairs bar on Feb 17.  It was a Sunday but the bar was full.  Always liked this pub but the service last night let us down.  We were not advised what the special was; we had to ask.  We asked for water; never came.  When our drinks were finished there was no "would you like another?"; we had to stop server to ask. Observed other patrons having to go to bar to ask for bill or service while server was busy talking.  Disappointing.

Would I go back? Not at all. I woke across this place, but I would never go back. 
Why? Bad service, low quality food 
Pros: beautiful interior and design, great patio. 
The rest was just bad 
Cons: everything else except for the decor and ambiance and the patio 

I had the worst service and the worse fish and chips I've ever had. Server was ver rude, she was not happy that she had to serve us, not only we were not welcomed, but we could tell, she didn't want to have anyone there. I can't think of an experience as bad as what we had there in years. 
She was not responsive and only wanted us to place an order quickly when they didn't even have an updated menu. Whatever we asked for she said they are changing the menu and it's either not available or she does not know. When we wanted to order wine, she even refused to help, and just kept saying I don't know, our menu is changing! She brought the bill half way through our meal, we asked for water couple of times, and did not receive it, and the Icelandic cod and chips was the worst fish and chips I ever had. It was the low quality frozen fish, nothing Icelandic about it lol 
The fries was cold and not tasty, there was barely any fish and mostly deep fried batter which tasted like bad old frying oil. I could only have a bite and although I was super hungry, I preferred not to put those stuff into my body! Lol
I went there with my colleague to see if this would be a good place for our corporate event, and it turned out to be a disappointing experience. My colleague ordered the poke bowl, he also couldn't finish as the fish was not fresh.
Came for lunch and they were already out of calamari and steak sandwich. Loved the vegan mexican bowl. However they ran out of beans and rice and brought my friend's bowl out with no explanation.
Fantastic service and reasonable prices with an outdoor space. What more could you want on a great sunny day?

When Pick 6ix first opened in Toronto, it was the hot, Drake-affiliated cocktail bar with the weeks-long waitlist. After the first wave of people had given it their initial try and the hype has died down, Pick 6ix has re-branded as an upscale sports bar, located right in the heart of Toronto's Financial District.

I respect that the owner(s) of Pick 6ix didn't half-ass their transformation to a sports bar - there are PLENTY of TV screens to catch the game, and the general atmosphere of the establishment is markedly more casual. It's actually a pretty decent place to catch the big game, so long as you're not expecting a place where "everybody knows your name". The beer/wine/cocktail selection is pretty formidable, and the traditional pub fare that you'd expect in a sports bar is all there in the menu (think: nachos, burgers, chicken wings).

It's personally not my cup of tea, but if you work on Bay Street and you happen to get out of the office JUST in time for the big game, Pick 6ix is probably going to be your best bet.

The service is lax. Robert was a bit all over the place, slow, and not professional. My fries never came and I reminded him about my beer. These two stars are for the sauce flavours, they're decent and well curated.  Although the wings were a bit small. Is a wing special worth it if it's serviced poorly and the wings are small? I think not
